Reviews.Title: “Has potential once renovations are complete”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the process of transforming from an independent hotel to a Starwood. The hotel is a good value for New York, and the rooms are comfortable, but the renovation process does create some issues in the hotel. When I checked in, due to my Starwood status, my husband and I were told that we'd been upgraded to a newly renovated room. We were thrilled until we stepped off the elevator on the renovated floor and were greeted with the overwhelming smell of wet paint. We proceeded to our room hoping that the smell would just be in the hallway, but the room itself was also very freshly painted (not wet perse, but still full of paint smell). The room was REALLY nice, so the renovations definitely went well, and we would have loved to stay there, but for health reasons, we decided we needed to ask for another room. I personally don't think they should have even had this floor open yet, because there was no denying the smell. We called down to the front desk to ask for a room on a non-renovated floor, and they told us they could move us, but all they had left were rooms with two double beds. So unfortunately, our romantic evening in NYC turned into more of a friendly slumber party with us on two separate beds. As a platinum Starwood member, this was disappointing. However, the unrenovated room was perfectly fine - beds were comfortable, the room was quiet - other than not being able to sleep together, the room was great. I would consider staying here again - hopefully once the paint dries from the renovations.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: manc59
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just spent 5 nights at new york helmsley and throughly enjoyed the stay. we were given a renovated room (as i requested) on 36th floor overlooking 42nd street which was very noisy considering we were so high up! but fantastic views of the chrysler building.lovely room very clean, very comfy bed and pillows. a little disappointed no tea/coffee making facilities or room service but this was due to the renovations.pax next to the hotel for breakfast was ok or walk up to grand central lots more choice. we found all the staff.. reception,concierge and house-keeping to be all very friendly and polite. we had a small problem with the safe i made a call down to reception, the guy was knocking at the door within 10 minutes to sort it out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Purplelenni
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel on two previous occasions and being more than happy with my stay, I must say on this occasion I was quite disappointed. The location of this hotel is great very near grand central and so handy for subway but not right in the middle of everything so a little more peaceful. The hotel is being refurbished and the room we had was desperately in need of an upgrade but clean and comfortable. The bar and restaurant were closed which was fine for us as we were out all the time but would have been nice to have a drink in the bar in the evening. My main disappointment and sheer outrage was on my last day, having stayed for three nights we checked out and left our bags and went to do some final sightseeing and shopping. Before my flight I wanted to use the bathroom and freshen up...only to be told the bathroom was shut due to the refurbishment and I could use Starbucks down the street!!!! I asked to use a room an was told i would need to check in to do this' After insisting on speaking to a manager, a very rude manager opened the bathroom to let myself and another hotel user in. Without a smile or apology she stalked about and locked them again 5 seconds after we left them. I was appalled that having has such a good experience on the past it was tarnished by this. I'm sure that a hotel must have facilities for people to use on departure. I think the helmsley need to improve as there are so many nice hotels in new York that I'm sure treat guests a little better!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Scott G
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. Service was good, room clean, but a bit dated. There was not a refridge in the room nor a coffee pot. Don't spend alot to stay here. Worth it if you can get a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A NYC Dream!”
Reviews.Author: haasie406
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC for the weekend and wanted a hotel that was clean and in a good location... boy did I get that and more! We lucked out with a corner room on the top floor, so we had a FANTASTIC view of the Chrysler Building right across the street, plus our south view was of the East River, the Empire State Building, and midtown and downtown Manhattan. The hotel has recently been refurbished and is a part of the Starwoods brand, so the bed was fantastic. I had a great experience and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: shammy7545
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed here for a night while visiting friends in NYC. The location of the hotel was perfect. Walking distance to times square, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle. Also, about 4 blocks from grand central station which was very convenient. The staff was decent and the room was very nice! Very comfortable bed and pillows. Starbucks coffee maker in the room. It's in the middle of being converted to a Westin hotel, but we found nothing that made the hotel look like it was under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay - don't be put off by the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Lou020
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Helmsley. Having stayed here several times before and always found it very pleasant I was really worried when I read the reviews pre departure. The hotel had upgraded us to a delux corner room to accomodate a crib in the room and the view was amazing. Really spacious for New York standards and in a great location. Hotel next door to PAX for coffee and breakfast and so close to grand central, fifth ave and times sq. I agree that the hotel lacks the bar facility but appreciate the renovations are taking place. This did not impact our stay at all and urge anyone who is reading the reviews to keep an open mind as we had a wonderful stay and wish to thank the staff at the Helmsley for all they did. We will return. Mrs and Mr O'Brien.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Packabag54
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We had a very nice updated room on 22nd floor, very comfortable heavenly bed! As this hotel is in the process of being converted into a Westin hotel it is being renovated, therefore there isn't a bar or restaurant at the moment, only a breakfast dining room. Having said that the staff were very friendly and helpful on checking in, considering the upheaval. An excellent location in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Once renovations are complete, this is will be an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westtripster
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an unrenovated room on 28th floor, which showed its age. In addition, due to construction the television cable was damaged so the video feed was terrible. The only thing they could offer was to change rooms which we were disinclined to do. Nevertheless, the location near Grand Central was great...away from the noise of Times Square yet close enough to get anywhere in minutes. We were upgraded to a premium room which was spacious. Beds were very comfortable. Fitness Center was closed due to construction, but the hotel offered free one day passes to the New York Sports Club on 41st St.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pilarv1
Reviews.Content: Bad service at check in, were lied about renovations on the check-in desk (told that was done 3 years ago!). After that woke up at 7 am with someone hammering over our heads. Left after that. The room was overall dirty, even found a piece of bitten chocolate under the night table . DonÂ´t waste your money on this hotel, the Holiday Inn was better.

Reviews.Title: “Not empressed”
Reviews.Author: Lkmetyk
Reviews.Content: Check in was great . We got up to the 26 th floor and into the room. I was rather disappointed, it was a small non-discript space, completely lacking in character. There was no style, no color , nothing welcoming at all. It looked like it had been put together with old left overs. However it was clean and the location couldn't have been better. It's okay if you are not planning to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travelcat164
Reviews.Content: My teenage son & I stayed here for 3 nights. We were on the 26th floor and our room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We did not have any wait to check in or out of the hotel. Close to resturaunts, an easy walk to Grand Central and we were comfortable walking the neighborhood no matter what time of day/night. Other than the resturaunt being closed, you could not tell there were renovations going on. The pro's to this hotel are: size, comfort and location. We were perfectly happy with our room, there are a few cons that may bother other people.... street noise througout the nite, slow draining bathtub, outdated furnishings (which will be resolved when reno is complete.) I'd recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay @ NYC”
Reviews.Author: campdavidranch
Reviews.Content: Just arrived from our trip to NYC and was amazed with the location and room was just fine; did know they are renovating but room we got was hust fine everything work fine and bed were really comfortable and pillows as well... would recommend to anyone looking for location in midtown ..perfect for shopping and leaving bags in hotel and going out for shopping again!! loved my stay here.. breakfast is simple pasteries.. but you can always do Sarabeths right beside the hotel.. for some yummy eggs.. would return and consider for my next trip to NYC..

Reviews.Title: “Once all the renovs are done, this will be great!”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay here recently (March). We were assigned a room on a renovated floor. The room was nice and comfortable. The furnishing was fresh. Good water pressure. Toiletries were good. In fact, I think if they move to the standard Westin toiletries, it'll be a step down. A/C worked fine. Yes, you can independently adjust air con or heat. Very good hi-def flat screen TV. Safe in room. Coffeemaker in room with Starbucks coffee. Internet worked very well, and was fast. Check-in was a bit slow, but it was fine. Check out was efficient and friendly. There was minimal noise from hallway, so sound insulation was good. Except for a minor problem with our room being directly across the staff elevator room. Loud talking in the morning(before 9) acted as an alarm clock. But on a Sunday right after St. Patrick's day, it was not overly welcome. Everyone we came across was friendly and courteous. Well, the check-in person was kinda robotic, but he wasn't nasty or anything. In all, the staff members we encountered were very nice. I don't think Chatwal's has anything on them in terms of service attitude. I can't wait for all the renos to be done. I stayed at this property when it was called the Harley. That was back in the early 80s. It was a gem then. This will be gem once again! I look forward very much to returning this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great East Side Value”
Reviews.Author: limerickbee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Helmsley on a recent weekend in the city. This hotel is still a great value even though it is going through a renovation period.....about to become a Westin in July. Our accommodations were more than adequate, spacious by NYC standards. The only drawback is that the restaurant/bar is closed, though breakfast is available. This is a minor inconvenience as the hotel is located close by Starbucks and many great restaurants. The location is ideal, midtown-east, not in the high volume center. An easy walk to the theater, Grand Central, shopping. Second avenue is close by....great to stroll without the crowds...would recommend to anyone and plan to return...it can only get better as a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: hmo102
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely clean, and has some great people!! We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed each one! It is in a great location, and everyone is so eager to help. The hotel is undergoing some renovations, which will only be an improvement. The room in which we stayed had not been renovated on the 33rd floor. However, it was clean and met our needs for tourists...I don't really care about what color the carpet is, really! You can't go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “If you are bad-mannered, the rest is nothing....”
Reviews.Author: letiziax
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my 10 years daughter after a long flight from Italy . Thay had my reservation made time before. At the reception desk, the lady rudely told me the room is not ready (7 p.m!!) and nothing else. I asked to speak to the manager but she said no. So I had to call my tour operator assistence with my mobile. Ten minute later the room was ready. I had my keys without a word. The hotel is under restructuration but the diseases for visitors are big: f.e toilets in the hall are all closed and the space in the same hall is really few. I expected an apology from the manager, but...did you see him in 5 days I spend there? Surely not! Bad, very bad

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here ....”
Reviews.Author: ghfatw
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum member with Starwood, have been for 7 years and so when I reserve a room for early arrival (12 Noon) and arrive at 1 pm, I don't expect to be told after waiting some time to check in that "well, we might have a room for you at 3 pm". "Oh, you're a Platinum and you stayed more than 75 nights with us - that's very nice". The smart thing to do would have been to call up Starwood and switch to another property but I didn't do that. All night the fire alarm was going off - "this is a test. Please ignore". There was no fitness center -not yet, no restaurant, no bar. The elevators are slow but not as slow as the internet which had trouble downloading even the smallest files. This hotel is in a good location near Grand Central. And it is in a building which could one day have very nice rooms. But it needs new staff and a lot of renovation and this will take some time. In the meantime, this is a hotel you need to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Sound & Fury”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastAz
Reviews.Content: We were to stay a week at The Helmsley, we last 1 night. Noise all night long. Slamming doors up an down the hall, arguing couples on both sides of us. We were on the 31st floor. Told there would be no running water between 10 AM and 2 PM of both Fridays we were to be there. Thermostat didn't work in room, had to "crack" window open to cool room down....in February. Upon check out the next morning, let check out clerk know of all the problems in just 1 night, she called over manager, who asked my wife, "what, are you just going to go home?". No, lust a better run establishment. Went 7 blocks north and had a restful, peaceful, attitude less expierance. Run, don't walk away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: joers
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed one night at the Helmsley, and it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have had in NYC. I was on the 39th floor, and they were doing some kind of construction on the floor above me, and all day I heard this excruciating loud/painful drill sound. They were supposed to stop at 7 but I continued to hear it until around 7:30. Then, the next morning (Saturday) I heard hammering starting at 9:30 am. Awful experience, the room was tired/worn, and rug was disgusting. Only plus was location. Would never stay there again, and this experience has left me with a very poor impression of the Starwood brand.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Rooms are the way to go”
Reviews.Author: caviargal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in December of 2011 as part of a family reunion. The rooms were large by NYC standards. Lobby is small and we did not use the lounge or restaurant. Location is ideal for walking everywhere we enjoy. Rooms could be noisy at times and we were 40 floors up. We would stay again if price was right.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: thepearofus
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights.Hotel is very central for sightseeing as very near Central Station.No food available as under refurbishment,but lots of outlets available nearby.A good Italian across the road for evening meal and breakfast next door

Reviews.Title: “Dry room, but super location. I have no idea what prices are like”
Reviews.Author: melted_snowball
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on my Aeroplan points, so I don't really know if it's a good value or not. The lines were way too long for check in and for check out, and the lobby was really not great. The location was superb. The rooms were "old elegance" in all the stupid ways: dumb big bathroom mirrors, heavy water taps, etc. But the king-size bed was a nice indulgence after a few nights in my parents' spare room double. They also gave us a lat checkout, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Dated furniture, A little worn down”
Reviews.Author: bellboycary
Reviews.Content: PROs: Good location (i.e., close to grand central); above average room size (for nyc) CONs: Dated furniture, worn down look in some rooms Overall, the Helmsley is in a good location (of course, location is personalized given what you are in nyc for...however, it is 2-3 blocks from grand central station). The rooms are in need of updating as the decor is dated and some of the furniture/wall paper/bathroom are showing obvious signs of wear. One of the doormen is in need of an attitude change. Lobby: the lobby is smallish with a check-in counter and a small 'cafe/bar' to the right as you enter. The lobby gives a feel of a modern/chic hotel (esp given their music selection). There is a bank of 4 elevators that were reasonably fast. Rooms: I was on the 28th floor. The room was above average in size for NYC standards. The room faced 42nd st so it was quite noisy (despite being on the 28th floor). The beds/bedding were average. The decor was clearly dated and inconsistent with the 'vibe' in the lobby. Some of the cloth (gold fabric) chairs were worn, the marble countertop in the bathroom was stained, wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling in places. Location: as mentioned above, location is dependent on what you are doing in NYC; however, I still think that the Helmsley is in a good location. Close to grand central and shops. Verdict: Not my top choice in the area as there are at least 3 other nearby options to choose from; although if priced significantly under my top 2 choices; I would book the Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel getting nicer!”
Reviews.Author: timfromnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the New York Helmsley to go out to dinner, visit the Blue Note and go to a Saturday afternoon play. I picked the New York Helmsley because Starwood had it available with a "points and cash" reward. My wife and I stayed in a very nice room on the 37th. floor that was recently renovated. The room was large, clean, and laid-out well. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large enough for us and was clean and well-stocked with towels. We did not park at the hotel, which charges $60.00, but used an ICON Parking lot behind the hotel at half the cost. Check-in was quick and the bar and dining areas were operating and were in excellent condition. When the transfer to a Westin is completed later this year, I would expect all the standard amenities that Westin offers will be fully in place. All the staff that I met were nice and were helpful. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Grand Central Station and about a 20 minute walk to Times Square. The room was very quiet. I only heard some sirens during the night, which has to be expected in New York City. The room had heat, so I cannot comment on air conditioning. The temperature controls in the room looked new, so I assume that are all being replaced during the renovation. As we stayed over Friday to Saturday, we heard no construction noise. I would recommend the hotel during the renovation phase and will return again to stay when it comes under the Westin flag later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Ming_Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, and its best feature for now is its location! The property is currently under a much needed renovation, following a change of ownership and management company in 2011, and will re-branded as a Westin in June 2012. The room was pleasant, but no amenities available, quite disappointed for a Starwood managed hotel. No coffee/tea, no bottled water, no amenities in bathroom except for soap and shampoo. But staff was quite friendly and helpful, especially the doormen, front office staff and luggage clerks.

Reviews.Title: “For sure you will enjoy staying here”
Reviews.Author: mxok
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights at this hotel.as a part of our 40th wedding aniversaly. just a walking distance from U.N Building. and also very close to Grand Central station. Very convenient location to enjoy New York City. Good room and Good location and Good people.. We will come back here on our next trip too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tripopinonsw
Reviews.Content: Not as high end as many other Starwoods properties but great value. halls dated, but rooms are renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mista_Sizzla
Reviews.Content: i brought my girlfriend to NYC for Valentines day and spent 2 nights at the Helmsley. The location was great and very accessible to the transit. Also it was easy getting there from the airport. The staff was curteous and very helpfull. If there was one draw back to the trip was that although they gave us a "quiet" room on the 12th floor, Ear plugs are a must if you go from now until they are done renovations. I suggested to the staff that earplugs be provided because as of 7 am you can hear hammering and other demolition noises. Although this motivated us each morning to have an early start. Again i do believe it will be great once the renovations are done, but it kind of put a kink in our Valentines day celebrations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: DistrictScott
Reviews.Content: As always, I generally prefer to stay at Starwood properties. As this was the best priced Starwood property in the city, I decided to give them a try for my four night business trip to New York. The hotel was very close to the Grand Central Station subway lines, as well as many local restaurants. The hotel staff was generally friendly and accommodating. The hotel rooms were very dated and in great need of updating. I was happy to hear that the hotel will become a Westin property soon, as I'm sure this will usher in a much needed remodel. The hotel rooms were large, which is difficult to find in New York City. The beds were extremely comfortable, and I got some of the best nights of rest I've had in a long time. I was rather perplexed that the hotel didn't offer coffee makers in the rooms, as most all Starwood properties do. I'm hoping this is remedied in the upcoming remodel. The water temperature in the shower was also an issue. It couldn't keep a steady temperature and would run from cool to hot for the 10 minutes it would be utilized. All-in-all, I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and look forward to returning once the remodel has been completed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Starwood Property in Murray Hill”
Reviews.Author: KNAChicago
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the New York Helmsley Hotel since it became a Starwood property. The recently renovated rooms are nice with all modern ammenities including mini fridge, flatscreen TV, comfortable bed and large desk. Bathrooms are small, standard for older NY hotels but clean. My top choice when I have business in the Murray Hill area.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: iliketotravel123
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Helmsley using a Travel Zoo deal ($159 per night). After not being able to find the reservation - which was cancelled by TravelZoo - we were assigned a room on the 27th floor. The room was nice. Not plush but nice. And clean. Service was adequate. Front desk had a line with only one person working the desk at checkin. The room was too warm. We opened both windows - and the noise from the street was annoying. We had earplugs - so that helped. Don't eat breakfast at the hotel. Plenty of choices in the area. We had a $25 credit for breakfast so they sucked us in. Too expensive. $80 for three people. Two of us had oatmeal. No room service at the hotel until 6 pm. So plan accordingly. No mini fridge, no coffee maker in the room. Flimsy shower curtain. Water all over the floor so be careful. I would go back. Definitely. No perks but I'd rather pay less and do without the extras. Had dinner at Pietros around the corner. Pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: sebring1970
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised. Stayed on a "lower" floor and expected renovations would have been needed, but other than no working ice machines, everything worked fine. Staff not friendly but not rude either. We thought the walk from Penn Station to the hotel, through Bryant Park, past all those shops that sell beads on 6th Ave, past the library, Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building, was great. Eat breakfast at the Central Cafe' underneath the bridge that crosses over to Grand Central Station. Best corned beef hash, potatos I ever had. And my GF said her eggs were the best ever too but I thought an egg was an egg.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: SarahM81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to celebrate an early Valentine's Day with my husband. I got a deal for roughly $150 for one night through TravelZoo, which is a great price for a weekend stay in a hotel in Manhattan. We were fortunate enough to get a room on the 38th floor, so it was one of the newly renovated rooms. There was nothing super fancy about the room - it was clean, comfortable, and had a modern look. Despite the renovations, the tile in the bathroom still looked dated, and the room didn't have the "plush" look or feel. For instance, the room lacked a coffee maker, which I found strange, and there were only poly-fill pillows available, no down options. There was a mini-fridge, which would have been useful had we stayed for more than one night, and bathrobes and basic toiletries were provided. The room was a decent size, and the location was great for walking to lots of great restaurants, Central Park, Museums, etc. I would stay here again if I got a similar deal. Even though we were on one of the highest floors, we could still hear traffic noises in our room (not enough that we lost sleep, but it was one of the indicators that the building is older and lacked more modern insulation and/or windows).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, squeaky clean, good service, not overly friendly or bubbling with enthusiasm, no room service avai till 6pm, hot”
Reviews.Author: maria21189
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, squeaky clean, good service, not overly friendly or bubbling with enthusiasm, no room service avai till 6pm, hotel restaurant expendive, room very warm and needed better lightening. Difficult to read

Reviews.Title: “A work in progress”
Reviews.Author: SgFm
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, this hotel is in the process of a major remodeling. As a consequence, I intentionally booked a more expensive room to be sure of receiving a newly remodeled room, and to also be on a higher floor. The room was a comfortable, corner room and the view was of downtown and to the East river. There were three of us, and when putting in a roll away, we found we had little space to move. Fortunately, housekeeping was able to set it up later in the evening and so the impact was minimal. The public areas seemed attractive, although to be honest we were only passing through, and did not really spend any time in them. If you want convenient and quick options for grabbing a bite to eat, or even to sit down for dinner, you will find you are spoiled for choice, even in the immediate neighborhood/block. I would certainly go back, the location can't be beat. I do imagine room prices will be more expensive, once the renovation/remodeling is complete however, since for similar hotels in midtown, this was one of the most reasonably priced I found.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing Stay for the First Night”
Reviews.Author: AJWW4764
Reviews.Content: Had booked 2 King Size Bedded rooms for 2 nights. When we arrived we were told there were no king rooms available and we were put in twin bedded rooms. We asked to change for the second night, which they did, but made us change rooms without help. Manager was courteous, but it didnt help our feeling of us putting them out somewhat.

Reviews.Title: “Grat location”
Reviews.Author: Bill n
Reviews.Content: This is a great location and the rooms are excellent. we got a rooms at the last minute and the staff and front desk were quick and very pleasant. The room is quiet and very nicely appointed. The good news is Mrs. Helmsley's dog is not really the owner so it has really not gone to the dogs!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: geordienorth1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Thanksgiving with my wife and a further party of four adults. This Hotel is in a great location on 42 st close to Grand Central, Times Square, Central Park and so on. The Hotel offers excellent accomodation, the rooms are clean and spacious, and offers excellent reataurant facilities, we ate breakfast out each morning at a small restaurant on 42nd St, there is plenty alternative places to eat. Easy access for getting to downtown Manhattan bt Taxi of subway.

Reviews.Title: “What a trip”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: It's a bit risky to stay at a hotel undergoing a major renovation since there's always the chance you will end up in one of the old rooms. The Helsmley is a NY classic, named after developer Harry Helmsley. But, let's face it, the Helsmley name is no longer a positive, and the hotel is being rebranded as a Westin. There are some really fun quirks at the Helmsley, which I hope the hotel keeps as a reference point to its Helmsley heritage. These include the fun hot pink bathrobes and the 70's bronze mirrored ceilings in the halls. I had a renovated corner room on the 38th and it was actually quite nice. It even had a great view down 42nd street with a peek of the Empire State thrown in. Housekeeping was very good and I found all the staff to be very friendly. I can only imagine how terrible the unrenovated rooms are since all the unrenovated parts of the hotel really are horribly run down and shabby looking. Overall recommended if you get the new rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Ukdesi
Reviews.Content: If you want a place that's value for money, in a brilliant location that's clean & friendly then look no further than The New York Helmsley. We stayed for 9 nights and found that the room and bathroom were of a good clean standard with a good selection of TV channels and wi-fi as standard. The Concierge is very knowledgeable with shopping, dining and entertainment locations. The Hotel bar is pretty good with a decent range of drinks available. We had Breakfast at Pax next door to the hotel, this was adequate for us and at a fraction of the cost of the hotel breakfast. There are a couple of convenient ATMs close by.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling74
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Helmsley on business. I'm pretty loyal to Starwood, so when I checked out the SPG site, I found a really great deal for this hotel - $239. Too good to be true, and sometimes, you get what you pay for. I don't think I've ever been as disappointed in a hotel as I was with the NY Helmsley. First of all, the room was seriously dated (i know they're in the process of updating the rooms, so I think I just got an old one), with a tiny little flat screen TV, which was more like an oversized computer monitor. Much worse, the room was overheated and overly stuffy, and the thermostat was outdated, and didn't even seem to be functional, so I ended up having to open the window to cool the room off. Which, even though I was on the 35th floor, resulted in a very loud night. Surprisingly, room service didn't open until 6:30 am!!! I called down at 6:30 to order coffee and oatmeal, and was told that it would take 45 minutes to deliver!! Since I had to leave at 7:20, I left without coffee or breakfast (there was no coffee maker in the room either). Also, the blowdryer on the wall in the bathroom didn't work. I called housekeeping and they delivered another one, which also didn't work. I called down for a third blowdryer, which finally did work. I had a nice view of the top of the Chrysler building, and the shrimp caesar salad I order for dinner was really quite good. Neither of which made up for the frustrations listed above. This hotel needs a serious overhaul and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some help.”
Reviews.Author: SeaTravelTime
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in January. Front Desk check-in took some time even though they were not busy. Rooms are dated from the late 1970's and in desperate need of renovation. Bathtub was clogged and I was standing in water each morning while I showered. Heat was out for several hours one night. TV reception was non-existent, every channel was fuzzy. Bartender was great - he has been there for several years. The hotel is becoming a Westin which should really turn it around.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location, room and staff”
Reviews.Author: weissguy11
Reviews.Content: Although a few blocks off of the main midtown strip, this chic hotel has fantastic service, decent sized rooms with excellent showers, and a very good all inclusive breakfast for a business traveler. The front desk was quick and understanding when I left something in the room, remaking me a key very quickly. I appreciated the decor of the room, although it overlooked an air conditioning duct and the room was fairly dark, as was the hallway. Overall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJM123
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 37th floor for business. Front desk check in very efficient and staff very nice. Room was big for NY standards and bed comfy. My room looked exactly like the photos posted on their website. I LOVED the bathroom. Nice marble counters and I just loved the wall paper. Very smartly designed. Good price for the room and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located Base”
Reviews.Author: helene-boyce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights spanning New Year's weekend. At first glance, I was a bit put off by the garish and dated lobby but our room on the 38th floor was comfortable and clean with a large desk at the window and a great view north. The Chrysler Building was just a bit west and gorgeous from that height. I could see down 42nd street to the East River and to Times Square looking the other way. Our room was quiet, the housekeeping staff was invisible and excellent. 42nd Street is architecturally fascinating from river to river and the proximity to Grand Central is a real plus both for the trains and subway and because it is very easy to get a cab there. With Grand Central as a landmark, you can always find your way home. Good restaurants, interesting streets that vary in character depending on which direction you walk, close to many NYC highlights and a perfectly located base for venturing further into Manhattan and the buroughs. The hotel is transitioning to a Westin (June?) but still hangs on to some of the Leona pink and gold gaudiness. When it becomes a Westin, then I imagine it will be just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Still a "work in progress" but Promising!!! CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: longball4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days as a winter vacation with our daughters. Superb locations on 42nd between 2nd and 3rd ave. Started out rough as we waited 45 minutes in line to check in at 4pm with only one reservationist. Our assigned room wasn't ready so they gave us 3504, 2 doubles on a high floor. SO, after reading all the reviews about the uncontrollable heat, we get off the elevator and notice how warm it is. Then as we walk to the room at the end of the hall it gets worse! OH NO... But as soon as we entered the room the temperature was bearable and it had an operable window that we used to regulate the temps a little. Nice room by NY standards, flat screen tv, great linens and duvet sets, big bathroom, desk, closet with bathrobe. Staff was helpful as we had problems with our door lock and card reader. After the first night, we noticed the noise coming off the street, and we were 35 floors up! It was loud! While not a deal breaker, just dont plan on sleeping late in the mornings! WHo could in NY city anyways?? We had free wifi through SPG and it was readily avaialble in the room. Parking is expensive $51 night, so try to park around the corner at a parking garage and get an online coupon. Wound up paying $16 per night! Getting into our room was a crapshoot, as the card reader needed new batteries, then decided to only work in fits. Luckily my daughters got the hang of hearing the different clicks and knowing when to turn the handle. It became the joke of our trip! LOts of staff around at 11pm every night...not sure why when people checked in there was one person at the desk, yet at 11pm there was always 3??? We had a great time, nice place when they get the refurbishment done, and remember Location. location, location!!!!! VERY CLEAN!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: txmasonmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 4115-top floor- with view of the Chrysler Building right outside one of our windows. The room was a fantastic size with a king bed, 2 chairs, storage, large flat screen and a monster closet by the bathroom. Pillows were very firm and after the first night, requested softer ones and they were brought immediately. The bathroom has updated counters but the other pieces still need some TLC along with the carpet. We always rec'd elevator service very promptly and hot water was plentiful. Fairly nice italian restaurant across the street and an espresso place too.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool1234
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Good Midtown location - Room had an excellent view of Chrysler building - Spacious room by NYC standards, with modern, updated decor - Part of SPG's loyalty program, so eligible for points redemption and upgrades - Staff seemed attentive, including bellman who hailed a cab and helped us out of cabs Cons: - TV in room had terrible reception with lots of static, very annoying - Bar/restaurant area seemed dark and dull; not a place you'd like to sit and have a drink Potential cons: - Staff said the hotel was about to undergo a renovation to turn it into a Westin, so there may be construction going on in the near future - No executive floor for SPG elites Bottom line: - A good value in a good location with comfortable, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Need not have worried”
Reviews.Author: wimble52
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel before christmas. Recent reviews made me dread that it would be terrible. Quite the reverse, we had an unrenovated room on 25th floor,the furnishings were a little dated and worn but it was extremely clean and the bed was wonderfully comfortable. Street noise was not really a problem at that height and a small price to pay for the fantastic location. We could walk to many of New Yorks attractions and Central Station was only a few blocks away. My only gripe was that I would have appreciated tea/coffee making fascilities in the room. The hotel is due to undergo a major renovation about which the staff are very excited. I look forward to returning to see the result

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: WillyD9
Reviews.Content: We had two beautiful rooms on the 39th floor with fabulous views of the Chrysler building and 42nd street. We stayed for my daughter's 16th birthday and were pleased with the extra amenity touch from Violet. The rooms were large, quiet, and comfortable...especially the king size bed. Great location to Grand Central and Times Square. We did the self park in the garage on the street behind the hotel for $40 for the two days...very convenient. Breakfast was good at the hotel but was also a bit pricey. We hope to return to the Helmsley next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: kadina64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley the week leading up to New Years weekend. It's conveniently located within walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, and the park and Grand Central Station. For those who prefer less walking it's close to the subway station at Grand Central. The bed and room were comfortable. Room service was excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a GREAT place to get breakfast and cheap just 200 feet to the right of the hotel. And there is a another place just across the road. We ad a great view from our corner room on the 41st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Helmsley - where is the sunshine?”
Reviews.Author: Steven P
Reviews.Content: First of all the location is great. Near Grand Central, Crystler, and Bryant Park. Having said that - I was very disappointed with the service. I don't think the 6 days I was at the hotel I saw an employee smile. Even upon check in, or to make an inquiry - they did not make you feel welcome. Next we made an inquiry with the Concierge - regarding whether a restaurant was open on Christmas - she quickly said she believed the restaurant was closed - without calling the place. Isn't that what she is suppose to do? Well guess what, it was open. Finally, the fire alarm went off at 1:30pm. An annoucement came a minute later - well it was so mumbled, and barley resembled english that it was hard to make out. Also, the annoucnement was not made in the rooms, only in the halls. How secure it this? Finally I guess we were put in the the older section of the hotel. It certainly looked old. I had to use all my strengeth to get the shower working. BTW - it is loud and your neighbours shower will be loud as well! So great location - very poor serivce.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: rln76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley over the New Years weekend. It's conveniently located within walking distance (under 25 mins) of Times Square, 5th Avenue shopping, and the park, Grand Central Station, and the Empire State Building. For those who prefer less walking it's close to the subway station at Grand Central. There's a convenience store on the corner and 2 Starbucks within the block. Bed was very comfortable which is the main thing for me. One downside was no free wifi in the room, but you can either pay 10 bucks per day or go down to the lobby where it's free. Only other thing that put me off a bit was that they didn't replace the glasses in our room after they had clearly been used. Dried orange juice pulp on the sides showed theyd been only rinsed (poorly) and replaced. Maybe not a big deal to some but made me wonder what other cleaning short cuts were taken. Overall, I'd still recommend it if you get a rate that you think is good.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with Everything Except for . . .”
Reviews.Author: erineile
Reviews.Content: The rudeness of the concierge who clearly did not want to take the time to answer my questions via a phone call I made the day before my arrival. She abruptly put me on hold and after approx 6 minutes the call mysteriously disconnected. Our one night room stay was fine - clean - nice amenities - early check in was accommodated; however, staff is lacking hospitality. Check out took over 25 minutes of waiting in line as there were only 2 desk people and one was dedicated to preferred hotel membership (which I joined upon checkout for future stays). Staff needs training on providing a "welcoming atmosphere." I had a $25 food/beverage credit and special rate from Travel Zoo. Even though I had it confirmed in writing it was questioned and had to be taken up with the manager. Eventually it was ok'd....but this took precious time from my brief stay and I felt like a tourist haggling for something I was not entitled to.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate.”
Reviews.Author: kljw70
Reviews.Content: Pros: -I reserved this hotel through Hotwire.com. Thank goodness I got a fantastic rate, $140 (unbelievable, really, for NYC at Christmastime). -Fine location, easy access to Grand Central -Quick walk to Chrysler building, UN, NY Public Library, and even to theatre district -Clean -Spacious room (we have a double-double) Cons: -needs updating. I know they are working on this. Our room is totally fine except for the heat, which is mentioned in many other reviews. It is really really hot, even though we've turned off the thermostat and opened a window. -Fire alarm went off at 1:00am. Soon, an announcement over the loudspeaker that they were investigating whether it was a false alarm or not. I lay in bed planning how to get my family out safely if need be. An hour later, another announcement: False alarm. Then again they announced. A swankier hotel would have apologized in the morning, and given patrons some sort of compensation (maybe a free cup of coffee at the hotel restaurant). Here: nothing. Would I stay here again? Well...probably. The price was right. Price is the #1 factor for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here! Smallest beds I've ever had in a 4 star rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: We had the delux room on the 27th floor with two beds I thought we were getting queeen beds but they were very small doubles. We are an average size couple 5'6" and 5'11". My feet hung over, and did not have enough room to turn over. The windows were so poor the street noise was very loud. We could not control the room temp, it was 78 degrees. They had not done a thourough cleaning for a long time, stains and old grime was on all the furniture. For the price we paid it was the worse room I've ever had. We had expected more from the web pictures but were very disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a total and complete mess.....”
Reviews.Author: NYCshopper
Reviews.Content: I thought I would give this hotel a try as it has gotten 50/50 reviews on various websites and it is being converted into a Westin Etc. Check in took 10 minutes as there were people waiting everywhere and lined up. It is New Years and the hotel was obviously full. I booked a deluxe high floor room as as a platinum starwood guest the only room they had for me was a renovated room directly in front of the elevator on the 38th floor. This room had no view and as it directly faced another building, it formed a canyon where the noise from the street roared up so every truck and car that roared by sounded like it was in the room. Between that noise and the "pings" every time the elevator came it was not a pleasant night. To top it all off there was a "false alarm" fire drill at 3AM which had the alarms blaring throughout the hotel....to say I didn't sleep well was an understatement. At 7:45 am they were doing hotel maintenance in the hallway outside my room....don't ask me what....noise everywhere. The furnishings in the new room are already looking worn however the bed was very comfortable and the internet/wifi worked well. Location of this hotel is excellent on 42nd street with easy access to all public transport. All staff were friendly and seemed excited about becoming a Westin. After staying in the newly renovated room, this hotel reminds me far more of a Sheraton than a Westin and I think this is going to be a hard sell. After a miserable night, I went down to the front desk where there were TWO people checking in 30 people waiting. I was hoping to speak to a manager and figure out what was going on. Finally I tired...I called Starwood chalked up another $80 and booked the W Union Square. A lovely hotel with a view of the Park....I checked in in 1 minute and my bags were instantly in my room....The quiet is deafening and quite frankly for a little extra money...this was well worth it. With so many rooms, so many people, renovations going on and seemingly little management, I did not feel safe at the New York Helmsley. If you are looking for a cheap easy well located place to stay with few expectations....this hotel fits the bill. Anything else....forget it. Happy Travels! NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, could do with some modernising”
Reviews.Author: mstraveller78
Reviews.Content: Firstly I love NYC!, this was my first trip and a great experience. I stayed at the Helmsley in Oct 2011. Its a great location for times square, grand central station etc. Nice entrance, very modern and recently refurbished reception, which may make you feel that the hotel is quite modern, but its not. The room is quite old fashioned and could definately do with modernising, including the bathroom, very old fixtures etc. Our window faced the street, the window didn't close properly so there was abit of a draft and noise, I could sleep through most things so it didnt really bother me, but if you are light sleeper I would check the windows when you are taken to your room!. Also expensive room service and we had to keep changing our room pass almost on a daily basis, because they stopped working All in all I would recommend it if you are looking for somewhere clean to stay in a good location. Probably wouldn't stay here again, would want to try a different part of NYC, and maybe somewhere alittle bit more luxurious!.

Reviews.Title: “Back amongst friends......”
Reviews.Author: CubanboyShaun
Reviews.Content: It's becoming a bit of a habit unfortunately but once again weâ€™ve been (very) slow in getting this on here but here goes anyway. This was our 4th stay at The NY Helmsley and our 2nd inside 4 months and once again, all expectations were exceeded. We were greeted with a tremendous smile by Pei in Reception and after she found out we were in NYC for my birthday and that we were repeat customers and knew an awful lot of her colleagues she managed to put us in one of the recently refurbished rooms on a high floor with magnificent views of both the Verrazzano Bridge and Empire State Building. The room was exceptional and we were incredibly grateful for the allocation and her continued beaming smile throughout our stay. As before, everybody we spoke to in the hotel was as courteous and friendly as ever and it was great to be remembered so fondly and affectionately by a number of The Helmsley team, but then I guess we are almost becoming regulars there these days! Denis (the Doorman) and Miguel (Concierge) were as friendly and helpful as ever and it certainly feels like our home from home in NYC these days. Everything that has been mentioned on here previously about the excellent location of the hotel is true and it is a fantastic base to discover all the restaurants, diner's, deli's and adventure that 2nd Avenue has to offer if you want to slip away from the usual suspects in the tourist trap areas. In summary, we want to thank all the staff on here again for a great stay, and in particular to Pei for allocating us such an exceptional room. We recognise there will be some disruption in 2012 as The Helmsley transforms itself in to a fully fledged Starwood hotel but I'm sure under the expert guidance of Maurizio Bonivento, the General Manager of The Helmsley, that disruption will be kept to a bare minimum for the guests. The effort that Maurizio is putting in to replying to comments on here is to be commended, indeed he responded to my previous comments on our stay in April 2011 but unfortunately I have only just discovered the email address that Tripadvisor uses to contact me was nearly 5 yrs out of date so I never saw the reply (I'm so sorry Maurizio, I have now replied to you separately via email and corrected the email address Tripadvisor has for me!). We expect to be back in NYC on at least 2 occasions in 2012 and can think of no other place we would prefer to stay in, and given the number of hotels in Manhattan, that's no mean feat.

Reviews.Title: “great location,great staff ok rooms BUT!!”
Reviews.Author: biggles223
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliantly situated near grand terminal.The staff are helpfull and genuine. The rooms do need refurbs! We started on the 32nd floor but the heat was terrrible and when we opened the windows the noise was also terrible!The hotel staff the next day swopped us to the 26 flr.This was no better,We contacted the engineer who said the a/c did not work in the winter thats why it was hot and the heat rose up thru the building.Reception continually told us about the promised improvements and how it would be wonderfull! It isnt now!! 2 nights without sleep is ridiculous.The purpose of a hotel is not promises but a good nights sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tequilaup
Reviews.Content: What a surprise this hotel was. I have stayed in many NYC hotels for business. The rooms in this hotel are so spacious, you almost don't feel like you are in NYC. There is also a wonderful old world charm that his hotel has. The only down side is the noise on 42nd street, but you are in NY so that is expected. I would def stay in this hotel again. The location can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel...an Oasis in City Center”
Reviews.Author: Maireadsy
Reviews.Content: It was perfect. Staff so friendly and welcoming--allowed us to get into our room early. The room was great--luxurious sheets and pillows, thirsty towels, complimentary copies of The New York Times on every floor. The restaurant is terrific, very spacious, and we must have been attended by five separate persons as we were served breakfast. Ahmad was particularly delightful--sharing the secret of preparing the to-die-for blueberry pancakes we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole222
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I spent a long weekend in New York City two weeks ago. I'm a Starwood member and this is a new Starwood hotel. We stayed at the The New York Helmsley, and had an enjoyable time. I was a tad disappointed that I had to take a cold shower after we checked in around 5:00 PM that day, but I am assuming that everyone was checking in and showering around the same time. It seemed to be a little better the next evening. The hotel lobby is very pretty, it has a nice bar and lounge area. A few food items & drinks that we ordered were not available, they had run out, which was dissapointing. But the food was pretty good, pricey, but that is New York, that has nothing to do with the hotel. All in all, it was a nice place to stay. Our room seemed a tad outdated, it looks like some of the rooms from the photos have been updated. Not sure if they will continue to update the rest of the hotel. Nice hotel would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: RodP11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel b/c I got a great rate (199 prepaid per night). Room was very spacious (especially by nyc standards) but the decor and furniture are dated (old furniture and carpet) looks nothing like the "preferred rooms" featured on the website. There was an old school temperature control and the room just never seemed to cool down. Located on 42nd and 3rd so it's ideal to get to Times Square and Roc Center. And a quick walk from Grand Central. Stick with the subways if you're heading downtown or to the west side - a can to TriBeCa cost us $25. For NYC, a rate of 199 is a deal and made it worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Location”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: The location next to the Park, Sara Beths, and 5th Avenue is alone worth staying here. I would agree that the hotel is dated, but kept up nicely. It's just that it looks like Trump's designer from the 1980s decorated it while insisting that you cannot go wrong with gold. I've stayed at many NYC hotels, and this was the most spacious. Most hotels in the City have small rooms and small bathrooms, which really doesn't bother me. Not the Helmsley. These rooms are gigantic by NYC standards. Very livable if you have kids with you (we did not).

Reviews.Title: “Should Be Better in a Few Months”
Reviews.Author: luv2travl003
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley is currently being renovated and comverted to a Westin Hotel. The property, while stateley and very well located, needs the refurbishment. We had particular problems with the HVAC, which is a single pipe system that is either delivering heat or A/C. We visited in mid-December, and found the room excessively warm (between 75-80 degrees), and were unable to get any cool air at all. Upon inquiry, we learned that if we had the thermostat on at all - even at the coldest setting - that it would deliver heat, since the master system was set for heat. Maybe that worked in Leona's day, but it doesn't fly today. On the plus side, the staff were very professional, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ali_baba
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the reviews about the Helmsley, its like I stayed in a completely different hotel. We had an amazing time in New York and the hotel was an oasis of calm and luxury to return to at the end of every day. I didn't know what to expect in advance due to the mixed reviews but we got so much more than I thought we would. First impressions of the room were wow I can't believe how big it is and wow look at the amazing downtown views and it just got better, the bed was huge and probably one of the comfiest beds I have ever slept in, the bathroom was average size (but had very nice soaps/shampoos), there was a great flat screen TV and an empty fridge. We were on the 38th floor and had a corner room so even got a view of the Empire State Building. I had a special request as we were visiting to celebrate a special birthday so I emailed the hotel through their website and not only did they respond almost immediately they delivered what I asked for and a surprise cake compliments of the hotel, little extras like this make a hotel visit extra special. All the staff I encountered could not have been more helpful or friendly and considering everything I really really recommend the Helmsley. The location was perfect for us as well, just outside the Time Square tourist hub but close enough to be able to walk there when you want to take in a show.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great service during our visit”
Reviews.Author: bmpauling
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the service was exceptional. When we checked in we met Pei. She was the best, she had a great attitude and we very helpful to us. She recommended a great restaurant and greeted us every time we went in or out of the hotel. If you stay there, look for her if you want to be taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly kept up, badly needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: PsprtStampCollector
Reviews.Content: This property is being converted to a Westin shortly -- let's hope they invest a substantial amount before doing so. Summary: avoid this hotel, there are certainly better values in New York. Yes, they are renovating the property, but they clearly have substantial work to do. I wouldn't think of staying here until June 2012 at the earliest, and even then I would have to see favorable TripAdvisor reviews before returning. Pros * Location, if you are coming to/from Grand Central. It is a few blocks away. Not the ideal neighborhood in New York, but very convenient. * My experience with the front desk staff was excellent, save for the fact they couldn't address the heat issue. Cons * The rooms, even the renovated rooms, are in generally poor condition. The tubs are cracked and the vanities and counter tops are well worn and a bit grimy around the edges. * The heat. Our room was 80 degrees in December, and no combination of turning cooling/heat on or off or opening the windows helped. * The window was stuck open. It couldn't be closed at all. This is VERY noisy. * The beds seemed a bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Management”
Reviews.Author: Patchpeach
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is the Night Front Desk Manager, John. I typically never ever comment on past hotel experiences as I understand that challenges can and will occur even with the best run properties. That said, my wife had left her wallet in a NYC cab by accident at the hotel lobby. Of course her ID, credit cards and cash were in the wallet. The cab drove off before she could alert the cab driver. This was late in the evening and her flight the next morning left JFK at 7:40 a.m. The hotel was helpful in suggesting that I arrange for a car service to take her to the airport. However, she was going to be travelling without a penny on her, without Identification (TSA nightmare) and without the opportunity to find any source of funds in a limited time frame. We asked John and team to simply advance $20 and add this to our bill which was well over $1,000 already. $20.. that's all we asked after first requesting help. John, the front desk manager said it was against the Hotel's policy and that we were out of luck/on our own. As a Platinum Starwood Member, this is certainly not the way we have been treated in many other Starwood locations around the world. Hotels have always gone our of their way especially with Gold and Platinum members to ensure their guests are always comfortable. This hotel has recently joined the Starwood group and the Management Team needs to be re-trained on Starwood Guest expectations since this experience was less than desirable. My wife is going to be back in NYC next week and we will be avoiding this property needless to say. Anyhow, the hotel itself is a great asset for Starwood. They just need to address how they handles special one off situations rather than lump ALL guests into a single protocol/process. The Starwood manual undoubtedly suggests customizing a unique experience for each guest and a plain Vanilla approach offered by John is simply inexcusable. Starwood Corporate has been terrific by the way.. They are going way out of their way to remedy the situation and we love this Franchise and the many great benefits the Starwood program offers us and our family. Simply amazing. Just a bad apple at one property in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “Confusing Experience”
Reviews.Author: J R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice in the last month. First time my partner and I asked for a renovated room and got what we asked for, no problems. Second time, on November 19th, we wanted the same thing. We asked for a renovated room with a king bed. The gentleman working at the front desk was polite and professional, but cold. Nonetheless, he assured us he was putting us in the room we requested and gave us the pass keys, so no worries. On the way to the elevator I asked my partner "did you get the sense he didn't like us?" Probably just my imagination. When we got to the room, he had only given us one key. He didn't ask if we wanted two so we figured he just put two in the holder. Nope. Just one... and it didn't work. Had to go back down. Wait in a long line again. A different person gave us two keys to the same room. They worked, but it was an non-renovated room with two double beds. We're pretty low-key travelers and I can't remember the last time I had a real complaint in a hotel (something that the hotel could control, anyway). All we did was ask for the room and provide the information he asked for. I don't think he made a mistake because he missed on both requests... the king bed AND the renovated room. All those details are listed on the computer he's working on. So why? Maybe he doesn't like gays? Maybe that one particular guy is just kind of a jerk? Maybe we rubbed him the wrong way and just didn't realize? Who knows... not sure I'd stay here again, though, even when it is fully renovated. Not because of the chilly reception... I can live with that. Because someone on the staff just decided, for no given reason, not to honor our simple request... no explanation... he just agreed to give us what we asked for, but chose not to.

Reviews.Title: “well worn”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Helmsley over the weekend. Very disappointing. We were aware that there were some renovated rooms with others not yet refreshed. We were in an older room. Very care-worn. Bed was very uncomfortable as were the linens. No type of spread or throw on the bed; just the white linens. Reminded me of a hospital room, but not as clean. The room was very warm no matter what the thermostat read even though one of the windows was permanently cracked open. As other mentioned, no fridge or mini bar, toiletries seemed recycled from another guest. Valet parking outrageously expensive. Worst we've experienced in NYC, and we have stayed in some really lovely upscale hotels. All in all unimpressive. Sad since it really is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn”
Reviews.Author: dcmchi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business because it was a Starwood. The rooms were tired and worn out. Room was hot and stuffy. Toiletries were half used. No food available in bar on a Sunday night at 7 pm. This is terrible. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: silvia9805
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for business purposes for many days. It was a bad experience. No service at all in this hotel. The rooms are big but old, carpeting is dirty, no fridge in the room, no umbrella, no free wireless available in the rooms. Good location for visiting the city. I want suggest this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Downgraded to a filthy room.”
Reviews.Author: OCO081
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG Gold status member and decided to try out this property for the first time. I knew that some rooms are not upgraded so I emailed hotel a month before my arrival requesting an upgraded room. Note that I had a prepaid rate for an king room with a view on a high floor. We checked in early around 11am and preregistered for our room. The front desk person told me that my upgraded room would not be ready until 4pm and should come back anytime after that. After shopping and sightseeing, we returned at 6pm with just enough time to get ready for dinner reservations. I was then informed that the previous guests of my assigned room had not checked out and that they were considering extending their stay. I didn't really believe them and instead thought they just gave it away to someone else. As I had no other option, I agreed to take a room on a lower floor after she assured me that it was also upgraded. Imagine my surprise when we arrived to find the room with the maid still in it having a nice dinner break in the room. She was just as surprised to see us as we were to see her. As you can imagine I was furious especially since the room was not only old and dingy but also absolutely filthy. I demanded a full refund and left the hotel as soon as possible. Luckily the Hilton one block away had a nice last minute room for us. This was a horrendous experience after a long day and it made us miss our dinner reservations. I am really upset that they staff lied to us about our room which only added insult to injury after waiting for the promised room after 7 hours. I cannot believe that this hotel is an SPG property as they do not treat loyal SPG clients with sincerity and efficiency. Unfortunately, I don't think this lack of service is unusual for this property. As I dealt with my problem, I overheard a woman with a her young daughter complaining about walking in on strangers in the room that they had just been assigned. imagine if this woman had walked in on an adult situation with her daughter. It is incredibly unsafe to assign a room that is already occupied. Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: kiaprnll
Reviews.Content: My friends and me stayed here November 11-13 and it was horrible. We reserved two rooms and both were dated and dingy. The carpeting was old and green in color (not what the site pictured). The bathroom was dingy and dark (poor lighting). The bedspread had holes in it, although we were in a non-smoking room. When we spoke to management about the rooms, they said they were still under renovation and only about 40 rooms were completed. They did absolutely nothing after we spoke to 3 different people in mangement. We were extremley disppointed and had we known we would've chosen another hotel. The staff were rude and not helpful at all. We drove 100 miles just to be disappointed. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: majmaj4
Reviews.Content: Good: Helpful by letting me check in on arrival at 9am Comfortable up to date bed & bedding No lines waiting for check-in or check-out Neutral: Small lobby area Location is convenient to subway (most hotels in NY seem to be) Carpet in the room was old and overly worn Bad: Room smelled like moth balls, Room/hallway were very hot even with heater turned off, (luckily weather was nice and one of the windows would open to allow some fresh air). Bathroom was not cleaned properly (Dirty towels left over from previous guest, shower was not cleaned with approximately 6 dark hairs strewn around the shower).

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the photos fool you”
Reviews.Author: beejturner
Reviews.Content: Website photos show upgraded, modern rooms - this simply wasn't the case for me. My room was straight out of 1978. The only upgrades I saw were in the lobby. Very surprised this passed Starwood brand standards. As a gold SPG member, I was certainly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: dancefloork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not far from the 5Th Ave, but very closed to Chrysler Building and Grand Central. Nice room, not extremely clean, but without noise and good temperature. I've no breakfast, because of prices and food. Bathroom was a little bit old, but it works. Someday no one cleaned it. We met a lot of italian tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TeeMcPee
Reviews.Content: Staying in NYC seemed so expensive & difficult, but am glad we took the advice of friends & stayed at NY Helmsley. We were there for 5 nights. Located near Grand Central, subway stops, 5th Avenue, made it easy to get around NYC. It is a great hotel - cute lobby (though small), rooms clean, COMFY beds, and EXCELLENT front desk staff. Deidre was wonderful. She's great! By day 2 she knew my name, nice touch. I don't like to ask for help, but she would chat with me then would assist me with where to go, best coffee to buy, times for shows, etc. and always with the best smile and attitude. I wish all customer service agents were like her, I was sad to check out and say good-bye. She's the best! The only negative at this hotel was that we found the food to be pricey, so ate elsewhere. Go eat at Fagiolini on 40th. Great food, big servings, doesn't hurt your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: AnnaD33
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfortable bed and pillows. Room was dated in its decor (nothing like pics on web site - of course!) but staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: wellermdfan
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Helmsley and I had a very good experience. My room was fine - it was larger than I expected and the bathroom was new and very clean. There was enough room to exercise in the room without banging into furniture. They gave you plenty of towels which is really important to me (I hate when you only get 2 towels!) I was on the 41st (top) floor so I think it was one of the newer renovated rooms. The elevators were quick and I never had a long wait for one. The worst part of the room for me was the temp. I like it cold and even though I tried to turn off the heat, it was always too warm. I even opened the windows but the room just wouldn't cool off. I didn't experience any problems with check in or check out - there was a line but people were orderly and waited in line patiently. The line moved pretty quick. The location is convenient and close to major subway/bus lines. I didn't use the bar or restaurant (don't even know if they have one). Overall I was really pleased and would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. I would certainly return if I could get a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: I just spent one very brief night here but it was comfortable. Fantastic location, large rooms, cosy beds! However I did fine the air conditioning very poor! The Room always too hot!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, large room, good bed”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night here 11-26-11. We got a great deal on line - $188 nonrefundable. We chose the hotel for its price, location (3 blocks from grand central) and because it is now a Starwood-Westin property and we usually have good experiences with that brand. We arrived early and checked in and dropped our bag and then went shopping and exploring. We had the front desk call my cell when the room was ready later I asked for a high floor and room away from the elevator and got it. A corner room on the 26th floor which was very large with a good view and it was quiet. The room was nice. The bathroom needs renovating. No minibar or coffee in the room - which surprised us. And the phone in the bathroom rang several times for no reason. But for the price we paid the hotel was just right.

Reviews.Title: “NYNY”
Reviews.Author: lulu217
Reviews.Content: Trip was lovely. Busy! Too short. Hotel was a good place to crash but that was it. Complimentary internet was going to have a charge so watch for that. We had it removed being Starwood preferred customers..Paint peeling in bathroom and sink broken. All in all clean, quiet and had comfortable beds..no view. Cab drivers charged 7.80 - 25.00 for same ride from hotel to Central Park...Friendly people. Perhaps next time stay closer to central park...museums...and take a horse and buggy ride...with daughter and husband...

Reviews.Title: “Good value for good location”
Reviews.Author: taxwatcher
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Good price. Chaotic check in. If you reserve through one of the on-line agencies, be sure to bring a copy of your confirmation. Early check in is advisable. They did not have my reservation when I checked in and only found it after 30 minutes of searching their emails. I was glad I was not checking in late. They were appropriately contrite.

Reviews.Title: “Great One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: SMB0627
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Helmsley for a birthday outing in NYC, and was not disappointed. Located about 5 blocks from Times Square, there's lot's to see within walking distance We had a renovated room on a high floor looking at the Chrysler building. It was well appointed and stylish. Check-in was easy. Big comfy king bed with a neat headboard. We had high hopes for the hotel bar on a late Saturday night but no such luck. Suggestion - Park at 41st & 3rd Ave, and you'll save about $30 and can easily walk with your luggage. Caution - They have some admitted HVAC issues due to it being an older building that they hope to have remedied by the Spring which made for a warmer room than needed. Also, the housekeeper overlooked some areas in the bathroom from the last guest, but we had already unpacked and were ready to head out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sundevilfans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley 11.16-11/17 2011. The lobby felt very fresh and modern. The staff was very pleasent however upon getting to my room 903. I felt as if I had stepped back into time 20 years. The room offered no bottled water nor did it even have a in room coffee brewer. The bathroom looked tired and stuck in the 90's. This is not a condemnation of the Helmsley, just for $300 a night i expected more. I have been told the new rooms are very modern and plush. The bed was AMAZING I did sleep very well.

Reviews.Title: “Old room”
Reviews.Author: Irene S
Reviews.Content: First time in new York. Tv remote didn't work, hair dryer didn't work and the safe is broken. No fridge or amenities. Here for 6 nights and not impressed. Also lihting is poor. We will letting our travel agent know. Irene Australia

Reviews.Title: “Ask for an updated room!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York Helmsley this week (Nov 12-17), and I found the updated rooms were very nice. The first night I was here, I was put in an older room, it was very rundown, the bathroom had very low lighting, there was no desk, no fridge. The next day I was moved to an updated room which was very nice, I had ample room to work at the desk, it had a fridge, lots of lighting, and a much nicer view. The main restaurant in the hotel is closed Sundays and Mondays, so I did not get to eat there. I did eat at the lounge, Harry's New York Bar on Monday night this week. The menu is the same as the in-room dining, but much cheaper. The service was terrible. The menu brags about the exceptional service, but I didn't receive anything above poor service at this place! The food was mediocre, but I had no choice but to eat there at 10:30pm. They also automatically charge you 15% gratuity included with the bill, which in my opinion is how the servers can get away with terrible service, since they are going to be tipped out either way. I think the in-room dining needs to open after 11pm, because there is nothing else to eat within a few blocks of the hotel late at night! For some of us, we are running on west coast time, and eating at 7:30-8:30 MY time is my normal. We asked the server to split the bill by price (not item), and she made it the biggest ordeal I've ever seen in a restaurant. It's not complicated to do this, we had a corporate card for a portion of the bill, and a personal credit card for the remainder. The server had to get management to do this for us, even though this is really a simple task, but she wouldn't just admit that she didn't know how, she made it a big deal by saying that she wouldn't do it. The location to Grand Central Station was very convenient from this hotel, but the amenities at the hotel were sub par. The fitness center was ok, the machines were really old, but they all worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 48Carmen
Reviews.Content: Carmen & Jerry Montreal, Quebec Hubby and I recently celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary (Nov 9, '11) at the New York Helmsley Hotel.
