We spent 5 nights and have only good things to say about the hotel and location. After having read some of the negative reviews we were a bit skeptical, however since we arrived, we had asked for a renovated room which they provided us with on the 40th floor, and it was beautiful, spacious, and very comfortable and clean, was corner room, had windows on 2 sides of the room, overlooking Hudson river and Empire State Building. Hotel was clean, people were helpful and courteous. Subway very close to hotel. Parked our car one bock away for 39.00/night which is reasonable in New York. Only 15 minute walk to Time Square. We had a wonderful time and would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it to friends and family. Great breakfast place next door hotel called Pax for $4.99 you get 2 eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast. Also you have to try the lamb gyros they cook on the street, only $6.00 they are really good. Another great place you must go to is Eataly Food market, had great fish for dinner and picked up many Italian specialties to take home.We got married in New York 30 years ago and it was a perfect hotel to reminisce about all our wonderful years together and make new memories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pickersgills
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms at The Helmsley for a family break in October. All 5 of us had a wonderful stay and will be going back. Our check in was quite quick and were given 3 rooms next to each other on the 37th floor, and they were all just like the internet photos. It was good to have a small sofa and armchair in the room, plus the usual table for working at with chair. Don't usually get all together. Breakfast was included in the price, it was more than adequate, and set us up for the day. We found the staff in the restaurant the friendliest, Paul, Nagi and a thank you to Jose for the ketchup each morning. Didn't really have much to do with the other staff, usually got a smile as we walked through reception. Found it quicker to get a taxi ourselves rather than the doormen. We did the usual things tourists do, Central Park, Statue of Liberty, best to book the tickets before you go, you can do this at the hotel, you will be charged to use the internet, and of course Times Square. Went to cheap and expensive places to eat. Hudsons, just around the corner in 3rd Avenue will take about 5 minutes to get to, good value. We went to Le Caprice one night, they even offered their chauffeur driven mercedes to take us back to the Helmsley, obviously we didn't refuse. All in all a great stay and as I said before can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jrsygirl918
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Helmsley for nine days while I was at Sloan Kettering for surgery. As this was a difficult time for both of us, this was not a typical vacation. My husband is not a city person but the staff at the Helmsley made him feel at home. They were extremely helpful with restaurants, delis, stores and overall directions for getting around. The rooms were comfortable and clean. He expecially enjoyed Elliot and Jonathan who worked the front. The hotel location was perfect for patients at Sloan, only a two block walk. The hotel staff will work with you in terms of adding or subtracting days as hospital stays can be unpredictable. A big THANK YOU to the staff at Helmsley!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff Made Veterans Day Weekend Memorable”
Reviews.Author: KarenArmyWife
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Stay!!! I booked the Helmsley Hotel through Priceline and got an amazing deal, but was worried after reading some of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor. I decided to email the hotel to ask for one of the renovated rooms, explaining that I was surprising my husband,( a soldier), and 2 kids with a trip to NYC for Veterans Day Weekend. I can only say that the response I received from the hotel made me teary- in a GREAT way. Violet Sanchez not only upgraded us to a Premium King Room (clean and spacious) with a breath-taking view of the city, there was a wonderful bottle of wine and a hand-written note from the general manager, Maurizio Bonivento. Everyone from the doormen to the receptionists, concierge, bartender, and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge (all 3 of them that I talked to during my stay) were extremely helpful in explaining which subway to take, which mass at St. Patrickâ€™s was better, how to get tickets to a Broadway Show, the Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial, etc. We were even able to check our luggage in for storage after checkout since there was still sight-seeing we wanted to accomplish. The location close to Grand Central (just a short, short walk away), Times Square, and the Empire State Building, among others, was unbeatable. If you are on a budget, be advised that the parking is $55/24hr in the adjacent parking garage. **The parking garage is run by an independent company**, and is valet parking. (Yeah, we were the morons that tried parking the car ourselves. Whoops.) The parking attendant told me that parking was $60 if the hotel parked for you. (But hey, the hotel will park your car and deliver your luggage, so I should have gone with that!) I was surprised when we picked up our car 26 hours, yes, 26 hours after leaving it and were charged $100+ instead of the $50 plus hourly charge I assumed. My fault for not reading the signage. Iâ€™m not sure if having the hotel staff park the car for you would result in not being charged the full 24 hours if you overstay, so be sure to ask. There is a small grocery/cafÃ© on the other adjacent side of the hotel that has very inexpensive breakfasts. I missed that option, but walking past the restaurant in the afternoon, noticed breakfasts advertized for $6 (eggs, bacon, toast.) Iâ€™ll have to try it the next time I go to NYC. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. My husband and I were so touched and thankful for the attention to detail, and the warm welcome the hotel provided. It made Veterans Day weekend so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: travellerZ_rich
Reviews.Content: We bid for the room and paid about $100 per night for a large room with 2 queen size beds. Great location right next to Grand Central Station, good service, nice bar downstairs. Cannot really recall anything negative. We had breakfast across the street in the espresso bar: real espressos!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and central!”
Reviews.Author: Dish90
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay here and was a great stay once again. Staff are nice, rooms are spacious and clean. Very nice hotel and will stay again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: Recieved a pretty good deal through Priceline for this hotel. Thank goodness we got the deal we did, because our stay wasn't the best. Please note that this my second review of this property. I had stayed at this hotel back in July 2011 and had a better experience during that stay. We checked in around 2:00PM. We parked at a lot up the street. It was $60 for two nights versus $60 a night at the hotel. We were given a room on the 12th floor with two double beds. The room was small and it looked dated. The furniture was straight from the 1980s. The bedding was worn in places. WIFI was free which was a nice touch. There was a nice LCD TV in the room but it did not work properly. I was a bit dissapointed with that. While housekeeping came to freshen the room the next day of our two night stay, the room was pretty filthy when we came back. There was dirt all over the carpet and hair all over the bedding. Never really been in a situation where housekeeping made it dirtier. It seemed that they only made the bed and gave us more toiletries. I understand that the hotel is undergoing much needed renovations and they really can't come soon enough. Location is great. 42nd street right by Grand Central! Great access to the city from here.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning in guest bedrooms??”
Reviews.Author: Jessica219
Reviews.Content: Room was unbearably hot and humid - when we contaced reception to ask them to fix our air conditioning, we were told there is no a/c during the winter months! How can this be a 4 star hotel with no a/c in the bedrooms? Guest services told us to open a window (on 37th floor). Not good enough or what you should accept from starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Peytonsage
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend and can't beat the location and price. The beds were clean and comfortable, room quiet and the staff helpful. My husband and I were treating our 8 year old granddaughter to a weekend away and found the standard room ample for the three of us. Had read complaints about the place being a bit shabby but we felt good about the cleanliness and value for money. No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GEM!”
Reviews.Author: kitalki
Reviews.Content: This is a GEM! You can BID for rooms and the location is right near Grand Central Station. So you can be in Times Square in 10 mins and still be in a quiet part of town to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Request renovated room”
Reviews.Author: ccmbgrl
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights. The 1st night was in an old room. I normally would just suck it up and stay in the room I'm first assigned, however it wasn't up to par! Cold sink knob was broken, so only hot water in bathroom sink...old carpet, old furniture, things looked a little dirty, the bed head board was falling apart, the bathtub was stained, the shower wouldn't drain so by the end of my shower I was in 2 feet of dirty looking water, the TV only got about 5 off stations! Too many things! The upside was the manager was super nice and accommodating when I asked to be moved to a renovated room the next day. That room was much nicer, more modern, newer everything, plumbling worked, etc. Hard to believe they charge the same amount for old rooms vs.new rooms. The old rooms should be 1/2 price! Hotel is in okay location. A little far East, but if you like to walk you're still pretty close to all the mid-town good stuff.

Reviews.Title: “very very central. nice room but not my cup of tea.”
Reviews.Author: mariodambrosio
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room but a bit old fashion, it need to be refurb in my opinion. staff friendly. good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “If not for the cheap rate we had I would have given it 1 start less.”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: In town for the marathon. Got an el-cheapo rate for the three nights ($175/nt) for a 2 double room. Hotel was fine. Room definitely is old and worn. Carpet is very dated and didn't seem to have been vacuumed. For $175/nt in Manhattan I'll take it, for what they are charging now? No.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: globaling
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent - very prompt and responsive across the board (front desk, bell captain, housekeeping). The management (both Maurizio Bonivento and Violet Sanchez) were amazingly generous in making our trip very memorable. The room we were given had breathtaking views of the city. It was very nicely appointed (disclaimer: it was one of the renovated ones), and quite spacious (definitely for NYC standards). The location is also central for both business and leisure. It's rare to have one's expectations exceeded, and they definitely were on this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but front desk staff needs some training”
Reviews.Author: Marikrizak
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The New York Helmsley with two other friends, as soon as we checked in no one helped us with our luggage, after that as we open the door there were a couple inside the room! As I head back to the reception, the receptionist implied that was one of my friend in the room! After a little discussion we went to a different vacant room. The hotel is great, big rooms, nice location, but they need seriously to improve their front desk service!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvy1952
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant place to stay and so convenient for most sightseeing ,a short walk to Grand Central Station with lots of fabulous restaurants we ate in two in there and were not disappointed. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: philly19111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on starwoods points. I didn't pay for it, so I can't complain too much. However, the spg. com website should be much clearer about the fact that many of the rooms are dated. The website only shows the newer ones. If I had paid for the room,I would have been very upset. The un renovated room was old, the beds soft. there was no pay per view TV (every now and then its fun to watch a movie), no coffee. In otherwords, none of the "little" things I'm used to getting when I say at a Westin level hotel. The front desk staff was very slow. For a hotel that caters to a lot of foreigners (who often require more attention, they really should have more staff. I waited a very long time to check in. Even my straightfoward check in (drivers license, credit card were ready), the front desk clerk took a long time to process my check in. There were no obvious options for express check out, and I had to wait in a similarly long line to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Throw back to glam days”
Reviews.Author: vuvu14
Reviews.Content: got this room on Priceline for $140.00 a night which was a good deal. The hotel is 2 blocks from Grand Central Station and in the other direction, 2 blocks from the UN. The location is good, not great. It is an old building and while rooms are updated, they are not modern. If you enjoy crystal-like lights (bathroom) and solid brass lamps, etc. then you will enjoy this. The bathroom had a make-up mirror which I appreciate greatly. The beds were firm and adequate but definitely not "heavenly". Electrical outlets were not handy (none in the lamps like more modern rooms). I enjoy microwaves, mini-refrigerators, and in-room coffee makers. This room had none of those. The Helmsley is fine for the right price and a few nights but I would look elsewhere for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: Jlpic40
Reviews.Content: great hotel with great locaton no problems. nice clean and large room with great view. staff was very friendly and helpful. close to grand central to catch subway and within walking distance to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anik17
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been bought by Starwood and uses that as bait.... But don't be fooled!!! This is not a hotel that offers Starwood service and accomodation standards. The rooms are old and dingy. Service is very irregular and often very bad. The person that greeted us at the front desk had trouble expressing herself in English and had a bad attitude (no smiles, no welcome...). Our room door mecanism broke and we had to wait for over 30 minutes for anyone to adress the problem. It then took an additionnal 30 min to fix. The hotel did not apologize and when we complained at the front desk they told us that the hotel would be renovated soon. I don't know how that explanation would help anything at that moment???? We had a bad experience and will definitely not go back,,,, Starwood needs to be careful how they advertise their newly acquired hotels that are not yet up to par with the Starwood brand!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: pmpterp
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel within my price range - the choices were slim. This one fit the bill and was far enough away from the noise of Time Square but easily within walking distance. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel room was clean and quiet. It appeared to be updated recently. The lobby was clean and updated. No loud noises from the rooms nearby, no drunks walking the halls late at night, no kids running around the halls. The wait for an elevator was short. The parking was steep - $60 per 24 hour period. The staff at the front desk was courteous and efficient even with 50 people on a tour checking in at the same time. Bed sheets were noisy and stiff. Closely situated to the subway and many restaurants. Pax was cheap and tasty for a quick breakfast. Aroma was decent but much pricer than Pax. Both situated within steps of the hotel. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best part was we cancelled before we slept there”
Reviews.Author: Mklipper
Reviews.Content: Everything went wrong with our short but memorable stay. It darted with a 25wedding minute line to check in. We reserved a king size bed, but they gave us a room with two double beds. The shower was broken and filled up with dirty bath water. The hotel location is good, but the rooms are small and very outdated. The best part was after four calls to the lobby they let us check out with a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff. Very nice room.”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the NY Helmsley and was a little worried based on some of the reviews I've seen. I was really pleased with the property and the staff. I arrived around 10 AM with the intention of leaving a bag. The clerk at the front desk, Loida, was very helpful. She was not able to put me into a room but did help me find the bell staff to take my bag; I agree with others that the bell staff is a little tough to find and if there is room for improvement. Quite simply, they should make themselves more obviously available as you always have to look for them and it is not clear who is bell staff and who is not bell staff. The fellow that took my bag was very nice though. I also agree that the lobby in not ideal and it was tough to figure out who was waiting to talk to the front desk and who was just hanging around. When I came back to check in, I saw Loida again and was given a room on the 14th floor. I asked her if I could have something higher, and she suggested I take a look at the room and come back if I was not happy with it. I was given a large corner room that was really nice, and even though it looked out over 42nd St. it was set back in an alley or something and was one of the quietest rooms I've stayed in in New York. I am pretty sure the room has been renovated, as the bed was clearly the Westin heavenly bed and there was new carpeting. I really liked the room, and was able to do my morning exercises as there was enough space. The shower was nice but was not the heavenly shower (something I can live without as I don't like the Westin heavenly shower) and the bathroom amenities were high end. I did not notice plumbing noises from other rooms, which I find is a problem in a lot of older New York hotels. There were about 100 television channels available and the television and internet worked very well. Also, there was a spacious in-room safe which I always like to see. I did not use the hotel's restaurant or fitness center. I really liked the room I was given and got two very nice nights of sleep. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location near Grand Central Station is great. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: jlkkshic
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Lily at the front desk was very friendly and personable. We arrived too early to check in, so we stored our bags and headed out to explore the city! Our room was on the 35th floor. Great view of the Empire State Building and the Brooklyn Bridge. The beds were SO comfortable!! The hotel is a bit out of the way from all the hustle and bustle, but that made for a quiet nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: mister_mister1981
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Helmsley in mid September. Had a corner room on 31st floor with great views. Chrysler Building to our left and the UN and river to our right. There was a bit of noise at night but it's not that of surprise considering you're right in the middle of NYC and neither my wife or I had any trouble sleeping. The room was not modern but was clean and felt homely. I think overall it was excellent value for its location and all the staff were very helpful when we needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jae2020
Reviews.Content: Light control is not automatic. Air conditioning too old. Good location. Average services. Wifi is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for just sleeping”
Reviews.Author: Hanzi-b
Reviews.Content: We stayed sept-early oct. Rooms were ok, spacisious but dated. Very old furniture. No celling lights just lamps, which only 3 out of 5 worked. Also shower hardly worked and was a mixer tap with a switch tap to change to shower, which didn't was not very good. The staff at hotel don't help. No one to show you to your room, no advice and an extremely rude man who works on the bag storage area! I also reccomend you don't use the phone in room as I got charged $112 for 8mins of calls to uk due to there service charge. Which is unbelievably a rip off! Which I complained about. They also advertise free wifi, this is not true, this costs aswell. It's location is brilliant. 5mins walk from central and 15min direct walk to times square. Highly reccomend the blue bus company. Very good info given and you can see and do everything on a small budget. When you go to St liberty go before 3 or you won't beable to get inside.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: JCCPlymouthMI
Reviews.Content: You would definitely want to avoid this hotel. We were able to check in around 10:00 a.m. Oct. 14, 2011. We had prepaid on-line, but the desk clerk asked to see my credit card for any charges that might be incurred. That was the only time the card was used that day and the only time in several days prior that the card had been out of my possession. On that same day fraudulent charges for fuel purchases in Texas amounting to nearly $1000 were posted to my account, prior to any other use of the card. I e-mailed my concern to the hotel. The director of roomsâ€™ response completely failed to address the issue of the card being out of my possession and sight for a brief time, and dismissed the matter stating: â€œOur Front Desk associates do not have access to reveal your encoded number and we do not imprint your credit card on any duplicating paper. I can assure you that we did not compromise your account.â€� Of all the credit card uses at least two weeks before and the days after the fraudulent charges were made, only the Helmsley had the zip code associated with the card, which is generally required to purchase gasoline. The cavalier attitude of the hotel management toward the security of credit card information perfectly explains how the fraud was able to occur. Unless you intend to pay with cash only, you should avoid the New York Helmsley. We certainly will.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but old hotel :(”
Reviews.Author: JP C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week end at the Helmsley. Our favorite part was the location: you can easily walk to Grand Central Terminal, Time Square or even further Central Park. So A++ for the location. The service was really good. Hotel stuff was friendly and helpful, the Concierge gave us good recommendation for dinner. So far so good. The hotel itself is not that great. We booked on Starwood's website who was showing pictures of rooms that were looking really nice. It was very different once we got there. It turns out that only some rooms have been renovated and looked like the nice pictures (that was according to hotel staff). After we got to our room we very disappointed. The Starwood's website totally upsell the hotel. We went back to the front desk and showed the photos to the staff and asked them if we could change to one of those nicer renovated rooms. They say no problem and changed us to a different room (we went from the 19th floor to the 40th floor that was cool). Unfortunately, the room was exactly the same (just different floor).

Reviews.Title: “In need of a renovation.”
Reviews.Author: lily60745
Reviews.Content: Our company had booked 7 rooms for 3 days. Upon arrival at 9:30pm, one of our co-workers was told that here were no rooms available until 10pm or 10:30pm. Check-in is at 3:30pm. When I checked out, they charged me an incorrect (highly inflated) rate and I had to have them cancel the invoice and issue a new one. The bathrooms are old, dirty and leak water. The cold water for the sink kept turning off and water was pouring out of the handle, instead of the faucet. The tub leaked water as well. The fixtures were not marked "hot" and "cold" and this could be problematic for international guests. The hotel should renovate the bathrooms. The only positive is that the beds were clean and comfortable and the gentleman who delivered room service was extremely nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Service is supposed to be part of the experience, right?”
Reviews.Author: happytrailer33
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights this past weekend. It is a Helmsley that is now run by Starwood, on its way to becoming a W Hotel. From the moment I walked in to the front desk, there was an air of aloofness that bordered on disregard. I was not alone, as others around me seemed to get the same treatment. The room was clean, but dated (likely to be redone soon in the transformation of brands). Nothing special, but bigger than most Manhattan hotel rooms. The location is great, easy walking distance to Grand Central and all of Midtown. Twice when I went to retrieve my car from valet did I experience further rudeness/dismissive attitude by the staff. First of all, at $60/day to park your car, they are being nicely compensated for storing it below the hotel...yet, each time I was waved off (literally - with a hand gesture on the second occasion), by staff. Why? good question...it wasn't for being too busy. In fact, on the second time, they brought up the wrong car, would not look at my ticket to see what they had done, and after the hand wave, only came over after I went looking for a supervisor to speak to me. Nice warm fuzzy feeling to leave the hotel with! So, although I review hotels often, usually to sing praise for the really good ones I find, this one was a stinker. Wait until it becomes a real W before trying it if in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTravelBug
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stay at a Hemsley Hotel. Got a great deal on Hotwire and grabbed it. I didn't get to choose the room type and they were out of king beds when I arrived. I accepted the double room. It was functional. A bit outdated and reeked of old cigarette smoke. I called Housekeeping who promised to spray the room. When got in later that night I went into a full blown allergy attack including sneezing, throbbing headache, and stuffy nose. I called the front desk and spoke to the manager, Jody. She offered to change my room which I did. She placed me on a higher floor which was a non smoking floor. Oh, so much better! The rest of my stay was smooth sailing and I felt like a princess. The room was made up beautifully every day and the maid would ask me what time was convenient for me for housekeeping. It was very comfortable. The gym has a nice amount of treadmills, ellipticals, free weights, and 1 recumbant and 1 upright stationary cycle. The equipment is well maintained and the room is kept clean with fresh towels and cold water. The location can't be beat. Right in the center of midtown near shops, restaurants, many subways, busses, the UN, and Grand Central Station. There are 6 elevators in the elevator bank so you never have to wait long regardless of your floor.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Kaotcgd
Reviews.Content: We ended up in the Helmsley trying to escape a terrible previous night at a Guest House named in another review I have posted. pros: Comfortable, well-made up beds. Quiet and clean room at the end of the hall; carpet in good shape; loved the bathroom toiletries provided; a wonderful and kind bartender downstairs who went out of his way to find us some peanuts at 1 a.m. even though he had nothing at the bar and the kitchen was closed for the night (and he got me a glass of milk for bedtime too!); helpful front desk staff who contacted housekeeping for me to make sure that our hairdryer was replaced that day (the hairdryer in the room was on its last legs and kept shutting off); location is walkable to Times Square but out of the crush of activity. cons: would have been nice to have a bottle of water in the room (like Westin hotels do/although they do charge for it, but it is nice to have); or a mini-fridge in the room with water, juice, etc. Would also be nice if the kitchen would stay open past 11 p.m. You can't even get a snack or pub menu after 11 so there is nothing if you are coming back late from a show. Surprising, given the many hotels that have round-the-clock room service or a late night menu. And in New York, you would think that they would be expecting folks to come rolling in late looking for a small snack or meal. Aside from those few suggestions, I was very pleased and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaterGuy1
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate (120/nite incl. fees & taxes) via Hotwire. At that price, this hotel is a steal. Its equivalent to a Sheraton/Hilton type level and has a very very good fitnes center, wifi free for Starwood members, and the rooms are spacious for New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Very good Staff and Management”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in Sept. Was assigned the most amazing corner room on the 37th floor with a great view of Manhattan. The room was very well appointed with new furnishings and was really quiet. Was celebrating my birthday and the GM, Maurizio was really kind to send up a fruit bowel with birthdays wishes. That was a really nice touch. The managment was great and responded immediately to any concerns. I had requested a refridgerator and it was already placed in the room when I checked in. Loaction is great-very central and close to Grand Central Station. Would not have any problem recommending this hotel to anyone. Big Thanks to Maurizo, the GM who made the stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Skater6491
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on East 42nd Street near Grand Central station. Plenty of good restaurants within 5 minute walk, buses and trains even closer. Bedrooms are large by New York standards and the beds are really comfortable and bathrooms well equpped with good selection of toiletries. Hotel is clean and has been recently renovated to a good standard. All the staff are very helpful and even though we had to check out in the morning they were more than happy to store our luggage until late afterboon.

Reviews.Title: “Big thanks to Lily at the Front Office for making our stay amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: AirportDisco
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is unbeatable! Rooms are comfortable, great views from high floors, and overall excellent stay for the price and the location. Very greatful to Lily at the front office for allowing us to check in early after a trek from Miami, and helping us throughout our stay. Will be back thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff are Excellent ,Hotel is Ok. but could have been Refurbished with more Imagination”
Reviews.Author: DavidCraddock
Reviews.Content: Visited the US in August - unknowingly just in time for Hurricane Irene, so unwittingly faced a 24hr lockdown of the City, and so had to stay put in the Hotel itself. The Staff were excellent, the impromptu 'Buffet Meals' first class, and All the Staff helped out,including a Manager from the Finance Dept who 'served' our Breakfast, its what we Brits would call the 'blitz spirit' The only disappointment was the Refurbishment of the Hotel, firstly it hadn't reached the 14th Floor where our Room was, the Carpet in particular had clearly seen better days, as for the Foyer when we stayed 2 years ago, the place was covered in Dust Sheets and there was a sense that after they had finished it would be quite something, well they've finished this element & to be truthful they missed a trick, its quite bland, No WOW factor at All, shame they had an opportunity to make a statement - to be bold & stand out rather than just bland

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms and a good view!”
Reviews.Author: AWWTG
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to NYC with seven friends. We had been lucky enough to bid on rooms at the Helmsley and got a great rate. The hotel was more than satisfactory for our trip and we managed to do well with four women in each double room other than a couple of brief partial power outages due to using "those powerful hair dryers". The staff was very quick to get power restored on each occasion. The rooms were quite spacious by NYC standards. We had a nice room on the 28th floor with a view to 42nd Street and the Chrysler Building. There was a subway entrance less than one block away and Grand Central Station was a mere two blocks which greatly facilitated our ability to get around the city. We were out and about most of the day and the nights were a little noisy but that was to be expected in the middle of New York City. Earplugs helped a lot. Easy walking distance to many sites and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: J-Class_only
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay, large room by NY standards. Very clean hotel/rooms/halls/lobby! 6 lifts to rooms...never had to wait! Excellent location, close to UN, 34st and Empire State, right beside Grand Central. 10 min walk to Times Sq. Lots of restaurants close by, PAX wholesome foods right next door, 24 hr CVS and Pret-a-manger across street. From Grand central I caught No 7 Subway 1 stop across to Queens to take pictures back across to Manhattan, also took the No 6 downtown to City Hall to walk across Brooklyn Bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_ATL
Reviews.Content: Well, it may not be exactly like other Starwoods but for the price we paid for (around 200 USD through priceline) and the location, it was an excellent value. We didn't actually spend that much time in the hotel but the room was big enough for my family of 4 and was clean. The beds were comfortable also. The bath tub was stuck at first but the service guy came almost immediately (around 2am) and fixed the problem quickly. The concierges as well as other front desk people were polite and helpful. Times Square is 1 mile away and there is a CVS about a few steps from the hotel (turn left once you exit the front entrance of the hotel). Grand Central is only 10 mins of walk also. We enjoyed our stay there and will definitely choose Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “"construction zone level noise; rude front desk management”
Reviews.Author: Todd933
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in last night to renovated (premium) room on 37th floor, facing 42nd Street. Loud street drilling started around 11 p.m and didn't quit until 3 a.m. My wife and I felt like we were in the middle of a construction zone- noisiest room I've had in over 15 years of frequent travel-- not possible to fall asleep! I called front desk to inquire about moving to a different room for my 2nd and 3rd nights. "Will", the rude front desk manager, said "not possible. All sold out and no other room for you. Same noise in every room." Of course there are lots of rooms available and he didn't even attempt to check. I asked for Maurizio (GM) to call me in the morning. "Sure." I didn't receive a call this morning and was told by front desk that he's not available for the next couple days. Called SPG platinum concierge and arranged to move to a "potentially" quieter room. Will use earplugs tonight and hope for the best. I strongly recommend looking elsewhere if you value a restful night's sleep and courteous customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,good location”
Reviews.Author: JoeandAnna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is going through a gradual renovation. We had a traditional decor room (late 80's). For the price we paid, it could not be beat. Although some floors had the old decor, the bed and linens were new and of high quality. You will pay more for a newly renovated room, but if you are in New York to see the City, then it does not matter. A great location, good bed and quiet hotel are all that is required.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MaAsc
Reviews.Content: Good location in terms of availability.Staff is friendly and helpful. Room is ok, but one window cann't be completly closed. AC very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “New york helmsley”
Reviews.Author: bigoh20
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley 's lobby and Harry's bar were recently renovated and were in excellent condition. The rooms on our floor require some attention. Icemaker on our floor did not work. Hall need new carpet. Bedding very good and TV's were old. Overall it is a good hotel which was recently sold to Starwood group and will become the W hotel in March 2012 at which time it will be completely renovated.

Reviews.Title: “New York getaway”
Reviews.Author: Pille-Riin
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is huge, having people on movement all the time. So it was a bit too crowded and noisy but in the room it was nice and quiet :) The service was not the best I've experienced, the staff was slow and not as polite as I'd expect. Location was just excellent, main attractions on walking distance. Now that I've been in NY many times, I'd still go to that hotel. The first time it was blind luck, now a wise selection. Rooms were quite spacious and tidy, with just breath-taking view on higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in New York”
Reviews.Author: SaoPauloBrazilian
Reviews.Content: It is my third time in this hotel. I really recommend to stay there. If you go by business, it is perfect. Just near from everything. I had an early check in that made all diference in my day. Ask for a high floor, fantastic view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: E_Synnott
Reviews.Content: I went here in 2005 so apologies for the late review. What a fantastic hotel. Not being used to fancy hotels I thought this was an amazing hotel. Staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were absolutely unreal and so clean. We had fantastic views of the NYC streets. We had great views of the Chrysler Building and we could also see Grand Central Station which was less than 5 minute walk. Times Square wasn't too far either. The day we arrived was the day they were putting up the tree at the Rockefeller Centre. Amazing. Right night store to the hotel was Pax, a bagel and coffee shop. We got our breakfast in here some mornings before we set off. There are Pax all over Manhattan. Fab food. Really really would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Check for renovations, drilling noise during business hours”
Reviews.Author: 4familySanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the mostly good tripadvisor reviews. I understand the mix now as four floors of this hotel are renovated so the experience varies as the new rooms are quite lovely but the older rooms are worn. Sept 12-16 the hotel had emergency drilling that no one had told us about and the noise carries throughout the hotel. We are checking out as the drilling makes it impossible to be in the rooms and do a conference call, etc. Apparently they will start full time renovations in the next few months so I would check with the front desk if you pick this hotel and noise during the day will bother you. We were told drilling would be 10 am start but it started at 8:30 so the hotel doesn't control the construction. We haven't had the good customer service experience others have written about but I would stay at this hotel after it's updated. The rooms are good size, the location is lovely and the rooms that are renovated now do warrant a four+ rating if they can figure out the service star wood is famous for having at it's hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Serivce, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: lilj155019
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews...actually, truth be told - I never write reviews but I had such an amazing experience at The Helmsley that I had to write about it. My family and I were in the city celebrating an anniversary as well as my daughters first birthday and on learning this, the hotel upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. This was SO helpful for so many reasons but we were really impressed and grateful that they would do this for us. The service was impeccable...check in and check out was a breeze, concierge and front desk were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were huge by new york standards, clean and quiet. Location was great....less than a 5 minute walk away from Grand Central. We couldn't have asked for anything more. We will definitely be staying here the next time we come to the city. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Not on par with other Starwoods and too busy”
Reviews.Author: Tokyopro
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there several times and find the rooms verycomfortable but some of the staff are mediocre at best, e.g. front desk. Was given misinformation when I called. Hotel is bustling but perhaps staff is new. Location is very convenient, though, and easy to take limobus or Supershuttle to and from airports but I had to pay double fare because I was traveling alone with 3 pieces of luggage and two hands and their staff not allowed to help me to airport bus a block away so had to pay for Supershuttle tocome to hotel. Staff very tough, crass, uncaring and impersonal - and did not get a wakeup call so had to complain to manager. Overall, still looking for a hotel I can use regularly on business trips to New York from overseas. Cannot recommend any! Prices high, service generally not good enough considering price. This hotel is one example of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: ForrestJones
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel, no complaints about it to be honest. Service was good, clean beds, good AC, good location, not perfect, but good. I would definately stay here again if coming back to NYC. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel with a Plan to Improve”
Reviews.Author: TheBayou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on 42nd street, right off of 3rd Avenue. The hotel is a little run down but my understanding is that upgrades are planned for December, in connection with the new affiliation with Starwood Hotels. Once completed, I expect this hotel to be a good replacement for the W-Court and W-Tuscany which left the Starwood family over the last couple of years. The rooms are good size, comparable to the Marriott on Lexington St or the Westin Time Square. The lobby is always very busy. It could use some modernizing. The hotel bar has some energy to it, which is nice. The room service was good, about as good as at the local Hyatt or Marriott. The location is great as it is easy walking distance to Grand Central and a comfortable, nice weather walk to pretty much anything in Midtown, Time Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catdfromsc
Reviews.Content: LOVED our stay at The Helmsley during the US Open! Great location with big plus being so close to Grand Central Station. Very reasonable rate for a good sized room in the City. Rooms were clean with flat screens, plush robes and great beds. Enjoyed a very early check-in at the SPG Gold with Deidre, who could not have been more accommodating. Angel, the bartender, delivered wonderful service and drinks. My favorite staff were all the bellmen...shout outs to the 2 Michaels and Caro. Get to know them and they will totally take care of you. I am in the hospitality business and travel to New York at least once a year AND I will definitely be back to stay here! Now that its Starwood, I get my points as well!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it an will recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Philippe M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beyond our expectations ! Top-top note in terms of cleanness. Our room was very spacious, the personal helpful and friendly. The location (a mere 5 minutes walk from GRAND CENTRAL) is a further +++. To avoid suffering from the street noise, preferrably ask for a room overlooking the 41st street. Breakfast is excellent but quite expensive. We will recommend to our friends and have left a note to our excellent travel agency Universal Tourisme in Geneva, Switzerland.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road - Decent Location to Lay your Head Down”
Reviews.Author: bawdyjane
Reviews.Content: Overall the room feels a bit out of date, I don't believe the room had an iron and the bed is somewhat (barely) comfortable. At a mid-price point it does the trick, someplace to lay your head and store your belongings while you're in NY. If you plan on taking on the city and want to save money on the fun stuff stay here - given the choice though I'd check and see if there are comparable rates at the Sheraton nearby first though.

Reviews.Title: “Request a renovated room unless you want to relive the 1980s”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: I'll hold off my critiques of the property by first addressing what is positive about the New York Helmsley Hotel. The location near the corner of 42nd and 3rd, is extremely convenient when I'm visiting NYC for work. The hotel is just blocks from Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building and some of the hotel's higher floors provide views of these iconic buildings. Additionally, the rooms are well appointed and spacious - esp. by NYC standards. My biggest critique is reserved for the rooms yet to undergo a renovation. These older rooms will transport you back to the 80s with their decor. I won't belabor this point since the hotel is obviously making a concerted effort to update their rooms. My other critiques are of a more personal nature. I find the space lacking personality. If you look at the walls they are bare, lacking warmth and interest. Lastly, the showers (even in the newer rooms) are not as nice as what I have in my own home, which is too bad, because I generally look forward to taking long, hot, relaxing showers when I travel and am away from friends and family. Some hints and tips about the property: - There is free internet access if you are a Starwood member so join Starwood's loyalty program before visiting and you can save yourself $10.00 a day - The hotel has views of the Chrysler Building - if that's important to you; call ahead and request a room with a view. The hotel staff does seem to try to go the extra mile to fulfill requests when possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: chuy13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week during new years eve. Arrived the morning after the huge snow storm about 7am. The front desk was so friendly and accommodating. They did not make us wait to check in. Gave us a room right away so we could get some rest. Room was pretty roomy and nice and clean. About a 10 min walk to times square. Had a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine B
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a family week in New York with our 2 sons aged 11 and 8. Having read some off the reviews about this hotel we were slightly worried prior to travelling. There was no need - the hotel was fantastic - Check in staff were helpful and friendly, greeting both our sons by their first names, and they agreed straight away to our request for a higher floor room than we had originally been allocated. The room was of ample size for the four of us and was immaculately clean - beds were really comfortable and the bathroom more than adequate in size, spotless and with plenty of luxurious white towels. The location is excellent for seeing all the sights. I really cannot recommend this hotel highly enough :)))

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: IamnotBartSimpson
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend here to tour New York and catch a Yankees game. The location was great and convenient to everything. The lobby, bar and restaurant look to be recently renovated and is gorgeous. The rooms are in need of a makeover but were clean, spacious an well maintained. The staff was very helpful and friendly and swiftly helped remedy the one issue we had. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Most Enjoyable family holiday (better without Irene though!)”
Reviews.Author: eeyore30westmidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The New York Helmsley Hotel from 24th - 29th August 2011. On arrival check in was very fast and staff friendly. Check in was from 4pm but we arrived early and our rooms were ready for us to to go stright to at 1pm..impressive start, the rooms did not disappoint either, we had 3924 and our children 3921, both rooms had views of the Empire State building (3921 the better view) and ours also had a view of the Chrysler Building. There is nothing that I could fault about our stay here. We had to experience Hurricane Irene and the staff remained calm still went about their duties in an efficient manner, as we were unable to leave the hotel the staff did a buffet dinner on Saturday & Sunday evening and buffet breakfast on the Sunday morning to cater for the larger amount of guests needing to eat in the hotel, it was well thought out considering this isn't something they would normally have to do. Having now returned back home I do miss the hotel and will be looking forward to a return visit. It is situated in a nice quiet part of town but not that far that you can't walk to Times Square or an even shorter walk to Grand Central and hop on the subway...many tourists seem wary of the subway but we found it most useful and luckily our son mastered the map reading... Overall we had a fabulous time on our recent trip...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RobH3
Reviews.Content: This has recently become a Starwood property and prior to branding the hotel they should have considered a renovation and a major over haul. This hotel is extremely out dated. Room furniture looks like it was purchased at ikea, and amenities are non existant. Bar and restaurant service is slow and the service staff appear to care less if they are there or you are there. Five people in the bar and it took me 20 minutes to get my bill. During that time my server passed the table 5 times. This hotel is not worth the price. I am a Starwood Platinum member and have stayed in Four Points Hotels that have better service and are more updated than this hotel. A three star rating would be generous. NYC is filled with superior properties at more reasonable price points.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended and this not only because of it's location”
Reviews.Author: KubaTraveller
Reviews.Content: A really good place to stay during the trips in NYC. The location is top, Grand Central Station in the immediate vicinity as well as many shops, pubs, restaurants. From rooms on higher floors the perfect view overall the city and the Eastriver. The hotel is decorated in American style, a little bit old-fashioned form 80ies but I like that atmpsphere. The staff were competent and friendly. The rooms are nice, comfortable and offer free WiFi acces. Everything perfect cleaned every day. The breakfast was for me absolutely sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Eriks1939
Reviews.Content: We were staying on 32th floor in a room not yet renovated, the room was still nice but the bathroom had a broken fan so the wallpaper was starting to curl from the walls. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the ventilation was very quiet and effective. The room was looking on 42nd street giving us a view on the Chrysler building.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately go back!”
Reviews.Author: Jerzeygirl53
Reviews.Content: The location was awesome, a short walk from the subway and the bus passed right in front of the door. The staff was pleasant and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable. The furnishings in the room were dated and the beds were not the most comfortable but we were never in the room except to sleep. Our room was on the 39th floor and the view was breathtaking. I would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for tourists”
Reviews.Author: MrMagee_11
Reviews.Content: On vacation from Britain, we appreciated being on 42nd Street close to the Chrysler building, Times Square, Grand Central. The hotel is very busy, and a bit worn down, but the rooms were large and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok. Practical but not unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: Hedin
Reviews.Content: Overall nice, safe location, good value for money, but for a 4 stars hotel I'd expect fresher, nicer rooms. It felt a bit worn out, despite clean above doubts. Nice, kind staff in all areas. Beautiful bar area with friendly atmosphere. If you look for romance or extras go somewhere else. If you want a pragmatic, value-for-money choice here you'll be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: hmo102
Reviews.Content: My sister, daughter and I spent 5 nights at the New York Helmsley. The hotel is very conveniently located near Grand Central Station in a very safe area and within walking distance to Times Square. The lobby is beautiful and the double room had ample space for the three of us. The view was great! We found everything to be very clean with everything we needed for our stay with the exception of a fridge, but I didn't inquire. We came and went at various times of day and night and were always welcomed! From the time we arrived, the staff was helpful and welcoming. Everyone went above and beyond to make my daughter's 13th birthday an experience of a lifetime! I contacted Maurizio before our arrival, and was pleased with a reponse immediately! I can't say enough about Maurizio, Donna, and Michael (my daughter's favorite guy outside) and staff. I have, and will continue, to recommend the New York Helmsley to all of my family and friends who plan to travel to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Very average.”
Reviews.Author: reddaithi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights. Agreed the price on arrival and received the bill the night before we left. Payed it, figured that was it. No problem? No on check out we were charged for another night, we were informed that a change it the hotels computer system didnt calculate our total bill. It wasn't really explained and there was no compromising. Really let us down. Found the rooms too warm and there didn't seem to be any air con. I will say the location is average if you want to hit Times Square, Broadway etc. Small bit of a walk but not the end of the world. If it was maybe $100-$200 cheaper for the entire stay I would consider it reasonable. You prob could get a nice hotel, more central for the same price. It wasn't all bad, the staff on reception were generally nice and helpful particulary the lady when we checked in. And the bell boys were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel at a great location!"”
Reviews.Author: AnnelieG
Reviews.Content: We chose the New York Helmsley after reading some reviews here at Tripadvisor. The combination of location (very close to Grand Central Station) and the smooth possibility of the Airport Express bus from Newark stopping almost just outside the door, made the choice easy. They were very friendly in the reception and we felt very welcome. They also managed to grant us our wish of getting a room high up in the building. The room was spacious and in good standard. Not top modern, but good. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was fresh. When going back to New York, I will probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Twilight2Twilight
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Aeroplan. The service we got was outstanding. While driving to NYC, we called ahead of check in and requested a room on a high floor with a view of the Chrysler building. No problem ! Upon check in, our request had been taken into consideration. Nice way to start our stay. ROOMS: We stayed on the 34th floor with a great view of the Chrysler building. We were very pleased that our request was granted. The room was a 2 double beds, very clean and no bed bugs. The bathroom was very nice and clean, spacious and all the towels were large, yes ! Bonus ! The room was in need of updating but it was clean. The only thing we were surprised about is that there was no coffee & tea in the rooms. But there is a PAX deli just 2 doors down that serves breakfast, lunch & dinner so that did the job. LOCATION: the hotel is well located, a 5 minutes walk to Grand Central, 10-15 minutes to Times Square and very close to all major attractions. There are plenty of amenities close by, pharmacy, restaurants, delis, shops, subway & train. SERVICE: We could not have asked for better service. As mentioned above, the request to our room was granted upon calling ahead of time. We also requested extra blankets upon arrival and within minutes someone was at our door with the blankets. On another night, we experienced a problem with our room safe. We called the front desk (past midnight) and withing minutes someone was in our room to fix the problem. Last but not least, Alexandra. She made our stay a most pleasant one. We ran into a price discrepancy with parking as the price was changed (without our knowledge) after we inquired upon booking the room. She honored the initial price we had inquired about and was very nice about handling the whole thing. Overall a very pleasant stay. I would go back for the service alone. Yes the rooms need some updating but the service was really out of this world for us, and that goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean. Staff good. Good to come bnack to after long hot days.”
Reviews.Author: Tessington
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights in really hot weather and it was great to come back to. very clean, lovely big towels/robes, great air con, ice machines on every other floor. good base to explore on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Not one single piece of decoration at the walls of our room !”
Reviews.Author: GilsBerlaar
Reviews.Content: Although I'm aware hotel standards in NY are lower than national average, I still can not understand how a hotel can advertise a room without a single piece of decoration as "excecutive". Size was OK, location simply great. And nobody would accept the bath room door even for free at his own place. But since the cabs in NY are extremely cheap I will next time not focus on the location. Good breakfast opportunity just next doors.

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of the world!”
Reviews.Author: Francesca B
Reviews.Content: We have been in june for the honeymoon. The hotel is clean, big, in a good position. You can reach the most famous buildings, central park and times square by walking. We are very happy and we' recommend this hotel to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a true SPG property yet”
Reviews.Author: Deavster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently acquired by Starwood. They are in the process of updating the hotel and getting it up to par with let's say a nice Sheraton. The staff seemed to be trying very hard, like they are now under new management and this is what they were told to do, did not feel genuine. The rooms are kinda an after thought. They tried to modernize the old layout by adding a few newer accessories. The lighting was also inadequate. I was on a one day business trip so I was in and out. If I had to stay for a period of time I would have been disappointed. I will say the bed was comfortable and the view was great. The location was also very convenient, right down the street from Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Old School Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kirb7
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley Hotel is classic in every sense of the word. The old school feel of the establishment is prevalent as soon as you enter the building! The front desk employees were very cordial and helpful despite the volume and bustle of the front lobby. It is very clean,centrally located, and an excellent place to call homebase while diggin it out in New York City. The rooms were spacious compared to most NYC hotels, and we enjoyed the traditional feel of the place. Our room had a flat screen TV, a very nice view, and the bed slept excellent. I guess you can tell from my tone that we had a great time in Gotham...we always do!

Reviews.Title: “A scam”
Reviews.Author: JustjillRe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline for a TOTAL price of $350.40. When I received my bill it was $409.08. I called the desk and spoke to Mariah she said the manager would call me . I waited in my room over an hour it was checkout time and has to leave. Again at the desk I talked with Mariah she said even though all of my paperwork said $350.40 she would not reverse the charges. I called my bank who then told me they actually charged my $390.56. Again I called looking for the manager twice [--] and he not called me back it has been 5 hours. This hotel is a scam don't fall for it. They also charge $53 a day to park when you can park around the corner for $21. I heard them tell the lady next to me it was going to be $70. Never mind the decor is old and gross wallpaper, the lobby is so crowded you can't move.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for leisure trip, not for business stays”
Reviews.Author: pankajg05
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, average staff (can be more smiling and welcoming) and great views of Empire State. Rooms are very traditional looking and didn't quite fit my taste. It is not a good hotel for business stay. I think it was not planned for business stays. It has been converted into a Starwood property, but staff wasn't fully aware of SPG benefits (they say full integration has not happened till now). Good for leisure stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Jane but reliable”
Reviews.Author: ksk17
Reviews.Content: The best thing about The New York Helmsley is it's proximity to no fewer than3 Starbucks stores just a few steps in almost any location. Unless you are in a renovated room, expect to be totally underwhelmed. However, the room sizes are not too bad and the place is kept clean.. No matter how high up you stay, brace yourself for extreme street noise (ambulance, fire, truck, etc.). This hotel is all about location, stay f E. 42nd Street suits your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room not quite in the best condition”
Reviews.Author: GracefulUnderFire
Reviews.Content: My friend and I met in New York using the Helmsley as our base of operations. The location is unbeatable (three blocks from Grand Central, great walks in all directions), the beds were very comfortable, and sound-proofing was excellent. However, the room was in slightly poorer condition than expected. Also, the staff with whom we had interactions were all perfectly competent, but most seemed overworked and tired. Overall, the Helmsley is still a good place, though.

Reviews.Title: “The Bull likes this Hotel...I'll be Back”
Reviews.Author: THEBULL84
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights this past weekend. We were joined by another couple who were making their first visit to NYC. We enjoyed ourselves and were very pleased the way we were treated by the Front Desk Staff and Valet Attendents. We were given corner rooms with a great view looking towards the Chrysler Building to the east and The United Nations to the west. We were on the 35 th floor which gives great views and less street noise. I look forward to visiting this Hotel again after the renovations are complete. I was told that it will run under the Westin Brand sometime in 2012. The location will keep you coming back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay there again next time we're in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: LinnHansen
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the New York Helmsley Hotel this summer. The staff was super nice, helpfull and very service minded. The room was clean, big and had a great view to the Empire State buildning. And the locations was also good, just a few blocks away from the chrysler buildning and central station. Not a along walk to times square either. We never ate at the hotel, so I cannot tell how that was. We are absolutely staying here on our next trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: MikeT2003
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location. Very glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: bkmom_11
Reviews.Content: We had a standard double room which was larger than we expected. The room itself was somewhat plain and dated, but the beds were comfortable and the shower had wonderful pressure. We were able to check in early and the hotel staff was very nice. We would definately stay there again. Short walk to Grand Central Station and then only a subway ride to anywhere you want to go or catch at taxi outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ADKtraveller
Reviews.Content: The room is comfortable. Oddly though there is no work space in the hotel room. The room has a feeling of being more of a guest room in a friends house than a traditional hotel room. There are several comfortable chairs in the room and a side table but no work-space for a computer. Not a good room if you intrend to get some work done while in your room. Also the room lacks outlets to charge phones and computers. Oddly though even the my room was on the 19th floor it was very very noisy from the street. The check in service was lousy. There were a few people at the desk when I entered and employees just standing behind the desk doing nothing when I entered. Eventually someone decided to check me in. I could barely hear her over the noise in the lobby and she was not helpful when answering questions. The valet was more helpful and was quite friendly - he was able to help me with items that should have handled by the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: skyritchie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and had no issues. Check in was quick, and PEI(I believe that was her name?) was very helpful and friendly; even gave me an upgrade and free internet. I did not see her again during my stay to thank her. The room was plenty big enough for myself, and I was actually surprised, as NYC hotels are notorious for being small. Location was the best thing for my purposes, as it was close to Grand Central Station and subways. Plenty of coffee shops and resturants around the area as well. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience, i hope to visit it again.”
Reviews.Author: ThePeacefulWarrior
Reviews.Content: Well placed, nice service, good GYM, didn't like that there weren't spanish channels on TV but it's ok. Good food at restaurant, excellent sleep quality for a NYC hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: BostonMass1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley New York for a long weekend in July 2011. Based on some of the reviews, I was a little concerned. The Helmsley is certainly an older hotel, but I found it to be completely comfortable and clean with a very helpful staff. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was also fine (clean, though not fancy). The front desk was incredibly helpful! Pei Hu in particular was excellent. After my first night, she moved me to a different room because there was a problem with one of the windows in my original room. All in, an excellent choice for a reasonably priced New York hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms seriously need updating and internet should be included.”
Reviews.Author: Cin_Cin11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and were disappointed. The room didn't look anything like on the website, they must have renovated a couple rooms and took pictures of the updated rooms for the web page. Our room was straight out of the 70's!! The bathroom was seriously dated, I felt like I walked into an old movie...that aside the room was comfortable, and there was no bed bugs which NYC has a reputation for. Internet was an extra charge and there wasn't even a coffee maker in the room! Located close to Starbucks though... My son left his Ipod touch in the room when we checked out, we discovered it when we were catching our train at Penn station. When we got to Providence RI, I called security and they said it wasn't in the room. Security told me they would file a report and their insurance company would contact us to replace it. This has not happened, so although we didn't get pick pocketed in NYC, the hotel didn't even return our left items to us....although we loved NYC and will return to see more, it''s not likely we will stay at The Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “5-star location, 3.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MommaFox
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for three nights. Overall, we were very pleased and would stay again. Check-in was smooth. Even made sure we had adjacent rooms for all the members of our party. Lobby is lovely. Restaurant/Bar is really overpriced -- $6.00 for a small bottle of coke. Rooms are smallish, but clean. I see where past reviews have called them tired or dated. I can see where they are coming from (some stains on carpet, fixtures old or leaky, etc), but I never felt as if the room was dirty or uncared for. Wonderful view of the Empire State building from our room. A/C worked well, which was important during insane heat wave. You can't beat the location of the hotel. Nice, upscale area. So close to Grand Central. Staff was helpful and courteous. Felt welcome and taken care of. No nightly turndown service. Beds very comfy. Would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “high rised hotels, scary”
Reviews.Author: loubuddy
Reviews.Content: arrived at this hotel after leaving the hamptons, what a difference. we were on the 27th floor and i struggled to look out of the windows due to the height. the room was small but comfortable and as we were out most of the day it didnt really bother us. it was clean and the staff were friendly enough but beware as every door opened or bag moved an inch came with a big smile and a hand held out wanting a dollar tip !!! location was very convenient to central park and fifth avenue but if you go there you must visit tiffanys. its huge. didnt eat in this hotel so cant comment on much else. nice enough place though

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: I was assigned this hotel through Priceline and got a great deal. I really liked the location of this hotel. It was located within a 20 minute walk to the 'tourist areas'. It's also quite close to Grand Central Station and there is a 24-hour CVS across the street which can come in handy. I arrived at the hotel around 11:30AM and was told that a room was not ready and to check my luggage with the doorman and come back later in the afternoon. I came back around 2:00PM and was given a room on the 11th floor. When I went to obtain my luggage from the doorman I was also given someone else's bag, as it was tagged as being mine. You may want to be careful about having them store your luggage. The room itself was pretty big for Manhattan. It had a large and comfy king bed with great linen. The furniture was very dated and the carpet was stained in places. The room was definitely showing signs of aging. The room actually smelt a bit musty and I really hope that I was not inhaling mold. I also found a dirty Kleenex underneath the mattress when I was doing a check for bedbugs, a bit gross. I had a problem with the a/c unit making a loud rattling sound half-way through my stay. I called the front desk and maintenance came when I was out for the day, however, the problem was not resolved. It kept rattling. The final morning, I heard quite a bit of noise from an adjoining room. The hotel did not seem to be well-insulated. All in all... if you get a great deal then this hotel will do, but I would NOT want to pay 4 star prices for what feels like a 2 star property. PS... Make sure you sign up for the SPG Reward program. This is how you get free wifi in your room.

Reviews.Title: “It was generally ok and I would go back and/or recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: Mimi_Brux
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and spacious, the bathroom could do with a renewal... the service was generally good. The lowest point of our stay was the concierge. He was totally unhelpful... We've asked help to book some shows, and he said that everything he could do was to give us the name and number of an agency which would have charged us 70 US$ for the booking...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rtmalone10
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The rooms were nice and clean - great beds and pillows. The check-in/front desk people and bell hops were great. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Content: Make sure you ask questions before booking! Hotel has parking lot underneath that you would assume is included but no . We stayed two days and was hit with a $120 dollar fee for parking instead. Our room was on the 10th floor and very outdated for a hotel in New York. Nothing was included with these rooms , my wife wanted hot water for her tea so i went to the front desk. I was then told to go to the hotel bar. Needless to say, 7 dollars later i got my cup of hot water. No pool , No nothing. As far as New York City goes, stay far away unless you plan on spending at least $1000. dollars for a two night stay. everybody everywhere has their hand out for tips.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I am too fussy”
Reviews.Author: nylike2travel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent one night due to the fact that we had an engagement party to attend the next day. I have to say the room is tired and worn. There was a piece of furniture where a T.V. used to be that was now empty and just taking up space. The air conditioning unit was old and did not work well (not too clean), so I did call down to the front desk. The T.V. that was in the room had horrible reception. I did not expect much from this hotel and I really didnt get it. We also ended up overpaying for our room.

Reviews.Title: “Just Quality”
Reviews.Author: Goodpace
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate of $120/night on Priceline and found the place to fit all my needs. The place is borderline luxury and cleanliness was not a problem. Good, comfortable beds and strong water pressure provided relaxation. Consider this place if you need to be near mid-town on the East side near the United Nations. Taxis will make all of NYC easily available as well. Really no negatives from the room to the staff. I guess if there was some sort of parking, the place and deal would have been better!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night and found it to be an adequate hotel, though nothing special. The best feature is the location. It's easy to walk to shops and restaurants, and very close to Grand Central station, which makes it easy to get pretty much anywhere you'd want to go. There is a CVS less than a block away, which is great for buying basics such as snacks, beverages, baby wipes, etc. The room itself is fine, though could use some updating. The one nod to the 21st century is a flat-screen tv, but it's an awkward addition. They simply plopped the tv on the desk, which renders it useless as an actual desk. Meanwhile, the huge tube-tv cabinet unit is still in the room taking up space. (They put some pamphlets and stuff in the old space for the television to try to make it seem useful, but that's a stretch.) The bathroom is ridiculously out of date, though the towels and toiletries were both of generous size, so that's a plus. One thing that was annoying was the fact that when we stored our luggage on the day we checked out, they guy who took our items stood around expecting a tip. Correct me if I'm wrong (honestly), but I think a person should only be expected to tip when they come back to pick up their luggage, not when they drop it off. Why would you tip someone before you know whether or not they took good care of your stuff? Altogether it was a fine stay, and I really did like the convenience of the location. I'd stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay than this one in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Jimindc2007
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Omni in New York city, and stayed there during this same period last year but on this trip I took advantage of a deal through American Express which brought me to the Helmsley. While the hotel is due for a future update I did not find the room to be shabby or uncomfortable. But the hotel is very crowded with group tours and it seems the staff is just simply overwhelmed. For instance, during my three night stay the room wasn't made up until after 5PM. The desk staff seemed frazzled and several of the hotels usual services were just not operating properly. While this is not the end of the world when you pay New York prices you expect at least a modicum of good service. For these prices there are mush better places to stay in the Big Apple,

Reviews.Title: “Puzzled by too generous reviews, nothing exciting!”
Reviews.Author: freiburg13
Reviews.Content: Ok, as everyone knows, it is a prime location on East 42nd. One of the reasons for me to stay there was my SPG Gold Status, This is just outdated average, overpriced, as most NY hotels, another one of the long strings of average overpriced hotels I stayed in NY over last several years. The room is fairly large, but badly designed, work area is small and not set up well for laptop users. The room and common areas srat showing age. Staff was generally fine and helpful. A lot of nice places to eat and drink around the hotel, but nothing interesting inside the hotel. I wonder if I should start spending even more money in NY and stay in Sofitel or Kimpton that have invariably great hotels in several cities worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “My home while in Manhattan :)”
Reviews.Author: robbi68
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great property! Excellent location, love the Chrysler Bldng view :) Staff is very friendly, room clean. Will definitely come back there ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but outdated”
Reviews.Author: mjpfrank
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, clean hotel. The lobby is very fancy and modern but the room, with the exception of the flat-panel TV, was very outdated, but still clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: KianaArt
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent but otherwise pretty mediocre for high prices. Rooms need updating; opening and closing curtains, turning on light switches etc. is a chore because of old-fasioned appliances. Curtains didn't even close properly in one room I was in meaning that I had to sneak around my own room to avoid being seen by the neighbours. Room service food was way over-priced for the quality - all processed cheap stuff not befitting hotel of its supposed calibre - get much better fare at any local deli for about quarter of the price. Rooms not set up for business travellers who need to work in rooms - lighting inadequate and power points too far from desk.
