Staff good, no complaints there but management advice in the brochure about how much to tip staff is irritating. how about the management just pays a decent wage to it's staff and stops placing the onus on guests to worry about tipping for basic hotel services - baggage storage, room cleaning etc.? Concierge services are very nice and one of the best things about the hotel but they could coordinate their responses on common questions e.g. how to get secured internet access, where to get airport bus, as they give diffierent responses and some are more accurate than others.

Reviews.Title: “A Very , very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 59Tom
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel we will recomend for all people that shall visit Manhattan. A friendly and serviceminded staff. Very nice, clean and comfortly rooms. Also very central. If this hotel will keep their "friendly" rates, me and my family for sure will use it again when returning to New York. We miss blended drinks in the bar ! Thank You from a Norwegian family

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: corkerIreland
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, friendly staff, lovely comfortable clean room. Will be even nicer when all rooms are completely renovated. Perfect location, within walking distance of many local attractions with lots of cafes nearby. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay at The Helmsley.”
Reviews.Author: CubanboyShaun
Reviews.Content: Once again weâ€™ve been rather slow in getting this on here but my wife and I felt we needed to write a review about our 3rd stay at The NY Helmsley in April to ensure all those looking to travel to NYC know what a fab place it is. As mentioned, this was our 3rd stay at the hotel and as before, all expectations were exceeded, despite the very challenging times all the staff were coping with as the transition to being a Starwood Hotel was only a fortnight old. We had emailed ahead to the Room Controls Manager Timothy to request a high floor as we were celebrating our â€˜unofficialâ€™ anniversary during our stay in NYC and he duly obliged and also ensured a late checkout for us on our last day due to our 22:30 Virgin flight back to the UK. He secured Room 3909 for us which once again gave us a magnificent view down East 42nd Street and of The Chrysler Building. Everybody we spoke to in the hotel was as courteous and friendly as ever and it was great to be remembered so fondly and affectionately by Miguel in the Concierge team who was as exemplary in his courtesy, helpfulness and all round sparkling personality as ever. Denis the Doorman was also really pleased to see us again and he was able to give us lots of useful advice about the city as ever and once again showed what we have to come to love about The Helmsley. Excellent stories and a cheeky grin combined with marvellous service. In summary, we want to thank all the staff on here again for a great stay, and in particular to Timothy Leetch for ensuring our stay came and went without incident. Itâ€™s a shame that Timothy has moved on to pastures new since the Starwood Regime commenced but his legacy is one of excellent customer service and timely and efficient communication prior to our many stays at The Helmsley. If there is one criticism I have to mention it would be that Timothy was the only person whoever did respond to emails for information etc. Since his departure (and during his stay at The Helmsley) every other person emailed has without exception failed to respond to me or has done so in a very corporate and not especially helpful manner, not giving me the specific info I wanted but instead just quoting information from the website which I could have easily got myself. We are hoping to find somebody in July who we can create a relationship with who can be that point of contact now that Timothy has moved on. In summary, we enjoyed our stay so much in April that we are returning for another 3 night stay at the end of July, this time to celebrate my birthday at the end of that month. Looking at the effort that Maurizio Bonivento the General Manager of The Helmsley is putting in to replying to comments on here Iâ€™m sure he will ensure the transition to Starwood and the planned complete renovation will retain what we love about The Helmsley at the same time as bringing its decor and amenities well in to the 21st Century.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!”
Reviews.Author: vongordon
Reviews.Content: recently visited this hotel... decor in lobby was nice. The hotel appeared to be very clean! we had the deluxe, very spacious room on the 38th floor with a great view of Empire State building! Everything was pleasant, only complaint was the hallways and room was very dim. Great great great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Winner!”
Reviews.Author: jazz4me
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NY Helmsley and had the most pleasant experience. The front desk, the diningroom staff, the maid service and concierge were so helpful and ALWAYS with a smile! I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Thanks for making my New York trip so positive and uplifting.

Reviews.Title: “Great locating and large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: amato11
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the doormen very friendly and helped with the bags. The front dest clerks were excellent and efficient. The room they gave me was very large and quiet with a view of the Empire State building.. The decor is somewhat dated and the room did not have a coffee maker. The hotel restaurant' is above average in service and food quality. The drinks at the bar is somewhat pricy for a hotel bar. My only complaint are the bellhops. When I checked out I had to store six bags (three suitcases and three backpacks) becasuse my departing flight was not unitl 6:00pm. I gave the bellhop Joe a $3 tip, but apparently it was not enough, he said he would not be there when I came to retrieve my bags. He said he had to put away the six bags and insisted on getting another $3. I gave him another $3. There was another short bald bellhop that mumbled something about the clientel of the hotel, and then he ran into the storage room. When I came back Joe was still there and did not take my ticket, but another bellhop retrieved my bags. This fellow however was the nicest, helping with our bags and waiting until we repacked and bringing them to the van that was waiting for us.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: oscarf23
Reviews.Content: get automatic revolvig doors, and when i needed an extra box for a sculpture i bought the concierge was not helpful at all.... just said go to staples.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great room, good value”
Reviews.Author: voyager50
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and I would highly recommend it - I read lots of the other reviews and was a bit worried that I would be disappointed and not enjoy my stay but my fears were unfounded. I've left a few negative comments but they are only for trivial things - the positives make up for them: Positives- The room was spacious with very comfortable beds The shower was powerful and always had hot water It was great to have the use of bathrobes The complimentary we-fi was a bonus Perfect location for getting around the city The front desk were helpful - they had allocated me a room at the front of the hotel but I said I would prefer a quieter one and they put me at the back at the end of the corridor, away from the elevators which was perfect. Negatives - The maids always left my nightclothes on the bedside table - I would rather have had them put back in the bed where I left them. There was a crack in the bottom of the ice bucket so when the ice melted water leaked out I had to turn them off all all the lights individually ( if there was one switch for them all I couldn't find it!) - The room was perfectly silent and we were not disturbed except for being woken by inconsiderate guests letting their doors slam shut. It would be good if the hotel could put a few signs up asking guests to closes their doors quietly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malc16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with three friends (girls weekend in NYC). We chose this hotel because we could all fit into one room and this kept costs down considerably. The room was fine - clean, comfy beds, good shower. It was a bit cramped for four, but we expected that. Housekeeping responded quickly when we needed extra towels. We really didn't use any of the hotel faciliies, so can't comment on food etc. The situation is good though, not too far from 5th ave, times square etc .It served our purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms improved. Bar somewhat worse.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here May 4th and 5th for a business conference. The last time I stayed at the Helmesly, I swore I would never go back. However, the conference I wanted to attend was hosted at this hotel so I decided to try again. I was pleasantly surprised. Pei at the front desk was warm and friendly. The rooms were clearly updated but even those updates are several years old now and not quite current. The bathrooms are certainly dated but very clean. In fact, the housekeeping standards are excellent! The lobby has been completely renovated as it has been acquired by Starwood. Unfortunately, when they lost "Harry's Bar", they also lost dismantled the half-wall that provided weather protection from the outside. It was very cold that weekend, and sitting at the bar, my husband found he needed to wear a coat. I.e., it wasn't the sort of place where you would want to curl up and relax for a few hours. That said, there was a particular bartender, Sam, who was just terrifically welcoming over the three days we were there. He was both cool and professional ... and yet managed to make you feel as though you had been coming for years. He was simply terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, our favorite in NYC”
Reviews.Author: shepsphoto
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Hotels in NYC over the past 30 years, but our last stay at the NY Helmsley was our best Hotel experience so far.The reception and service was excellent, and our room was not only on a high floor with a great view, but was very large (by NYC standards) and the bed and pillows were super comfortable.Bathroom was also to a very high standard. We have just two minor observations..1. How hard can it be to provide an in room coffee maker? I mean, you get a complimentary copy of the NY Times delivered to the door in the am, and then no coffee?Ridiculous! One night(early November) the room was a bit warm when we arrived from our day out on the town, and after fiddling with the control on the wall for a while to no effect, we called housekeeping. within two minutes a nice Chinese technician arrived, and "fixed" the situation....by opening the window! He said "in winter, AC no work...only work in summer." I guess the thing I was fiddling with becomes a heater in winter. His solution did work, but there was more street nice coming in than before. Glad we were on the 23 rd floor. Never had meals there, as we would get a real nice inexpensive breakfast at the Deli just out the front door , to your left. Lunch was on the road, and dinner was at various lovely restaurants that NYC is so famous for. (iIncluding the Grand Central Station Oyster Bar.) We will definitely go back to the NY Helmsley next NY trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NY”
Reviews.Author: leonGreece
Reviews.Content: Very big rooms. clean and good location. We didn't wait for check in or check out. nice price. We had a room on 28th floor which was big enough for three adults. Big bathroom ,good amenities, plenty towels, hot water all day.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Uncorked4u
Reviews.Content: overall I would avoid this tourist trap... 1. rooms are hot and temperature is uncontrollable 2.staff is average at best 3.food is not passable the hotel lobby is a mess, no order, check in is unorganized and chaotic

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TonyTeshera
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley is in the perfect location in NYC if you're visiting and take the subway everywhere. We did (it's very convenient and safe from our experience). You're a half-block from the "7" train and a block from the rest of the Grand Central subway station. It's generally a nice hotel, but on the downside the maid service is inconsistent and there's no alarm clock in the room, no coffee in the room and no mini-fridge. The room was nice, but it's no-frills. Special caution: if you book through travel sites like hotels.com or similar, they claim they can't honor specific room requests (such as king vs. double-twin). We had booked a king and when we showed up they said "sorry, we can't honor that". When we explained that we'd called the hotel directly to confirm the booking and the room type, they capitulated, but the attitude on this was disappointing. So, be SURE to call the hotel directly after booking online, and be SURE they have you down for the right room type.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient with good service”
Reviews.Author: robwvu
Reviews.Content: Staff was very courteous. They did not have a king when we checked in, so stuck with doubles. Short walk to Grand Central. Rooms are clean, comfortable and mid-sized. Fitness center was small, but sufficient. No ice machine on each floor. TV on desk with large former entertainment center in the room making it crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in the perfect location - close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: kenthewizard
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault our stay at the NY Helmsley. The hotel is first rate and ideally located for sightseeing. Rooms are spacious and the hotel staff are very helpful. We spent 4 nights there and overall we had a great stay we couldn't recommend the NY Helmsley enough..

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early June and were really delighted with our choice of hotel. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well. Our room was on the 38th floor and it had the most amazing view of the Empire State building. The flood lights of the building changed four times during our stay and we got some fabulous photographs. We were facing downtown Manhattan and at night could see somes of the bridges lit up too. It was just wonderful and very romantic. Our room was very well decorated. The bed was just one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, and the bed linens, well you will just have to check them out for yourself. I did not want to get up each morning. We also had good robes and soft fluffy towels. We had asked for a fridge and there was one in the room which was great, as we were able to store cool drinks ( it was very hot outside). We would have liked a kettle( I love my tea), but the deli Pax next door does great coffees and snacks and met the need. I know lots of reviewers have commented on noise, but I have to say that our room was quiet. The air conditioning worked very well too and was never intrusive. We found the free wi fi to be very quick and a real bonus. Breakfast was included in our rate. We were only entitled to help ourselves to the buffet and I would have liked to sample pancakes or perhaps eggs benedict from the a la carte. However the buffet was plentiful and I particularly liked the fruit and yogurt. The dining room was a really beautiful space and must have been decorated recently. It is worth walking in to have a look even if you don't intend to dine. We didn't eat any other meals there as there were so many lovely restaurants to choose from in the locality. If you are looking for restaurants , bars, delis, grocery shops etc., walk downtown on 3rd avenue and you will find a lovely local neighbourhood within a few blocks. What more can I say ? We found all of the staff to be friendly . Yes they were busy at times, but it's a busy and successful hotel. One day I as I walked through the lobby, I got a big wave from one of the ladies at reception who had helped me out previously. It felt good to be remembered. I will stay here again on our next visit and have already recommended the hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decdent hotel”
Reviews.Author: viongone
Reviews.Content: I booked here because it was the cheapest of the decent hotels in mindtown, I was a bit worried by some of the reviews I read, but this is really a pleaant surprise. Yes, as the reviews say the decor is very 19702, but it's clean so i can accept that. the room os bigger than most NYC hotel rooms I stay in, so I think this is pretty good. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Very nice people and quick services”
Reviews.Author: henriquevale
Reviews.Content: I booked online using the "place a bid" option for The New York Helmsley Hotel and I must confess that I was kind of worried after reading some reviews here. For my surprise and joy my stay there don't had any issue like the ones people was complaining about here. I got to the hotel at 11am, 4 hours before the check in but the staff just took 2 minutes for setup everything for me and give me the keys of my room without any expense for the early check in. The apartment was very nice, cozy and clean. Everything was in the right place and well organized, the feeling was that they were really concerned about my satisfaction as a costumer. The other positive point is that they were very quick to made my life easier when I was a in a big rush. The furniture it's really outdated but it's functional anyway so you are not gonna have a problem with it. My room was a city double double room with a $200 day fare and a stunning view of the 42nd street. That's it, nothing to complain, just compliments and hope to get there again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time back”
Reviews.Author: brissybarb
Reviews.Content: disapointed, 3rd time back and have not only booked myself and a friend but I have in the past booked 3 rooms for my family at one time. The room was not kept clean, One of the concierges was rude on multiple occasions where my visitor from Italy would not go to her. The room was very run down and I was embarrassed that I had booked it. Unless there are some changes will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Second and probably final stay”
Reviews.Author: fomalhaut
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Helmsley in two years and, yes, you'd be right to think I enjoyed it so much first time around I made a point of returning. Firstly, the location of the hotel really can't be beaten: Grand Central Terminal is two minutes away, which makes the hotel a great location for exploring the five boroughs and beyond. That's not to say travel is necessary: the whole of midtown and its many landmarks and attractions are easily reachable on foot. The area immediately around the hotel is well stocked with shops, banks and eateries, too. I must echo a number of other recent reviews in stating that my experience with the front desk wasn't brilliant. Upon arrival I was greeted with a dour "Yes?", and on returning my door cards a week later, received merely an "Oh" as I departed for my long journey home. The front desk area also feels to be cramped, dark, and often seemed to have an inadequate number of staff on duty. The rooms themselves are fairly large for New York and, though a little tired, I found the furnishings and decor to be acceptable for a hotel of this class. The bed was just as I like it (rock hard), and there is plenty of storage and seating available. The bathroom, again, a touch tired perhaps, though I understand the hotel is beginning a major renovation. The views from the Helmsley are excellent: on my two visits I've been treated to magnificent views of the Chrysler Tower (facing north) and Empire State Building (facing south). Guests may want to check in advance whether their room is blessed with a majestic view of one of these icons. I'd also say, the higher the floor the better (they go all the way up to 40), as midtown is never silent. I didn't use the restaurant or room service, and nor would I with a plethora of coffee and food shops on the doorstep. One thing that did bug me a little was the fact that the housekeeping staff called as early as 10AM some days and as late as 2PM on others. I appreciate they have many rooms to visit but I do prefer my room to be ready when I return in the early afternoon from a morning visit somewhere. My stay was considerably more expensive than my previous visit, though I suppose this was to be expected to some degree given exchange rates and different circumstances, though I did feel on this occasion that my stay was at the limit of what I'd be prepared to pay. Were my review to end here, I'd most likely have left four stars; however, upon returning home I discovered that, despite my paying in advance, the hotel charged me for my stay, forcing me into a series of emails and phone calls to obtain a refund. A simple clerical error perhaps, but I wasn't impressed by this. Sadly, I feel the manner in which hotels request your credit card upon arrival these days as a matter of course increases the risk of such errors being made. To conclude, excellent location, great views, decent rooms, but I must admit to some reservations about the service. I expect to visit NYC again someday and will most likely stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service & Location!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeinTX
Reviews.Content: Location: -The location is on E 42nd Street between 2nd & 3rd Ave which is only a few blocks away from Grand Central Station which came in handy for taking the subway. You must check GCS out because it is a very beautiful building. It is also very close to the Chrysler building which we had a view of from our room. -The walk to 5th Ave is only about 10 mins and the NYC Public Library and Bryant Park is right at that corner. Our first day we walked down to 5th Ave for some shopping, Rockefeller Center, and Time Squares. It was a bit of walking but nothing too strenuous. I really loved the location out of all the places I had stayed in NYC. I would never stay in Times Squares again because it is way too busy. -There is also a CVS at the corner so we grabbed some bottled water for the room and a couple things that we had forgotten for our trip. Check In: -We had arrived about 2 hours ahead of check in but was still able to get our room at the time. -I had reserved two double bed rooms and got my room no problem. We were only a few doors from each other which was nice. I didn't even request it. We got our room keys and even extra keys no problem. I had a tendency to misplace room keys or forget them in a other pants pockets sometimes so I always request an extra room key. Rooms: -The rooms are a decent size. We had 3 girls in one room and 4 in another room no problem even with all the shopping that we had done. Yes the rooms were a bit dated, but they were very clean though. -The bed was a bit stiff for me but the rest of my roommates slept great in the them. Bedding was clean and crisp and very comfortable. -My biggest complaint would be the AC not properly working. I had it turned down to 50 and it was still warm in our room. Luckily it was cool outside so we just open the windows and were fine. It was bit a noisy at night but we were exhausted from the day that we all slept fine. -The bathroom was a decent size and had all the toiletries that we would need. The only thing that was a complaint for me in the bath room was the water pressure and the drain. Weaker water pressure and it took some time to drain the tub. -Also it would have been nice to have a mini fridge in the rooms too but it wasn't a deal breaker. Restaurant and Bar -Because hotels' restaurants and bars are always very pricey we skipped out on the one here. -There is a PAX right outside of the hotel to get some coffee or snacks. So i didn't feel the need to get at the Hotel Customer Service -We had ordered a cot up to our room and thankful it was up right away. I was worried that it would have taken forever to get it our room. -At one point our room keys had stopped working, so I called the front desk and they had sent someone up immediately with new ones. -Check out was a breeze. -We had a few hours left before we had to go the airport and was able to leave our bags with Bell Service. When we came back, I gave him the ticket and they pulled it all out for us to the front of the hotel. -Unfortunately we didn't think about rush hour when we were trying to catch a cab to LGA. The guys up front tried for 40 mins to waved down a cab for us until one would agreed to take us to the airport. There were at least a dozen cabs that denied going to LGA. So make sure you give yourself enough time to catch a cab. A car service tried to charge us $65 plus toll to go the airport and one of the Bellmen strongly advised us against taking it. -When we finally left, I was in such a rush that I had left a shopping bag behind by the curb. I didn't realized it until we were half way to the airport and traffic was so bad that if we had turned around we would have missed our flight. Luckily they turned it in right away and I was able to get it overnight by the concierge. If was any other bag, I don't think I would have freaked out as much but this was Chanel Shopping Bag with very expensive pair of shoes in them. Thankful for honest people! For the price ($200/night for a double room), I believed that it was a great value in Midtown Manhattan. I gave it a 4 based on the location and the outstanding customer service. I would definitely stay here again if I can get the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: baysidegirl55
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Helmsley and I hate to say I was very disappointed with my stay this time. The hotel has just been purchased by the Starwood group and I don't know if there is a little uncertainty of the hotels future or not but it was no where near as good as during our stay last September. At check in the staff bordered on rudeness and really didn't care. The staff at breakfast were the same and on one morning there was an argument between two staff members the whole restaurant could hear. Rooms are a good size, as is the bathroom for an NYC property, but they desparately need a refurbishment. The carpets were badly stained in my room and the bathroom tiles needed a good clean and regrout. My shower also did not work properly but was ok for my stay. We paid $100 per night more this visit than last year and frankly it was certainly not worth it. I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: nannj
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 10:45 AM and hoped to check in and drop our luggage before running to a meeting around the corner. There was one woman at the front desk with a line of people waiting to check in and out. When it was our turn, she couldn't find our reservation, even with the confirmation number. I had made the reservation before the change to Starwood and apparently it was lost in cyberspace. After much ado, she called for a manager who kept getting distracted by other guests on her way to the desk. It took her some time to find the reservation and when she did, the clerk said our room was ready. But she gave us a king, smoking room when we had reserved a double non-smoking, saying none of those type were ready yet. We really didn't expect that the room would be ready, just wanted to get the check in process over with since we would be returning to the hotel very late. The whole check in took about twenty minutes and the line behind us kept growing. At check out, again there was only one clerk on duty with a line. Hotel rooms are often dark, and this one was. But, in addition, the bathroom was too dark to put make-up on. I read on other reviews that the hotel is undergoing a renovation but this room has not yet been updated. The armoire that used to hold a TV now holds just the ice bucket and the mirror above the desk has been removed to hold a flat screen TV. Since we were two people in the room, if there had been a mirror over the desk, one of us could have done our hair and make-up there and one could have used the bathroom. I'm sure this set-up was done by a man! For $330 a night, this hotel needs to do something about its customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag - Management Issues?”
Reviews.Author: originalsix
Reviews.Content: I booked one night here via Priceline ($175+tx), and upon checkin the nice lady working the desk game me a free upgrade to a 29th floor king room (instead of the standard two doubles). The shower didn't drain well, and the bathroom could use some good cleaning. The sleep was good and the bed was comfortable. The next day the lobby was permanently packed. The lines to check in and check out were moving very slowly, and there is no way to checkout on your TV or via kiosk. It took 25 minutes to get drop off my room keys. The bell hop was nowhere to be found, and I had to ask other staff (standing around in the lobby) where he/she was after waiting for 10 minutes. Eventually one located the person in the luggage room. Staff needs to focus on customer service, rather than staying in a role ... clearly people could have multi-tasked and made the experience much better. If you get this on Priceline, then it's ok. But there are many better hotels in NYC to spend your money on (Affinia Dumont is great).

Reviews.Title: “Worst night spent in NYC”
Reviews.Author: haryun
Reviews.Content: I go to NYC 6-10x/year on business and 99% of the time stay at SPG properties. I usually stay at W's, but I've stayed at St. Regis, Four Points, Sheraton, etc. I tried the Helmsley when it joined SPG and will NEVER stay there again. There were dirty foot prints in the bathtub, stains on the pea green carpet, and best of all, RODENTS scratching away at the wall all night long. I ran out of there and checked back into the W the next morning. Apparently they are "rennovating" the hotel, but out of more than 33 floors, only 2 floors are rennovated and ready for occupancy. Despite paying over $400 for the room and having platinum status, I wasn't able to secure a rennovated room....or even a room without rodents. The pictures are misleading since, chances are, you won't get a rennovated room either. And their regular rooms are DISGUSTING. It was the worst night of sleep I've ever had: the bed was uncomfortable and squeaky, there were MICE or RATS or some kind of animal scratching away in my room all night, and everything felt dirty, old and used.

Reviews.Title: “New to spg, dreadful service”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravDaddy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new to the spg program. The front desk staff and management do not understand ow the program works. I asked for an upgrade, being spg platinum. The agent and supervior lied and said none was available. When I asked for the MOD to tell him that I intended to leave, an upgrade miraculously becomes available. The hotel is slatedbfor substantial renovation. The only good thing about this property is the location. I am glad to be checking out today!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Needs a Facelift”
Reviews.Author: carandizzy
Reviews.Content: Great location midtown. Unfortunately, busy week in NYC, and obviously a reason this was one of the last hotels with availability. Bus tour groups checking in and out. Front desk staff friendly but stretched thin with crowds. Morning room service took forever. Room size standard for NYC, but worn and dated, not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice room with mediocre everything else”
Reviews.Author: HN_travels25
Reviews.Content: We chose the Helmsley after getting a great rate on expedia which beat all the other hotels for the reviews and star rating compared to others in the same price range. When we arrived we were impressed, it's looks lovely from the outside and the reception area is also very nice and also very busy. We arrived at 8am and were hoping for our room to be ready (I had emailed ahead 2 times leading up to our stay to request if possible as we were on the overnight flight from LA) although we didn't really expect it to be and it wasn't. Wandered around town waiting for lady on reception to call us when it was ready (she had offered to do this however never called) and went back to hotel at 1pm and when we asked if our room was ready now, it was. Not a big deal that she didn't call and she was nice enough, but this check in experience and much like the whole time we stayed at the Helmsley showed that there isn't enough staff for the size of the hotel, and the ones that are working there appear to be bothered by us whenever we asked a question. Another example was 4 porters hanging around near the unmanned concierge desk we approached them to ask for a map as there was a long queue at reception and we were told that we have ask at reception, even though we had seen another porter earlier grab a map from under the desk for someone else. The rooms were a gorgeous art deco style and the beds were massive and extremely comfortable. We stayed on the 22nd floor and the view was ok, they have forty floors so higher up would have definitely been better views. There was some street noise but not enough to bother us from from sleeping etc. the worst noise came from whenever our neighbors had showers and then it sounded like a kettle was whistling and boiling right in the middle of our room! Lucky we only heard them a couple of times over the 6 days so it really wasn't an issue but definitely noticeable. There was no fridge in the room which got annoying when your staying somewhere for a week, especially when we had bottled water as the NYC water does not taste great and we couldn't get any wine etc. We stayed in just their standard room which was quite roomy by NY standards from what I understand. The location is good, it was our first time to NYC so it's pretty accessible to jump on the subway on the green line really easily, about 5-10 minute walk to grand central and maybe 20 mins to times square. Really easy to get taxis out the front too. Definitely too far to walk to central park so subway or taxi got us there. The immediate surrounding areas of midtown were ok, a bit touristy and not the real New York that you think you will see, but it's a good central base to start out on your way uptown and downtown. Overall we really weren't in the room much and it suited us well for that, great bed for a good nights sleep after sightseeing all day. Fridges in the room would be a great addition. Service not great but not offensive either, really mediocre and not memorable (but I guess i would rather that then strong memories of really poor service.) I think totally worth it if your not going to in your room and you get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, great location, a little outdated, all in all we were happy.”
Reviews.Author: hvhollyberry
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 parents, 2 teenagers) spent a week at the Helmsley. I was very concerned about bed bugs in the city, and am happy to report we had no problem here. YEAH!!! Other good things we have to report: We got a good rate through the bidding option on the website, The location is great, an easy subway to Times Square or any other location really, or a nice walk to many attractions. Lobby staff was pleasant. Our room did have a small refrigerator. Room was clean enough for us. We enjoyed the view of the Empire State Building from our room. The bedding is comfortable, but we sure wish they had queen size beds instead of doubles! On the negative side, the room was always HOT. We had the heat off, slept with the windows open, and we were still too warm. The bathroom was especially outdated and showed signs of wear, (cracked tiles, stains in tub.) The tub did not drain properly, and I did report this to the front desk. They either never sent maintenance, or if they did come in there was no sign of any improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, will be going under the knife soon to come out as a Westin”
Reviews.Author: cruisejp
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to the NY Helmsley listed as a Starwood affiliated hotel. I decided to try it out. Read all the way through because it has a great ending. I checked in early and had a suite reserved. At check-in I found out that the hotel was not offering SPG Platinum Amenities as of yet but they were working on it. I was given suite 1414. I opened the door and walked into the 1970â€™s and my spacious suite with sweeping views was a small suite overlooking a wall. I called down to the front desk and I was then given suite 3920 which was right out of the 60â€™s and smelled of mildew. I called back down and asked for a manager and was connected to Maria Danna and the whole experience changed. It has been a long time since I have experienced such sincere fantastic hospitality. Maria said she would see what she could do and call me back. She also explained that the she was very sorry but the suites had not been renovated for a while and that the hotel was going to go under major renovation and come out branded as a Westin. After a few minutes Maria called me back and I was moved to 4120 a suite that had probably been renovated 5 to 6 years ago. From here on out I experienced nothing but fantastic service. I left my room and put my DND sign on the door. The housekeeper came up to me and asked me if I wanted my room made up. I said I just checked in. She pointed out to me I put the makeup room side of the sign on the door. We both laughed and I apologized. I ordered 3 meals room service. The food came hot and was delicious! The trays had a white rose on them. Moral of the story is this hotel has a great base in great employees working for it. It will soon be renovated and branded Westin. Welcome to the Starwood chain. Now one thing puzzles me. If Leona Helmsley may she rest in peace was such a stickler on the appearance of her hotels. Why have the hotel suites not been renovated in 30 to 40 years? I canâ€™t figure this one out. Thank you again Maria because of you and your staff you have stolen me away from the Hilton and I am returning this week to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated but Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TobyLee60
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby but outdated guest room. Great location with an excellent free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn masquerading as a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockfishHunter
Reviews.Content: This place is tired tired tired. Stayed here for a night on a recent business trip as my usual hotels were not available. I'm not sure where the pictures on the website were taken, but it sure wasn't my room. My room was a joke. Old tired furnishings, peeling wall paper, outdated bathroom. I guess at some point they upgraded the TVs to flatscreens, but instead of spending $25 on a wall mount from eBay or a real TV table, they just plopped it on the writing desk (so much for having a desk in the room) and moved the GIANT TV armoire that used to hold the old tube TV over into the corner and put an ice bucket on the huge lazy susan inside. Carpent was kinda old and dirty, bed was comfortable enough. Lobby is small and cramped for a hotel its size. I'd avoid it if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Mrs. Helmsley Would Not Be Satisified”
Reviews.Author: mclossey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel over St. Patricks Day - great location. Pax's next door a wonderful value for food................. I do not understand why they left the armoires in the room? It serves no purpose and is really beat up. I also felt the carpets were worn and the tile needed a good scrubbing in the bathroom. The refrigerator as well should be replaced The heating system was still on heat and it was 60 degrees outside. I waited over an hour for a fan and had to call twice once told by the operator none were available but, the night manager said no problem. Unfortunatly the condition of the fan was not good when delivered but, certainly helped. The over all service was good and check in was expiditious. I would stay again and city views magnificant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel by all means and value for money”
Reviews.Author: nrn218
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, very comfortable beds, excellent collection of toiletories at the rooms makes it a good place to stay during business visits. Location is very convenient tp get a shuttle to Airports, walkable to almost all the important business places in NY city. Staff at the front dest speak only thier terms and conditions of room booking and rates. Particilarly, when we extend our stay beyond original booking dates, tariff jumps higher and the front dest is not cooperative. As is any other NY hotels, tariff is determined by demand-supply. In general, we throughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: PogoJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered all that we required for a recent vacation to NYC. Friendly accommodating staff, reasonably modern and spacious, clean and a very good location. It's not 5 stars so don't expect that, but you can get great rates (including breakfast) which makes the hotel a 5 star value. The bathrooms are a bit dated and worn, but they're clean and more than acceptable. The beds and linens are top notch and great to fall into after a long day onthe street of NY. For us, the hearty full buffet breakfast included in our room charge (+$40 otherwise) was a real bonus. It allowed us to go hard for much of the day, with only a snack between breakfast and dinner. Only drawback we noted was a fee to use the business centre computers and Internet access. We did not need the service, but charging for it seemed about five years out of step.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fulu_M
Reviews.Content: the service here is impeccable; the food scrumptious; the eds are soft and feel oh so good and the hotel is waking distance (1km) from times square/bradway fifth venue is even closer if you want to shop

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, extremely clean, family friendly hotel with wonderful staff close to main attractions and eateries.”
Reviews.Author: megnorris
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location, within easy walking distance of Grand Central Station and Times Square. We stayed in January with elderly parents and found our rooms extremely clean and and comfortable though we would have loved tea and coffee making facilities. The hotel's staff were extremely helpful to us in arranging trips and organising transport and offering general advice about the city. We have stayed here twice now and have already recommended it to friends. Fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: 255100Nick
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed @ the Helmsley during our Honeymoon. What can I say about the hotel nice staff, great rooms and really good location. We found a Pizza store which sold 99c pizza slices on 3rd ave. Only negative about the hotel is the noise while your trying to sleep bring ear plugs. Check there website for cheap prices as they allow you to bid if you not happy with there internet price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Wauters
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers agreat breakfast and combines easy access with a great location. The rooms are decorated in a somewhat old-fashioned style. I would recomend this hotel to every visitor because its location amidst all the interesting sightseeing points in Manhattan. The proximity of the Grand Central station, subways and the Chrysler building are also worth mentioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma0116
Reviews.Content: I went to NY with an old friend and having looked at lots of hotels we decided on the NY Helmsley due to the generally good reviews on TripAdvisor. Even so after finding my first long haul flight very difficult, I was nervous about what the hotel would be like when we arrived. I didn't need to worry, it was lovely!! It looked amazing from the outside and inside was just as I had hoped. When we got to the room it was a good size for two people. Huge, fluffy white beds and a spacious bathroom greeted us. There wasn't anything else I could have asked for, all my necessities were catered for. The location was fantastic, we could easily walk to most of the places we wanted to visit and found some good restaurants etc near by. My one tip due to the hotel being so central would be to take ear plugs! I'm the kind of person who can usually sleep any where but it was rather noisy here and I was glad I had ear plugs so my sleep wasn't disturbed by sirens etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Less than impressive.”
Reviews.Author: VinoLover27
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, I was disappointed to hear the room with a king size bed and great view, as I was promised, was not available. After telling me the person "lied" to me about the availability seemed less than professional. Eventually convinced me to upgrade to bigger room with a great view and breakfast (They couldn't offer it for free? Not the best for customer service!). The view was the best part of the stay. The room was nothing special, bathroom a bit dirty. The breakfast buffet had little selection serving cereal, eggs, bacon, sausage and pastries; not a great selection for the price; not to mention the service was beyond terrible. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone; they sound impressive on their website but did not follow through.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: ahawaii1
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because my husbands job payed for it, that said, it was a beautiful plush hotel. I would definitely stay here. It was so clean and beautiful, great service.This hotel was about 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. Great location! If i complained about anything, it would be the daily cleaning. They did change the sheets and towels everyday but I don't think they "wiped down anything" and there were a few glasses that stayed in the hallway for a couple days. But really, thats it. Despite that I really would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice sized room, good room service, room needs updating”
Reviews.Author: revival75
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable and the location cant' be beat. However, the room needs updating. They used the armoire-where the tv was formerly located, to house an ice bucket. The desk was used to hold a flat panel tv. It was kind of sad. The bathroom was spacious but the tub was discolored with age. It would be a very special room with updating. I ordered room service for breakfast and the food was quite good and the server very couirteous. The front desk staff was efficent but someone had given away my room to someone else by mistake-which was disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Eczema crazy”
Reviews.Author: weejim
Reviews.Content: I've heard about a bed bug epidemic in NYC and I don't know how the hensley cleans there sheets but there were no bugs but I developed bad eczema all over following my stay. apart from that, the lack of a real bar and the high price, it's a quality hotel. Especially on expenses ;)

Reviews.Title: “Run down rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sierra1225
Reviews.Content: The helmsley needs updating. Furniture is outdated and old. Maid service was poor. Front desk attendants went out of their way to help

Reviews.Title: “Great location with rooms in need of updated design”
Reviews.Author: Intheigloo Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days with family of four. Staff were nice and very serviceminded. Only thing on the downside was the room, this hotel could be a strong 4 star hotel if they only carry out a renovation of the rooms which are in a early 90's condition. The location couldn't be better. During business or pleasure, this hotel always ends up in the center. Perfect hotel for a weekend trip, when you are spending more time touristing instead of spending time at the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: MollyOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business. The location was great ( I wish I had more free time to sight see). The room was good size (I had an end room), the view was great, I could see the Chrysler building from my window. The room was very clean and comfortable. I loved the lighting fixtures in the room and in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “First time to New York, will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: GerGogg
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to New York and was very pleased with the hotel choice we made, It was very comfortable, we had a corner room on the 30th floor with super views. The check in was efficient and friendly, the staff were helpful and very accomodating. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was compact but very well appointed. The accomodation was serviced well each day, and all the public areas were well mainitaned. It was very well situated to do all that we wanted, including shopping, sightseeing and all the touristy things that are a must in the city. Only one staff member was put out when he was not tipped, as we were in the habit of tipping after we had finished with our services, he expected to be tipped beforehand, this did not happen needless to say before or after as a result of his attitude. He was the only one person who did this for the duration of our stay. Denis the doorman was most helpful and the bell hop and recepionist were wonderful. The concierges were most helpful also. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable well appointed accomdation with helpful staff.. It was good value and I will most certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel rooms lacking style, comfort or charm”
Reviews.Author: dianeNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Public spaces appear to have had a recent facelift, but the rooms are dated and lacking style, comfort or charm of any kind. Dark and drab would be the best words to describe rooms. Sheets are rough and abrasive. TV stand sits on sole desk, taking up a fare portion of the limited width, making working from the desk with a computer impossible, as well as room service tray. No gathering space in lobby to wait for a colleague unless you are sitting in their lounge ordering food or drink. So many nicer places to stay in the same general area -- skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star experience in any way...”
Reviews.Author: Gymstar
Reviews.Content: 1st night toilet was broken, was fixed then was broken again. hairdryer literally blew up came back at 15:00 one day to find room not made up. took an hour while we were left sitting in a corridor. remote broke twice. receptionist attitude was curt and they just offered $100 off one night. as bill was worth over $3,400 dollars this was derisory. not a 4 star experience in any way. Sent several emails and spoke to them to give them a chance to improve (we were their ten days). Nothing was really done. Had a short meeting with a duty manager and he mentioned an amenity pack that never arrived... Overall, very poor. (& I stay in hotels every week).

Reviews.Title: “Great value (for Manhattan), they really work hard to do things right”
Reviews.Author: The-Bray
Reviews.Content: We (mum, dad, 15 year old daughter and 12 year old son) stayed at The Helmsley from 28th December 2010 to 2nd January 2011. I spent ages trawling Trip Advisor looking for a good hotel recommendation in Manhattan and I was really pleased we found The Helmsley. The location is great, just 10 to 15 minutes walk to Times Square and is dead easy to find as all you have to do is walk out of the hotel, turn left and keep walking along 42nd (past Grand Central and Bryant Park) until you hit the edge of Times Square. Our first room was on the 9th floor and if you pressed your face right up against the window and looked up you could just about catch a glimpse of The Chrysler Building (my favourite NY landmark). I emailed the duty manager of the hotel to politely ask if they had any better rooms and within minutes Zach the General Manager called me and said he would arrange an alternative room the next day (as it was during the Christmas holidays the hotel was pretty full). Sure enough, the next day Jody the duty manager called so that we could view an alternative room on the 29th floor. Although the room was exactly the same size and layout it had a much better city view, was slightly less noisy (what is it with NY drivers honking their horns all the time?!!) and it had the most awesome view of the Empire State Building, which was perfectly framed between two adjacent skyscrapers to the right (I have posted a picture of it taken from our room at night). For us, the only downside to The Helmsley was that there are no rollaway beds available. A third bed (or even a sofa bed) would easily have fitted in the room and this would have made our sleeping arrangements much more comfortable as the two queen size beds are more like UK divans. There was not a kettle in the room but I read about that on another Trip Advisor report so we took a travel kettle with us. Having said that we also made great use of Dunkin Donuts for our hot drinks and morning toasted bagels. DD's are all around but the best one we found was out of the hotel, turn right to the corner of 42nd and 2nd, turn right onto 2nd Ave then just a block down to the corner of 40th and 2nd (5 minutes walk and no big roads to get across). Alternatively, the deli chain Pax is right next door to the hotel and although a little more pricey than Dunkin Donuts, Pax do a great range of sandwiches, salads and cakes, etc. The only other thing that might have improved the facilities in the room would be a fridge but there are plenty of ice machines near the stairwell on many floors. If like me you find you can't bear to be disconnected you will find the free wi-fi more than adequate. Logging on was always easy with no cumbersome procedures to follow and the speed/ was always pretty good. Our room was clean and comfortable, with freezing temperatures outside, our room was always warm and cosy and housekeeping visited us daily. On our day of departure we stored our bags with the concierge service as we had a few hours to kill. When we returned they arranged a taxi to take us to JFK and the whole process was as smooth as a 4* experience should be. New York can be expensive so another top tip if you are planning to stay at The Helmsley is to research the best price you can get from all the booking websites then log on to the Helmsley's own website (www.newyorkhelmsley.com). At the top of the home page hover your mouse over 'Reservations' then click on the 'Place A Bid' tab that drops down. Here you can put in a cheeky bid for the amount you want to pay per room per night and within 3 days you will find out if you bid has been accepted. I saved over Â£500 (yes Â£500 not $500) on the best price I could have got anywhere else! I definitely recommend The Helmsley and I say a big thank you to Zach the General Manager. It was a nice touch for him to respond to my email with a personal phone call in such a prompt fashion and considering the hotel was so busy I found him to be most accommodating. This personal touch made a big difference and made our stay even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a nice hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: NY_Guy_Traveling
Reviews.Content: My wife, our baby and I spent four nights at the New York Helmsley to see friends in New York. (We lived in NY until recently.) Our experience was exceptionally positive, with one small complaint. I secured a low rate (including breakfast) via Travelzoo, so, frankly, I was a little afraid, hoping the reviews here were accurate, although it didn't seem possible at the price I was paying. I had nothing to fear. For starters, by New York standards, the room was large, with room for a king bed, a crib and a cushy chair (without feeling crowded). The furnishings (and carpeting) were not new, but they were in excellent condition (with minor blemishes from age). The room included a flat screen TV and lots of cable stations. The bathroom was in excellent shape, with newish tile, etc. In other words, a very nice room, but not a five-star luxury one (if that's what you're looking for). I'm kind of picky, and I was very comfortable in the room. The free wireless Internet was stable and while not fast enough to play any video online (e.g. I couldn't even watch 45-second sports highlight clips--video was not an option), was adequately fast to look at websites and definitely served my purpose. There is also an in-room safe, which is helpful. The hotel itself is very nice, with an attractive lobby, a lobby bar that is basically part of the lobby, and a restaurant in the back. The restaurant and bar service was excellent. The only meal we ate at the hotel was breakfast, and while it was fine (buffet with cereal, yogurt, eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes, pastries and rolls), it would have been overpriced if I had to pay for it. Being NYC, there are a million restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel. (We enjoyed several relatively inexpensive meals at Energy Kitchen around the corner on 2nd Ave, and Osteria Laguna is a great upscale Italian restaurant literally across the avenue from the hotel.) As for service, it was mostly very positive. The front desk clerk who took care of us upon check-in (I think her name is Regina) was very helpful, as was the security staff, doormen, our housekeeper and restaurant/bar staff. We spent a lot of time in the hotel visiting with friends (with the baby around a lot), and the staff made us feel comfortable and relaxed. We appreciated that. I was also impressed that the crib and refrigerator we requested was waiting in our room. On the negative side, there was one big thing and one little thing. The big thing was the lack of communication after several rooms on our floor lost power for three hours due to a fire in the building. (Which meant we were effectively trapped in our room, since the elevator was out.) An hour and a half into the blackout, an announcement was made over the emergency sound system that everything was back to normal, and when we called the front desk, the clerk did not know that power was still out on our floor. (Several times, the announcement system was engaged, but no announcement was made. There were issues with the system.) Nobody from the hotel ever contacted us to apologize or offer us any kind of compensation for the disruption. That was disappointing. The small thing was that certain specific staff members, unlike most of their colleagues, were not especially responsive the few times we had questions or requests (e.g. asking a question at the front desk or when we called housekeeping for something small). But over all, our experience at the New York Helmsley was great (especially given the rate), and if we could secure a similar rate, we would be happy to stay at the hotel again on our next visit to NY.

Reviews.Title: “understandable reservations office - snow storm disruptions”
Reviews.Author: lena-software
Reviews.Content: We were due to arrive to the hotel on 27 December but only made it to NYC on 29th because of the snowstorm - the hotel offered refund for the two nights we could not stay there, although our fare was the least flexible one and fully pre-paid in advance - I was quite pleased. Also, we asked for a high floor in advance of our arrival and got a room on 35th floor which was nice. I think some room features did look a bit tired, such as the wardrobe and the bathroom (especially the bathtub) but generally no major issues. yes the heating system isn't perfect, but we found the temperature quite comfortable. Something which did annoy me was a fire alarm that happened around 630 in the evening and I do not think the duty manager was handling it very well. Apart from that, quite a nice hotel, convenient location and a buzzy atmosphere in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: leapea29
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this trip to NYC as a surprise back in March. He found the room online at an unbelieveably good price so it was a bargain. When we arrived, the doorman was only too happy to help with our bags and the staff on the front desk were friendly, polite, chatty and just generally happy. My partner had written to the hotel in advance as he was planning to propose to me on this trip, and I am told all of the notes taken at the time of the booking were on the system upon our arrival! They even upgraded us to a bigger room on the 40th floor with a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building. The hotel was clean, spacious and the room was very tidy. They had recently renovated most of their rooms, but we had an older style room which was yet to be decorated. However, it was still in good condition - the decor was just a little dated. The bed was huge and was very very comfortable, which is a must for me as I have a bad back (and after all the walking in NYC, you need a decent nights sleep!). The bathroom had a bath and shower, which suited us as my partner prefers to shower while I prefer a bath. There was plenty of room for cosmetics and there was also a spacious wardrobe and plenty of drawer space. There was also a safe in the room which you could lock with a digital keycode of your choice. We didn't try the food as we ate in a nearby diner for breakfast every morning, but we did have a peek at the buffet and it looked lovely. The best thing about the hotel was the location - it was just far enough away from the buzz of Times Square that there was no street noise at all, but it was right on top of Grand Central Terminal (you HAVE to go there just for Junior's Cheesecake), Bryant Park and the Chrysler Building. Walking to Times Square took about 10 minutes. I would highly recommend this hotel as it was perfect for our stay in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: puramo
Reviews.Content: This hotel can not be 4 star... it should be 2 star hotel. The room has not coffe maker even water to drink. No mini bar. Small refrigerator in bathroom(!) is not working. The worst one is that I wasted 20 min on 1st day + 40 min on next day to follow assistant instructions by phone to fix not working WIFI conncention. And finally he gave up to fix it.I recommend to look for another hotel...if you want derseving 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: duffiej
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was just a few blocks to Times Square and Grand Central Station. There are several good restaurants close by which were reasonably priced for the area. The hotel and the room were clean and in fairly good condition. Front desk staff were efficient, but not very friendly or helpful. They are somewhat pushy and very strongly encourage using a bellman to take your luggage to your room. However, the bellman was very helpful when he accompanied us to our room. He realized we were staying for several nights but didn't have a view, so he suggested that we call the front desk to request a room with a view while he waited. The front desk staff agreed to move us to another room with a view of the Chrysler building. The hotel is on 42nd street, so it can be noisy at times. One BIG issue that should be addressed is the heating system. Even in much less expensive hotels, I expect to be able to control the room temperature in my room. But there was no way to control the temp in our hotel room. It stayed between 76 and 82 degrees in our room all the time, regardless of where we set the thermostat or whether we set the system on Manual, Auto, or Off. It was obvious that the hotel controlled the room temperatures at a central location. We kept the windows cracked open as far as possible for the entire day, but had to close the windows at night due to the traffic noise. Even with the windows cracked, the room was very hot at night and we were all miserable while trying to sleep. Didn't use the restaurant or bar or concierge service, so I can't comment on those. Business center was ridiculous - there was a per-minute charge to use the computer AND a charge per page to print anything, with a $5 minimum just to do anything at all. I estimate that it would have cost us $10 - $15 to do the online airline check-in and print our boarding passes. I can do this at most hotels at no charge. Not sure I'd stay there again, unless I got a really great price on the room.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel never lets me down!”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler201096
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Helmsley hotel many times when I go to NYC. The rooms, service and location are perfect. On my last trip this past November I asked and immediately received an upgrade to a beautiful contemporary room, with free room service. We had a beautiful view of the Empire State Bldg and the Hudson River. My friend who had never stayed at this hotel loved it. The staff are very kind and helpful. The prices of a decent hotel in the city are mostly, very high. This one is still affordable and they offer terrific values at different times of the year. They have a lovely bar and offer a buffet which I haven't had, so I cannot comment on it. It is so near to everything..walking to Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall and Broadway are all a 15-20 minute walk. I will, more than likely, stay there again when I plan another trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose but would not stay here again (and didn't when delayed)”
Reviews.Author: ChrisB369
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night pre-cruise stay at the Helmsley prior to an 11 night caribbean cruise on Cunard Queen Mary 2 sailing from Brooklyn cruise terminal. I had read the reviews of this hotel prior to booking and had considered the Belvedere as well and due to some peoples comments that it's only somewhere to sleep whilst in the Big Apple sightseeing I opted for the Helmsley partly due to the phenomenal upgrade costs of choosing a 4 o5 5 start option - the 5 star upgrade to Waldorf was an extra Â£600/$1000 per night! The hotel lobby is very nice. Restaurant too expensive for me so we used the PAX deli immediately next door (see photo) which has seating and an excellent breakfast & lunch selection. The room has pluses and minuses - it was a decent size with, nice bedding, good tv and bathroom accessories, safe etc however the room was yellow with smoke, it smelled of smoke but was on a no smoking floor. On arrival either the staff or previous occupier had been smoking as the smell was strong. The smell dissipated over 24 hrs a little but never went away. The windows let every little noise in and when shut gave the impression it was wide open. Every police/fire siren could be heard all night long as well as every car horn. Capital cities are very noisy and on a recent stay in London we noticed the emergency services sirens however you expect a certain amount of buffering via the windows and the Helmsley offered none. Due to the smoke/noise I have rated this hotel 3/5 overall and would not stay again however the service and staff were good.

Reviews.Title: “A traditional spacious hotel in a great location with the most comfortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Maree4
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple who just needed somewhere to sleep that was clean and in a good location - although the decor is a bit dated its not an issue and actually was nice to stay in a hotel that had character for a change! The beds are soooo comfy and the room was spotless. Reception/porters were efficient so couldn't ask for much more. The location is great, about a 15 minute walk to times square and near to grand central station. I don't have anything negative to say about this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: steve68
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 5th December after a very long days travelling and was completly worn out, I had mistakenly booked a king room with lastminute and tried to change for a twin but wasn't able to, however on arrival the lady at the desk just asked for my surname, offered the twin room without prompting handed me the keys without any fuss or fanfare, no fiddling in my bag for reservation papers etc which always gets me down, I was in and room ready in one minute flat, the room was a good size and perfectly fine for my five days stay, only downside was no fridge in the room, on the plus side the beds were very comfortable,and big, room was cleaned every day and sheets changed on the third day, didn't use the restaurant, however the bar served pinot grigio at $12 a glass, 42nd street station/Grand central is about 100 metres away with a line to Times square (Two stops) and another which takes you south to Chinatown and Battery park. We bought a seven day metrocard for $27 each which was perfect for getting about. My daughter spent alot of time shopping for designer labels all at 30%-50% less than the UK prices. She tripped across a shop called 'Forever 21' which although not designer was full of womens clothes that she liked and she reckoned it was well worth a wander around (theres one in Times sq). For any male UK travellers who drink real ale, I found a local beer which although not a real ale has a flowery aromatic flavour not disimilar to 'London pride' or 'Bombardier' its called ;Brooklyn lager' ($6.50 a pint) and is at least worth a try if you can't tolerate the tasteless frothy pale stuff, it is served in a diner called Pershing square which is on 42nd st on the opposite side of the road from the entrance to Grand central station, the jumbo prawns were pretty good in there too. In any case I hope this has been of use to someone, I liked the Hotel for location and the service must have been pretty good as I had no need to bother anyone from checkin to checkout which by the way was done in less than a minute. I would recommend it to a friend. Some things you should know if this is your first time to New York, you should not be charged tax on clothes purchases under $100, Macys and Bloomingdales will give you a 10% discount card on production of a UK passport or driving licence, the price on the tag does not include tax at 8 -9% which is added at the till, if you are taxed keep the receipts and recover it from customs at the airport, all restaurants charge a 12 - 20% on top of your bill as a tip for your waiter the usual is 15% this is shown as part of your bill. Happy shopping.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money...a little old”
Reviews.Author: MichelleS01
Reviews.Content: The web site for the hotel is much fancier than the actual rooms. The lobby of the hotels shows exactly as indicated, but the hotel is old from the room standpoint. You can not adjust the heating or air conditioner, so we were very hot one evening. There are no windows to open, so when it's too hot, there's not too much you can do. There is a small fridge, but no microwave or coffee maker in the room. This made it difficult to eat left-overs from large meals at various restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Renovated! Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Boris072
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least eight times since we have a company rate. Previously I would put this at the same level as a Holiday Inn, but now it has been renovated and much improved. What a difference! Flat screen TV's, good WIFI service, really nice lounge and bar area. Much improved heating/cooling system. It's almost like a completely different hotel! Can't beat the location! Right across the street from Grand Central Station and several area restaurants. I look forward to my next stay here at the Helmsley! I recommend a high floor since it can be loud outside (after all, the hotel is right on 42nd St.).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, beware of the bellboys!!!”
Reviews.Author: NormanManchester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights with my husband, Mum and Mother in law. The hotel is in a fantastic location, close to the subway and within walking distance of Times Square. Hotel was very clean and rooms were always cleaned and changed quickly once we'd left for the day. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. Reception staff were quite off hand (not unusual for New York) and the concierge despite claiming on the website to be available for any questions looked at us like we were an inconvenience when we asked anything! The main issue was with the bell boys. Although they quickly came to the room to help with the cases, they clearly have a set amount of money they would like for a tip. If you didn't oblige with this amount (we're not sure what it was!) then you were subjected to a tantrum and in the case of one customer we saw he was told to " Have s**t day!" As he walked away from my 60 year old mother he said at the top of his voice "Happy fu****g Holidays" whilst kicking the luggage trolley. Mildly amusing for us but other customers may find it a bit intimidating as they weren't scared of confronting you if they weren't happy with their tip. We accept that tipping is a way of life in New York but there is no justification for the behaviour of the staff. The one we dealt with was Ralph who had two tantrums in a short space of time, one with us as $3 for 3 minutes work was clearly not acceptable and the other with another customer a short time later! Imagine a child who has had his sweets taken away and you'll get a good picture of what to expect! Shame really as these people are the face of this hotel and are ruining a good stay. The doormen were lovely, very friendly, very quick to assist with cabs etc and didn't seem to expect anything, although they deserved much more than Ralph!!!

Reviews.Title: “updated hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Eric451
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at the high level of professionalism and the friendliness of the staff in this mid-level hotel. I expected the hotel would have the anonymous feeling of other large New York hotels, but I was surprised to be greeted by name on my second morning as I went in for breakfast. All the staff made a great effort at making their guests feel welcome. The rooms were large by New York City standards and I could see the Chrysler building with some straining. There was a large new flat-screen television in the room, a comfortable bed, a small empty refrigerator (that was a nice change) and an old-fashioned but ample bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location, impersonal service”
Reviews.Author: NickB1979
Reviews.Content: Great mid-east location, just away from the hustle and bustle of times square. Spacious and quiet 33rd floor room overlooking 42nd st. Quick elevators and good qaulaity food for room service and comparitvely well priced. Only complaint is service was rather impersonal from check-in to check-out. Check-in was rushed and not very friendly. It was busy but no excuses. Concierge seemed disinterested and bell/valet out the front has to approached to request taxi and not even a simple "good-morning" as we walked out each day. Nice bed and no bugs! Still recommend this place though.

Reviews.Title: “Gratuity gone mad!”
Reviews.Author: CameronsPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the NY Helmsley Hotel from 13/11/10 - 18/11/10. This wasn't the first time we had stayed but it will be the last. After we checked we were showed to our room by one of the bell boys however; the room wasn't cleaned properly so he moved us to another room which he claimed was better, I gave him $5 and he smiled and left. It was only after I read the hotel information on gratuities that I had over tipped by $2 (yes the hotel actually tells you what they expect you to tip their staff). The room was a bit sad and dated and needed renovated however we made do. I'd advise you not to spend too much time in the bar as the drinks are around double what you would pay elsewhere and even though you sit at the bar you will be hit with a 15% gratuity charge and 18% if you have a meal. On leaving we needed to put our luggage in the store for which I tipped $3 even though they were stored no more than 5 feet from the room door however; when I needed to get them out again so we could leave I only had $1 left so I gave the guy this thinking it would be okay as I had already tipped to put them in. He looked the dollar and then at me as if I was dirt, shook his head and muttered something and walked off knocking over a case as he went. I know the culture for the USA is service staff top up wages off tips however; it's gone mad as they aren't interested in providing you with an acceptable service they just want money and all the staff came across as quite greedy in this hotel. I won't be back and I would ask others to think first before booking.

Reviews.Title: “A good find.”
Reviews.Author: MissPf
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the Waldorf but this hotel may change that. The rooms are lovely and the staff very helpful. Bigger rooms than usual for NY! I had a good stay here and will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and cool bar”
Reviews.Author: sammyjo_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with an Expedia deal earlier this month. Hotels in NYC are very expensive and this came up as a relatively good deal as it also included breakfast for 2. Great location, easy to walk everywhere or jump on the subway. Trendy bar and restaurant (we only had breakfast there) but bar was chilled. Very busy hotel so a good buzz about it. We were on 25th floor but lots of lifts so didn't have to wait for ages. Room was a good size, even with 4 of us in it. Bathroom was a little dated but great light fittings - very art deco. Only hassle was trying to sort out the room bill at the end as there were issues with the free breakfast but did eventually get sorted. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the New York Helmsley. I stayed there about three years ago and the hotel has improved a lot. The lobby and restaurant areas have been updated which is nice. The rooms are a bit dated but fully functional. The only criticism I have is the lack of a fridge in the room. On the plus side, the internet is free of charge and worked fine apart from one day. Another great plus was that the great breakfast was included in my rate. What a treat to have some breakfast while reading the New York Times. Reception always seems very busy and staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Pricey Location”
Reviews.Author: chauddog
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the New York Helmsley. We were in a renovated view on the 48th floor. Although we were high up, not much of a view though. Room was recently renovated we were told and was nice enough with newer furniture, and definitely spacious but carpeting looked dated and stained. Bed was FABULOUS..so comfortable. Our biggest complaint was the room was uncomforrtably warm and we were told that because of the old heatiing system, there was nothing they could do. Opening the windows and getting a portable fan made it more bearable. We got a deal through the hotel WEB site but staff seemed baffled as to what our rate actually was so we are glad we brought our printout.
