Expensive rooms but we did get one night free due to special promotion. Breakfast buffet was pricey and not very good. We have had better buffets at much less fancy hotels All in all a pleasant stay in a very convenient location at a price that was in line with other similar hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable But Not Desirable for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuestTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not at its prime. The hotel offers few amenities of the top business hotels and the service/staff at the establishment is not consistent with a top notch hotel. The rooms are adequate. I stayed in a renovated room and it was fine. The bed was extraordinary, but all else was average at best. The hotel has the impression of a property that is struggling financially. They seemed to cut corner on costs and have minimal staffing. For example, I ordered room service for breakfast (which was nice and timely delivered) and I left the tray in my room when I left at 8:30 am. When I came back in the evening at 11, the tray had been put in the hallway and reamained there. While the room appeared clean enough, the common areas and hotel were not clean and well maintained. The rates were very low which makes sense given the quality. This would not be my first choice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape May Court House, New Jersey
Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr. Hong
Reviews.Content: NYC hotels are so expensive in Times Square. The Helmsely was close enough to everything. It is a nice hotel with very clean, nice beds. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: oldskoolboarder
Reviews.Content: I had to find a hotel near the UN because of family obligations. This was the cheapest one I could find w/ in walking distance of the UN. We were pleasantly surprised. GREAT location, so close to Grand Central, there's even a station 1 block away that can get you to some stops, it's right on 42nd. However, I couldn't figure out how to actually arrive at this one... After a recommendation on Yelp, I tried the bid option and got a very good rate for the City King. Nice room, clean, and not as dated as other seem to note. If you want a contemporary hotel, pick a newer, remodeled one w/ a different style. If you want a clean, nicely located place, this is great. Would stay again. I failed to check the Bed Bug registry but we had no problems here. We liked the coffee shop across the street for easy/quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: joanslade
Reviews.Content: On the whole very good and comfortable.Friendly helpful staff...The room we stayed in was just starting to look a little "tired".Were disapointed that there was no coffee/tea making facilities in the room....There is a deli almost next door which serves one of the worst breakfasts I have ever had.There is a super 24hr deli about 5 mins away...Turn left on leaving the hotel then next left then next right and walk just a little way and it is on the corner of the next block.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: BoomBoomsPunkin
Reviews.Content: Evelyn with room service was EXCELLENT. The view from the room was EXCELLENT. The food quality was EXCELLENT. No coffee/tea/water in the rooms. No TV guide on the TV. The room decor including the rug was Super 8 motel quality. I've stayed in better motels that were Best Westerns and Courtyards. And of course that's for a fraction of the price paid at The Helmsley. Everything was outdated and dingy. The security on the door was a chain link. I haven't seen those in 20 years and they offer little to no security. Everything in the room needed to be updated or showed its age in a very bad way. The particle board desk and hutch were peeling and bruised. The chair was dingy, the rug was disgusting. the sheets on the bed felt like rubber. the bathroom floor was not clean and I found several stray hairs NOT MINE in the tub. For the price of these rooms, this is highway robbery. There are plenty of other hotels in this price point in the area to stay in. DO NOT STAY AT THE NEW YORK HELMSLEY.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you need to be near Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: ilonajane
Reviews.Content: Hotel is easy access to Grand Central and shuttle bus to airports. Lobby redecorated but rooms had old furniture and carpet. Most important: scrupulously clean beds, linens, towels, bathroom. Quiet, even facing 42nd Street, and spacious. Front desk personnel very friendly and efficient. Concierge even located a Pittsburgh Steelers bar for us so we could watch the Sunday football game which was not on national TV. Good deal was three night stay for the price of two. All in all it was a perfect choice and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DartfordTony
Reviews.Content: I have stayed herer several times before on business and decided to stay again for our holiday due to mixed reports on Trip Advisor of other hotels. We had a fear of the reported bedbug epidemic in NY, but I e-mailed the hotel beforehand and the General Manager quickly replied putting our mind at ease. A very good sized room with a comfortable king-size bed and chair with footstall. Good TV with all the channels. Nice clean bathroom with bathrobes and a good bath and shower. The bar and restaurant on ground floor were pricey - especially the wine and the 19% service sharge - but we had a really excellent meal. Great location close to Grand Central Terminal, subway & buses. About 15 minute walk to Times Square, Empire State, Macy's & 5th Avenue, however not in the main tourist hubbub, which was good as the windows are not double glazed so some police siren & traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “The location was great but the hotel was outdated.”
Reviews.Author: DonnaBee1231
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in our room, we discovered hair in one of the beds and immediately went to the front desk to complain. Because of the "reason" we were given another room immediately. The room was clean but the sink leaked when the water was turned on which created puddles all over the counter. We again complained and were moved into another room which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and would stay again on a discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: BornForTravel
Reviews.Content: My special friend and I stayed here for his birthday and also to meet up with other friends in the city for the weekend. I had booked through my Iprefer membership and got a very nice discounted rate on a king room. We arrived and there was no record of our reservation. Fortunately, I had the confirmation email printed out and with me. The receptionist called someone (likely a manager) who located the reservation through Iprefer. I was understandably irritated and said so and that this booking was for my friend's birthday. We received an upgrade to a corner king room on the 40th floor given the inconvenience. It had a great view. While the hotel is nice, you can tell it is a bit older once in the room. Considering how great the location is, the older hotel feeling of the room could be ignored. The bed was also quite comfortable and the room was very quiet since it was in a corner. Besides the reservation issue, I had two minor negatives. First, breakfast was not included and the restaurant breakfast prices are pricey. This may be because we received a discount through my membership. Second, we needed assistance several times from the concierge and found the experience to not always be entirely pleasant. We were given mis-information which could have led to me arriving at one location and my friend (who was staying at another hotel) arriving at a different one for breakfast. Some of the concierge staff also weren't as friendly and seemingly as happy to help as concierge I've dealt with at other hotels (even lesser hotels). But, perhaps that's New York... (I can safely say that since I used to live there.) In any event, the location of the hotel won us over as did the comfort and view the room did offer.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location , and an excellent hotel, i always recommend it to friends”
Reviews.Author: traveltoneUk
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for getting to know NY/Manhattan We Drove directly into the valet parking area, your car and luggage taken from you at this point, such superb service, the bags then taken to your room . i stayed on the 42nd floor with a commanding view of the Chrysler Building opposite. The Staff were excellent rooms very clean and spacious , everything is walkable from here so no cabs required price i would say towards the upper middle end of NY Hotels circa $300+ per night , but you have to pay for great quality and location. Perfect for a long or short stay , in fact if you were doing a city weekend break this is the one for you (no time consuming commuting unless for fun !) tip: try to stay on the higher floors for the views i also recommend you try Blooms Deli at 350 Lexington/corner of 40th 2 mins away

Reviews.Title: “First stay, won't be our last!”
Reviews.Author: DASL
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were quickly allocated our rooms, which as requested were next door to one another. We had our two teenage daughters with us who no longer like to share the room with us and vise-versa so we wanted the rooms as close together as possible. The porter was knowledgeable and friendly and pointed out the many restaurants and attractions within walking distance. Our rooms, on the 9th floor, were double twin rooms so they were a good size although the decor did need a little bit of updating in our opinion. At times it was a bit noisy but that's New York for you! It didn't stop us from having five good nights sleep. They were very clean and fresh, we even had a fantastic view of the Empire State building. We had a small but adequate fridge in each room but we felt we would have appreciated coffee making facilities. The hotel is in one of the best positions for visiting Times Square, 5th Avenue and Broadway. All are within walking distance. Grand Central Terminal is only a few blocks away. The lobby and bar areas are beautiful, spacious and comfortable. We didn't use the restaurant so can't pass comment about it. A wonderful hotel in our opinion and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding central location, all comforts of a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: Shoutcaster
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the US with my 16 year old sister in June this year. We spent 5 days with family in Long Island and selected The New York Helmsley for its fantastic location and value for money so that we could spend the weekend in the city. The staff was helpful and courteous and even though an early check-in was not possible (their check-in time is 4pm), they got the concierge to hold our bags till we could check-in, giving us the chance to roam the streets. Our room was spacious and had all the necessary amenities including bathrobes! The hotel is extremely functional and suitable for solo travelers, couples, families and even large groups. The Helmsley is 5 minutes walk from Grand Central and 10 minutes from Times Square making it a great choice for travelers who'd like to explore nearby areas on foot or use the Subway extensively. We has an early Amtrak to Rochester the day of our check-out and were a little ancy about being able to make it in time to Penn Station. However, the Helmsley's express check-out facility had us out in less than 5 minutes. The bellboy was also kind enough to get us a cab (at 6am!) ensuring we made it on time for our train. The Helmsley is a great hotel and fabulous value for money. I look forward to our next visit to NYC and will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Average - nothing bad, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: BrianGomi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in the middle of UN Council meetings as well but it didn't seem to be as crowded as I expected especially as considered with how close it is to the UN, which might be a good thing. I had an expectation as for a 3 star hotel so I wasn't disappointed. After the renovation, the lobby looked nice but our room was still average - large for NYC standard, clean, comfortable and except Friday/Saturday night, I didn't notice that much noise from outside. The service - average as well. The front desk staff was friendly when we checked in but at the check-out, "thank you - bye." No assistant for cab (we pre-arranged a town car to the airport so there was no need but..). That's it. Since I am in the hotel business, I might be a hotel snob somewhat but I kind of expected to be asked "how is your stay" "have a safe trip home" or a few more words rather than just "you are all set - next!" There is nothing to be complained but nothing to be particularly mentioned either. Uneventful and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovel hotel very central”
Reviews.Author: catTipperary
Reviews.Content: stayed in the new york helmsley for 1 week with my cousin,it was a lovely hotel, very clean and very comfortable beds,the staff were very friendly the manager called us his irish girlfriends,the hotel is very central located,only a 2 min walk to grand central station 1 stop on the subway and your in times square,only a 10 min walk from 5th ave,also only about 15 min walk from 34th st(empire state building and macys),the only thing i would say is that when checking in the presumed we were paying by credit card but we told them we wanted to pay by cash,we had to pay a $400 dollar deposit but we got that back when we were leaving,there is no tea coffee making facilities in the room but i had known that before i went and brought my own kettle,we didnt eat in the hotel as it was very exp

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced average hotel”
Reviews.Author: MAG1982
Reviews.Content: This hotel cost â‚¬1300 for 6 nights, the staff weren't friendly/helpful, the rooms were bog standard no tea/coffee facilities in the room, the bathroom was tiny and outdated. Do not use the phone in the room, i used the phone for 5 mins every day as I lost my mobile and when we were checking out they had taken $470 off the credit card used to make the booking and just handed us the receipt we tried to dispute it but "their rates are their rates"!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: JUDI07_10
Reviews.Content: Close to Grand Central, walking distance to Time Square. Rooms were quiet although there was a lot of traffic noise outside, good size and very comfortable. The only negative was there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room. Staff pleasant and willing to assist, especially when we were returning from Boston and due to lengthy delays on the train we missed our flight to Spain and had to re-book in again very late at night and they could not be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre - and no coffee in the room”
Reviews.Author: MelZim
Reviews.Content: The tub was very slow draining (gross!), the fridge in the room didn't work, there wasn't any coffee in the room and they clean your room even if you have the "do not disturb" sign on the door. The service in the hotel was subpar - from the people at the front desk to the doormen to the lounge. The doormen will get you a cab - walk half a block down and get a different one. The cabs that they get you have incompetent drivers. On both occasions, they tried to charge us at least $10 more than what the ride should have been (conveniently, the meter wasn't working) and on one of those occasions the cabby kept pulling over and asking us how to get to the destination. The only thing good about it was the location and that we got a deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExeterGeorge
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several New York Hotel and this is, by far, the best. All the staff from the doormen, bell boys upwards were all so polite, friendly and helpful. The bedroom was larger than I had previously encountered in New York. The hotel was ideally located witnin easy walking distance to Times Square, Theatre district and other landmarks. There is also a bus stop right oiutside the hotel. I pould not fault this hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lafia
Reviews.Content: We, a family of four, used New York Helmsley as a base for a 6-day pleasure stay on Manhattan. The hotel fully met our service and comfort expectations and at a reasonable price for NYC. Allways a friendly reception when coming back from excursions, cozy well equipped rooms with comfortable beds, and good service from the concierge staff. The only thing we missed was coffee making facilities in the room. We will be back :0)

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Scez79
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much so was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Helmsley. The rooms were much larger than expected and our room in LA was far smaller than this room. The bed was really comfortable and the free internet a nice addition. The bathroom was heading towards being a bit dated but it did have nice toiletries. All the staff we dealt with were courteous and helpful if not a little disinterested. The location served us pretty well although being our first time to NY we didn't have anything to compare it to. We were on quite a low level and facing the back of the hotel and we heard some sort of construction on one of the mornings which wasn't great but apart from that the noise was fine.

Reviews.Title: “ok nothing great”
Reviews.Author: bruce03
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights. Price was ok for NY. The room was large no bed bugs. Ac did not work well we had to keep the air set at 50 just to get the room cooled to 75. The 2 beds in the room were full size. parking was expensive at the hotel $52 per night + tax If you park on 41 st the same lot the hotel uses it is only $35.87 with tax. good location but would probable stay somewhere else next time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel providing excellent service in a prime location. Will definitely come again”
Reviews.Author: CarolineJSam
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 with a 17yr old daughter. This was our first visit to New York and we were not disappointed. The hotel sits in a prime location with nearly everything within walking distance. We used Go Airlink NYC Sedan driver service for our ground transportation to and from the airport which was reasonably priced, quick & reliable and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a SUV on our arrival in NY! We made our booking back in February this year, so well in advance with good rates. We stayed at the Helmsley for 4 nights and were very happy with the room and service provided. Our room was located on the 12th floor on the main E 42nd St side and we had a nice view of the Empire State Building from our window. We had 2 double beds in a generously sized room which was clean and comfortable with air con you can manually control. The traffic noise did not disturb us at night and we slept soundly. There is also free WiFi available in your room. The maid service is provided daily and free newspapers are left at your door Mon-Fri. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant as it was a little expensive, but there are many places close by. We ate breakfast every day at a diner next door to the hotel called Pax which I cannot recommend highly enough! Their food is divine and will be something I miss back in the UK!! As I said, the majority of places to see are within walking distance. We managed without using the subway or cabs and our furthest walk was to Central Park which took around 35 minutes and Times Square was only around 15 mins away. The street system is actually very easy to follow after a day in the city. I would suggest that you read up on gratuities, as we did before we went - most places expect a tip (usually around 18-20%), but certain services do differ. Also expect an added sales tax at the till (of around 8.8%) when purchasing goods, but in most cases items bought with the sales tax added are still cheaper than in the UK!! All in all our stay at The Helmsley was great and our first experience of New York was an absolutely wonderful one, the city is amazing and the people are friendly, polite & courteous. The only downside was that we couldn't fit everything in to 5 days, so are planning to visit again next year for a longer period of time! New York is now officially my favourite place in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephengk
Reviews.Content: Got good deal by booking long way in advance. Had room at back of building so was very quiet especially for this part of NY. Didnt really use facilities as ate and drank at other locations. Up early each day due to jet lag but no refreshments available 24hr. Had to go out to a to deli to get coffee and snack. Reported shower tap not working properly but not fixed. Wasnt a big problem but should have been done. Overall a good stay and would use again

Reviews.Title: “It is okay, but it is getting a bit shady”
Reviews.Author: Bumbi17
Reviews.Content: This is my second time in this hotel. Last time I liked it a lot better. I feel that the Hotel is not being taken care of properly, I mean that the furniture is outdated and very used. The location is (still) very-very good the price is not low but what do you expect from NYC? :) The staff varies very much! Some of them are really nice people but there are some rude staff! All together: I am okay with it, but maybe next time I will choose something else (if they will not have special rate).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ONail2010
Reviews.Content: Truly great location - give me any day East Midtown rather than noisier, dirtier West - , close to Grand Central. Plenty of eating places and shops in the surroundings. Room big, well equipped, very good bed. Only problem was the noise from outside, a sort of dull grinding sound, like some machine at work - I suppose it was the air conditioning motors: it wasn't a loud sound but it certainly was a nuisance. The service was very good. All the staff were very efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to explore New York”
Reviews.Author: stephentaynton
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed here on the last night of our vacation before returning home. We had already spent five weeks in New York so this was really a pit stop before flying our. The hotel is centrally located, close to a lot of things, and the best thing is if you get a high floor like we did, floor 40, you get great views of Manhatten. The room is nice, bed comfortable and front of house is extremely good. Many thanks to the Head Doorman, Joe, who is a very friendly and nice guy. Good value for the night we stayed and I am sure for many others if you wanted to. Only negative comment - the tip that is automatically added to your bill in both restaurants, the service is not that good. In particularly at Leona's where the wine waiter literally argued with my wife. Food okay but not worth a mandatory tip. Oh yes, free Internet, great way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Solid option”
Reviews.Author: Xephyra
Reviews.Content: Advertises itself as a four star hotel but feels more like a three and a half as the facilities have started aging a little. Concierge is very helpful to travellers. A couple of nice little extras - free wireless internet in your room and the New York Times delivered each weekday morning. However overall the price, location and cleanliness of the rooms make this a good option.

Reviews.Title: “NEW IS BETTER”
Reviews.Author: gerardocors
Reviews.Content: Great location, newly refurbished, great style, good rates. Close, very close; to Grand Central. Will back every time in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location coomfy bed and towels”
Reviews.Author: youngboo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights Aug 12 to 15 with a girlfriend for a girl's weekend in NYC. Had a great time. My freind is very well traveled and used to the finer things in life. I was a bit worried she would not like it but she loved it. the room was fine - big even for NYC with two double beds that were very comfortable. The towels were very nice quality and large. I think the best thing was the service. I arrived before her but the room was in her name. She would not be arriving until midnight. The manager was able to ascertain that I was to be included in the room via emails between us. This let me in the room and did not compromise the security of my friend. A nice way of making everyone happy. I'm glad the manager had common sense. On the last ight we returned to our room to find the inroom safe would not open. It was midnight. This would be a long night but No. We called down and some one was up at our room wthin 10 min. He could not fix it as the timer was frozen for 15 min. He told us he was going off duty but would tell the next security guard to come back up in 15 min. Just as we were thinking we might need to call back down, there was a knock on the door. In from central casting came the secuity guard. He too could not fix it and timed the lock out. THis was not going as planned. But alass he came back in 15 minutes with another guy with a key. They could not have been better. I was very impressed with how well they stayed on top of the situation. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend The NY Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: DF75
Reviews.Content: The NY Helmsley was fantastic!! Highly recommend it as the location is central, the rooms are a good size, clean and very comfortable. We were there for 7 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Very close to Grand Central Terminal, Times Square and Fifth Ave for shopping. Drycleaners (to drop your washing off) close (cnr Lexington and 39th) and good prices. Request high room if possible we were on the 36th of 41 and you could hear the street traffic but then you are in a city that literally never stops so noise comes with the territory!! When booking just check if taxes are included in the price or not. Ours came to an extra $300US once added on for the 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gghhii12
Reviews.Content: Great location great services. They gave us newspapers every morning. It was a first time visiting NY and so glad we picked this hotel. I will definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leethepee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Helmsley for 5 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location!! Close to Times Square, Empire State and Top of the Rock. Room was nice, staff were helpful and friendly bar one Spanish receptionist! Bar has been renovated and is very well equipped and modern looking. All in all, I'd stay in thi hotel again in a heartbeat!! NYC rocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: msmcT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York Helmsley with my daughter and son-in-law. The staff was first rate and extremely pleasant. The view was wonderful. The room and comfy robes were great. The only problem might be the location, but cheap taxi rides fixed that problem. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for getting around the city”
Reviews.Author: Halibut51
Reviews.Content: We booked online with the hotel's website and took advantage of their free night offer on stays of of 3 days or more. Our room was on the 28th floor and was fine with a great view of the Empire State Building. I would say that the bathroom looked rather tired and could do with a spruce up. However it was clean and the airconditioning in the room worked well. We had chosen to prepay $15 per person for the buffet breakfast in the hotel which, by day 4, we had probably had enough of as the options didn't vary at all. All staff were attentive and courteous. The hotel's location is a real bonus as it is close to Grand Central Station if you want to use the subway but only about 20 minutes to TImes Square. If we ever return to New York we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: princessfiona47
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 nights at this hotel in a city double/double room on the 33rd floor. At check-in there was confusion over our booking but this was quicklyy sorted. Our room was not as large as we had thought it would be after reading previous reviews on T.A.There was only one arm-chair and one dining type chair to sit on & storage space was minimal. Overall, the room seemed 'tired' and a bit shabby in places and in need of renovation. The bathroom was very small, it was difficult to fit more than one person in it at a time. The hot water supply was good and the shower powerful. Despite being on the 33rd floor, traffic noise was constantly noticeable particularly the sirens from emergency service vehicles. The air conditioning unit was also very noisy. Is in a convenient location, easy to walk to popular sights/subway stations. The housekeeper was very thorough but struggled to understand us. Concierge was very helpful as were the bellboys. Reception staff were not particularly helpful and abrupt. On the day of our check-out, we found a bill for $635 under our door despite paying in full when we booked, again this was quickly sorted by reception but an apology would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, outdated rooms and arrogant front desk "help"”
Reviews.Author: rhodymetsfan
Reviews.Content: Took a chance for a $200 rate and it wasn't worth $20. Tried to check in around noon and the person at the front desk barely looked me in the eye and said room would not be ready until 4 p.m. Now, I've heard of a 3 p.m. check-in, but that is rare...by 4:05...growing exasperated, they told me that the room was "almost ready." Finally got into my room at 4:10 pm...on a hot NYC day the thermostat was essentially a museum piece set at its lowest temp and it barely cooled the room down. The green carpeting looked as if it was installed the last time I stayed in this property, in the early 80's. Seems to primarily cater to Europeans...they certainly didn't care about my stay....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large Room”
Reviews.Author: WldHrt60
Reviews.Content: Received a great price through Helmsley website on room. Large room for New York and in a great location. We had just traveled from Omni Parker House in Boston and our room was much larger at the Helmsley. Very pleased with accomodations and how close we were to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Buy 2 nights, get one free”
Reviews.Author: mrsluna
Reviews.Content: We were able to take advantage of the "Buy 2 nights, get 1 free". Reservations staff on the telephone was exceptionally friendly so I felt good about the initial booking. Everyone talks about the location on the reviews. I agree- location was great. Hotel was pretty with its fine decor and ambience. The room was decorated like any of the nice Mariootts or Embassy Suites that Ive stayed in. Pretty lighting fixtures in the bathroom. Comfortable beds and bedding. Free wi-fi in rooms. We arrived early, about 7AM or 8, and they had a room available. That was a big blessing because after not sleeping all night on the plane, we were ready to rest. The only thing I would add to the rooms: coffee maker. If you are like me, and need your coffee before you see the general public, bring your own. I would have gladly put it in my suitcase if I had known. No frig in the room- but we didnt have the kids with us so it wasnt an issue. Business center near lobby had computer internet access- but you have to pay. FYI There is a small cafe right next door. You can eat there or take it to go. Convenient. Thank you NY Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Incredible Location, Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: heathercorrinne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley July 18-21. It was absolutely wonderful!!! The room was large, a city double Room 2720. It was clean, nicely decorated, had a large and very clean bathroom, and a beautiful view of the city and Empire State Building! When booking your room be sure to do so at least a couple months in advance and directly through Helmsley's website. You will get a better deal than the search engines, and a room with a view! I had contacted the reservation email a couple of times with questions, and Ruth was extremely helpful!! The hotels' location was perfect! Only a few blocks from Grand Central, the Chrysler Building is close by, United Nations also, and Times Square is about a 15-20 minute walk. Subway is the faster way to get there, but not when you have a child in a stroller. Most subway stops are not handicap accessible and not clearly marked. However, It isvery easy to get from Grand Central to Times Square by subway and both are stroller friendly. Also, if you have never gone to NYC, If you go to the subway after hours, one person must go through turn style and let the other person with stroller through the emergency exit door. We also bought the New York Pass to get into attractions, and I highly recommend that if you plan on seeing a lot of sites. Also, we did a Grey Line Bus Tour which was awesome!! Wish we would have done it the first two days also!! Worth the money and you get transported all over the city! We will for sure return to the Helpsley next time we come to NYC! The hotel is beautiful inside and out with first class service at a 3 1/2 star price!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ORCon
Reviews.Content: I went with my sister and daughter. We stayed one night before moving to a hotel where the dance competition was held that my niece participated in. This hotel was on E42nd St. It was close enough to the Times Square area where we walked to a play, but it was far enough to be out of the craziness of Times Square. Our room was quite large with a very nice bathroom and looked like new carpet. Two beds very comfortable. Bathrobes provided. The hotel had a work out room, a restaurant and bar, and a business center. It was very clean and had a high class feel to it. I'd stay here again anytime. I enjoyed this place much more than the other hotel in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: corvidd
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley is a newly renovated (2009?) older style hotel located on 42nd St at 3rd Ave, in midtown east, a few minutes walk from Grand Central Station. The hotel's location is ideal for subway and train travel. During busy periods the hotel's small lobby can become rather crowded, but the bedroom was large by NYC standards and quite comfortable. The king sized bed was an oasis of comfort, with huge pillows and quality bedding and duvets. The bathroom was older style, with tub and shower, but clean and well equipped. The shower was adequate but was in need of minor repair. The bath towels were large and soft. Two comfortable bathrobes were provided, as were Gilchrist and Soames hair and skin mini products. The LCD TV offered a good selection of channels. Free in room wireless internet was provided. In addition to a standard desk and chair there was an upholstered chair and ottoman. The room air conditioner worked well and was reasonably quiet. There was no mini fridge but I read somewhere that one is available on request. The elevators were fast and numerous. There were a few cafes/coffee shops next to and across the street from the hotel. The front desk staff were pleasant, helpful and professional. The hotel's location was great for us and we found the rooms large by NYC standards. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: glenysPlymouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days from June 30th until July 6th as the first leg of our trip to the USA. The hotel was undergoing refurbishment at Christmas and it was great to see it completed. Our room was on 39th floor and we had an amazing skyline view. The room was large and had a big bathroom and was certainly more than we could have hoped for. The staff were courteous and most helpful when my husband needed to go to the ER. The doorman Michael is a credit to the hotel as is Lily the receptionist. Nothing was to much trouble and always polite and cheerful. We love the Helmsley and the position of the hotel to all major attractions makes it a perfect base for sightseeing. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,Friendly, Great Location, ...... a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mlyons11
Reviews.Content: My sister and my two daughter's and myself stayed for 4 nights in June/2010 and it by far exceeded our expectations. The front desk staff were friendly and very accomodating as were all the staff. Older hotel but very clean and the A/C was working wonderfully as we were in an extreme heat wave. Also the rooms are quite big by NY standards. Nice lounge/restaurant with good food and reasonably priced. Nice little restaurant right next door for an excellent eat in or take out breakfast. within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Macey's etc... Next door to subway as well. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, can't beat location and price!”
Reviews.Author: priestlakepie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at the NY Helmsley, July 2010, where my 17 year old daughter and I and had a great stay. Our 35th floor room was quite spacious with 2 beds and great views of ESB, the financial ditrict and the Brooklyn Bridge. Very clean with comfortable beds. No cups in our room, but a quick call to housekeeping had that fixed within 10 min. Hotel staff was courteous and helpful. We didn't use extra ammenities at the hotel or eat in the restaurant, so can't comment on that. Hotel itself was quiet, while noise from the outside was about what you'd expect for NYC. If street noise bothers you at night, bring earplugs. Location was fantastic, just a couple blocks from Grand Central with easy subway access. Also easy walk to Times Square and the theatre district. We felt very comfortable walking back at midnight. Also, try bidding on their hotel reservation system. Got our room for $135 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ybrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NYH in mid June and also had an issue with roadwork noise outside the hotel. In fairness though, it wasn't the hotels fault. Ear plugs fixed that problem for us. We were on the 34th floor and had a lovely view of the Chrysler building and 42nd street. We booked a room for six nights directly with the hotel and got a great deal. Stay two nights, get one free. This turned out to be excellent value for money. The room was very clean and the king size bed was heaven. Unfortunately we received a phone call at 5 in the morning from someone we had never heard of looking for someone we had never heard of. We raised this with the receptionist the next morning as to why a call was put straight through to our room without reception first checking with the caller who they were after. We were told that any one calling the hotel is automatically put straight through to the room number they are after if the receptionist is on a break. Hmmmmmm .......... not a very good system I would have thought. Apart from that, we would stay at the NYH again if we ever have the chance to visit fabulous New York in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tinki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the Midtown area, and is a good place to stay while exploring the city. Close to the Grand central station, it is easy to get to both Downtown and Uptown, and everywhere else you might want to go. The staff is mostly nice, espesially the doormen, the reseption staff; well - you can be unlucky.. we stayed for a week, and recieved both very good service and were treated quite bad by different members of staff. When our room was not cleaned for three days, we got complimentary fruit and water...

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room but needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: sevenstates
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I waited until the last minute to book a hotel room for a conference and all of the conference hotel rooms were filled. The room was large for NYC. The beds were comfortable and the room was pretty quiet. The decor could have used some updating. The walls needed painting and the green carpet needed to be replaced. Got a special -- pay for two nights and get the third night free. Great location. Just a three minute walk to Grand Central Station. Would stay here again but will ask for a more recently renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy028
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley 22nd June 2010 for 4 nights. On arrival we were told that the Executive King room we had booked was not available, and that it was only a request. On looking at our booking form it clearly states that the room was part of the package. We were told that the following day an Executive King room would be available, as we were only staying 4 nights it didn't seem worth moving. This was a disappointing start to our vacation. Reception staff was not very helpful. On the plus side the Hotel is very clean, comfortable, and in a great location for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Loud... & 3.55 for a cup of coffee? You've got to be kidding.”
Reviews.Author: JDevin
Reviews.Content: The room was okay, but not great. The decor and amenities seemed more fitting for a three star hotel. The room faced the street, which would have been okay except that construction started outside in the wee hours of the morning, making sleep impossible. This went above and beyond usual NYC noise. When I went to the restaurant downstairs to get a cup of coffee with real cream to bring to my room, they wanted $3.55 for a small styrofoam cup, which I found pretty outlandish. The bar is also overpriced, as are the appetizers. The good news is that there are plenty of other options in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: mcoelho7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with my daughter at the Helmsley last month. The location was really great!! Great views from my room on the 32nd floor. Recommend if you are travelling with max of 2 people. Room was quite cozy! Staff was really helpful. Great with every bit of it....You can walk or get the metro easily.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: LondonCarioca
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to be near to Grand Central Station. By New York standards, our room was very spacious and comfortable and had everything one would expect from a four star hotel other than two curious omissions:no in room mini bar or coffee/tea facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel , Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kavedas
Reviews.Content: Im now staying in this Lovely Hotel , rooms are good size ,im in floor 23 no noise at all .. there are many shops and restaurant in the street . Station is just 5 minutes walking or less .... Times Square is just 15 minutes walking distance .. i do recommend this Hotel for Everyone , would stay here again ........

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: dreamer2207
Reviews.Content: my mum and i stayed in the new york helmsley for seven nights at the beginning of june. What an amazing time we had. We'd hardly stepped foot out of the shuttle bus from JFK before the fantastic doorman had popped our bags on a trolley an had taken them into reception for us to check in. There was no queue to wait in at reception and quickly we were whisked away by another doorman up to our room. We were situated on the 15th floor which suited us. The view from the room was facing east 42nd street and out the left a great view of the chrysler building. The room was very large (for a new york hotel) we had two double beds, a comfy chair, a table, a unit with drawers that also had an ice bucket and a vanity unit with a tv. The toilet was fancy but was extremely clean. While we were there it was so hot so our room was also very warm but we opened both windows and it soon cooled down (it may not suit those who dont like traffic noise to open the windows). There was a lot of traffic noise, tooting horns and police sirens but this didnt bother us at all as we stay in a city and are used to traffic noise so it was quite comforting. This hotel is within walking distance of absolutely everything. I was worried about booking a hotel for new york as i wanted to get a good location and i definitly made the right choice. It's like a 5-10min walk to times square, less than that for 5th Ave. Empire state building is maybe about 15min walk. And the hotel give you a map when you check so its pretty easy to find your way about. And its very hard to get lost in new york, the grid system amkes it so easy to get about and find where your going. We didnt eat at all in the hotel as it was very pricey but there's a small deli right outside the hotel with a great choice of food for breakfast lunch and dinner. Theres also a starbucks a 2min walk away. Theres also a 24hr pharmacy just across the road which has absolutely everything you can think of including drinks and snacks. We had a few problems with our room key during our stay, it wouldnt let us into our room a few times but the problem was quickly rectified by reception on both occasions which was great. The beds in the room where the comfiest ive ever had, the pillows moulded to the shape of your body which i loved and the duvets where so fresh :-) Always plenty of towels in the bathroom. Mon-Fri you get a new york times delivered to your hotel room door. And as one other reviewer said, we did feel as if we were the only ones on our floor we never heard a peep from anyone else. I organised a late check out for my room which i had asked for a couple of days in advance, two seconds an it was sorted, so efficient. Also on the day we left we hadnt had time to organise a shuttle bus back to the airport but the concierge for the hotel quickly arranged one for us and gave us a time to be picked up :-) All in all i can say i had the best experience at this hotel and it would definitly be my first choice for a new york hotel

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Convenient . . . Two Steps Above Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Donald017
Reviews.Content: Not quite in the thick of the action but reasonably convenient to much: decent restaurants, delis and neighborhood taverns, 5th avenue shopping, Time Square and theater (12-minute walk). Except for one indifferent doorman, staff was extraordinarily friendly and accommodating, especially Alexandra at the front desk . Room was spotless. Hotel restaurant was a bit pricey, so we ventured out to dine. Unless you're expecting the hotel itself to provide the NEW YORK EXPERIENCE, what's not to love? Other hotels had bigger lobbies, etc., but we stopped by decided we weren't missing anything. My wife and I stayed three nightâ€”Friday through Sundayâ€”june 11-14th. Nary a complaint. We highly recommend it. Recommend upper floor away from street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent !! Great location”
Reviews.Author: aussierules2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in your great city recently and had a great time.What made it so good was our accomodation and its location to all of the things we wanted to see.The staff were very friendly.Very good with directions around town and as an Australian in a very large city that was extremely helpful.We thought the room was always clean and well presented.Thank you for making our stay a fantastic memory. Jeff and Cat,Gold Coast .Australia

Reviews.Title: “great, prompt service! perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: d_is_trippin
Reviews.Content: my husband and i recently stayed 2 nights here and had gotten a great rate through their bidding service [$160+tax/night]. our first room had some issues with the tv and within 15 minutes of placing a call, a service man was knocking on the door. unfortunately, he couldn't get the problem fixed and on our 2nd call, the woman kindly asked if we would like to switch rooms and had a bellman meet us to switch us keys. it was such an easy, painless, QUICK process! i'll be honest, our first room was on the 25th floor staring at an office building across the street and the street noise was a little noticeable but our 2nd room was on the 40th floor and had an AMAZING view of the city and the empire state building! so, if you're going, just request a room on a higher floor. :) the hotel is clean, the staff is wonderful and helpful and the location is unbeatable! a few blocks from times square and grand central station practically across the street. LOVED IT! [the FREE internet was a HUGE plus as well!]

Reviews.Title: “Comfy room, excellent location, would do it all again!”
Reviews.Author: lenny&cookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Helmsley over a 3-night anniversary trip. Our friendly bellman admitted our view was not the greatest in the hotel, but hoped the size of the room and the king-sized bed would make up for it. Since we spent few waking hours at the hotel, it turned out the view didn't really matter, plus we had gotten a 3-nights-for-the-price-of-2 deal when we reserved a few months in advance. The street noise took a bit of getting used to, but Advil PM and exhaustion from our Big Apple explorations helped tune it out, plus the hotel itself was so quiet that it seemed we were the only ones on our floor. Really, really comfy bed. No complaints about the bathroom, even if it wasn't the most state-of-the-art. Unlike other reviewers, I thought the lobby looked pretty cool. Concierge was happy to print our airline boarding passes. Didn't try the restaurant or bar, but there are lots of eating/drinking alternatives in the area and taxis were always available for further treks. The biggest selling point was the primo location, convenient to Grand Central, 5th Avenue shopping, the NY Public Library (check it out!), the UN and so much more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful - we stayed with our 10 month old baby”
Reviews.Author: Aussiet0urists
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We were expecting a tiny room while staying in accomodation in NYC however the room we were assigned was as big as some of our other rooms we had stayed in while travelling around the states (we stayed in 17 different hotels). The staff were soooo friendly and very accomodating for when we needed bottles to be warmed up for our daughter. There was a complimentry cot placed in the room for her to sleep in. Some hotels wanted to charge us $20 a night for this service. Overall the rooms were big, clean, the staff were extremely helpful and it is located in a wonderful part of New York (very close to Central Station). Thank you The New York Helmsley for the hospitality provided during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: bonnlieber
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here with teenagers. The hotel room was great -- clean, spacious (by New York standards) and very comfortable. The lobby is not much to write home about, but the service was top notch, and the location is perfect, being 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. Overall, a great base from which to explore New York.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice if you don't mind a soft mattress”
Reviews.Author: Margo56
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff, relatively convenient location. My only complaint is how soft the mattresses and pillows are. For anyone who needs even a slightly firm mattress and pillow (e.g., for back/neck problems) this would present a challenge. For that reason, I wouldn't be inclined to return, but otherwise it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent stay - perfect NYC view!”
Reviews.Author: cle99
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The location was perfect, close to 5th ave shops, a short walk to times square and very near to the subway to head downtown/Brooklyn. We stayed in a double double, it was spacious and the beds were amazingly comfortable, one of the best hotel beds I've ever slept in. The bathroom was slightly old but very clean and plenty of soft towels. The staff were very friendly and helpful, nothing was a chore. There are always cabs available outside the lobby, good neighbourhood for cafes and bars. We stayed in room 2923 and it has a fabulous view of the Empire State Building which really made our stay when we saw the sun coming up against this iconic landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in great location :)”
Reviews.Author: annieholly
Reviews.Content: I really must ask people reading the old reviews to not base their decision on them. I just got back from a week stay with my boyfriend and we loved this hotel. All the renovations in the lobby have been completed...it is lovely now. Our room was spacious for new york with a huge and very comfy kingsize bed. We were on the 32th floor which was ideal if you want quiet. The air conditioning was excellent. Yeah the bathroom was a little old styled but it is very clean and a size with lovely shower/bath. We had a lovely view of the empire state building from our room. We found the staff helpful and friendly, the bar to be nice also.The free wifi in the rooms was great for researching our trip. we didnt eat in the hotel as we explored new york and all the different food types. We got a great rate on booking.com, and are delighted we chose this hotel and would recomend it to our friends and family. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at a good location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterista
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at about 8:30 on the morning. Since I hadn't written the hotel requesting an early check-in, I intended asking the receptionist but I did not get a chance since we were offered a room immediately. This was very nice of them, and we were really happy because we arrived after a long night flight. The receptionist and the baggage handler were very courteous and kind and checking-in was a swift and pleasant process. Throughout our visit the staff was friendly and courteous. We booked a room with two double beds for three people, it was a nice size and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. Our room on the 34th floor was quiet. I read some reviews here complaining tha the rooms were not up to scartch; I disagree with them as our room was not very new but it was not shabby at all and was very clean. The bathroom was old fashioned but charmingly so and it was quite spacious. The lighting in the bathroom was a little poor, and putting on makeup was rather difficult, however when I went out no one burst into laughter or ran away in fear, so I gather I did a fairly adequate job. Amenities were basic; shampoo, soap, conditioner, and body-lotion. No shower-cap, perhaps they do provide one on request, but I did not ask so I don't know. Free wi-fi was very nice to have. During my 5 day stay I did not to wait long for the elevator even once. I did not use the bar of the hotel nor did I eat there or use any services the hotel offered other than the room, so I can't comment on that. As others have written the hotel is in a very convenient location; there are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops around, and it is very close to the subway at 42nd Grand Central Station. On our first and last night there we enjoyed dinner across the street at an Italian restaurant called Osteria Laguna. I would definitely stay at the New York Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfonhols
Reviews.Content: We booked in for the final night of our holiday and found this lovely hotel, really well situated, walkiing distance of all main attractions, but far enough away to get a reasonable nights sleep. Very friendly check in, and very efficient. Room was great, lovely big fluffy towels, comfortable beds, bar in lobby was well stcoked and very pleasant bar man. great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in the middle of Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelertrainer
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here and was extremely comfortable. Meetings were around the corner in the Chrysler Building, and there were plenty of good shops, restaurants and public transportation near by. I had a great sleep there and enjoyed the spacious rooms. I got a great deal on the internet -- paid for 2 nights and got the 3rd night free. My only complaint was that there was no real lobby per se, although a great bar and very nice bartenders.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing stay - the best ever”
Reviews.Author: jeanwales
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the review of the last person saying it was a dump!!! I think it must be a different hotel I stayed in! My friend and I visited from the UK and we had separate rooms as my friend is a smoker. When I emailed reception, they kindly gave us two rooms one floor apart and a corner room. On arrival we found everyone to be so helpful. Our rooms were not ready but we were able to leave our luggage and wander around for an hour or so. The rooms were great. Well sized for New York and the bed was a dream to sleep on. Everywhere was really clean and the bathroom was well equipped with toiletries. I loved lounging in the dressing gown supplied too! The concierge were helpful with a couple of queries. They recommended a great little chinese restaurant close by - The Phoenix Garden, so good we went twice! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and it is definitely one of the best I have ever stayed in. The area was good and safe, a few pharmacies close by for bits and pieces, Grand Central Station was nearby and my favourite building the chrysler building was visible from my bedroom window

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Explorer852
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel makes this place look promising, but believe me, once your past the front desk it goes downhill fast. Yes, its an old hotel and at one point it was a good place, but those days are over and its shameful. The rooms are aged and dirty. Frankly, I've stayed in Econolodges that looked better. The green carpet doesn't look like its been cleaned in years, the walls are all cracking with warped wallpaper, the bathroom looks like its from the 70s (because it is), the tiles were brown and black, the shower tub was not clean, and the bed was the worst that I have ever stayed in (with exception to the plywood bed I had in Northern China). It was one of those places where you felt dirty just by being there. The worst part is that its not cheap either...I booked it through priceline's name your own price program and it was still almost $200/nt - parking was a joke. I'm very glad I was only there for one night. I've stayed at a lot of places in NYC, and there is sooo much better out there for this price. Do yourself a huge favor, stay very far away from this sorry excuse for a dump hotel. The surprising thing was that it had a higher star rating...who rated this place and when? Truly truly terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: ejh259
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent only one night at the hotel but it was great. Our King bed was so comfortable and the room was big and clean. They had a new flat screen TV in the room which was nice. The location is good and quiet but for those looking to stay in the heart of things - it's about a 10 minute walk to Times Square. This didn't matter to us because we were in the city for a wedding, not for sight-seeing. The only suggestion I have for the hotel is to either get rid of the old armoires that used to house the room TV's or add shelves in to it so it could at least be better utilized for storage. The cabinet doors were open with an ice bucket and glasses sitting inside and it just looked awkward.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Located - Good Management - 2. time without any claims ;-)”
Reviews.Author: qdmp
Reviews.Content: Nearby: Grand Central Station, Times Square, United Nations, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, .... Breakfast: very good cafe nearby (10 meters left) ;-) -> enjoy Manna-hata ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Really one of the best hotels in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Jacktheguest
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley hotel is a unique merge of good old classical American service with professionalism cleanness and comfort. It is quite amazing how the staff manages to create a family like atmosphere in such a big hotel. The hotel bar is great and I would like to specially recommend the bartender Samuel for being kind and truly friendly. There is really no reason to go outside the hotel for a drink when Samuel is there. Just keep on what you are doing with the moderate prices and I will definitely be back. Jack

Reviews.Title: “Sound Option for Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JimBlandings
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in April 2010 during a business trip to New York City. I chose the New York Helmsley primarily due to the location of the hotel as our NY office is also sited on East 42nd Street. As far as an overnight base is concerned, the Helmsley ticked 3 major boxes. (1) The bedrooms are large and comfortable - my own room on the 20th Floor had 2 Queen-size beds which were extremely relaxing. I had 3 sound nights' sleep which is the big test for me. (2) The hotel itself is located within a relatively "quiet" part of Midtown Manhattan and once I was in the room on the 20th Floor, I heard no real "noise" from the outside world. Furthermore, there was no noise from adjacent bedrooms or from the corridor outside the bedroom itself. Very satisfying. (3) Staff service was professional, courteous & discrete - another big tick in the box for me. Now, I used the hotel only for sleeping / recharging the batteries from 10.00 PM until 07.00 AM, & not using the Helmsley for wining or dining. Hence, this review is for the solo traveller or partners who wish to experience a very secure, quite, relaxing evening / overnight base and who will use some of the multitude of bars, delis, cafes & restaurants nearby. There are some good cafes on East 42nd Street for breakfasting and a great range of diners / restaurants travelling west of the hotel along to Grand Central Terminal and beyond. Put the Helmsley on your short-list.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our nest stay!”
Reviews.Author: Munchkin47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated perfectly for sight seeing, shopping and sleeping! With diners just around the corner for a formidable breakfast, and Time Square just blocks away it was a perfect place to stay. The staff were helpful, friendly and efficient. It has a business centre available to guests and 'wi-fi' connection too. The concierge, more than one, assists with any problems you may have, from directions to umbrellas if it should rain. Don't just take my word try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “"Not to great..."”
Reviews.Author: Martijn32
Reviews.Content: In January we stayed for a couple of nights at the Helmsley hotel. When we arrived we noticed there was a big renovation going on so there was no lounge, bar, restaurant. But when you are in NY it is a waist of time to have dinner at the hotel, so it didn't bother us at all. The rooms itselfs can also use a renovation. One light was broken and the TV made a strange noise. The location is great, near the central station, the chreysler building and the UN headquarters. I heard recently from friends that the hotel increased the rates after the revovation was finished... If I would visit NY again I probably would stay in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ptarmigan15
Reviews.Content: Usually stayed on the West Side (I don't book the hotels) when visiting New York. On this trip I did the booking and found the Helmsley. The location is great, just a 2 minute walk to Grand Central Station so travel round is easy. The hotel restaurant was very good not only to have breakfast but also dinner if you can't be bothered to go out. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Room was clean, well equipt and spacious with a nice bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: rx81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well kept and the staff is really nice and helpful. The location is amazing because it's near most of the sites we wanted to see and a 5 minute walk to Grand Central. They were nice enough to store our luggage securely since we came in earlier than regular check in time (4pm). Unfortunately they couldn't provide us with a pull-away bed because they didn't have any, but it didn't make a big difference to our opinion of the hotel. I read some reviews on here including one negative review about windows opening without a safety screen in place...yes it's true that they do open direclty but there are security bolts in place to prevent them from opening far enough to allow someone to fall through. If you do happen to place a baby there or something, you're an idiot! I would definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/value”
Reviews.Author: txstate04
Reviews.Content: The entire staff is really nice & helpful. Rooms are cozy, we had a great view of the Empire State Building. Great restaurants all around, in addition to access to shopping and Duane Reed is right down the street, perfect for when you forget to pack certain items. Shower didn't have much pressure but it still did its job.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Akuragrl
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that the hotel is situated in great area of Manhattan (close to times square and theater district). I was looking for a hotel, great for a quick stay, with two other family members. This hotel has definitely lowered its standards over the years. The room itself was small (double/double), but that's understandable since its in Manhattan. The bathroom was a mess. First off, the shower liner was not clean. Second, the tub drain was not working, and there was a leak coming from the shower. Most of the bathroom floor was flooded as a result. Third, there were not many toiletries given. Aside from the bathroom, there also was no coffee maker (what I thought would be an essential for every New Yorker and tourist alike). The A/C also made a knocking noise while on. Plus, where are the Helmsley chocolates they used to give? For over 200/night, I would have expected something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StellaEngland
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel. The rooms are really nice and comfortable and as we had a room high up we had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building to the right, Brooklyn bridge straight on and the East River on the left! The reception, bar and restaurant are newly refurbished also. The staff are really nice, especially one of the concierge ladies, so helpful. My only criticism is the bar and restaurant prices - way too high - subsequently we didnt eat or drink in the hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Third stay in this excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scianoir
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice before and was very happy to go back again. We were welcomed by name by the bellhop as he opened the taxi door for us (a nice touch) and check-in in the newly refurbished attractive lobby was very friendly and efficient. Room was very comfortable, clean and in very good repair with all the necessities available. Hotel staff as always were friendly and helpful and the food is good, although the variety available on the breakfast buffet was not quite as extensive as in the past. The hotel is very conveniently situated and you can easily get around Manhatten from here on foot and with a Metrocard (recommended) for use on subway and busses. The M42 bus from just outside the hotel will bring you anywhere along 42nd street and Times Square on foot is only about 10-15 minutes walk anyway. Pax Deli next door is also very good and reasonably priced for food!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel, easy to find and clean.”
Reviews.Author: 2DogsSarah
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel on recommendations from friends. It's a nice hotel in a central position. Being only a few hundred meters from Grand Central Station, it was always easy to get back to! We wanted a central base. This being our first time in New York we spent almost the whole day sightseeing. We only used it as a base to sleep in. If you're wanting personal service, choose somewhere else. New York is an expensive place, we had a great rate and it was very clean. For our needs it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value”
Reviews.Author: curiousbunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. We picked the Helmsley based on location, price, and reviews here. We got a deal on the hotel website that was better than on any of the travel sites, and we decided to give it a try. They recently remodeled the foyer and their restaurant & bar, so the lobby is shiny and new. The location, just a block and a half from Grand Central, is fantastic. Plenty of restaurants in easy walking distance. We used the (free) WiFi in the room to find good restaurants by searching google maps around our location. This worked well. The WiFi worked lightning fast most times. We had one hour where it went in and out, but it seemed reliable all other times. The rooms were not remodeled recently, and I'm sure that is the reason that the rooms are reasonably priced. Our room, #1416, a city double double, was pleasant. The lighting was a bit dim, and our view was mostly of the wall of another building (though you could see the Chrysler Building if you craned your neck). There was a smallish flat screen TV situated on a desk in the corner of the room. The toiletries were Gilchrist & Soames and I enjoyed those. Compared to other bathrooms I have seen in New York, it hotels, the bathroom seemed spacious. I was staying in the room with a friend, so I was glad the bathroom was big enough for me to change clothes in. Hot water had good pressure and was plentiful. The room seemed big by NY standards -- two double beds fit along with a desk & chair, and then an arm chair in the corner. We were very pleased with the amount of space. we were always gone from about 9AM to at least 4PM during the day, and housekeeping always came when we were out. There was no refrigerator or mini-bar, but this didn't bother us. The room felt clean for a hotel, and the complimentary NY Times in the morning was a nice touch. There was no coffee maker in the room, but there is a brisk breakfast spot next door, a hotel in the restaurant, and an espresso bar across the street... so there is no shortage of coffee. Staff was helpful and courteous. On garbage day, we did hear the trucks and banging, even up on the 14th floor. We were also by an elevator, so we heard anyone coming out of the elevator at whatever hour. I bought earplugs at the CVS across the street and that was sufficient. In all, our complaints are trifling, and for the amount we paid, we were very pleased. We enjoyed our time at the Helmsley and would definitely stay here again the next time we're in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “'very happy dont worry”
Reviews.Author: msbdieap
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the reviews we were a bit worried to say the least but when we arrived all our worries dissapeared a perfect location for everything a great view from our spacious 35th floor room comfy beds big bathroom and very clean if your thinkin about booking but a bit worried don't be great friendly staff very helpful and a beautiful cantonese round the corner a must bar is a bit expensive but hey we didnt have to go there

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for NYC Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cookie376
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and the foyer area was lovely, staff very friendly and our high floor request was granted. The rooms were very spacious for NYC and decorated very nicely. The bathroom was huge and was very well lit which is something I love for putting on makeup and something you dont get very often anywhere!! Only one complaint the room was very hot no air con but hotel provided an inductrial fan, unforntunwelty it was too noisey to sleep with. Even on a high floor you can hear traffic but hey its new york. This hotel is a 2min walk from grand central station and 10mins to times sq. 2 blocks from 5th avenue!!! Next door is a pax diner, great for breakfast. would definaely stay here again, lovely hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for value and luxury”
Reviews.Author: ctb1262
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel many times over the last 12 years, while traveling for both business and pleasure. It's centrally located in Murray Hill (Midtown East), near a lot of shops and restaurants, and VERY close to Grand Central Terminal. They've just completed a remodel, which is very nice, although I thought the original was pretty fantastic. Great hotel, all the way aroung!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JamesWD
Reviews.Content: Clean, not too pricey and conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jay1206
Reviews.Content: great hotel on 42nd/3rd street, near times square, grand central station, broadway...

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jandcsmdb
Reviews.Content: Lobby renovation is complete! And it looks beautiful! Room was large, clean and quiet. Beds very comfortable. Huge, very thick towels, robes. Some decor is a little dated, but everything is in great condition and very clean. There's a feeling of old-world elegance in the rooms, while the lobby renovation is now a very sleek, modern metro style. Friendly staff, but the only reason i gave a 4 star rating instead of 5 was that we didn't receive wash cloths one morning and the doormen didn't consistently open doors for us....very minor, just not 5 star perfetcion. Close to everything...starbucks, drug stores, breakfast/pastry shops, restaurants, Grand Central Station (subway connections)...Nothing negative.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: heydn62
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on location and price of room for quick 2 night trip to NYC for myself and my 13 year old daughter. This is not a luxury hotel, but was a very comfortable room with 2 beds and plenty of space for the 2 of us. Room: We were on the South side of the building and had a view of the empire state bldg. Room was clean and comfortable. Nice roomy bathroom with tub/shower (good water pressure), nice large towels, bathrobes in closet. Could hear noise from hall and adjacent rooms, but fortunately our neighbors were quiet. Large flat screen TV on desk (apparently doesn't fit in entertainment center - which was empty). Would have liked to have had more electrical outlets available, and desk space was limited because of the TV. Free wifi was easy to setup and use on my laptop and my daughter's I-Pod touch. Location: Short walk to Grand Central Station. Two subway stops (or about a 20 min walk) to Times square. CVS drug store about a 1 min walk away from the front door. Service: Professional front desk staff. Quick and easy check-in/out. Concierge helpful with directions and maps (made no bookings with them). Security asked to see key card when returning late 1st night. Didn't see them on our return the 2nd night. Bellhops held our luggage for us on day of departure so we could go out for lunch prior to our 4pm flight to Laguardia. Misc: About a 25 minute ride to Laguardia on a Saturday afternoon. Cab fare was about $30. We didn't really use any services in the hotel (restaurant/bar/fitness center, etc) nor did we ever call the front desk with any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for NYC”
Reviews.Author: gmike59
Reviews.Content: We were a bit concerned at what we might find after reading some recent reviews but were greeted by polite and helpful staff, a finished lobby area and a very clean double-double room that was warm despite the snow outside & had a great view of the Empire State Building. Let's face it ... New York is one of the most costly cities in the world and hopefully you do not go there to spend hours sitting in your room!!! With this in mind the hotel meets your needs well - beds were comfy, the TV & safe worked, the hot water for baths was plentiful and the house keeping of the room maintained to a high standard .. even around the belongings of 4 people. The price is comparable with other main cities and affordable. The main plus is the location ... outstandingly convenient for many places of interest and walking further afield (as well as the drop off point for the Newark airport shuttle bus to Grand Central). The road that the hotel sits on is in easy reach of lots of shopping & places to eat - if you have teenage boys try the marvel comic shop on the corner of Lexington & 43rd. We happily ate hot bagels & pancakes for breakfast in Pax next to the hotel (being too stingy for the $24 hotel breakfast). We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: recruitgal
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Helmsley, after getting a very good deal on Expedia. I arrived late and was greeted at Reception by name which was a nice surprise. They were very apologetic, but didn't have the King room I had reserved. Instead they gave me a Double-Double, which was fine. The room was pretty big, in good condition, and it had a great view of the Chrysler Building. Location-wise the Helmsley is tough to to beat. It's a block from Grand Central. The renovations appear to have been finished and the lobby, bar and restaurant look lovely (although smaller than I had imagined!). Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tafftraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel over Christmas with my family. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you are coming from the airport by bus. It is just a short walk, two blocks, from Grand Central Station where the airport shuttle stops. Short walk to a number of places of interest. Empire State Building, Time Square. The rooms we had were very nice and suited our needs. Its a pity that the hotel refurbishment is so slow as its been going on now for over six months. Despite that it did not really affect our great break in NY. Had a great deal from Best@Travel UK

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: twilight74
Reviews.Content: I booked this room under a wedding rate. The plastic sheeting at the entrance was not the most welcoming sight - I understand lobby is undergoing renovations, but an "Apologies for our dust" sign or better disguisement would have been nice. The hotel and rooms are run down. This is the first 3-star hotel I've been in that had no coffee/tea maker. Also no refrigerator or minibar. At least the CVS across the street was 24-hour. At check-in, I told the woman that the previously requested rollaway (which was quoted to me as $35/night) was no longer needed. At check-out, I had the nice surprise of a $50/night charge for a rollaway. (Must be a damn comfortable rollaway, at that rate!). When I asked for a recalculation of the charges, the checkout woman had an extremely sour attitude and took entirely too long for what should have been a simple process. I would never pay the reduced wedding rate again to stay here, nevermind the rack rate. The only plus was the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: carrie-ny01
