Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the New York Helmsley, during October 2009. I stayed here with a large group, we were in NY for a wedding, so we had about 25 rooms. The hotel staff were so helpful to us, bar the girl at the Concierge desk, but all others were great. We had a few issues with the room key cards, as in they would often not work, so they had to be replaced a lot, and because there were so many of us by the end of the week we had about 5 key cards each! The renovations were ongoing while we were there, and although I did get a shock upon arrival, they looked worse than i had expected, they didnt impact on our stay at all. It would have been nice to have a lobby or bar to meet up with members of our group, but we worked around it! Pax next door must be getting great business as a result of the renovations at the Helmsley! The rooms are very nice, large and spacious with good bathrooms and comfortable beds. Some rooms have amazing views of the city. As we travelled with a group, we got a group rate, which was good value, but there were renovations going on. I wonder what the prices will be once the construcion work is done...The location of the hotel is wonderful. I have been visiting NYC for years, and always stayed on the west side of town for some reason. But from now on, i think i will definitely stay east at the Helmsley. Its such a short walk to 5th Avenue, Bryant Park (my fav place), Grand Central, Port Authority etc. I really loved the area, its one of the Helmsley's greatest attributes!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but reliable. A great place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: purewaves
Reviews.Content: We had a superb stay here. Even though we live in town, we had to get a room for a few nights while renovations were being done. The room was spectacular, right on the 30th floor with a jawdropping view of the Chrysler building and the Manhattan skyline. The room had a brand new 50+ inch flat screen tv that worked brilliantly (damn you Barclay International with your tube TV - what year is it, 1988?!), a super comfy bed and pillows, and a nice selection of toiletries in the bathroom. One downside, no fridge or minibar. I should also note the renovations (which, according to the staff, have been going on for months), totally gutted the lobby. So when you enter, you are entering a virtual construction site. Lame. It's exposed wire and plaster board all over the place. Hey guys, couldn't you have spruced it up a bit? Plants, pictures, anything? Despite that, it was a great experience. I've stayed at some other notable Manhattan hotels and this has them all beat.

Reviews.Title: “NO ammenities, no coffee, coke $10.00!! NOT accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: Lwn343
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where these people are getting positive reviews. We just got back from our stay there and won't be going back. We ordered a king bed and never got one in the 5 days we stayed. No coffee makers,no microwaves,fridges,etc.staff was rude,window was broken.not even a vending machine! A coke we were told was 10$ plus tip.this place was ridiculous for the price.stay next door at the hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Very BAD experience!”
Reviews.Author: XXTL
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is marketing itself that it is "World-class hotel" and "First-class", but that is absolutely way high. It's rather 2 star hotel. It was bad surprise that they had renovation on going during our stay. Hotel didn't have any services available. No restaurant, no bar, no lobby. They have six elevators. And sometimes only 4 was in function. During afternoons/evenings there was huge traffic and queues when guest was using the elevators. In the mornings, we had to wait 40min to get elevator to go down. Numerous guest were forced to use stairs do go downstairs. Some elevators had alarm on and stucked in between floors. Hotel Management didn't payed any attention to numerous guest complaints. BAD EXPERIENCE. The hotel rooms didn't match the marketing (photos on htl web-site). Our room was maximum two star level. Don't choose this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “hot rooms, good views, good location”
Reviews.Author: portside123
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley is two-and-a-half blocks from Grand Central Station and even closer to the Chrysler Building, Bryant Park all on the same street. Shopping is real close, Starbucks and other local little places to grab a snack. The NY Helmsley is within walking distance to Madison Sq Garden (20 min), Radio City Music Hall (15 min), Rockefeller Center, Times Sq.. (15 min) brisk walking. Great location. We stayed on the 36 floor and the room had a nice view, in my opinion. The opposite side of the hotel has a view of The Empire State Building, our side had The Chrysler Building if we looked out to the side, diagonally to the left, and to the right you could see part of the Queensboro Bridge. The room was HOT, warm at best. There are no controls for the air at all and we kept the window open the whole 4 days we were there. No lobby or restaurant due to renovations, which we were told would be done mid December, but we knew that when we booked. Rooms were pretty clean other than finding a sock under a bed from someone else's stay. Towels, bathroom soaps were great and robes were provided. NO coffee pots in rooms, NO refrigerators, NO microwaves in rooms. Dbl beds seemed small from what I am used to, but they were very comfortable!! I would stay again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: OZKoala
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to a attractions. We walked to Grand Central and then to Time Square. You can also catch the subway at the corner of 42nd and 1st. Beds are very comfortable. Staff very friendly. Would have loved to stay longer. Tripadvisor hasn't stirred us wrong yet. Thanks everyone for their recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: CallumS
Reviews.Content: Despite undergoing renovation I was still very impressed with the Helmsley, had a great room with large TV and a view of the Empire State building. Although the renovation meant there was no bar or restaurant, the plans looked excellent and this hotel is sure to be even better after the work is done. The hotel is very close to Grand Central and is walking distance to Times Square. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: Mutard Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley is situated so central, you can walk to most things, which is a big bonus! The hotel is very clean, and staff are very polite and helpfull. We had a lovely big room, with a great view over 42nd St and of the Chrysler building, and crisp new sheets every day. If I had to find a negative, it would be the ongoing referbishment of the lobby area. However we knew about this before we booked, and it did not spoil the stay. Who sit's in the lobby anyway?? Not me! Loved it, and will go again in the spring of 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value, Location, and Accomodations for People and Pets”
Reviews.Author: Fatchihuahua
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the NY Helmsley because of its pet-friendly policy (no addtional fee!) and central location. The staff was so friendly and happy to meet my dog. The lobby was under construction, but the staff and accomodations made up for any inconvenience. I loved being able to walk to major landmarks: Times Square, Grand Central Station, 5th Ave shopping. The room was clean and had a great view of the Empire State Building. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Business & Leissure”
Reviews.Author: IrisGhozi
Reviews.Content: Very old and antique furniture with good hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience - spacious, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dubaiexpat71
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC for Spring Break with our 3 children (all under 7) and really enjoyed staying here. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. Location is great (very close to Grand Central Station). We didn't eat at the hotel as it always looked pretty busy but we rarely eat at hotels on family holidays anyway as it's always overpriced. But family who were also staying at the Helmsley did and said it was goo.d We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandMetrogirl
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel were very professional and polite. They were very helpful and gave us directions and tips for travelling about the city. We were delighted with the bell staff. Nice fellows. We enjoyed the availability of separate beds in the room. Very comfortable and clean accomodations. Thanks very much for allowing us to access the room early. This made everything go smoothly. We had a wonderful time and would recommend this hotel to any of our friends or family who would visit New York City. The whole staff was friendly and even had a welcomed sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “convenience”
Reviews.Author: billisue2
Reviews.Content: Was in New York for the first time in september for the Brazil Festival. Quite an experience I must say. First we got charged or ripped off for the ground transportation from airport to the hotel. We got to the hotel and it was under construction for bar room and dining room. We managed nicely without it. In all and all the hotel employees were very helpful and courteous. Our room was just what we needed to be comfortable, who comes to new york to sit in their room anyway. Coffee shop right across the street, Mickey D's just down the street, and the employees always hailed a cab for us when we needed it. What fun we had in the cabs but what a ride they gave us. Lot's of laughter and wondering if we were gonna live through the cab rides, but we did and as of right now we are planning another trip to the big apple and definitely another stay at the New York Helmsley on 42nd street. I loved new york, ground zero, the lady, empire state building, and the cruise that we took while we were there. Now I know why a lot of the movies are built around New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ValuesGoodValue
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference at the Helmsley. First, the lobby was under construction, which was a big turnoff, but I'll cut them some slack on it. The service upon checking in was a bit standoffish. I had reserved a king bed and all they had was two doubles - no apology, just a take it or leave it attitude. The room was quite small, as many in New York are, but clean. The location is good - a short walk to theatres and Grand Central. I probably wouldn't stay there again, but if you have to be in the area and get a good deal, it's not horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Travelhappy98
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from this hotel-we stayed from 26th to 30th October. I must admit I was some what concerned by some of the reviews I read before staying here, but these were totally unfounded. I was in a room with my 12 year old daughter & our friends in a seperate room. On arrival the reception & door staff were very friendly & helpful.We were given rooms on the 35th floor. Ours had a wonderful view of thr Chrysler Building,whilst our friends had a good view of thr Empire State Building. The rooms were very comfortable & whilst the bathroom was slightly dated it was perfectly adequate. The only slight gripe we had ,was that there was no tea or coffee making facilities. At the height we were there was very little road noise. We did not eat in the hotel, but there was a wonderful cafe next door called Pax where you good get a great breakfast for 2 for just under $20. Myself & my friends would recommend this hotel. It has really friendly & helpful staff,cofortable rooms & a great Mid town location.

Reviews.Title: “FIrst Trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: pompeydad1
Reviews.Content: Four nights from 25 October 2009 with familiy of 2 boys 10 and 13 Foyer and entrance was undergoing a refurbishment which we knew about and did not detract. Shame nowhere for a coffee, but we went for breakfast up to a diner just past the News building which was great friendly and good food. Room was fine not to too large but adequate for the 4 of us. We were 2820 on the rear so had a side view of the Empire State. Hotel v quiet at night - windows weren't great at stopping outside noise though.Beds very comfortable. Bathroom looking tired but good shower etc. Clenliness was so so - dust in the corners etc. Tried room service - expensive $3 each just to deliver to room - burger so so (dry) but all the rest was good. Wifi good and worked and a big flatscreen in the room. Staff all friendly and helpful. Location fantastic - would go back although didn't feel as if it was a four star room

Reviews.Title: “Fine despite the renovations”
Reviews.Author: BOHSMAN
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the NYH, and we went knowing all about the renovations and the implications of same. Yes, the lobby is a bit of a mess, but seeing as one only passes through, we did'nt see it as any problem. We got an excellent rate, no doubt based on the work in progress, and on arrival were given a high floor room as requested. This is a fine hotel with close proximity to Grand Central, etc.. All in all, everyone was a pleasure to deal with and extremely helpful. Only gripe would be that the room was very warm, and despite having the air/con at its minimum setting it seemed to make no difference. This is a hotel that we will definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Suffe
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and quite. Location was great for us, while our purpose for the trip was shopping and sights. There was a nice view from 32nd floor and traffic noise didn't disturbed us.

Reviews.Title: “View was great, service was poor”
Reviews.Author: tinalasvegas
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation through a travel agent who told me I was getting a good rate because of the renovations to the lobby/restaurant. I called the hotel directly to make a request for a high floor...but I had a feeling that the front desk person that I talked to was not listening to me whatsoever so I called about 2 weeks later to make sure my requests were on my reservation but the person told me there was no requests at all on my reservation so I asked him to put the high floor request on there. I called the day of my reservation to make sure the request was there but again it was not written anywhere so I told the lady this and asked if she could possibly pre-key my room so that I can get my request but she rudely told me that this would not be possible and that there are other people who have to check into the hotel and if they get there before I do then too bad. I know that requests are not guaranteed but I felt like she (who claimed to be the manager) was acting as if I was doing her a favor by staying at her hotel and that I should be happy with whatever room she gives me. I made a big enough stink at the front desk when I got there that they gave me a room on the 39th floor (which tells me that they had this room available but did not want to give it to me) Another night I had gotten some really good korean food at a restaurant and took some home for later. I asked the front desk if they had a spare fork or something that I could use and before the word fork even came out of my mouth I got a firm NO. Then I was going to ask for some napkins and before I even finished the first two words of my sentence I heard NO. Then I said "Do you guys have anything that I need?" and the front desk said NO!! (I don't think they even heard anything I said that whole time). I know these things don't sound like huge deals, but being rude and not providing any sort of customer service is a big deal to me. I ended up buying a box of forks at the CVS across the street and left them at the front desk for others that possibly need utensils to eat. (They did have a restaurant at one point, there had to be utensils somewhere) Well the view in the room was beautiful!! That was the only thing that could be praised about this hotel...but the room was not very clean. The carpet had some stains and it did not look vacuumed at all and when I was looking for my shoes, I looked under the bed to find someone else's shoes, a pair of socks, and a pair of men's underwear (not belonging to me or my partner)!! The location is very convenient because its right near Grand Central but there are other hotels in the vicinity which I will definitely try if I ever go to New York again. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: Doris781
Reviews.Content: Great location to main attractions and transportation. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly. Would only downgrade the temperature of the rooms, quite warm, and the lighting was too low of wattage. But overall, 7 days of a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “only stay here if you need this location”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler22
Reviews.Content: Two of us on a business trip, two rooms, two different experiences, He had the 5th floor and found it a tad shabby but serviceable. I was on the 35th floor and found it not so good. A hair on the counter in the bathroom, but I could overlook that, as I had brought my tiny can of Lysol spray. No, what got me was the fact that when I walked in the room, my allergies went into overdrive. I'm allergic to dust and mold -- neither is good to find in a hotel room. And the room was unbearably hot. I turned the thermostat all the way down, opened the windows as far as I could (to be serenaded by the plaintive honking of cabs in the cold October rain), but could not get the room to cool down,. Finally at 11 PM I called the front desk to complain. "Oh yes," the receptionist said, "that room has that problem. No worries, I'll just send you up a fan." Which they did, rather quickly, but I was still annoyed. Plus. there was not a coffepot in the room. Like so many hotels in big cities, don't stay here unless you absolutely need this location. At least until the renovation is finished.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: saymyname
Reviews.Content: Cozy and not to expensive,located on great location Nice stay, great value for money, we were very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Even with renovations, it lived up to my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: luvzlyf
Reviews.Content: I knew about the renovations going in, but the staff did an excellent job of minimizing the inconvenience. With a doorman and security near the elevators, it felt safe regardless of time of day. The room was appointed nicely and was clean. Housekeeping did a great job and was responsive to small requests. There were many choices for a quick bite or fine dining all around the hotel. We reserved through Hotels.com and requested two beds and received exactly what we asked for. The Helmsley is walkiing distance from Times Square, but far enough away to not be bothered by the chaos. Also, its proximity to Grand Central Station made getting anywhere else a breeze. I would not hesitate to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...go if you can!”
Reviews.Author: liesco
Reviews.Content: My stay in the Helmsley hotel was terrific. We had a room on the 24th floor and it was very big, the bed was huge, 3 people could easily fit in. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated.The staff was very helpful and polite. The only negative point is that the breakfast was so expensive, but you can go next door, there is a nice cafe which does delicious breakfasts for good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: quacamole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a double twin room on the 14th floor. A nice room with no noise from the streets. Closeby Grand central station. For taking breakfast you only have to cross the street and take a delicious sandwich by Pret a Manger. 24 Hour supermarket on the edge of the street so a nice neighbourhood to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great location - Do not Think Twice!”
Reviews.Author: LiatiSRAEL
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviwes before and was a bit afaid because some one wrote this was just 3 staer ad not 4 star level. After comparing it with the Omni Berkshire , which we stayed at after the Hlelmsley, I can definately say that this is a great 4 star hotel! The location is great with restaurnats, bars, coffe shops very close by. Th fact that the hotel was renovating the lobby was nno problem at all. The concierge in particular, but all the staff were soooo nice . It was a pleasure and I will definately want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice in Manhatan”
Reviews.Author: TLOBrasil
Reviews.Content: I can not think in a better option considering cost & benefits. I plan staying here every time I come back to NY. Definitly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beds But Lobby Renovation”
Reviews.Author: proftravlr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here, and yes there is quite a lot of working going on in the lobby (fyi I had booked this months ago and didn't know they were going to have any renovations going on). I had no problem with it, but my friend wasn't happy. There is no restaurant while the reno is going on and no where to sit and just people watch, so if this is a problem, stay elsewhere, it's a mess on the first floor. I liked the beds and it was quiet. One issue was it was supposed to be NS, but the last morning I was there, smoke from the next door bathroom came through our vents. The walls are sort of thin, but not a problem. The city noises are the biggest problem, but that's NYC. I liked it here, but with the thousands of other hotels in NY I would probably stay somewhere else (to compare). Do not go to the Pershing's for breakfast (go inside Grand Central or the Comfort Diner). Way overpriced, terrible food and even worse service. Also, Dylan's Candy Bar is bad too, a rip off and awful ice cream. Breyer's is much better (=

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: stokedn1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying in New York. Frankly, I find most of the recent reviews of this hotel unbelievable. If you enjoy staying on a building site then this hotel might suit you. If not, I would recommend staying somewhere else. The hotel has no services (bar, restaurant or lobby). You enter the hotel through a corridor with dust sheets, hanging wires and a very unfriendly security guard who growls at you! Check in occurs in a hallway on the third floor. It was utterly chaotic. We turned up at 1.30pm (having travelled since 6.30 am) and were brusquely told to return at 4pm. In a city where service standards are high, this hotel does not meet them. The hotel lifts are completely inadequate - if you are on a lower floor you will struggle to get in one during the morning and evening. There are so many better hotels, I suggest until the reservations are complete - and they have trained their staff better, it would be better to stay elsewhere. And one final comment - no one at any stage apologised for the state of the hotel for which we had paid a conisderable sum six months ago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4531
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must if you want to be in the heart of the city. Near Grand Central Station which is a tourist attraction in its own right, also is great if you need to nip into the market for some take away fresh produce for midnight snacking :0) We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we wanted to experience the variety of breakfasts stops within easy reach which is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay in new york”
Reviews.Author: maxine1961
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was going through building work this did not interfer with our stay. The room was excellent on the 36th floor with a fantastic view of the NY skyline and the Chrysler building.. A room big enough to cope with 4 adults, very clean and well decorated, friendly staff, efficient lifts, and a good position in the city for near sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: Marjol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in august and had a great stay. We booked the hotel through priceline for $95 a night and for that money, this was an excellent deal. As said before, the lobby was being refurnished, but it didn't bother us at all. We had a nice check in and the room we got was quite big for New York standards. The bed was nice (although my side was a little uneven), the bathroom was ok with a nice shower and we had a nice tv and view of the Chrysler building. The free internet also was a big plus! We did have some noise from the streets (we stayed on floor 26), but it didn't bother us that much. The location of the hotel is very nice, a two block walk to Grand Central Station and a 15 minutes walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: hsqos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2005 on my first trip to New York. However on subsequent visits have found it too expensive to stay in. Got really good deal on lastminute.com so based on first stay booked again. We got a massive corner room which was clean and gave us great views of Chrysler Building. It is so central, walking distance to Grand Central Station, 5th Ave, Time Square and UN Building. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: coolden
Reviews.Content: Even though the phone conversation one day before my arrival was quite rough (maybe I was not used to east coast culture), but the reception was very pleasant. I took a red eye flight and arrived early in NYC. The receptionist and manager warmly welcomed me and let me check in to my room in the morning (8am). I also requested a higher level so they gave me whatever available at the time. The construction did not reduce the standard of the service and room. Since I was there for family vacation, I did not really use any of hotel amenities. The location cannot be better. It is close to grand central station to catch any subway to all major tourist spots in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Renovation Hurts”
Reviews.Author: Riverspots
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on reviews here and I knew it was being renovated. I'm certain the renovations are the reason for the good price I was able to get. The staff is indeed very friendly as described in many reviews. Our room also was very comfortable although the Helmsley needs to do a pillow upgrade from foam to feathers. Also, we had a bit of a problem with switching from tub to shower -- but manageable. It is a bit dated but not too bad because it obviously was a four-star hotel in a prior life. My main complaint is that I did not realize (not their fault -- they are up front about this) that their bar and restaurant are both closed due to the renovations. They do provide room service. But, if you enjoy having a drink before you head up to bed, you will need to walk to the crowded Irish bar up a block or buy your wine or liquor ahead of time at the spirits store in the next block. Also, there is no coffeemaker in the room, and no restaurant, so you will need to get dressed and head for the Starbucks or many breakfast choices nearby. I admit, it's New York, so you have lots of replacement choices. But we did feel incovenienced by this. Just be aware. Other than this, everything was fine. The staff really does a great job of trying to make up for the renovations. Plus, the free internet was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room and a great location”
Reviews.Author: cavertoo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Helmsley mid-July 2009. The staff was efficient and helpful. Our room was very clean and had a great view from the 37th floor. Little street noise could be heard up that high. Pax restaurant next door had good food and prices. Pershing Square (across from Grand Central) is expensive but good. We also enjoyed eating at Jr's Brooklyn Deli near Times Square - a local favorite. We love NYC and will definitely stay at the Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, crappy check-in”
Reviews.Author: Munu
Reviews.Content: Like all other hotels in Midtown, the location can't be beat and it's only 2 blocks from Grand Central. Upon our arrival, there was a crowd at the front-desk for check-in. When we finally made it to the front, the guy helping us got called over to help another group because he spoke Spanish. Instead of another check-in clerk helping us, he left us hanging there for 15 minutes. We eventually got the attention of someone else to help us. While we were there, the hotel had just started with their renovations for the new lobby so can't really comment on it. Stayed in our rooms mostly while there because the rest of the time we were out on the town. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Didn't eat at the hotel at all, just took a walk to Dunkin Donuts for breakfast on 39th street (between 2nd and 3rd ave), only 3 blocks aways and Abitino's Pizza next door to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gugu76
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was under renovation but it didn't stop the service from being great. People at the door service, front desk and the cleaning personnel were all great and helpful. The consierge service was very professional and all our questions were easily answered and we got pretty good info on good restaurants and other stuff of interest. The hotel location is great: you can walk to a lot of places and the subway station is just a minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are very big and the bed is very comfy. The only negative thing I have to say about this hotel is that the street noice in the room (ours was on the 7th floor) was very loud. Practically every night I was woken up by a garbage truck and then again at 7 o'clock by street construction work. We got a pretty good bargain deal on the room so this in mind I have to say the hotel and the location were a lot better than what you can usually expect for this price in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: diipadei
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, though there was some renovations going on. Still don't consider it as 4-star hotel like it was said to be, more like 3 stars. The rooms look a bit old and there was some bathrooms tiles a bit loose in the wall of the shower. A bit noisy at night, you could hear the sounds very well from the street below even though our room was in 18th floor. Sevice was pretty ok, even though they tried to bill us from some minibar purchases we didn't make. But things cleared up very easily. But the location is pretty good and there was really nothing wrong with the hotel so I might come back because it was relatively cheap compared to other 4-star Manhattan hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a small boutique hotel, with NYC flavor!”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Why? it's the STAFF! They are great, and really make this hotel what it is. Their professionalism mixed with genuine warmth and friendliness make the NY Helmsley a special place. The people embody New York f (my hometown) for me, a friendliness that's REAL and down to earth Is this themost elegant or modern hotel in NY? NO. but they have something money can't buy in the form of those who work there, at every level. There are other reasons I'd stay again. The beds are just about the most comfortable I've ever slept on. I love te bathroom, with its old-fashioned towels and the hotel's name "carved"on them, and the thick soft bathrobe. The location by Grand Central Station on the East Side is perfect. The M104 bus, which has a route across 42nd st, via Times Sq, and all the way up the West Side, is diagonally across from the hotel. The English eatery Pret a Manger is across the street for a quick delicious sandwich, coffee, etc. There is a 24 Hour CVS right across the street . Great shopping (including a wonderful food-stalls market)in the passages leading to the huge lobby of Grand Central Station. The neighborhood is very safe. Among the very best IMHO bagels and great deli foods (try the gefilte fish) in NY are at Daniels, a few blocks away. Drawbacks: the lobby is being re-modeled, so you walk through a constuction area to get an elevator to third floor rception. However, this is after you've been greeted and welcomed warmly, so you don't feel like a duck out of water. The room furnishings, other than the marvelous beds with their white linens , are a bit dated--greens and golds. The mgr told me that, slowly but surely, once the lobby is completed, the rooms will be re-decorated. I was on the 20th floor with a view of the Empire State Bldg--especially striking at night, with clouds floating by its illuminated upper floors. Even at this level, the noise from garbage trucks and cars from the street below (facing 41st )was loud--the NY canyon effect? Obviously the windows are not double glazed . (In contrast, a friend stayed at the Times Sq Hilton, and we couldnt hear a thing from her room above the traffic). All in all, I would defintely recommend the NY Helmsley. I look forward to a return trip to see the new lobby and get a good dose of that great NY friendliness and spirit. Thanks to all who contribute to your visitors' enjoyment of The Big Bad Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: kewpielovesyou
Reviews.Content: Having never been to NY before, it was important for us to choose a hotel that was conveniently located from the train and other public transport hubs. The hotel was close to Grand Central Station. Rooms are a tad small, but that's NY for you. When we were there the rooms were also a little dated. I note that the hotel's gone thru abit of a facelift. Other than that, a great hotel at a good location. Shopping, food, it's all there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!! One of the best in New York”
Reviews.Author: stephaniefromcanada
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to New York, and probably the most enjoyable because of our hotel selection. The location of the hotel was amazing. The service and staff were the friendliest of any travels we've had in AND outside of New York!! I used the fitness centre which was clean and stocked with water & towels. The hotel lobby is currently being renovated, but who cares, you don't sleep in the lobby....you sleep in your room!!! and the check in services on the third floor were FAST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but needs a bit of a cleanup”
Reviews.Author: JuniorBHalifax
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel for 3 nights. The room was extremely comfortable and large for New York standards. Our room was not cleaned one day, despite me calling housekeeping to ask them to do it. They also didn't rush to do it the next day - they finally showed up at 3:30 in the afternoon and had run out of towels. The staff were extremely friendly but didn't seem to go out of their way to make it an extra special experience. The location is fantastic - about 20 minutes walking to all the major areas and around the corner of Grand Central Station. We would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Rocco2006
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Ney York Helmsley Hotel for one week, the hotel is good located, rooms are clean and good furnished and equiped. Are big enough for 4 persons. The lobby was being restored during our stay, but no noise or something that can disturb us in our room. (no breakfast service due to restoration but you can order food from outside restaurants to your room, at the front desk they have the menus.) In general rooms have a nice view to the city, specially on the upper floors. The location of the hotel is very nice, near of the Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station and you can reach easily walking Times Square and the 5th Avenue. Something interesting is that in case of rain the hotel lends umbrellas to the guests. Free Internet. I would really recommend this hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Kordangeli
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in July and we dont have anything to complain about. Sure there is renovating going on in the lobby, but that should be good thing for future travellers. Location was great and room was big and well equipped. Only minibar was missing, but there was no need for that. There was some noice from street eventhough our room was in the 18 th floor, but you get use to it. I guess New York without sound of traffic would not be New York. The value was great since we got this hotel from Priceline with low price. Eventhough restaurant is closed during lobby renovation there is plenty of places to have breakfast near by. E.g. Grand Central Station is perfect place to catch something to eat while watching busy New Yorkers commuting.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby under renovation, no dining room”
Reviews.Author: MontrealWendy
Reviews.Content: We walked in to the hotel without knowing that the lobby is under complete renovation. To enter the hotel you walk through a construction site. The reservation desk is now on the 3rd floor. The dining room and bar is closed. When we left the hotel yesterday only one elevator seems to have been working. It took us 30 minutes to leave our room on the 34th floor to get to the 3rd floor to check out. Other guests had to go to the top floor to ensure that they actually got on to the elevator because by the time it reached their floor, there was no room! The beds were comfortable but the shower didn't drain properly.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: lynnmoon
Reviews.Content: I'm very glad that my first trip to Manhattan brought me to the Helmsley. I did book the trip from one of the discounter sites, so getting the place for over half off certainly didn't hurt my opinion of it...but there were very few things that could have caused me to give it anything but a positive rating. The Bad: Since it's such a short list, I'll list the bad thing first. The only negative that we experienced was the fee for parking. Parking in the hotel's garage is around $52. I asked about garage parking and the bellman gave me some bit about it only saving a little and being several blocks away. Another much nicer person turned us on to parking right behind the hotel (2nd and 41st) that ended up costing us about $38. He actually thought that it would cost us a little less than that, but I wasn't made. That's still better than $52 and it was no trouble at all to find, walk from (less than 2 min.) or retrieve the car from. The Good: Everything else! The hotel first floor is under renovations (which didn't disturb us at all) so you check in on the third floor. All the staff was super nice, friendly and helpful. They offered us many suggestions on places to eat, how to find what we needed, etc. I'm always a little nervous when I book through a discount site that the staff will give you the leftovers and be ugly to you....but that wasn't the case at all. Truthfully, I've never really had that I'm just nervous about it a lot. Anyway, the room was great. A little small, but perfectly acceptable to us for our 1 night stay. Everything was very clean, the bathroom was equipped with the standard things, the beds were comfortable and fitted with white linens, the room had WiFi that worked perfectly immediately and the flat screen was an attractive touch. Because of the great people here on Trip Advisor, we were already hip to the minibar so we didn't even touch it!! But I did snap a couple of pictures of the wide range of technology. In a room with the super high tech sensor equipped minibar, there was a 1970's style thermostat. It worked just fine, it was just a funny combination. The CVS and PAX next door were very, very handy. My only frustration with that is that we didn't see them the night we arrived....but the following morning. I wish we had found them immediately because I bet I would have gotten something a little better for dinner than what I happened upon on 2nd Ave. around the corner. They are right next door, but when we came out the door we went right that night....we should have went left first. Anyways, all in all, it was a great stay at a great location and I'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: erato51
Reviews.Content: Location is great. but the hotel badly needs a makeover. Decor is 1980s and definitely worn and shabby. Some renovation seems to be going on. On the plus side the windows open and there was a nice breeze and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything - worths to stay there”
Reviews.Author: Bumbi17
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel with my mom and sister. It says it is a four star hotel, but in reality it is more three stars but there is no problem with the place at all. It was clean, the rooms were big (compared to the usual NYC hotels). There is a renovation going on but it did not disturbe us at all. (There is no lobby currently, but who needs it? The check in is on third floor. :) ) So: if you want to stay close to Times sq. at a reasonable price, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BrainSnag
Reviews.Content: Rates were pretty decent, but the hotel was no more than a shell. No apparent services with the lobby being nothing more than a sheet rocked hallway to the elevators. The reception desk on the 3rd floor was easy enough and all the employees were actually very nice. Was quiet enough as well although the street noise was still pretty apparent on the 10th floor. Furnishings were comfortable and the only complaint was the mini-bar charge of $35 and the wi-fi was very spotty. We never touched the mini-bar and frankly I have no idea what would cost $35. The front desk took car of it easily and I'll check my visa bill to make sure. A nice comfortable place at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationsrus58
Reviews.Content: Although it's undergoing some remodeling, the rooms were so comfortable, clean and nicely decorated not to mention that the staff were so serviceable, helpful, and friendly that the rest didn't matter! The location is great, safe, All around we had a very pleasant experience at the Helmsly and will definately consider returning to see how the it will look like once the remodel has been completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location but under construction”
Reviews.Author: organicdesign
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the New York Helmsley with few problems. Check-in took far longer then expected which may be related to the removal of the check-in desk to the thrid floor as the lobby, bar and restaurant are remodeled. Our room was spaciaous by New York standards with the most comfortable bed i've ever slept on. The staff was very friendly but neglected to refresh our supply of shampoo and plastic cups during our stay. The construction was only mildly irritating but I wish I'd known about it prior to booking. A loose toilet seat was the only problem with the room. The hotel is located near Times Square but is just far enough away to avoid the craziness and crowds. I would defintiely recommend this hotel and plan to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Property is very nice, Staff are Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: atlantisweb
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsely is in a great location, just a couple of blocks east of Grand Central Station and within walking distance of Macys, Empire State Building, Times Square and the UN. The rooms were very clean and appeared to have been recently renovated. The restaurant and bar were closed when we were there, which is not a bad thing as one of our party got food poisoning on a previous visit to the hotelâ€™s restaurant. The front desk staff were not at all friendly, but were efficient and did what they were asked. However you were always made to feel as though you were a nuisance and should just leave them alone! The bell staff were the worst, with a very rude and unpleasant attitude, that only got worse if they were not happy with their tip. They very aggressively demanded more in a verbally aggressive manner that bordered on demanding money with menaces. This occurred even when the bell man temporarily lost one of our bags, he was more interested in getting his tip than finding our missing bag! Despite the nice property I would not stay at this hotel again simply because of the unpleasant staff. If you do stay at this hotel donâ€™t let the bell staff â€œhelpâ€� with your baggage, itâ€™ll save you a lot of aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at a wondeful hotel”
Reviews.Author: crimsoncelluloid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Helmsley Hotel for 5 days in April and can't fault it in any way. A very warm greeting at the front door was just the start. We had a beautifully located room on the 36th floor (we'd asked for a room on a high floor when we booked)..small,clean and functional..and what a view!! All the staff should be very proud of the hotel. From the doormen, concierge, the room cleaners (excellent job. I did the same work for 14 years, and I know what to look for!!) through to manager. I enjoyed the view whilst using the gym facilities too. Will stay here again next time. Great central location too. ONLY negatives, ridiculously expensive minibar (I know,that's the same everywhere) and internet access (use the kinkos up the street).

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: rcmillerpt
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, the staff was very friendly and eager to help, and the price/location were great. Also their fitness center was nice and free! Free weights, machines, and cardio equipment. Space was confined but who cares as long as they have the equipment I need. The only complaints was the room was a bit dated as far as curtains and some of the furniture. But that is no big deal. The only other problem is the room was kind of warm and not sure if the AC was working correctly. It was not that bad just had to sleep with no covers on. I am warm natured. Wife had no problems so maybe it was just me :) Also you had to pay a fee for the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emm1979
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and very professional. Room was very clean, beds were so comfy especially after a long day of walking. Air worked great. Great views and two blocks to Grand Central. Would definately stay again. You wont regret it here!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Shennin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the end of May in The New York Helmsley. It was perfect from start to finish. We checked in with no problems, the staff on reception were most polite and friendly. Our room was on the 22nd Floor, spotlessly clean, and quiet, we heard NYPD sirens sometimes, but other than that no noise, and i' m a light sleeper. The beds were like heaven, so comfy and the linens were really fab. The bathroom was clean, no overly luxurious but clean is good enough for me. We did have a problem with our toilet overflowing,but to be fair to the staff, they had someone fix this problem right away. Anthony , one of the doormen in the lobby was most helpful, and nothing was too big a problem for him. All the staff we came in contact with were helpful,friendly and polite. They even looked up different shops online for us, without as much as a moments hesitation. We didnt have any meals at the hotel, there was a deli right next door, which was good value for breakfast, so we used that, and ate out the rest of the time. It was so nice to come back to the quiet restful atmosphere of the hotel in the evenings, after a day out sight-seeing and shopping, we were so glad we chose this location away from the madness of times square, yet it was only a few minutes walk away. There is a subway station about 3 mins walk away, times square, empire state building, and many other attractions within minutes walk. There are several pharmacies within minutes walk. I hope to return to New York before the end of the year, and will most definately stay at the New York Helmsley again, its absolutely perfect, and we couldnt fault it, for service, value,cleanliness ,and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mal723
Reviews.Content: Great value, excellent location, clean. I had stayed at this place back 20 years ago, was nice then, and still is. Not to sound cheap, but if there is one thing I'd change is that I wish they had a coffee maker in the room-I got a small coffee from Mindy's restaurant-in the hotel to go, and it was $3.53-pretty steep for a cup of coffe, but it was a good strong cup of coffee. Not sure how much breakfast would run there, but I went to Pax Foods just a short walk from the hotel, and had a nice breakfast there, plus some fruit and a small bag of granola for later on, for about $10-not bad for NYC...Helmsley check in was superb, they knew my name, very very friendly....came down and asked for some info, and again, very nice and friendly..checkout-superb. A/C worked super-day I was there it was rainy and muggy, room was very comfortable....pretty quiet, except for the occassional honking cab or two-so, slept well at night.....only mistake they made was when I called the operator and asked where the health club was and she said third floor, went to 3rd in the morning and wandered around, staff asked can I help, and said health club was up on the sixth....so, they are very attentive, friendly, and responsive! I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: davekaz40
Reviews.Content: Great location, Hotel very clean, staff very helpful. Best bed we have ever slept in, in a hotel. We didn't eat or drink in the Hotel it looked very expensive. watch out for the mini bar seems to be on a sensor i think they will charge if you just move the bottles. Had breakfast in the deli next door which served really good healthy food at a reasonable cost. there were lots of good resteraunts and bars locally to choose from. 10-15 minute walk from time square. Recommend the bus tours around the city you can hop on and off and visit the area's you want to visit, saves a lot of walking and drops off just around the corner from the Hotel. When we go back we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms: great - atmosphere: a bit stuck up”
Reviews.Author: duffcake
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference but since my wife was joining me, chose more of a tourist location. Hotel was v presentable in good spot close to most of the tourist areas without being right on top of them. Room itself was great-clean, comfortable, smart and spacious. The doorman who showed us to our room was excellent. One day, our safe wouldnâ€™t open. I had left my laptop in it and needed it urgently for a conference that afternoon. Staff were great and sorted it immediately. Sadly, other staff were a bit off-hand. A couple of doormen in particular, made it clear that they were very put out at receiving tips of a few dollars for the most menial of tasks (not something I'd experienced at other hotels in NY). Also, I used the hotel internet room to print a 5 page doc for work at $1 per page (steep)! When my bill arrived though, I was charged $10. When I queried it, I was told that this was a flat rate for each time you used the room. While it hardly breaks the bank, Iâ€™d have preferred to have known in advance. This is my 4th time in NYC; I've stayed in different spots each time. Overall, this hotel was very good & the room was probably the best I've stayed in NY so far but the issues with the staff did bother me and would put me off staying here again. While it may seem like I'm knitpicking, I don't like being made to feel uncomfortable. Last time I stayed in a Club Quarters. The room wasn't as nice but I think I preferred it - the atmosphere was more relaxed and they didn't charge you for every tiny thing!

Reviews.Title: “Really Happy with Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: DB5464
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two weeks with my partner last year. We were really happy with the service, room and location of the hotel. The hotel is maybe a little dated on first impression (Styling) but eveything is fine. We stayed for two weeks so we were offered a room on the 6th floor as it was a little bigger than the roomd higher up which suited us fine. The room was cleaned everyday and no matter what time we left at from 9 am to as late as 3pm one day the cleaner was there to clean as we left. Excellent. Service form all the staff was fine although I would normally cfarry my own bag which was frowned upon by the bellhops and one made it known to me that was his job, but I took no notice. The hotel is beside Grand Central and we purchased a Metro Card (Unlimited travel for $25 for 7 days) which allowed get around the city quickly. Time Square is only a short walk away. The Irish Bar across the road had really good service also. If you want to call home (Europe) I would advise you to buy a phone card in the local shop and use the Hotel phone to call using that. It wa my partner's first time in The US and we both really enjoyed the holiday and were very impressed by the Helmsley

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but very disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: oldfogeys
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3rd - 6th June, celebrating a 50th birthday, e-mailed ahead to notify hotel of this, but never got as much as an acknowledgement from any of the staff. Upon our arrival at 1330 hrs our room wasn't ready, so we left our luggage and walked about the city for about 2 hours. When we got back to the hotel and checked in, we were given keys to a room on on the 24th floor - imagine our horror when we went up to this room, entered, and found it to be already fully occupied! Thankfully, there were no guests within, but we saw all their personal belongings, clothing, shoes, etc lying about and hurriedly made our way back down to the reception, where staff did not seem particularly perturbed - a 'computer error'! - and gve us another room on the 37th floor. On the plus side, the room was clean, comfortable and perfectly adequate. The following day, we left the hotel around 0700 hrs and returned about 1630 hrs, to find that our room had not been serviced. So we went back down to reception and this time asked to speak to a duty manager - Rae - came over to speak to us and we explained the errors that we had encountered so far. Although he was pleasant enough, we felt he did not appreciate our concerns, especially with the security breach we'd had upon arrival - I kept thinking 'imagine if that happened to us, imagine if we were in our room and someone else got access?' Not to mention the potential implications for theft allegations, extremism activities, etc, the list is endless! However Rae said he'd find out 'who dropped the ball' and suggested we went over for a drink in Harry's bar whilst he arranged for our room to be serviced. About half an hour later we went back upstairs and found our room had been cleaned, adequately, although obviously hurriedly. That evening, we telephoned home from the hotel room, as our mobiles weren't working. We had a 5 minute call to the UK. On the morning of the 6th June, when checking out, we discovered that not only had we been charged for the drinks in Harry's bar - which we had to take whilst waiting for our room to be cleaned! - but that we had been charged a whopping $49 for that brief call to the UK! Couldn't believe the exorbitant charges and asked for a detailed invoice which they were unable to provide. Spoke to a different duty manager, who again was pleasant, but dismissive of our dissatisfaction and did not bother to resolve the matter in our favour. Overall, we felt the hotel's fantastic location was spoiled by poor service, lack of customer care, and a disregard for customer satisfaction. A special occasion almost spoiled by the indifference and ineptitude of the New York Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: scmcb
Reviews.Content: I have made several trips to New York City and stayed in many hotels. The New York Helmsley is far and away the VERY BEST VALUE. The service was phenomenal - I arrived early (10 a.m.) and not only did they have my room ready, they put me into the best room they had available at the time (high floor with a view of the Chrysler Building). Every staff member was friendly and went out of their way to make my stay comfortable. The room was large (not huge, but certainly not small), clean and well-appointed. The location does not get much better - one block away from Grand Central and within easy walking distance to Park Avenue, Fifth Avenue, Times Square, the United Nations and restaurants of every kinds. I have no idea how I was able to get a room at the rate I did, but it was easliy worth at least three times what I paid (I'm reluctant to quote the rate because it was so low). They even provide free wireless internet access. There was not a single problem. Not only will I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York, I am returning this summer and bringing my family. Staying at the Helmsley New York is a no-brainer - do not hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: margaret2051
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 5/28 thru 5/31 with three of my friends. I did a lot of searching for an affordable, yet nice hotel in a good, central location. The New York Helmsley seemed to fit all the requirements my friends and I had. Once we got there, we knew we had made the right choice. The hotel is in a fabulous location (less than 2 blocks from Grand Central and a fairly easy walk to Times Square). The staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was 3408, which had 2 double beds. The room size was more than adequate, and the bathroom had ample counter space. We also had a great view of the Chrysler Building from our window. We had no problems with noise coming from other rooms. My friends and I agreed that we'll definitely stay at this hotel again on our next NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for price”
Reviews.Author: romanos116
Reviews.Content: Stayed at NY Helmsley thru 5/23 to 5/30. I read two years of tripadvisor reviews on this hotel and picked it because of excellent overall reviews. We are a family of four and came to New York for a week as a gift for my daughters college graduation. Her and younger brother stayed in one room and mom and dad next door. All our requests sent before hand by e-mail to reservations were graciously honored as we got these rooms from priceline along with our flights from Phoenix. Non smoking King for mom dad doubles for the kids on 22 floor corner rooms with view of Empire State Bldg. Rooms were of ordinary size for anywhere else in country but big by Manhattan standards. Front desk very friendly accomodating. We asked for small fridge for our room and it was sent up swiftly, although fridge didn't cool that cold. Porters and curb service friendly helpful. Rooms clean room service excellent. Elevators fast ,location excellent, rooms fairly quiet for NYC. We didn't use the Pax restaurant next door that much for breakfast as many have suggested as we found Daniel's Bagels on 3rd Ave around 36th 37th st on left side of street from Hotel a 5 minute walk a well recommended hole in the wall restaurant that bakes its own real New York bagels & pasterys every morning at ridicuously low prices for NYC. New Yorkers secret not many tourists at this place. Overall NY Helmsley and excellent NY experience would recommend and would go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location -- Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: UncleLed
Reviews.Content: Got a bargain on Priceline for this hotel and it was well worth the effort. The location is great. For a Manhattan hotel it was quite quiet. Found the rooms a little small but the bed was very comfortable. The lobby was rather small and there were very few chairs to sit in when we had to wait for our friends to show up. The little bar in the lobby was under-staffed and it was difficult to get the staff's attention to get a drink. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for price paid.”
Reviews.Author: YYZAC
Reviews.Content: Received this hotel via Priceline.com for $109/USD per night. For the price paid and considering the relative prices of hotels in New York, the value was good. The reviews are quite favourable for this hotel, which surprised me at first; however, I can say that they are quite accurate. The staff, espcially those on the floor in the lobby (door/bell men, security) go out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. I checked in quite late, after midnight. Initially was given a smoking room, but I asked to be switched. When did front desk staff stop asking if you prefer non or smoking? My room was 2402 and had two beds. The room was adequate and comfortable. Although there was evidence of a recent rennovation, it was not a total gut, just a little updating. The decor is still outdated, and impractical. For example, the hotel kept the "hutch" which an, older, TV would have sat inside. The new LCD TV has been placed on what used to be the work desk. Now the work desk is mostly unusable and the TV is difficult to see from one of the beds. The desk/TV stand had no desk light, which made reading the morning paper difficult. Again, I found this an odd feature of the rennovation. Another odd feature was the choice of dark, non-patterned carpeting, which, of course, shows every little bit of fluff and dirt. The windows are the originals and are quite thin. A lot of street noise gets through. I found the ledge above the bathroom counter a great idea: very helpful to expand counter storage space which always seems to be an issue in hotels. There was a large hair on the bathroom floor, but besides this the room was quite clean and was even vacuumed each day. The room itself was a decent size for New York and the bed was very coomfortable. Unlike some similar classed hotels in the area there was no complimentary newspaper either delivered to the room or available in the lobby. Overall a plesant stay at an attractive price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL I will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: MetalTraveler
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel. It's not the most flashy or new, but it is cozy, CLEAN, the employees are really friendly. The beds are great, and the bathrooms are spacious. The concierge service is awesome. The front desk is great too. We took a Carmel Car from JFK and paid in advance including the tip only $59. The same price we would have paid for a Taxi. When we got there, the doorman, kind of worried, asked us how much did he charged us. I told him, and he was relieved. The first night they gave us a room in the 6th floor. The next morning I asked to be changed to a higher floor, because of the view. The front desk changed us without any question. When we got to the new room in the 22nd floor the front desk called there to ask if that room was ok. The gym in the hotel is great. It's on the 6 floor, and it has some nice new cardio and weight training machines, clean towels too. Be careful with the water fridge, I sure they will charge a lot to the room. Everyday I used the free wi-fi in my laptop, excellent connection. And a PLUS is that the safe inside the closet it's big enough to fit a big laptop. I have a Dell Widescreen, and it fits great. The second day we got all wet because of the rain and the Concierge gave us a nice umbrella. It's close to everything, Grand Central, UN, Times Square is a 15 minutes walk away. There's a 24 hour CVS Pharmacy in the next corner, if you need something, including beer (LOL), there it is 24 hours. At night there's a staff person checking the keys to let you into the elevators, that's great. The down side its the air conditioner, it didn't work quite well, and we never turned it off, but it never got that cold. LIKE ALL THE REVIEWS, STAY AWAY FROM THE MINIBAR!!! Since I read all the comments about the prices of it, we didn't even looked at it. I saw that it has a weight sensor or something, if you remove something for 20 seconds it will be charged. I didn't even looked at the menu, that has the prices, and we had no problem. I'm going back in a couple of months, this is the hotel I will book. The staff is really really great. We had a great time in the City and the hotel was a big part of it. Since we booked a package through Priceline I thought we could have some problems. NOT AT ALL! Everything was smooth. I would totally recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel/Trip”
Reviews.Author: summertime59
Reviews.Content: Great hotel lovely comfortable rooms, great location close to Times Square, Chrysler Building, Grand Central. Would return without a doubt. Ellen's Stardust Diner great for the kids, went to see Lion King which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: alina12
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this well situated hotel. It is an older building, so the bath fixtures and tub are a bit on the "worn" side. We checked in past 2 am the first night due to a flight delay. The toilet was noisy and ran continuously, which kept me up all night. The next morning I asked engineering to fix it, and they did fine. Also, the asst. manager left a voicemail to give us his name in case we had any further issues, so the service follow up was very good. The bed, as others have mentioned, was extremely comfortable. Room size was not large, but not cramped either. All in all, a great value as the hotel offered 20% off for a 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel +Location”
Reviews.Author: Auldayr
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great location,(east 42nd St.) staff could not be more helpful. Ten minutes walk from Time Sq or Empire State building. Two minutes walk from Grand Central, opposite which you have a great breakfast bar, "Pershing Sq." Another nearby restaurant "Wollensky's Grill &Bar" on the corner of third avenue and 49th St. approximately 8 minutes walk from hotel, you cannot book so go early to avoid dissapointment.. We came in from Newark Airport, used the shuttle bus that took us to the hotel door in less than an hour for a cost of $38 for two people. This was booked at the airport's (less than helpful) desk

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room great location just a few small complaints”
Reviews.Author: John_Denis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on 42nd Street very near to Grand Central Station and the subway. The room was very big for a Manhattan hotel and please note I'm giving it top marks for value as I got the room for just Â£70 per night by "naming my own price" on priceline.com. Just a few small things to look out for: 1. I bumped into the minibar and accidentally moved a couple of drinks - they tried to charge me but once I explained they cancelled the charges. 2. Don't pay $10 for 15 mins of internet access in the hotel's "business room" - it's a con - you can get internet access just round the corner at the Old Bridge Deli on Lexington and 41st for $7 for half an hour - the concierge no doubt knows that but didn't let on to me. 3. On our final morning the cleaning staff knocked the door at 9.30am then rang the bell to ask what time we were departing the room at. I had to get up to speak to them. Check out was not until 12, so that wasn't great - you may want to ask the reception staff to make sure that doesn't happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a great location”
Reviews.Author: shasha0777
Reviews.Content: I got the hotel on a bidding website so I didn't really know the hotel. But I ended getting an expensive hotel for a good price. The location is wonderful. It's across the street from the Chrysler Building, which you can get a room with a view of the Chrysler Building. Our room had a view of the Empire State Building off to the right. The room was very clean and the beds are super comfortable. The linens were probably the best you can buy. Bathrobes were also included with the hotel stay, which is a nice little addition.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great views, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: garnet46
Reviews.Content: My brother, sister-in-law and I stayed at the hotel from April 15th to the 21st. We couldn't have had a better location! We were close to almost everything, and took the subway(which was only 2 blocks away) to the designations that were too far to walk. The service was exceptional! Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful, (which I was surprised, since I had heard that some New York hotels were really snobby) The room was great, and the beds very comfortable. We were on the 11th floor, and did not hear hardly any noise from the streets. The housekeeping service was wonderful! We got a refrigerator for our room, and bought soda, etc. down the street to store in the fridge. For what we payed, it beat out any other place! We will definitely come again and recommend it to everyone we know! I Love New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the thick of NYC”
Reviews.Author: lynvick56
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed here this past weekend. We were in town for one night to see Billy Elliot on Broadway. The hotel is conveniently located across from the Chrysler Building and withing walking distance of Grand Central Station. The hotel has a parking garage with valet parking. We were warmly greeted when we checked in and given three rooms near each other on the 33rd floor. The rooms were a decent size by New York standards. Each room had two queen sized beds furnished with high grade linens and wonderful pillows. The beds were extremely comfortable. Our room had a flat screen LCD TV, a minibar and snacks which could be purchased--but VERY expensive. There was a pleasant bar in the lobby and a restaurant that we did not take advantage of, but it is there for your convenience. Right next door to the hotel is a PAX Wholesome Foods which sells breakfast items, pastries, yogurts, coffee, juice, etc. We bought our breakfast there rather than pay $24 for the buffet breakfast at the hotel. Pax offers a variety of premade items: breakfast sandwiches, quiches, and the like, as well as bagels with cream cheese which are toasted to order. We were able to walk to the theater on the West Side and also to Central Park. There was a hotel employee checking room keys by the bank of elevators which made us feel safe. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Openstudio
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the UN where I had a conference. I wasn't expecting much since the price was so low compared to the hotels we have usually stayed in when visiting NYC (about 1/5 the price). When I opened the door I found a huge suite with a master bedroom, living room and two bathrooms. The bathrooms were all marble with new fixtures. The bed was very comfortable and although I was only on the 10th floor, it was very quiet for sleeping. The location was within walking distance of many things like shopping, Broadway and of course, the UN. The staff was extremely friendly and kind. I had breakfast in the dining room and service was fast and also friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: adyfoster
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was fantastic. The location is a min walk from times square, yet it is just out of the way enough to enable a peacefull walk home at night and good nights sleep. The room was clean and comfortable with brilliant views of lower Manhattan in the distance. Staff were friendly and helpfull, particularly the bar staff. My only, very small, complaint is that the Air conditioning in the room seemed to have a mind of it's own ! Overall fantastic hotel if a little bit sexpensive to buy drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & location”
Reviews.Author: MiTraveler33
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers here, I was nervous about our choice to stay at the Helmsley. We've stayed at many other New York hotels, but none were worth a return trip. The Helmsley is different. It's huge, but the service is personal as if you are staying at a boutique hotel. We asked for a high floor, done. We stayed on the 36th floor with an awesome view of the Empire State Building. We got a great deal on the hotel's Web site. The location was great. It was easy to and from La Guardia as you don't need to cross the island. Grand Central is just two blocks away and taxis are plentiful in front of the hotel. On 42nd Street, there are several deli type places to grab breakfast or lunch... Pax is right outside the hotel to the left and Pret a Manger is across the street. A 24-hour CVS is just across Third Avenue. We were greeted with smiles from each and every staff member as we came and went during our four-day trip. The staff was mature, professional and happy. We also ordered room service several times and the food was good with a lovely presentation. Beware the $10 bottled water. Otherwise, we found the food prices pretty reasonable for New York. The room itself was nice and clean. Housekeeping had our room fixed up every day when we returned from our travels. The bathroom was spacious, if a bit worn feeling. But it was spotless and a bit glamorous with the white marble countertop and cool gem themed lights. Plush bathrobes were supplied along with generous sized towels. The bed linens were very nice and new. The room was very quiet. The view was so lovely we often perched in the window ledge to marvel at it. My daughter and I felt very secure and well cared for at the Helmsley and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations”
Reviews.Author: captnkirk
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect having seen some of the comments from other Trip advisors but I was very pleasantly surprised. The location on 42nd street near 3rd avenue was good, just 10 minutes from the subway at Grand Central Station with its shuttle to Times square if yer don't fancy an interesting half hour stroll, bout 15 minutes to the Rockefellar Centre. Banks, sandwich bars, 24 hour Chemists and late night grocery stores are close by. The hotel lobby was suitably imposing, the doormen and bell boys very cheerful and helpful and our receptionist a bit uninvolved but by contrast the receptionist when we left could not have been more pleasant and called the manager over to say goodbye. he said the hotel was scheduled for a makeover next year but it looked fine to me. The corner room on the 21st floor overlooked 42nd Street with a side view of the Chrysler building and was pleasant and roomy. The bed was excellent and loads of drawer and wardrobe space with iron and ironing board and with an armchair and small table, there was a decent flat panel TV and mini bar. Soft furnishings were of excellent quality. The bathroom with bath with shower over was reasonable sized and crammed with good quality towels and flannels. There was also good quality bath products, hair dryer and decent one size dressing gowns. There was a little traffic noise but not bad at all. Minor niggles were: the lack of hot drink maker but I knew this and took a travel kettle and makings, and a notice on the mini bar requesting that personal items were not stored in it (messed up the milk strategy), thought this a bit mean. Also an interesting tray of goodies on top with a warning notice that if an item was removed for more than 20 seconds it would be charged to the room as consumed? (mission Impossible self destruct?). Thought this was quite amusing but really out of character with the overall ambience of the room and looked like the work of a rogue jobsworth not involved with the customer service side of the organisation. But this is probably too many words spent on minor aspects of a lovely room and hotel which was also excellent value. By the way I had a problem connecting my notebook to the FREE wifi and the helpful concerge sent up an expert to the room who sorted it for nothing and didnt want a tip. Be warned on using the business centre equipment it was $10 for 15 minutes and a fair bit more for each additional 5 minutes, this also seemed a bit mean, on line check in and printing boarding cards is quite desirable. Didnt use the hotel restaurant but it looked gracious and the breakfast and dinner menus looked good and not too overpriced . There is a PAX sandwich shop next door for breakfast take outs etc but we found it really crowded with limited seating, we breakfasted at the Frontier Restaurant on 3rd avenue around 39th street which we liked the food, space and service at not a lot more money than Pax. For evening meals we can recommend Deans italian just round the corner on 2nd avenue for reaonably priced very good food and a casual atmosphere. Saw Chicago at the Ambassador theatre on 'cheap tickets' we got at the Sea port ticket booth, tickets werent that cheap, show was great but be warned if you bigger than petite the seats are very snug. Tip, we took a good side trip to Philadelphia by Amtrak but the tip here for train travel is to make sure to take photo ID to buy/collect the tickets!! Amtrak dont tell you that when you book online.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: luckystar36
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading Trip advisor reviews, and I am so glad that I did. It was an absolute pleasure to stay there, from the moment they let us check-in two hours early, to when they got us a cab back to the airport. Check in was easy and quick. The lifts are amazingly fast! Our room was lovely ( re-furbished, I think, as it wasn't the same chintz decor as the photos). We treated ourselves to breakfast on the first morning which was a feast, we didn't eat for hours after that! All the staff were so helpful and courteous, from front desk, to security. I would especially like to mention Ruben, who felt like our friend at the end of our stay, he couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and if we return one day we would definately use The Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BrisVegasOZ
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in The New York Helmsley hotel for 7 nights from March 3rd to March 10th 2009 for our first ever visit to New York City. We loved it and would definitely recommend to anyone, particularly for first-time visitors, given the convenient location to Grand Central. We arrived a day late due to a massive snow storm that ripped through the east; the only problem was that our requested non-smoking room could not be met for our arrival night due to the amount stranded visitors. As a result, we were given a premium room on the 38th floor that did not smell like smoke at all! The decor was very modern, unlike the reviews of rooms on the lower floors, so we were very happy with the upgrade. All the staff were extremely helpful, very friendly and more than happy to provide advice to first time visitors. Given the location to Grand Central (5 min walk), the quality of the rooms and the wonderful staff, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
