Reviews.Author: DGXFrance
Reviews.Content: It was our second trip to New York, and we selected this hotel for its very convenient location. The staff member at the reception gave us a room on the 10 th floor (it was the highest possible location), and we have got a very beautiful room with a nice view at the Chrysler building. The room was quite spacious (for New York), very clean and stylishly decorated. All the staff members were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travellerTheHague
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from Feb 18 until Feb 24. Very friendly staff, clean rooms and in a perfect location. 15 minutes walk from times square and broadway. I think the best rooms are higher up. We stayed on the 32nd floor with a view at the Chrysler building. Value for money

Reviews.Title: “Poor stay at The New York Helmsley Hotel”
Reviews.Author: megItaly62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The New York Helmsley Hotel from 12/30/2008 until 1/4/2009 in two rooms at the 8th floor. Only on the 31st december they gave us the newspaper whereas it was expected to be given everyday. Our experience has been very negative for the following reasons: 1 On the arrival my son (age 17) noticed that the bathrobe that he was going to use had already been used as it contained a cigarette's packet in a pocket.. 2 The rooms were usually cleaned in the afternoon but not deeply as only the beds were made up and the linen changed. 3 The rooms were noisy because the noise from the street came as the windows were not soundproof. 4 The second day we found under a bed a dirty pair of under-garment together with lots of dust, sign that the room hadn't been cleaned there for long. 5 The hall was really small. 6 On the 1st of January in room 812 (my sons' room) one man shoe (brand Hogan) disapperead after the room was cleaned. We didn't found the shoe in the room , so we called the housekeeping service, a woman came in the room and told us that she would have looked for it, we spoke also to the direction and reception. The shoe was not found and on the 4th january (our leaving date) the Direction Service assistant suggested to my husband to fill the security form and she told him that in one month they would inform us about the shoe or the refunding. At the end of february they still haven't contacted us so we wrote 2 e-mail to her, the first on the 2/20/2009 and the second on the 03/02/2009. the Direction Service and the Assistant Security finally answered on the 03/02/2009, saying the same things they told us before leaving the hotel(the shoe was not found). On the 03/03/2009 we wrote the third e-mail to them asking for information about the refund, but until today (13th march) we had no answer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rhi26
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in the run up to Christmas with my husband and another couple. The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring the city just a stones throw from Grand Central Station. The rooms were emmaculate, well furnished and always cleaned to the highest standard. Only negative would be the grumpy old man on the concierge desk, the two ladies we spoke to there were always very helpful and efficient but the man was less than helpful and a little rude at times. Would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: kildaremary
Reviews.Content: Was travelling to NY for 3 nights to attend Allman Brothers 40th Anniversary gig, and wanted a good value hotel. I certainly found it in the Helmsley. Although most of the customers seemed to buisness men, everyone was treated with the same care and attention from the moment the taxi dropped us off. I had read a couple of negative reviews, but in all honesty, do you really go to New York to have a working TV in your room? Get out there and see the place! The room was a great size, comfortable bed, and I had requested a room around the middle floor region due to my partners fear of heights and this was honoured. The room was tidied and cleaned every day, and complimentary toiletries replaced. Location, a couple of blocks from Grand Central, pick up points for the Airport express and a great breakfast to be had at Pershing Square diner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiger5901
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first trip to New York, and we stayed at the New York Helmsley. We loved it. The location was great, only a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and very helpful. They also has a PAX next door, you could buy a $5.00 breakfast, or many other sandwiches and pastries. A CVS was located about a block away too. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre room, good maid service, average reception staff”
Reviews.Author: streds
Reviews.Content: I love the location of the NY Helmsley as it's round the corner from the UN so I could get to work easily. I was disappointed with the room as I've been in motel rooms with better facilities and the Millenium Hotel is far superior. The bedside light on one side only went on low setting so couldn't read in bed; the refrigerator we requested didn't work at all; we got an invoice for something from the mini-bar which we didn't take. I've recommended this hotel to many people; one friend comes every year to visit NY and stays here. Sometimes she has to ask for a better room and she usually gets it. It's very noisy if the hotel is full as the style of the door is such that it will slam loudly however you close it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, staff not the best......”
Reviews.Author: jackocomms
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location. But and a big but... didnt think the staff were at all friendly especially the bar, it seems all they are there for is the tips.. Great hotel otherwise,we were on the 19th floorwhich was great for the street noise. the deli next door 'pax' does a great breakfast. on a whole had a great tiime.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect all round hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: isanghera
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 of the best days at the helmsley and cant rave enough about it. If you want to go to a hotel with minimal headache and a great service, then choose this place. As soon as I got there, they had my requests I emailed via booking,com..surely enough they delviered a spare mini fridge up to my room so me and my girlfriend could store milk, water, basics etc (needed for a 9 days stay). The rooms were exceptionally clean. I requested a high floor and was given a floor in the mid 30's level so the views were brill...the staff were what you would expect if you stayed at the Waldorf. Location was more than perfection. One of the most central points in Manhattan, simply close to everything. Times sqaure, 5th avenue, empire state - metro stops etc etc etc. everything is walking distance from here, and I would not hesitate to go back. I am the fussiest person I know and I can honestly say I cannot think of 1 bad factor. There was space a plenty, rooms are massive for New york. Yes the curtains maybe a decade out of date, but it you've got issues with that, you wont enjoy antything about new york!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Does Me Another Solid”
Reviews.Author: AnyplaceOnce
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't have noticed this place on the other travel sites so I'm glad Trip Advisor readers pointed it out. Got the lowest rate by booking directly with the hotel. Beds were comfy, staff was friendly (with one warning: the concierge was wrong about everything). We accepted a low floor room with no view because it was ready for a very early check-in and I was glad to have the option. PERFECT location - and do try the bakeries in Grand Central Station, I'm still dreaming of their almond croissants...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location comfortable room fab view!”
Reviews.Author: NewportGuys
Reviews.Content: We were four adults, two with complex health issues needing to share a room, the Helmsley was one of the few hotels that offered two large beds in an adequate sized room at a very good price, Despite very poor communication from the hotel before we got there - they did not bother to reply to any of our questions emailed to them - the welcome was fine and apologetic for the service hitherto. The room was at the back of the hotel with a wonderful view accross down Manhattan and a spectacular view to the side of the Empire State framed by two other sky scrapers. We were very comfortable though there was no refrigerator - robes,towels and soaps very high quality - bath - just OK! The staff were kind though once again the concierge service failed sending us to a restaurant where under 21s were not welcome - causing quite an upset. The location of this hotel is very good. The iconic Chrysler building is just a short hop down the road and rooms at the front of the hotel must have had a wonderful view of it - Grand Central Sation just a short walk further down and Times Square ten minutes further on. The restaurant was very expensive and OK - just OK - even if the staff were charming ..... Yet ..... we would be happy to stay there again, it was great value and better than we expected

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: marymac1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day stay at the New York Helmsley. We had requested (in advance)a nice non smoking room on a high floor, the girl at check in noted our requests and all were met. Our room was beautiful, cosy and quite large. After a long day walking, shopping and sight seeing we were thrilled to return to our little "home" with its comfy bed and bath robes. Everyone at this hotel welcomed us warmly and the door men were so lovely. Of note the bar bill has gratuity already added. Elsewhere a tip we were given to work out how much to tip, was, double the tax and add a little bit. This works out at the recommended 18-20%. Hotel is in a great location less than five min from Grand Central station and 15 min from Time Square (left outside Hotel for both). We travelled by subway a lot. (If going to Ground Zero/Century 21, take the downtown number 4 or 5 on green line to Fulton Street), journey time < 10 min. Well signposted and a $7 metro ticket will cover the return journey for 2 people. Deli next door, (about $20 for breakfast, french toast and coffee x 2) however if like me you hate paper plates and plastic knives and forks, try the Pershing Square Restaurant. (left at hotel, 5 min walk. The Breakfasts were fab, about $42 inc tip for two breakfasts and coffee. Be warned Juice is about $7 a glass, as is cereal, we declined and just had a main and coffee. The brioche was the nicest I'd ever tasted. For Lunch i'd recommend the Porter House, in the Time Warner building,10 Columbus Circle, (corner of Central Park). Only lunch though, we went here last year on a friends recommendation and dinner cost us $200. Lunch is $25 per person for three courses, the best steak we had ever tasted ( lunch special offered 7 days a week). After lunch we strolled down 5th Ave, visiting Abercrombie and Fitch and the Disney store, Tommy Hilfiger are renovating a building on 5th Ave, not sure when it's opening. For bargain shopping I'd recommend Jersey Gardens over Woodbury Common, $80 for two returns to Woodbury and 1 hr on bus. $21 return for 2 to Jersey Gardens and only 1/2 hr journey. Bus leaves from Port Authority for both. We like Tommy Hilfiger and the one at Jersey Gardens had pleny of bargains. A taxi to Manhattan cost around $60 each way inc tips and tolls. We took the bus $54 return for the two of us. It drops you at Grand Central. Turn right and about a 5 min walk to hotel. Slightly Slower option as it collects at all terminals, journey time about 45 min. Remember this city is always busy and noise can be a problem at night. I bought ear plugs and slept soundly. This was our second visit to New York and although our hotel last year was a 5*, I would chose the Helmsley over it any day. Best and friendliest staff ever. Well done Helmsley, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: littleinnovations
Reviews.Content: Just back from a most enjoyable 6 night stay in the Helmsley. We had a really nice, spacious room on the corner with a view of the Empire State Building and the streets outside. The hotel is under 5mins walking distance from Grand Central station so you can go anywhere from there or you can walk to town either as it's not too far from the main attractions. We chose a room only option and went to either Pax next door or the Comfort Diner on 45th St for breakfast. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Free wireless internet was an excellent feature as we were able to research places to go from the comfort of our room and save on money too. Overall I'd have no hesitation in recommending this place to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Room, Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: disneygirl9064
Reviews.Content: Stayed week of 2/7 to 2/14. Hotel is nice, lobby etc well kept. Room very clean, beds very comfy, nice linens. Bathroom spotless. Carpets and decor slightly dated, but well kept. Front desk, valet parking, doormen etc wonderfully helpful and pleasant. Restaurant staff was snotty. Food below average and expensive. $28 for a standard breakfast for 1 person. Don't waste your money. There are tons of good restaurants within a block or two. Our only problem was the heating system. Stayed on the 39th floor, and room was 82 degrees on check in. (My travel alarm clock has a thermometer on it) Turned OFF heat, opened windows. Went out for 5 hours, came back room 76 degrees. The engineer was quickly called and came right away. But unable to help much, they use a hot water powered system. It's all heat, all the time. He did provide us with a box fan, but we had the fan running 24/7, the thermostat turned off, and windows wide open all week to keep room <76 degrees. So not a lot of privacy since windows/curtains open all the time, and very very noisy due to traffic and city noise. Only alternative was to swelter. Public areas like hallways, lobby etc always WAY too warm. So I probably won't stay here again, which is kind of a shame. It is a nice hotel, with nice rooms and staff, Excellent location, and a reasonable price. But just too hot for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved the Helmsley and can't wait to go back. I miss NY!”
Reviews.Author: flora_eliza
Reviews.Content: After many searches of hotels in new york and reading many negative comments about each hotel. i finally decided for the Helmsley which had less negative comments. I was a bit worried about the deco (flowers not my thing) and the fact that we got such a good deal from Expedia-i thought we were definately going to end up with a room that was on the lower floors and would be noisy as hell. even though i requested a room on the high floors, i was not convinced that i would get a good room. we arrive at the hotel on a friday and check in was a breeze!!! so easy. the receptionist girls were all very nice and friendly. the door men helped with our bags and they were so freindly. our room, 2214, was so good/clean and did not have the decoration that i saw on expedia (flowers an all). it was modern and not 80's deco as described by others. i was happy that we got a high floor with a good view of the chrysler. the bed were comfy, so very comfy. If i was leaving in newyork i would seriosuly ask them about where they got them!! We had a flat screen TV in our room which was huge and had a good selection of channels. our room was cleaned everyday, anything we requested was done (the first day we requested an extra bathrobe and it arrived immediately. same with the remote control). when we came in at night, there was security to check that we had our room keys (which i found very reassuring!). OVERALL I CANT SAY ENOUGH ABOUT THIS HOTEL APART FROM THAT WE LOVED EVERY SINGLE MINUTE WE SPENT IN IT! the location was just brilliant, 3 blocks from grand central, 5 mins from times sqaure, top of the rock. 10 mins from ESB, Macy's. We even walked down to Batttery park!! you can walk to all the major tourist site! I would definately stay here again. probably will not book another hotel if the helmsley has rooms!! One thing to warn you about--the mini bar-has ticker! if you remove a product for longer that 20 seconds. it registers to your room account. it was a good thing we noticed with a 5 seconds to go!!!

Reviews.Title: “New York Helmsley - Loved it. Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: feejam
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley is just excellent! It is located very close to Grand Central Station and 10-15 minutes walk from times square. The rooms are huge, spotlessly clean and the beds are massive. The staff on reception are extremely friendly and very helpful. Having to been to New York a few times and stayed in other hotels, I would definitely recommend the New York Helmsley and am looking forward to visiting it again!! Great Value - Great Location - Great Housekeeping - Great Time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: T_vodka
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 3 nights from the 17th jan 2009. Fantastic stay from the moment we checked in to the moment we left in the taxi. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We emailed ahead and asked if it would be possible with a room with a view. When we checked in the lady said we received your email and you have your room with a view......she was right. 36th floor and the Chrysler Building to the left in great view. The room was spotless and the beds and towels if needed where cleaned every day. Definately stay here again and will recommend to anyone to stay here. In walking distance everywhere, Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park...We even walked to Battery Park from here!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and location at great value”
Reviews.Author: Timor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in mid-January. We found excellent quality, a reasonably-sized room, and friendly and effective staff. Great value in Hotels.com sale - only â‚¬102 a night in mid-Manhattan. In room breakfast was excellent, just as we ordered it. We dined in-house one night in Mindy's restaurant, which had more staff than diners; quality was ok but even the Price Fixe menu was costly. Only mild criticisms - no coffee-maker, and very hot room (but window opens to let in nice and very cold air - 16F or minus 8C when we were there! - and E41St was quiet). We found that Osteria Laguna, directly across E42nd St from the hotel, provided good dinners - nicely cooked, balanced and sensible, and reasonably priced. Nice wines too at reasonable prices - recommended. PAX deli next door serves quick and good quality food and coffee (including breakfast) but bacon & eggs are never the same off a plastic plate!

Reviews.Title: “xmas holiday”
Reviews.Author: walesdolly
Reviews.Content: Hemsley Hotel 42nd st New york. 27th december 2008.-3rd January 2009. myself and my family would like to thank all the wonderful staff at this lovley hotel for making our stay such a happy time. we will return again in the near future. many thanks to fabian and sam for the delicious cocktails and company they provided us with most evenings. The welcome each day from the the staff working at the front of the hotel was always warm and friendly. The beds were to die for ,so comfortable it was like lying on a cloud after walking around the city allday. Thank you all once again, Angela & Billy coslett & family. wales.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ekkygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in March 2008 and was really impressed overall with this hotel. The room was spotless the bed was nicely made up daily The reception staff were polite and friendly as were the bar staff. We looked at the resteraunt but chose not to eat there as there was so much else nearby. The prices in the resteraunt are not overly expensive its just that there are some really nice eateries nearby The negative comments on these reviews cannot possibly be about this hotel and must be either a mistake or malicious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vivoli
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley is well situated. We stayed in an executive room - two double beds. Room was clean, relatively quiet (it was on the tenth floor) and nowhere is free from the occasional cop, ambulance, fire siren! View was great - we could see the Chrysler Tower just next door. The Helmsley is only a short walk from Grand Central and not far from Times Square. Fifth Avenue is also not far away. Costs about 7 dollars by taxi. Bill for a taxi to or from JFK is about 50 dollars including tolls so about 60 dollars including tip. Takes about an hour or 90 minutes depending on traffic. Hotel staff were always helpful. Breakfast though very expensive...there are plenty of diners etc nearby though, one right next door in fact. Overall I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amykff
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the helmsley. My room was spacious with plenty of light and looked right out onto the chrysler building...was cleaned everyday...bed was soooo comfortable! I don't think you could find a better location in the city...short walk to subway, times square, empire state building etc. Bar was small but nice to have a drink there before heading out. Restaurant was not for me...went there 2days for breakfast didnt enjoy either of them...and it was quite expensive. Theres a little bakery right beside the hotel where you can get a lovely breakfast and cheap too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Windy”
Reviews.Author: Fern3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and had a big room. Good points - Location. Centrally located, it's easy to walk to most attractions. And being near the gorgeous Grand Central Station means that you can hop on the Subway for longer trips. - Breakfast. Lovely, although expensive (and they add 19% service charge). - Room. Ours was bigger than we were expecting, and had all that we wanted. Comfortable beds. Not so good points - We were on the 39th floor, and the wind literally whistled through our room (going outwards from the corridor). The noise kept us awake. In the end we had to put pillows along the base of the door, which made it much quieter. I believe tall buildings are designed to allow wind to blow through, otherwise they would blow over! But it isn't much fun when the wind comes through your room. Avoid room 3920. - Expensive internet access. Although they have free wifi, not everyone wants to take a laptop on holiday. There are two PCs in the lobby, which guest can use, but it costs a whopping 10 dollars for 15 minutes. Very costly if you just want to check your e-mails.

Reviews.Title: “A Must - if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: scratch1927
Reviews.Content: Christmas in New York - Expectation were high Arrived late ( 12.45am) after a long flight. Check-in was so smooth, reception staff couldn't do enough for us. We had asked for a fridge in our room (which can be requested F.O.C). This they sent up as soon as we arrived. Knowing that Tea/Coffee making facilities where not available in the room we packed a kettle. So on arrival we asked for some milk and the bar staff fell over themselves to accommodate our request. The room was very clean (just a little dated) the beds were so comfortable we didn't want to get out of them. There is a very good deli next door where you can buy breakfast / Salads, very good sandwiches & cakes. Great to take up to room after a long day walking around New York. 24hr Pharmacy (sells all sorts) just on the corner. You can easily walk to Times square (10 - 15 mins) and the metro is just 2 mins, which will take you all over (at a very good price of $24 for the week). If I had one criticism it would be the restaurant. Food poor & costly, staff require more customer Service training. Oliver Tree (Time Square) for an Italian meal is a must. Quality food at a very reasonable price. Staff lovely We are looking forward to going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Racquel1982
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with our stay at the New York Helmsley, considering the price we paid! The rooms were clean and spacious and the staff were really friendly. The bar in the hotel was quite small but the food was really good and reasonably priced. The hotel is in a good location with a subway nearby and a 10-15 min walk to 5th Ave, Central Park and Times Square. There were plenty of restaurants nearby, 24 hour pharmacy and a few shoe shops. I would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay at the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: Erin_Dan
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at the Helmsley was at about midnight and after 8hrs on a plane, were looking forward to getting to the hotel and grabbing a coffee or a bite. From outside it looks like something out of a film, very bling, if not a bit seventies. Arriving at the hotel: the doorman let us struggle through the door with our own bags, not a great start, and the woman behind the desk acted most upset that she had to deal with some customers. Her manner was poor, bordering on rude, when she laid down the law about how she would charge my credit card for potential damage to the room which, she was eluding to, was the 'approval' to see if the credit on the card was good. My faith in the hotel was falling. We asked if we could get a drink.... No was the answer. The bar was shut, room service was closed too and she didn't know of anywhere nearby to get a drink at that hour. By the way, we'd visited NYC before and knew that there would be somewhere - we just didnt know where in that neighbourhood and found somewhere a few days later. Our first room on the 19th floor, was cold, had broken heat, an even more broken door lock that took many to open (we went down to reception and it took 15min for anyone to show). The room was okay - broken hairdrier, good view, nice TV, great bed, though it was a little shabby. A call down to reception about the heat was ignored. Next morning we showered, in the cold (it was 13F outside so the room wasn't much more) and headed down to reception. We complained and was told that these issues would be resolved immediately. They weren't. Most of the reception staff didn't care and had to look up simple info like when the bar was supposed to be open etc. It took several more calls and a final visit to reception when the issue was finally escalated and we were moved to the 31st floor to a better (less broken) but smaller room with a better view. The new room solved most of the issues, though the doorlock was still intermittently faulty - a fault most of the other guests we spoke to seemed to agree with. The director also kindly sent a bottle of bubbly to try make it right which we appreciated and went some way to salvaging our trip. To be honest, we were so tired of complaining that we left the remaining issues outstanding as it was really spoiling our trip. Room service was dire at all times. Always at least 35+ minutes if you wanted just a coffee (no facilities in the room) and the bar regularly didnt have coffee (this is NYC for Christ's sake!). Lucky there were 2 starbucks within a block or two though it was very dissapointing not to be able to have breakfast in bed a couple of times or at least a drink before setting out. If you have to stay here, I'd recommend the mini market on 2nd ave (right out of the hotel, right again onto second and it's on the right). And for breakfast - also on Second Ave - the Townhouse Cafe had the NICEST staff and the food was great value. On the left hand side, a couple of blocks down on the left hand side of second. Conclusion. Wouldn't stay here. The Helmsley wasn't cheap and last year we paid a little more for the Hilton Times Square which was light years better in terms of facilities and service. Unless there's big improvements, I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great Base but.....”
Reviews.Author: 051411f
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were very impressed, the location is great. And the frontage is impressing. I took my case out of the taxi, did the hotel help? did they [----]. Me and my 8 month pregnant wife hauled our bags in with no offer of assistance. despite a previous email asking for a high floor we were given 4th. I complained and was given 26th, very nice. Be aware the glass in the helmsley is paper thin, my wife needed ear plugs. Then we thought wed have a drink, bug mistake, 3 shots of whisky and a soda water and an hour later, $50!!!!!! $8 per half pint!! in short a great local, a nice hotel, clean and spacious rooms, bit avoid that bar!, unless you want to remortgage your house.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Raz868
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for one week in mid december. We absolutely loved the stay here, apart from a few hassels with the room(which I will get to later). Location of this hotel is so great, in east midtown on a busy street(42th) with aprox 15-20 min walk to times square and 25-30 min walk to central park. The hotel is right next to Chrysler Building and Grand Central Terminal, which is great for the subway (which we didnt use much of, instead we walked pretty much everywhere, location being so convenient) Our room was very huge and just great; we had two double beds (the biggest and most comfortable beds ever), a near spotless bathroom with a huge bathtub, a flat screen tv, and big windows which made the room well lit up. We did however had some issues though; there was a problem with the toilet and upon arrival the windows couldn't be sealed shut, resulting in some noise from traffic the first night, even being on 33rd floor(im a very light sleeper). The next day we spoke to reception and there was a guy to help us in 5 minutes. People at front desk were very kind, helping with all kind of questions. Very nice. There was a restaurant at the hotel that looked nice; we never tried it though as we always ate out. Same with breakfast, we took food from PAX next door(cheap and good) to our hotel room, or went to Pershing Square (not cheap but good) right opposite Grand Central Terminal. Pershing Square also had good valuable lunch and dinner. There's also a good mexican restaurant near the hotel which is recommended; it's called El Rio Grande and it's on 38th street just off 3th ave. I highly recommend this hotel for it being so good located, the friendliness of the staff and the cleanliness and high standard of the rooms. Me and my girlfriend had our best vacation in NY and hope to return; there were simply so many things that we didnt have time to do while there, new york city truly is an amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: Jimbob72
Reviews.Content: My third trip to New York and second to the Helmsley New York. This time it was a mix of business and pleasure. We arrived late (from JFK) and the hotel was the usual buzz of similar travellers and airline cabin crew that use the hotel due to its superb location. We asked for a high-up room and were rewarded with a 37th floor view of the Empire State and, towering over the hotel, the Chrysler Building. It was superb. The room was also very big and larger than when I last stayed. Service excellent again - though didn't really make use of the facilities. And the room was extremely clean and in good condition. But the best thing about this hotel is the location. More or less anywhere in central and downtown Manhattan is walkable and the area feels like proper NYC. Getting a taxi from the front door is easy and if you just happen to be a little worse for wear leaving a venue and don't want to struggle with avenues and streets, simply saying the 'Chrysler building' is enough to get you home. All in all, excellent and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time In NYC”
Reviews.Author: dhbrose
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec 7 & 8, 2008. Booked a double-double using a Travelzoo discount code for $259+taxes/night. So at this rate it was a great value and a great location. We were provided a south facing room on the 32nd floor. Staff was great. Only minor complaint was the parking. We had phoned ahead and were told by reservations staff that hotel parking was $45/day. Turned out to be $51. Should have gotten car out immediately but was too tired. Discovered there were several garages behind the hotel in the $35-40 range. Told front desk staff that since the valet parking is not part of the hotel they should advise guests of the lower cost alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Was not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: G0retti
Reviews.Content: Just back from 6 nights at this hotel and have to say it came up to my expectations of a good quality hotel. The lobby area when you come in first was very impressive, porters very attentive and girls on reception very friendly. The plush red carpet and the carpeting throughout the hotel was excellent. The rooms were upmarket, and I felt like I was being pampered staying at this hotel. I stayed on the 8th floor and found the room very comfortable, heating just right. We could turn it off if we got too hot by a switch on the wall and we could open the window if we needed fresh air. I never heard any traffic or noise as I slept at night, as reported by others on this site. My daughter and son were staying on the street side of the hotel and they had the same experience. Now the only thing I did not like was the food, but that was not particular to this hotel. The dining room had a nice ambience though and the waiters very professional. I found that most of the food in New York was greasy, heavy and sickening. The location is very central and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to my friends and would certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Daliada
Reviews.Content: Great great great! We found a great rate at hotels.com. The hotel is very nice, the room we had was huge with two double beds, the bathroom was big an clean, the towels were changed every day. The decoration is updated but who cares when you are in New York! Just 200 mts from Grand Central and a few minutes from 5th avenue. The 42 st is very nice and you have a lot of shops and restaurants around. It is not "in the middle of everyhting" but it is in a nice walking ditance to everywhere. The service at the reception was also very good, why didn't try the restaurants as they were overpriced. Get comfy shoes and start walking the big apple!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DunKev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for a weekend at the New York Helmsley and were extremely happy with our choice. The service was excellent (friendly, efficient and accommodating). We had a large, comfortable and clean room on the 40th floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building. Overall - excellent location, service, accomodations and value!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathysa
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed here the night after Thanksgiving. A nice hotel, friendly staff. Our room had 2 double beds and was a decent size room by NYC standards. I'd stay here again and would also recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great Thanksgiving getaway”
Reviews.Author: SouzRi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the NY Helmsley. My husband, 2 children and I came into the city to see the Macy's Parade. The hotel was a good location especially if you come into Grand Central Station. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to Times Square. The staff was very helpful, polite and efficient. The room was clean and decent size for 4 people. The only complaint was that the room was a little warm and there seemed to no way to cool it down unless we opened the window. Also, we did hear street noise which was surprising because we were on the 26th floor. overall we were pleased with the hotel and would stay again if we could get the same "special rate".

Reviews.Title: “The Helmsley really grew on us!”
Reviews.Author: Oz1Sydney
Reviews.Content: Just be aware that there seem to be different grade rooms available. We checked in after midnight and were told there were no King deluxe rooms available, despite requesting and paying for one in advance. The room we were given, on the 16th floor was very disappointing. It had 2 double beds and the decor was very tired. None of the features listed in the hotel guide were there - no flat screen tv, no robes, no safe, although there was a small fridge in the bathroom(!) The carpet was dirty and very stained and the pillows smelt old and smoky. There were no glasses, just plastic cups. This just didn't feel right?! The next morning we asked to change rooms. The lady on reception was very friendly and helpful. We were moved to the 22nd floor and the room was a 100% improvement - clean, spacious and very comfortable. Although the decor is in a bit of a 1980s timewarp, the Helmsley is a great hotel. It's in a good location, with a comfortable bar area and good cafes and restaurants just a short stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLadyLondon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited the Helmsley as a bit of a girlie holiday. We were a little dubious at first as we got a really good deal and assumed that there must be a reason for it! We were wrong. I emailed in advanced and asked for a high level room and got an email back straight away saying our request had been acknowledged. We arrived early and our request had been accepted and we went staright to our room, which was a great start. Rooms are clean and basic (and floral!!). The bathrooms are a little dated, we infact debated whether there were supposed to be art deco fittings or whether had had just been left since the hay days. To be fair we didnt spend much time in the hotel, but what we did we enjoyed. Majority of the staff were really great, except one of the receptionist who always looked me up and down and had a very snotty attitude whenever I spoke to here. We always had breakfast nextdoor, great little place for the morning bagel and orange juice! All in all we had a fab time, hotel is in great location and the majority of staff were very friendly. I would def recommend and I will def be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Friendly reception staff”
Reviews.Author: skibb
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend for Marathon, found all the public areas to be very clean and modern and the reception staff were very friendly on arrival and departure, as with other reviewers i found the bedrooms old fashioned but at all times they were kept clean and in good condition. i stayed on the 12th floor and could hear traffic noise clearly each night. overall i had a good experience here and left with a posative impression of the Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “The New York Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: gary1987
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a very good base would stay here again could do with tea machine in the rooms we were up one morning at 4.30am could do with a cup fo tea, room services in at 7.00am

Reviews.Title: “Great location; showing its age”
Reviews.Author: Phil2016
Reviews.Content: First, and perhaps most important when in NYC, the location can't be beat. Less than two blocks to access subways at Grand Central. I stayed for two nights (Weds/Thurs), booked in a king room. I'm a Hilton Diamond, but couldn't find a Hilton property <$500/night for this trip, so found this alternative at hotels.com for $360/night. When you arrive, you literally walk right into the registration desk. There isn't much lobby to speak of, which means at peak times, it can get quite congested and hectic at check-in. Still, check-in was friendly and prompt. I got my keys and headed to my room. Unfortunately no keys worked, I returned downstairs and got new keys. When I got into the room, I walked into a room already occupied (thankfully the guests were not there). It turns out the front desk wrote the wrong room number on my key folder (thus why the first keys didn't work). They then wrote the correct room number, another set of keys, and back up I went to find a double/double room, not a king, which I had reserved. After my third trip back downstairs, they corrected it and upgraded me to a corner premiere floor with an LCD-TV. The rooms and the hotel is definitely showing its age, but perhaps that is part of the appeal they are going for. It reminds me of the Waldorf in style...floral bedspreads and drapes; really looks like something out of the early 80's. Bed is comfortable, though linens are not the best quality. Pipes are quite loud, but given the age of many buildings in NYC, that isn't too unusual. The room and bathroom are generously sized (#3719) by NYC standards. Room service was quick, though quality was lacking and didn't match the price ($38 total bill for breakfast). WiFi is free in all rooms and public areas, a real rarity at higher end hotels. Good speed, though it does slow down a bit in the evening hours. The fitness center on the 6th floor has a good supply of cardio equipment (maybe 4-5 treadmills, 2 elipticals, and 2 bikes) as well as dumbbells (though no bench) and a small supply of machine weights. To save money, as I did, this is a good alternative. But personally, I wouldn't choose this over my usual properties in NYC (Doubletree on Lex, Hilton on Sixth, or Millenium Hilton downtown). I base that on quality of the bedding and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “The best in New York!!”
Reviews.Author: THETRUEMEZ
Reviews.Content: When we were planning our trip to New York we were very apprehensive BUT this Hotel is absolutely the best place to stay. The rooms are very spacious and all appear to have been refurbished to a high standard. The bed is huge and super comfortable, pillows great, air conditioning and heating [all through one unit] was great too.The bathroom gives you choice of tub or shower and the towels are high quality. The room has a safe and hair dryer and 'his and hers' dressing gowns and if you request it, they will send a refrigerator up to you room and set it up [invaluable for your bottled water, beer/wine for the room]. Once your reservation is confirmed send them and email request for the refrigerator before you travel and it will be on their system when you check in. They do not provide tea or coffee making facilities but room service will provide this for you all day long and not expensive. We were on the 29th floor and there was virtually zero traffic/horn blowing noise. The lifts are high speed and with six lifts runnig all the time, you have no waiting about, even on a busy check out period. We had booked an Executive King Room through 'Hotels.com' but you can book direct through the Hotel too. The staff are excellent in every respect. The bell hops are cheary guys and whilst you need to tip them all, it is part of the New York experience. A guy called Bernado checked us in and he was mega polite and helpful; but so was every member of hotel staff that we spoke to. They gave us a voucher for a free bottle of wine if we dined in the Hotel Restaurant, which we did on the first night and the ambiance and food in the restaurant was superb; The food was excellent and we both went for the New York stripp steak-one cooked medium and one well done and they were both cooked to perfection. The free bottle of wine was a superb bottle of Chardonnay [there was a choice] and it was not expensive in our view.The Restaurant Captain was very attentive and a most pleasant guy with a good sense of humour. The concierge was excellent and advised on all local restaurants/ Diners and sight seeing and marked up maps for you- we went one evening to 'O'Niels Irish Bar and Restaurant' a stroll from the Hotel and had a great evening there and had Dublin Bangers with Mash and Onions and it was great -very reasonably priced BUT very busy in the dining area -all the food that we saw served up looked super.Back at the hotel, the concierge checked out our train departures for Long Island and were most helpful.The Helmsley Hotel is located at 212 East 42nd Street and it was, in our view, a super location to get around. Checking out was also a painless experience.SO, IF YOU ARE GOING TO NEW YORK DEFINATELY STAY HERE- IT IS BRILLIANT!! A couple of other things you might find of assistance: Getting a cab between 4pm and 8pm can be a pain but be patient. DO NOT take a non yellow cab-plenty of Lincoln type cars will stop and wave a taxi card at you but these are unregulated in New York and are not recommended to use as you can get ripped off big time. The yellow cabs are pretty cheap [compared to London Black Cabs] If you are going to New York for the first time, mixing sight seeing and shopping is a mighty task to undertake and you are on the go every hour of every day; if you can, spread it over 4 days minimum and it is then both manageable and enjoyable that way. We highly recommend the Gray Lines open top Red Buses which are 'hop on hop off' BUT buy the tickets on line first as it is cheaper [from the UK anyway] We paid $44 each for a 2 day pass which was great value and gave us 48 hour access to the three loops. These were 'Uptown loop' [Central Park and Harlem etc]'Downtown Loop' which covers all the rest of NY Sights and then the 'Brooklyn loop' but we did not go on this last loop due to lack of time [needed an extra day for this really]. The ticket also included the night tour which is NOT hop on hop off. Once on it, it lasts about 2 hours seeing the NY Skyline lit up. With the Gray Lines 48 hour ticket you also get a free ticket for the NY Water taxis so you can get over to see the Statue of Liberty. BE AWARE that you will queue for these buses but it only takes a 20 to 30 minute wait max and you get on -everybody wants to be on the top deck of course so it takes a while for the buses to get around through traffic -there are other bus service providers but Gray Lines are the best. We do recommend that you take the Staten Island ferry -it's free and you get the best views of Manhattan and Ellis Island and the Staue of Liberty and it only takes 20 minutes each way with the boats running all the itme ALSO, if you want theatre tickets DO NOT book these at home. Go to the Marriot hotel in Times Square and go the the ticket office there as the tickets are half price. If you want to go up the Empire State Building, get there for 9.30 or 10am or you will dislike the queues and crowding- early is the very best time to visit and worth the money for the experience and the view. GIRLS -if you want UGG Boots there is a shop called DAVID Z.COM yards from the Empire State [there are a few in NY-check it out on line before you travel] and they have a great selection PLUS they do the Classic tall boot for $167 INC TAX and this is about $40 cheaper than Bloomingdales.Also, if the GUYS like Cons or Vans, these are cheap here too -Converse about $43 INC TAX If you want super cheap designer gear you MUST go to 'CENTURY 21' which is opposite Ground Zero/World Trade Centre site. Top designers really really cheap BUT be warned it is VERY busy in there with serious buyers. IF you are travelling on Long Island, we recommend both the LIRR Railway [you get it from Penn Station under Madison Square Garden] -it is very clean and safe as every train has guards/ticket collectors and it is easy to use. It runs ON TIME!! Also, if you want to see Long Island [if you are going up to the Hamptons] try the 'Hampton Jitney' -a luxery coach and whilst twice the train fare, it is very efficient and good views. Check it out on line for time of trains and buses -it's dead easy and again, they ALL run on time. If you do go up to Montauk, at the tip of Long Island, check out the light house and the local views BUT for the best dining go to the 'HARVEST ON FORT POND' this is a real food experience. Not only is this a superb restaurant and very nice ambiance, the food is very different is two respects - Firstly, the food is most excellent in every way but Secondly, this is a 'family meal restaurant' which means that when you order sometihng a HUGE PORTION arrives and it is for the family to share -it is not recommended to try this restaurant unless there is a minimum of Four or you will need to take away a dooggie bag [or doggie carrier bag]. This goes for all items on the menu, so when you see a Pizza for $17 DO NOT think it is for one -it is HUGE. Again, if you are going to Long Island make a day to visit a TANGER OUTLET [we went to the RIVERHEAD Location] - this is dying and going to shopping heaven and ALL at major discounts and I kid you not on that one!!! BUT BE WARNED - It is massive in size and it will take you all day to get around it -plently of choice to eat in the food court though. We recommend a car to get to this place by the way and it is a LONG WAY from central New York and not a a day trip. Well, we hope that helps any of you that have hotel choice concerns and especially if it is your first trip to New York. It is a great place to visit BUT if you do not plan it properly, it could be a nightmare -SO spend some time on the internet and plan your trip -REMEMBER to take trainers or good walking shoes because NY is vast and what seems short on the map is not quite as short as you think it is. Last thing if you live in the UK -get the 'AA Guide to New York' -easy to carry and invaluable -it was the best thing we invested in and a week or so pre-read helped us plan a memerable trip.GOOD LUCK & HAVE FUN!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenKad
Reviews.Content: Professional and friendly staff. Check-in easy and effective. Late check out made possible. Very good location. Good bar. Food is not worse it. For breakfast I reccommend PAX deli next door. The desk in the room was a bit small. The power outlets where hangin out of the wall. Room was too old - needs to be renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice !”
Reviews.Author: Wisali
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to New York, amazing city. Our experience was enhanced by the Helmsley hotel which was well worth it, in terms of service provided and the value for money. It`s location is excellent, a walking distance to the 5th avenue, time square, broadway and central park. There is a good bus service as well as underground links which takes you north and south of the city. The staff were very helpful and friendly and they walk that extra mile to help you as much as they can. I would highly recommand this hotel and will definitely stay there again. We paid around $400 / night including all taxes. Please feel free to contact me if you need any help before your trip to new york. I will be very happy to help. Hope you enjoy your stay too. Thanks Wisam Ali London

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for the sights”
Reviews.Author: mickosull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in august 2008 with my wife and 10 year old son, We had 2 doublebeds, and a fab view, this hotel is perfect for your average tourist, This is my first time back in new york for 20 years and my family has never been. it is 10 min walk from time square and broadway. 2-3 min walk from central station and 30 secs - 1 min from the cryslar building. very clean and staff very helpfull. we found the security very reassuring as my wife was a little nervous with " The big city " . A+ all round.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in an amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: d00ley2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley in February this year for my Birthday. From the first look at the hotel as we got out of the yellow cab was wow. We was very impressed with the Staff, Room, Cleanliness & location. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a great hotel, this ISN'T it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelDrew
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley may have been a nice hotel at one time, but that time is long gone. This is a worn and tired hotel, with old rooms, old carpet, old painting, and old bedding. While the newish flat screen TV in the rooms may convince some that this is a modern hotel, it serves the same function as lipstick on a pig. The hotel staff was, quite frankly, rude. My wife and I checked in, unfortunately, at the same time a large group was checking out. Instead of attempting to help the group, or individual travelers such as my wife and I, many members of the hotel staff decided to hide in their glass enclosed offices. When I confronted one, asking for help, he responded, "I'm busy." Then went to play with something on his computer screen. Check-in took more than 20 minutes. Several times during our stay, the keycard reader for our room became inoperable, requiring a trek down to the main lobby (40 floors down), to have a new key issued. This is unacceptable in a major hotel. Checkout was also no breeze. The rate charged was HIGHER than the rate initialed at check in. The manager denied the rate was different, but upon my demand that she find the paper that I initialed, she admitted that there was a mistake. Be warned: look very closely a the rate your initialing. This hotel seems to play fast and loose with rates. Bottom line: I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. It needs to be renovated, and the staff needs to be overhauled.

Reviews.Title: “bell boy attitude”
Reviews.Author: catwoman04
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 1 week stay in new york staying at the new york helmsley. a great hotel within walking distance of the empire state building, central park, great shops, chrysler builder, united nations, grand central station and times square. the room was excellent and the staff were always polite and helpful. although we only ate once in the restaurant the food was good we used the deli next door (pax) and the food area in grand central station. the only one problem we had was on our last day when we checked out and we put our luggage in a secure room the bell boy on duty that morning must have got out of bed on the wrong side because he had a serious attitude and was quite rude. we were going to tip him on our return, but he made it quite clear he wanted a tip there and then we have no problem tipping its all part of a visit to america, he even asked what time we would be returning for our cases is this because he wanted another tip, luckly he wasn't on duty when we got back and we we dealt with a much nicer bell boy. apart from this one problem we would stay again and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting new york.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Great location for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: LeonardCohenFan44
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (inc 2 teens) who stayed a week at the New York Helmsley recently. We found it to be very comfortable and well located for day trips as many of the tourists spots are well within walking distance. Also the train station is only a couple of blocks away. The area is very safe at night and not too noisy if you stay in a higher floor room. We found the hotel staff courteous and friendly and would be happy to stay here again. The Pershing Square diner about two blocks to the left when you leave the hotel is a great spot for breakfast. Pax deli next door to hotel is good too, and cheaper, but too few seats in it when its busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jerome_worcester
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based mainly on the comments from this websitre but were not 100% sure due to some negative comments. When we arrived there, everything was great. the room was all we wanted, very clean, all you need was there and a great bathroom. All was very clean and we did not have one complain for the 4 nights we were there. On top of that, our room had direct view of the chrysler building. Magical ! You can not ask for better location at that price. You are 5 minutes away from Grand central station (from where you can take the underground to down or uptown), 15 from the Empire state building. You have plenty of deli's around and the staff is always helpful. Went to PAX for breakfast everymorning (deli next to the hotel) and it was a great breakfast, real newyoker breakfast. All in all, a great hotel JErome & Rebecca

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: adri1493
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NY Helmsley Aug. 8th - 13th and it was absolutely wonderful. I purchased my stay mostly based on the reasonable price, cleanliness, and location. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor about the service, I was pleased with booking the hotel however, once I arrived, the service from everyone at the hotel was a bonus. The rooms were great (regardless of what other reviews might have said about the decor). Yes, it is not ultra-chic but there is nothing wrong about it. I had a couple of nieces staying at one of the latest modern hotels (which I won't mention by name) and they paid just as much as I did and our room was triple in size. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We had the Holiday of a Lifetime !!!”
Reviews.Author: Steve095
Reviews.Content: We (family of four) have just returned home after staying for a week at the Helmsley and had the holiday of a lifetime, all of the previous reviews/photos on tripadvisor really helped us. Staff very friendly and helpful, location brilliant ie very near to Grand Central, we purchased 7 day subway/bus metro cards for $25 each (real bargin). Fausto the bell hop a top-man with great tips of where to eat breakfast (try the Comfy Diner a couple of blocks north from 42nd street) or Dinner (try Palm Too if you like lobster/steaks). Get your coffee from next door in the local PAX take-away as no tea/ coffee making facilities in hotel rooms (no real hasstle for us). Concierge were really helpful as well booking (with the personal touch) e.g. limo to take us back to Airport, helicopter flights etc (with costs the same as you would get elsewhere). Our rooms were on the 26th floor in the rear of the Hotel looking over the Empire State Building......fab We would have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel. This is my first ever review sorry its a bit dis-jointed !!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: gibraltarr
Reviews.Content: We got a good price - about $225 a night for 4 sharing I asked for a room with a good view, we were on 27th floor and could see the Chrysler building. We did not hear any street noise at this level. Hotel was clean, safe, lifts always available and the location near to Grand Central Terminal was good. When it was cool in the morning or evening it was within walking distance to 5th Avenue and Bryant Park. I visited UN building which was a very short walk away. Can't find anything to fault.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July Madness”
Reviews.Author: weski
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for the 4th of July to see the Fireworks. The hotel was filled to the fills, with many, many foreigners in the for holiday. The line to checkin went to the door, but did move. We stayed on the 22nd floor in a double-double. It was fine - comfortable clean beds, decent, but not glamerous bathroom. Overlooked 41st Street - not a problem. Comfy chair, desk, flat screen TV. TIP for 4th of July - We thought we would get a bite around 7 pm before the 9 pm fireworks. The street was already packed with people lining up to get through the checkpoints (at 42nd St) to go down by the FDR Drive to see the fireworks. All the nearby restaurants, bars, etc. were filled with waiting lines. We got in line and went down to the river. We stood in amongth thousands of our closest friends behind the chain link fences and jersey walls until 9:30 when the fireworks finally went off. In hindsight, while we were close to the 42nd St. entrance, I would recommend going down near the Seaport for a better view of the fireworks - there are 3 barges in the East River, but we saw it all as one big mash - in the distance. A great disappointment - no music, just a crush. Then made our way back to the hotel - thank goodness it was nearby, but we were thirsy and starving, like everyone else. The line to the restaurant was huge, so we lined up for the bar. Got in, finally, had multiple cold drinks and a small pizza and quesdilla - they were fine. Went to bed. Checkout fine. Don't have to do this again, but if I do, it will be downtown or on someone's downtown roof.

Reviews.Title: “Great Affortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGroove
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley in mid-July 2008 and I can't say enough good things about it. The hotel is located about three blocks east of Grand Central Station, so you don't have a far walk to get to the train. The cab ride there from LaGuardia was about $25, which isn't too bad. The area is quite safe and busy most of the time, so you don't have to be afraid of walking back to your room, even late at night. The hotel is located only a couple blocks away from the Empire State Building, and you are only a shuttle train away from Times Square. The staff was excellent, from the front desk staff to the bellmen. The rooms were nice and decent-sized. I was lucky enough to snag a room on the southeast corner of the hotel, so the room was probably a little bigger than most of the other rooms. I had a problem when I checked in, when my room keys would not open the door. The person at the front desk promptly issued me two new keys and the problem was solved. Overall, a wonderful stay. My stay lasted six days and I feel I got a lot for my money. I would not hesitate to stay at the Helmsley again, and in fact, I plan on staying there during my next visit to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: SurfCity12
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to its location and the value. It is located right down the street from Grand Central which is a main stop for all of the subways. Orbitz had a special on the room rate which made the Helmsley a bargain. As far as the room was concerned we stayed on the 26th floor. You could hear the noise from the streets below, but I suspect that this is the case in most hotels. The room was clean, we had a nice flat panel tv and bath robes. From the time that we entered the hotel to checking out the staff was very helpful. I'd have no problems in staying at the Helmsley once again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great view!”
Reviews.Author: Archie24
Reviews.Content: Great central location, pretty good value too. We stayed for 5 nights and got a great room on 41st floor overlooking the Chrysler building - not good for someone who's scared of heights but I got used to it! Agree with other reviewers that it's better value to avoid hotel breakfast and go to Pax Deli next door, where you can get excellent breakfasts for half the price. Good little gym in the hotel, which always seemed quiet - only a few facilities in there but enough equipment to be able to work off the bagels every morning. The concierge (Frank, I think) was excellent and recommended great restaurants in the neighbourhood on the nights we were too tired to venture back downtown. Dean's Pizza round the corner on 2nd Ave was pretty good value for basic Italian or there's a great little Chinese place on 39th (from memory) where you can bring your own booze. We walked from the hotel to most nearby attractions - Grand Central, Times Square, Empire State building (a bit further away but still around 15 mins walk). Subway lines 4,5,6 from Grand Central take you direct to most of the useful touristy places - uptown to the museums or downtown to Wall Street, South St seaport, Brooklyn Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “not impressive”
Reviews.Author: lynn2536
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very dissappointed in this hotel. The website we booked it on gave it a 4 star rating. It was definitely a 3 star hotel. We were comparing it to the Grand Hyatt 1 block away because we stayed there on our last visit. The staff was great, location was great, and it was very clean with a spacious room. But it was so outdated. The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable with sheets not fitting properly and a very old bedspread. The bathroom wallpaper was starting to come off, and the tub was stained from being old. The water pipes were very loud and bothersome coming from other rooms. This hotel needs to be renovated badly. Also the AC did not work well.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: nic_leb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Helmsley for two nights in June of 2008 for a leisure weekend in the city with my spouse. The hotel is a favorite of my in-laws and I wasn't disappointed. We had a quiet corner king room with a nice bay window on an upper floor. Room size was surprisingly good for an NYC hotel. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. I have to say that the Helmsley is looking a little dated in its decor, BUT the hotel is IMPECCABLY maintained. Nothing that I saw or encountered was spotted, torn, stained, chipped or inoperable. There was a nice upgraded flat panel television in the room. Iron and ironing board both were good and in working order. The bathroom had a marble-topped vanity with many large towels and a handy magnifying mirror. There isn't a mini bar in the room, but there's a nice drugstore just down at the corner in case you need anything. The location is fabulous, walkable to the Public Library, Bryant Park, Grand Central, Times Square, Broadway shows, and all the mid-town attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: debs87
Reviews.Content: Just back from a fantastic few days in New York and was very happy with our choice of hotel. We also went with two teenagers (19 and 16) and had a double, double room. The boys did decide that two in a bed was not for them and used the extra bedding to make a bed on the floor which they took turns in- however the room certainly was not cramped. It was spacious and very clean- as was the hotel overall. The best thing about the Helmsley for us was the location. It was a short walk to Times Square , Grand Central and also to a point of viewing for 4th July fireworks. The staff were always very pleasant and helpful. Our only complaint that it took a long time to get food ordered in the bar. That was not a huge problem and there were plenty of good restaurants within easy walking distance. Will definitely go back to New York and will definitely stay at the Helmsley!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaCanberra
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the NY Helmsley for three nights. I chose to stay there after the reviews I had seen on Trip Advisor. It was a great choice. The room was clean and a good size for NYC. After fellow reviewers suggested PAX nerxt door for breakfast, I did just that. It is a great and cheap place to eat for breakfast and other snacks. The coffee was great. I would stay again at the Helmsley but would not eat in the restaurant again. At 7.00pm on a Sunday night there were only three couples there - no wonder, it was completely overpriced and food was mediocre. It doesn't matter though - everything else was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandHattie
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from trip to Toronto,New York and Niagara. The New York Helmsley was by far the best of the three. The staff were very efficient from the moment we arrived after an exhausting journey by Amtrac from Toronto(not recommended). We were given a choice of room and were not disappointed. Good quality toiletries and bathrobes provided in the room. The meals in the stylish restaurant were good quality and the fixed price of $40 dollars for three courses seemed like good value in very pleasant surroundings with first class service. I can't understand why this hotel is only rated as three stars. I think it deserves four especially since the hotel we stayed at in Niagara was rated four and didn't come anywhere near the quality of service and surroundings of the Helmsley. I have only one negative comment to make and that is - we were very late in arriving and were told we were too late to have a meal or even room service. In Harry's bar we asked if it was possible to get even a sandwich and were told it was not. However we would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel fab city”
Reviews.Author: caseypie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Helmsley for 5 nights in April and absolutely loved the place. From the moment we arrived we were made very welcome. The staff were amazing. Room on 27th floor with amazing view of chrysler building (requested by email 2 weeks prior to visit). fab view all the way down the street past grand central. The room had recently been refurbished and was spot on. The bed was v comfortable and room was spacious. All staff were awesome from the bell boys to the conceierge staff. Do ask for info/ adviise from staff they are very knowledgeable and will go oout of their way to make reservations or enquire about anything you wish. We wanted to watch a premiersip derby match and a member of staff made several phone calls to find the closet place showing the match. Another night we wanted to go to a comedy club and Roxie on conceierge was brilliant and recommended gotham comedy club which was abso amzing - such a funny night - the memories will last forever. Perfect location, perfect hotel - we will defo return to the hotel on our next visit to nyc and will recommend the hotel to family and friends. Could not honestly find a fault. Nothing to complain about at all. We also got engaged whilst in new york which was good...what a city! Thank you for an amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Meijssie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel on a good location. Spacious room with airco. Not too noisy for such a big city. Nice bathroom with bath. Only thing missing was a minibar. There was even a safe and a ironing board and iron. Big nice bed, nice LCD TV. Free internet in the hall, but only one computer. Service was fine and the employees friendly. I can surely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: NCWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at the New York Helmsley from May 22-May 25. When we arrived we were immediately greeted by a hotel employee who helped us with our bags and parked the car. He was extremely pleasant. Inside we did not have to wait on line to check-in as they were ample employees on hand. Check in was a breeze and the bell hop took us up to our room. He too was very nice. I saw complaints from others on this site about the dated furniture. Certainly, the furnishings are not comparable to that of the W hotel, for instance, but it was still very nice and the room was clean. For the entire stay, housekeeping, the concierge, and all of the employees we encountered were wonderful. The location is ideal. It is just a couple of blocks away from Grand Central Station and surrounded by great restaurants. There are also a few Starbucks' close by. It is an easy walk to Times Square, shopping on 5th Avenue and Bryant Park as well as the NY Public Library. There is also a great workout room that I utilized while there. Fresh towels and bottled waters are readily available. There are also security cameras that provide a level of comfort if you are working out alone. The only negative thing I have to say is that the cost of the breakfast buffet was very high. I don't remember the exact price was but there is a restaurant right next door that serves and awesome breakfast at reasonable rates. Overall it was great stay and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunStar1
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley was perfect for our week stay/shopping in New York. Room was large, plenty of space for all the shopping ! Needed some updating, but very clean and had everything we needed. Hotel restaurant was expensive enough, but who needs hotel food when staying in NY! Location was perfect, right beside Grand Central Station. All in all, would definatly recommend the NY Helmsley to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped for space in room for four!”
Reviews.Author: occident
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at New York Helmsly with my family (me, wife and two adult kids). Wanted a good accommodation for the four of us and got the impression that I would get that at Helmsly from booking.com. However the one room for the four of us was very small with only two small beds (smaller than queens). 495 per night was far over rated for what we got. I were rudlyl treated by the management when I explained that something must be wrong and asked for assistance. Due to congress allmost all hotels in New York were full, so we had to stay in the small room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our requirements”
Reviews.Author: SurreyTops
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some of the more 'upmarket' hotels in New York on weekend visits, we were more than happy with the service and room at the New York Helmsley. To be honest, unless you've got cash to splash on the likes of Waldorf Astoria and the Ritz Carlton I would think twice (unless it's a special occassion then that extra mile is worth it). The New York Helmsley, is great value for money in comparison and a great location, with a view of the Chrylser building from some of the rooms! With Grand Central a couple of minutes walk away you can't fault it's location. For a weekend's stay of sight seeing and shopping then I would highly recommend this hotel. For me as long as you've got a comfortable bed, clean room and fully functioning bathroom what else do you really need? On a return visit, I would definitely use this hotel again - don't be put off by the rather outdated bed spread!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Auburnmb
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in room 1074 on May 17th. We were coming off a cruise and arrived at the hotel around 10am. We were able to check in and given a room right when we got there. The only draw back was that since we were checking in so early we couldn't get a better room until 4pm. We had a tour at 3 so we couldn't wait. The only problem with our room was that the shower wouldn't drain at night. But worked fine in the morning?! Strange! We also had a 1pm check out. The maid came around 12:30 to clean our room we told her we had late check-out. I would have assumed she would have been told that. She was very nice though. We didn't have any issues with getting a cab. This hotel is very close to Grand Central Station and the Chrysler building. My boyfriend kept saying what a great location..right where we need to be for the ESB and 42nd Street. I was happy to see that it was a block from a Starbucks! We also lucked out and had a gorgeous day in the City. Friendly staff and easy to check-in/out. Would love to stay there again but w/a better view!

Reviews.Title: “A VERY Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: TheGazz
Reviews.Content: I travel almost every other week to NYC and I had never stayed at a Helmsley Property. I did not think they were my style (on the boutique/contemporary side), and there was just something about the "Queen of Mean" that made me NOT want to stay at her hotels. Well -- between the fact that there was a great rate on Travelzoo and the "Queen of Mean" is no longer...I decided to give it a try. My expectation was that it would be a very snobby and stuffy environment ---boy was I wrong. I book on Travelzoo frequently, and I often get the associated low level of service for the low price (second class citizen treatment). Not here...from the minute I walked in, EVERY person I came in contact with---be it front desk, car attendents, hotel operator, or housekeeping -- they all bent over backward with friendly and attentive service missing from so many other hotels in NYC. I arrived at 11:00 AM---fully expecting no room availability because I was so early. I really intended just to leave my bag, but I said ---what the hell -- let me give it a try. They were happy to both give me a room AND satisfy my request for a high floor --- the 38th. While the room was not my style --- it was stylish -- and a great size with a great size bathroom. A little dated, yes. Could use a bit of renovation, yes. But it had everytrhing you needed, all in good working order, and very clean. I'm so used to the snobby, "let me do you a favor by allowing you to stay at my property" cold shoulder treatment at so many NYC hotels ( i.e. Flatotel, Waldorf Astoria, Intercontinental Barclay, The London, etc.) that attitude and service count alot for me. I'm willing to overlook alot of little things when a hotel has that right. Yes, the location is great, the rooms are large, and the ameneties are nice -- but for me, it was the PEOPLE at the Helmsley New York that made it a truely enjoyable experience. I would not hesitate to stay here, or other Hrlmsley properties, ever again. She may have been mean -- but it looks to me like they are celebrating their freedom!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, offense to style.”
Reviews.Author: jdelid09876
Reviews.Content: Did not like: scratchy robes, towels and polyester sheets. Dated, ugly looking printed bed spreads. Motel grade linen. Liked: spacy rooms, staff is helpful. Overall verdict: ok, bring your own linen.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELAGENTITALY
Reviews.Content: great location on 42nd street few minutes by walk to 5th ave. very nice room (i get 41st floor with view on crysler build) and was ok, very clean and goog service.

Reviews.Title: “New York - What an amazing place”
Reviews.Author: Traveleasier
Reviews.Content: Arrived in New York from JFK courtesy of a limo from Lincoln Limousines ($65 one way - trip was easy, car was in need of an update). Pulled up to the hotel, went to the front desk and we were greeted by Doris who started off our trip perfectly. Big smile, easy check in process (our room was not ready so we just checked the bags) and then Doris pretty much took us under her wing. She pulled out the map of Manhattan and pretty much planned out trip for the next four days. It was like having your own tour guide. She was just amazing and her routes were fantastic. If you want to experience New York, just make sure that you speak to her. She gave us some insider tips (take the Staten Island ferry to see the Statue of Liberty since apparently, you can no longer go inside. The ferry is free.) and recommended some great places to eat (try Sarge's Deli, 548 3rd Ave, between 36th Ave and 37th Ave). Hotel was very nice although the rooms could probably use a bit of updating. We stayed on the 31st floor overlooking 42nd Street. Room was fine with a king sized bed, flat panel TV, regular sized bathroom and in room safe. Apart from the street noise (just typical New York with sirens blaring and horns honking) and the occasional door closing (not sure why it is necessary to make doors so heavy that when they close, other rooms shake. Be nice to your neighbours and gently help the door close.), everything was fine. We did not eat in the hotel or use any of the facilities (there are a couple of computers for guest usage but they cost). There is a restaurant just beside the hotel for breakfasts and light lunches and it will suit most people just fine.
