Hotel is really well situated about 5 minutes walking to/from Grand Central and probably about 15-20 minutes walking to/from Times Square. Use the New York subway. It's a great way to get around and better than taxis for the most part. Traffic in New York is just unbelievable, all hours of the day. All in all, it was just a fantastic stay and although Doris was not working on the day that we left, her smile left with us. Stay at the Helmsley, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: BryantPark42
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend any visitor to stay at this marvellous hotel. Was unsure when first made booking but was delighted upon arrival. Efficient and friendly service from door to door. Delightful spacious rooms and very comfy beds! Location is perfect. Staying at this hotel certainly made our holiday fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sildero
Reviews.Content: Leona is surely turning over in her grave. While this hotel was perfectly located in Midtown with everything so convenient and all the staff very accomodating in every way, the rooms were dated and dirty. They need to deep clean the floors in the rooms, it would make the guests feel more comfortable I'm sure. There was no coffee pot or mini bar in the room we had (3711) and the faulty shower button took 2 days to master but we had a beautiful view from our window, Chrysler building so close you touch it! We needed 2 double beds in our room so there wasn't much space but it wasn't European tiny either. Since we spent no time at all in our room we didn't use the amenities at the hotel, (gym and restaurant) we did have some nightcaps at the pleasant bar in the lobby. We were drawn to the Helmsley for the reasonable (for NYC) price and locale and since we walked or cabbed everywhere I can't let you know about the convenience to the subway but Grand Central Terminal is about a block away with the Theater district about 7 blocks in the other direction. I may or may not stay there again, it would depend on what I was in NYC to accomplish. If you aren't planning on staying in your room much and aren't squeamish about floor cleanliness bring slippers and consider this hotel if you are looking for something moderately priced in midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class, Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: FrankCC
Reviews.Content: We took a five day break at the Helmsley in New York at the end of Aprilâ€¦..we were given a room on the 10 th floor, the room was top class for what we needed, ironing board, Sat TV, clean and comfy bed. Previous reviews have stated that the noise was bad from the road, but we were at the back of the hotel and slept with the window opren and was fine. Apart from the hi standard of the room, the really big plus is the location, we pretty much just slept in the room, letâ€™s be honest if youâ€™re in New York you donâ€™t want to spend time in your room. Pretty much central to everything, we were up and out of the hotel before 8 and what a buzz when you hit 42nd street, itâ€™s just great, like previous reviewers we choose not to eat at the hotel; purely because we wanted to experience the full New York breakfastâ€¦Pershing Square opposite Grand Central is expensive but must be done as it is brilliant for breakieâ€¦..A small deli on the same side called Ciprianiâ€™s is also worth going to (itâ€™s next to the big hall Ciprianiâ€™s) We walked to Time Square (thereâ€™s a great park just before it; Bryant park with some great happy hour bars which are buzzing) we did top of the rock, but left the empire state building as the q were too long. We got the subway to Battery park and then took the ferry to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island (well worth it, but be prepared to Q) And thereâ€™s a great market on Union Square on a Satuday which is well worth going to, we walked back to the hotel, and we also walked to central parkâ€¦â€¦ A wonderful city and an excellent hotel to use as a base

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: roomandbored
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in May '08 and found the property to be very nice. The management accommodated all of our requests and (as mentioned) the location is hard to beat for the average tourist. The elevators are fast, the housekeeping was consistent and the tv channel selection was vast. Its the PILLOWS that I have a problem with. I know I should just take my own with me, but I found the pillows to be hard as a rock. Additionally, the room temperature is unadjustable (we ended up sleeping with our windows open) and the bed comforters could use some updating. Overall, however, we totally enjoyed our stay and had no problems of any significance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: linznumba3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Newyork Helmsley for 7 nights which was a fab hotel, we had a great welcome, all the staff were excellent and very friendly and helpful. All your needs catered for here, this is a hotel i would definitely go back to. We were on the 38th floor and the views were amazing. We left $3 a day tip for the cleaner and also tipped the bellman and front of house staff for getting us cabs. A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a tourist week end”
Reviews.Author: tellall1
Reviews.Content: Good, clean, well decorated tourist hotel on the East side on 42nd St btw 2nd and 3rd Ave's. A few blocks to Grand Central and subway or a quick walk to the U N. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Room was very clean and nice furnishings. Not an upscale place but very comforable and nice. Flat screen T V on wall, comfortable matress and great east side views looking towards Brooklyn and the U N.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Tinytoons
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay at the New York Helmsley Hotel. Location is excellent, only a 10 min walk to Times Square or a $5-$6 cab ride. From the moment we arrived at the hotel from the door staff (especially Ritchie) and bell boys to the reception desk staff all were fantastic and couldnt do enough for us. We had emailed previously and asked for a room on a high floor. We couldn't have gotten any higher on their 41st floor with an amazing view of the Crysler Building and city lights. The room was a great size with a huge bed and great shower. The room was cleaned daily and was always very tidy when we came back from a day of sightseeing. We were never disturbed by any noise during the night. We had an evening flight home and when I asked for a late checkout, there was no problem at all and they even held onto our cases for us as we took a final stroll around the city. Harry's Bar is small and a bit pricey, but hey it is a hotel after all! The only gripe I have about the bar was that it closed even when there were hotel guests still there drinking. I thought it would remain open until the last guest left???? We didnt eat in the hotel as we used the Pax Deli right next door which was perfect for brekkie. Security at night was appreciated as they checked that every guest had a room key to gain access to the lifts at night. We would highly recommend this hotel as a great base in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: tlemus
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the New York Helmsley was extremely enjoyable. After exiting LGA, we only had a very short cab ride $20 + tip. We were taken to our room with a wonderful view of the Chrysler building, which was requested after letting them know by email that it was our anniversary. We stayed there 6 days, and its location (which was one of the primary reasons we chose to reserve in the first place) proved to be a major asset. We were very close to Union Station, and from there we were able to take the subway to all the major points of the city. The people at the entrance and at the reception were extremely courteous and helpful. They answered all of our questions in a very amicable manner. Our room was of a very decent size by NYC standards. It was clean and tidy, and an oasis after having spent a whole day walking. We were not expecting a 4 star hotel, and so we were not upset by what was missing. However, since our expectations werenâ€™t high, we were pleasantly surprised by how much we got for the price we paid. You cannot beat it, especially in NYC. One thing we both didnâ€™t like was the wait staff at the bar. We stopped one day to have a drink since it was raining and neither one felt like getting wet. The bar had the worst music ever, and the waitresses werenâ€™t friendly or efficient. I think they rely on guests stopping for a drink, and so they take you for granted. Therefore, we just had a drink, we paid, and left the minimal tip. Other than that, we will definitely be back, and will definitely recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Added to a truely magical time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: wellbeing1986
Reviews.Content: My partner suprised me for our 2 year anniversary with a trip to NYC for a long weekend.... We booked through dial-a-flight (aka dial-a-s***e), who booked us into a terrible hotel with terrible reviews on broadway (Days Inn) so we decided to change our hotel at the last minute. All I will say is, they were incredibly rude about the whole thing and charged us a huge amount of money with no true explanation about what it was for (considering on the Days Inn website, you can apparently cancel until the last minute without being charged). Anyway, we decided to book into the NY Helmsley as an alternative, and what an alternative it was. The lights outside are magical, even though it is like your stepping into an 80's film set, the hotel is very clean, smart and expensive looking. The bellboys/reception desk were very helpful... and dealt with every problem. For example, we stayed on the 22nd floor (ask for a floor high up when booking, its really worth it!) and we wanted open the windows, but whilst doing so, the top part of the window sort of came off and slid down and wouldn't do back up, and they dealt with it straight away). Also, Our TV remote made a disappearing act...which after searching high and low (we still didnt find it!) we called up and they sent us a new one! The room was clean, obviously dated, but since when do you spend all your time in a hotel in NYC? Harry's Bar downstairs is expensive, there is a GREAT diner for breakfast at east 45th between 2nd and 3rd... amazing pancakes for 7 bucks.... I would say, do venture into Tribeca/Soho/West Village for the best restaurants and places to eat/drink. Overall, this was a fab break, and the hotel was great. I will stay there again.... and I will definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Helmsely Hotel -A great place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: LER_8
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in NYC - service is friendly, rooms are spacious, clean and nicely appointed - location, location, location is great- mid-town Manhattan - close to Grand Central within walking distance to many land marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Helmsley.”
Reviews.Author: Lolly8Dublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We were are group of ladies staying at the Helmsley in mid April & found it to be a great hotel. The location is excellent, which is partly why we booked it. I had read on your website that the hotel looks for $100 per room per night deposit - refunadable at the end of the trip if you didnt charge anything to your room. This was not mentioned on either the hotel website or Booking.com , and we wouldnt have known this only it was mentioned on your reviews of previous guests. The hotel was clean, comfortable and we found the reception staff to be most helpful. The only complaint we as a large group would have is regarding some of the bellhops, who really let the hotel down in our opinion.. They were very friendly when they thought there was a chance of receiving a tip, however when they had gotten the tip, they were completely disinterested in helping us - Rueben in particular was rude, and actually took some money from my hand before I had the chance to give it to him, then didnt bother taking the luggage outside to our airport transportation - we had to ask somone else to do it for us. Only we were in a hurry, I would have brought this to the attention of the hotel manager, as we were not happy with how he treated us. Having said that, the rest of the hotel staff were fine, and his rudeness would not put me off staying there again- next time however I would be ready for him !! Your website mentioned the Pax deli next door, which was a fantastic set up, and we ate there every morning - there was an endless selection of food to eat at very reasonable prices. Overall I would recommend this hotel to other people & would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura1004
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New York and stayed at the Helmsley following a recommendation, Great Hotel, very clean, spacious and had a stunning view of the Chrysler building from our room on the 39th floor. Staff were very helpful, always willing to answer any questions. Location was fab with a subway about 2 mins walk away and very close to Empire State, 5th Ave and Grand Central. Didnt use restuarant facilities as up and out early but Pax deli next door is great with some yummy food and cakes!!!! Must see is a trip to Ground Zero and a visit to the Ground Zero museum workshop which is about 10 mins from ground zero in a cab and located in the Meatpacking district, this was the best thing about our trip to NYC, Overall the Helmsley is a lovely hotel would recommend to anyone and cant wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good bet for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cohen_Jack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the New York Helmsley last Saturday evening to enjoy a night on the town without the commute back to the suburbs. For $358 including tax, we booked a room with a king size bed, which was not available on check-in. The clerk gave us a room with two doubles instead on a high floor with a nice view of the East River and the Verazzano Bridge in the background. The rooms are average size for a midtown New York hotel, with most, but not all, of the usual amenities. There is no fitness club on premises, no swimming pool, and the elevators are always crowded.The shower needed a little tinkering to get to work properly. On the plus side, the beds are comfortable, the staff is pleasant, the walls are thick, and the HVAC seemed to work. The hotel is in a great location-- 42nd Street, near Third Avenue. We had dinner at the Oyster Bar at Grand Central Station, one of the best seafood joints in New York for the money. After the theatre, we came back to our hotel and had a drink at Patrick Conway's, a great Irish pub near the train station. We forsook the $24 per person brunch at the hotel (which looked good), took a walk, and found the Townhouse Coffee Shop on Second Avenue and 38th Street, where for $25 for the two of us, we had a delicious breakfast. We walked over to First Avenue, where we viewed the United Nations and its gardens. By the time we left for home, we both thought we had the weekend experience we needed. I wouldn't necessarly rush back to the Helmsley for a similar expeience, but would come back there without undue worry or concern.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time !”
Reviews.Author: BEBaines
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this Hotel in April 2007 with a friend. I returned with my husband and son this year April 8th - 12th (check out 13th)2008. I love this place! This year we had a room at the back of the Hotel with a view of the Empire State Building. The hotel is so well situated, and easy walking distance of the main attractions - Chrysler Building, Times Square, Grand Central etc etc. Having stayed twice in different rooms, I can say that the standards of accomodation were the same. This hotel represents high quality and value for money. When I return to New York, I would not stay anywhere else - and I would certainly recommend it. Unfortunately for the hotel 3rd Avenue was being re-surfaced during the beginning of April, so I am sure some customers found it noisier than normal. Recommended: Top of the Rock Experience at Night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deggy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, within walking distance of the majority of attractions. Lacking some basic room facilities would normally expect in such a hotel, for example no kettle, coffee etc. I would recommend requesting a room at the back of the hotel, despite being on the 24th floor the noise from the street was loud and constant 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great!”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker50england
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fabulous. You are within easy walking distance of all the main attractions of Manhattan. Grand Central Station is just a few minutes away. We actually walked back from Central Park, which took us about half an hour all along 5th Avenue! The Hotel staff are friendly and we checked in quickly with no queue. As we were travelling with my two sons, I requested that our rooms be next door to each other, this was seen to without a problem which was great! The only downside was no tea or coffee facilities or a fridge. The PAX deli right next door was a godsend! Also be warned that they do require a deposit of 100 dollars per night for 'incidentals' - but i guess this must be common practice among all the hotels? All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Helmsley and would recommend it to any of our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: EssexJdV
Reviews.Content: I am not a person who gives a five star rating without good cause, but this hotel earned it. We stayed for 4 nights in February and it was the prefect start to our holiday. From the moment that we arrived we were treated as special. The front of the hotel screems luxury and as our taxi pulled up we were greeted by a uniformed doorman who told us to just leave our luggage and go through. The rooms were (as requested) on a high floor with a great view and little traffic noise. The Bell hop gave us a welcome talk in his bronx accent which was straight out of the movies. The rooms were spacious, clean, well decorated and luxurious. the bed was perfect and the bathroom was just right. we didn't eat in the hotel until the last night, prefering to sample some of New York's finest however when we did (despite the mixed reviews) the restaurant was great. Peaceful and relaxed with good food at a reasonable price (Even though the waiter looked as if he had escaped from a 1930's horror flick). Would we stay here again? - You bet. The location was perfect and everything midtown was within easy walking. The hop on Hop off bus tour had a stop a few hundred yards away for travelling further afield. I would like to balance this review with all the negative things about the hotel but there really wasn't any.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place, Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: JoeVBG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Helmsley in Dec. 2007. We arrived on an early morning flight and as expected our room was not ready but the staff was very helpful with getting out bags checked and with suggestions of what to do in the interim. Our room was just excellent. Clean, well kept and spacious by NY standards. The concierge was very helpful with a last minute restaurant reservation. The hotel is very well located in Mid-town within walking distance of 5th Ave shopping and sites, MOMA, and other galleries. I would return here anytime and would recommend it highly. TIP: There is a great Coffee Shop (PAX) right next door to the hotel where the locals grab their morning coffee and/or breakfast. No Frills but great value and alternative to Hotel Dining Room or Room Service. Line-up can be long but moves Very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel with pal, exhausted & looking forward to taking a much-needed nap but the smoking room booked wasn't ready. Apparently there's only one floor of smoking room in the whole hotel. We were earlier than the check-in time so had a couple of cocktails at Harry's Bar, where the 15% gratuity is added automatically! Returned to check-in a couple of hours later but still no smoking room ready so we accepted a non-smoking room instead and were assured it was a nice city view room - it was on the 30th floor, we could see the Chrysler and were delighted to find we had two beds instead of one to share. The hotel's staff were always very helpful and the bar was friendly. The beds were extremely comfortable and the in-room safe was a plus. Pax Deli next door to the hotel is ok for breakfast but if you walk up to the Pershing Sq Cafe (less than 5 mins, same side of road) they do a fabulous breakfast and it has a great atmosphere. The Capital Grille just a couple of mins up the road on the other side does a really nice dinner; it's not cheap but the staff are attentive and it's a pleasant treat. In the other direction is McFadden's Bar which serves some lovely fish dishes. You should have a cocktail at The View bar in the Mariott on Times Square, the views really are great & if you go for the sunset it's really quite pretty. Overall the hotel's location is great with Times Sq about 15 min walk and 5th Ave shopping a bit less. We thought Macy's was ok but Bloomingdales was the prettiest and brightest department store and Century 21 is worth a visit for past-season designer goods but is fairly chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Swarks
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned after reading some less than enthusiastic reviews but I was very impressed with this hotel. I did as suggested by others and requsted a room on a high floor - we were on the 32nd floor and had a great view of the Chrysler building. I went with two teenagers and the room was plenty big enough for three of us and had a good bathroom - certainly looked clean and modern to me. Location is, as all have said, very convenient and central. We didn't bother with the restaurant as the deli next door was so good and miles cheaper. It even made the lack of coffee making facilities less important. Not the most fabulous hotel ever but really no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: dustie_rocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights at the end of March. We had a room with two double beds (there were 3 family members staying in the room). We booked with a prepay website and got a very good deal. On arrival the reception area is very nice. We had no complaint with the hotel, the rooms were average size and very clean. The bathroom was large, lots of nice large bath towels and cleaned daily. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but I often went to the deli next door and brought the drinks back. I had checked with Trip Advisor before travelling and had seen Pax deli recommended.. however it is really busy at rush hour in the mornings so the first morning we had breakfast in the hotel. We got the buffet breakfast.. It was 24 dollars but for that you got an amazing breakfast.. fresh tropical fruit, cereal, youghurt, crossaints, crusty rolls, doghnuts, waffles, french toast, bacon, sauage, etc etc. The juice was freshly squeezed and they refilled your glass as many times as you wanted. It was a really good meal and we didnt eat again until that night so it was worth the money. The location of the hotel is very good.. as we were mainly on a shopping/sightseeing trip it was perfect and very close to Grand Central station for easy access to a number of subway lines. We had a very good stay and I would highly recommend this hotel for a good stay in New York. Would stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year at the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: burg42
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 days over New Year at the hotel. It was a no frills package, so we cant comment on the food or service to a great extent. However we did enjoy the room we were given. Spacious, comfortable beds and very nice bathrooms made for a lovely rest stop inbetween exploring the city. We did pay through the nose, but for new year in New York, it didnt seem any more or less than anywhere else. We also had a great view and could spy the Chrysler building from our room. We did appreciate the excellent location and we cant highly recommend enough the Comfort Diner that is just round the corner, for a true New York breakfast experience, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: split79
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location, friendly service, would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review”
Reviews.Author: shanedy
Reviews.Content: FABULOUS hotel!!!! This was my first trip to New York, on my own!!! for acouple of days to get a feel for the place, shops (LOTS!!!!), tourist spots etc This has a fab location opp the chrsyler building, its a 5mins walk to times sq, empire state bluiding, bloomies, macys etc, the room was large with plasma screen tv and wireless internet, I was upgraded to a empire room where I has a view of the empire building. All the staff are friendly and polite and the restaurant and bars are not too badly priced. The lifts aren't too bad I was on the top floor (42nd) and it took less than a minute to reach. This is a good 4 star hotel with a fantastic large feel to it, just what you need in New York!!

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: MACSPUD
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the building could not fault it. Got everything we asked for. Kevin was very heplfull told us different places we could eat by night. Had fresh towles every day & beds dressed what more could u ask for. It is not even a 10min walk from times square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New York Hemsley”
Reviews.Author: oapwill
Reviews.Content: Just read previous 2 reviews and thought I should add mine for balance. My sister and I stayed here in mid January for 6 nights. It was our first trip to NYC. The hotel was fabulous!!!! Beautiful room, large with very comfy beds . The bathroom was great with large fluffy towels changed every day. The staff were wonderful,especially Anthony and Patrick at the front lobby with very helpful advice and tips on where to eat and see. Going back to Harrys Bar in the evening for a nightcap was a relaxing way to end each evening!! I would book this hotel again gladly and hope to do so in the autumn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BHAgirl
Reviews.Content: Great Location, check in was very quick, asked for high floor which we had. King size room, everything you needed apart from tea and cooffee, but I did know this and took my own kettle etc.We were on the 28th floor, I think you need to be at least this high to avoid traffic noise. The bar was very friendly, also served snacks. Hotel Staff very helpful. Easy walking to Times Square, Empire State and Central Station.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Limerick_Liz
Reviews.Content: Six night stay here. Four of us were in a quad room (two double beds). Got a good rate on hotels.com but ended up staying an extra night due to flight delays. We were charged an extra 550 dollars for the room for the extra night which was way too much for this room! The five previous nights had not been much more than that altogether! No air conditioning was working and room was very hot especially at night. The bell boys at hotel entrance were practically begging for tips on the last day which was slightly irritating and resulted in us giving them less rather than more!! We brought travel kettle for morning tea... good idea! Although there are negatives to note about the Helmsley we felt overall this was a great hotel to stay in for location alone and would probably return here. Rooms were good size and very clean by New York hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very old and worn hotel”
Reviews.Author: morr27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Helmsley last week for a business trip and was very dissapointed. It feels like it hasn't been updated since the 80s and is definitely not appropriate for business travel. The lobby feels like a depressing airport bar and the rooms have none of the amenities that you would expect in 2008. Its like being in a time warp. No bottles of water in the room, no mini bar, no vending machines, no decent shampoo. It might be ok if you are travelling on a budget and want a convenient hotel in NYC but I think that the Westin is around the same price and it feels like a contemporary hotel. Overall, the core basics are there but it is in dire need of a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, crappy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valerie57
Reviews.Content: March 22/08 - we are currently staying at this hotel and it's one of the worst I've stayed at. Poorly appointed, no coffee maker as prev mentioned, only mirror in bathroom -irritating with 3 women in a room, room is stifling hot. Bathtub drain plugged, fixed but still slow and disgusting, towels were not replaced first day. TV remote did not work, very few plugs in room -difficult to recharge cameras etc. I generally don't complain too much but this has been a huge disappointment to my group and we would not stay here again. We were originally booked in another hotel but they overbooked and Expedia changed us the day before our trip so not a lot of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dazzathomp
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in Ny on three occassions now and have to say that the other two hotels were in time sqauare where all the hustle and bustle is. I stayed at the Hemsley to get away from this and i glad i did, what a wonderful hotel, i booked with ebookers and got an excellent rate for two people with two double beds and an amazing few of the Chrysler building room 2507, the staff were very freindly and had no problem checking in or out, they even sorted out my transfers for the return trip to the uk,. Piece of advise if your travelling from jfk to the hotel there is a flat rate for cabs of around 45$ which is excellent, but if your travelling from Newark which i did this time it was about $85 as theres quite alot of tolls to pay, on the way back the hotel booked a bus company called golden touch who took us back to Newark Airport for $23 which was a much better price, they have a website but im sure if you email the hemsley they will be more than happy to arrange this for you. i really liked this hotel as its within walking distance of all the main attractions that NY has to offer and i will definately stay here again, it was a little gem, the rooms are big and so is the bathroom which is rare to find in NY and the rooms are cleaned and topped up with fresh towels daily, i hope my review is helpful as i always come on here when i stay anywhere first and iv never been wrong :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: findersmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while my son interviewed at Seton Hall University. Got a great deal on Expedia at $179/night for a Sat/Sun. The hotel is only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station. It's an easy walk there and we took the subway to everything--World Trade Center site, Times Square, Chinatown, Little Italy, Greenwich Village, SoHo, etc. To get to Seton Hall, we took the Subway to Penn Station, got tickets on the NJ Transit which took us straight to South Orange. The university was only a 10-minute walk from the train station. The hotel was very clean, great fluffy towels, comfortable beds, flat screen TV, free internet access. I travel frequently and am known as a "hotel snob" and I will definitely stay here again. The staff was soooo friendly, from check-in to check-out. They let us check in at noon, and allowed us late check out at 1:00. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. The room didn't have a coffee maker, which is not important to me because I don't drink coffee, however that may be an issue for some. But there's a Starbucks a half-block away and a Pax restaurant right next door. Also the room had no air-conditioning control, but we just opened our windows and it was comfortable. (That could be a problem during the summer months.) There's a great deli about 4 blocks down 2nd Ave. called "Sarge's" that's open 24 hours. Had wonderful BIG sandwiches and soup. Also convenient to the hotel is a CVS directly across the street that's open 24/7. Overall, we loved the location and hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Nights at the New York Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: anniefNorth
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 22nd Feb (we were there for our 25th Wed Anniversary on the 24th, ...a treat to ourselves) After a very long day we arrived at the Helmsley only to be told they were expecting us on the 27th, the receptionist made a phone call and told us it wasn't a problem etc etc and that they'd give us a nice room. The room was on the 14th floor, king sized bed, which was the best bed I've EVER slept in! The room was clean spacious enough for the two of us. We had a view of the chrylser building. My only disappointment was that they don't have any tea making facilities, although we later found out we could ask for them (and have it added to our bill) anyway... please take a credit card as you need it to check in with, not a debit card, one of ours wouldnt work but thank god my hubby has his american express which was accepted everywhere we used it. His goldfish card wasn't, nor was my personal bank card (which had plenty funds in it).. also beware of the cash machine in the lobby, it accepted my bankers card but never gave me any cash.. sorry to harp on about cash etc but if you're new to the states like we were, we didnt have a clue what would or wouldnt be accepted. Breakfast in Mindys (downstairs) was great, we founed we didnt need to eat again until about 4pm as the breakfast were buffet style so we ate as much as we wanted/needed. The staff in Minday and Harry's bar were very attentive, and being British we weren't used to it, but to be fair I could get used to it, the service was great, fast and efficient. The hotel is in a great situation for Grand Central, but to be honest we walked most of the time, we did buy a 7day metro ticket for $23 each which was so handy and if you're tired it's so easy just to jump on a train, having said that, cabs are cheap enough if you want to use them. Overall we had a fab time, and the hotel was as I expected, it was clean and comfy, and believe me, Im a clean freak and I was very happy to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: htravelbug
Reviews.Content: I was a little uncertain about the hotel, as, from the pictures, it seemed a little dated. But it was great. From the moment we checked in, until we left, the staff were friendly, extraordinarily helpful and very professional. I was impressed by how many staff are around the hotel, always ready to help and be of service. The room was great. It was large and comfortable (on the 12th floor with a view of 42 St. & the Chrysler Bldg.) and very clean. The bathroom was large too, which is unusual in New York and a really nice feature was the large, plush bath sheet towels, not the tiny, thin, small towels that you often find in hotels. The room had complementary Wi-Fi which was very convenient and really helpful, as we searched the internet for bus schedules and NYC magazine website for dinning recommendations and theatre reviews. We found a great price on Orbitz, $207 for the first two nights and $187 for the other two. The location was excellent, as it was very close to the 4, 5, 6 subway lines (1.5 blocks to walk). There was a nice cafe downstairs (PAX), where you could get a good breakfast, sandwiches, baked goods to eat in or take away. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again, as it was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: vegophile
Reviews.Content: Eh, Helmsley was okay. Location was great, close to Times Square, etc. Room was tiny - with a king bed and a rollaway, there wasn't any walking room. Everything was clean though. The decor was kind of dated though. Bar/lobby area downstairs was decent - once again, nothing spectacular though. If you just need a clean place with a good location to sleep/shower, then I'd highly recommend the Helmsley. If you're planning on spending more time in your room and would like something luxurious, try something else - there's plenty of options in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: UKChristine79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through last minute and got a good deal of 5 nights for the price of 4. We took the airport bus from JFK to Grand central and walked the block and half to the hotel. We had a swift and efficient check in - please note you will need a credit card which they hold money on even though our room was fully paid for. We stayed in a king size bed room on the 12th floor. Plenty of lifts to all floors. The room was average size with tv, hanging built in wardrobe, safety deposit and easy chair. Small bathroom with bathtub and shower over. No facilities to make a hot drink or fridge. The room was cleaned daily whilst we were out. Comfy beds and quiet night sleep each evening. Small gym on 6th floor - machine very close together for easy use. Overall the hotel was expected for a place to sleep after sight seeing all day. It was in a great location for exploring and using the subway. Good coffee shops locally for breafast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but far from what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Malphaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights for a benefit show I was in. In the past for these events we have been put up at some ritzy places so I was expecting the best. The staff was very friendly, and the first man we encountered went out of his way to help us back our car in properly, unloaded our bags and parked our car for us without any question. Once we settled in though, we realized the small room had less than your average Hilton. The view was nice, we could see the Empire State Building which was beautiful at night, and there was a flat screen TV. However, there was no coffee pot at all. There were very few electric outlets, we had a hard time plugging in all our cell phones. The bathroom was ridiculously small, which was quite the challenge when the entire family needs to get ready for the day. Also, the cups were plastic and disposable which I found odd for such an establishment and not very eco-friendly The pillows were not that comfortable, and if you tossed and turned in bed they basically came unmade. There was also one day where we came back to our room at almost 4:00 in the afternoon and our room had not been cleaned and our clock was never changed for daylight's savings time. This is an ok place for a place to crash which is all we needed but even the location I was not crazy about. After our event we needed food and there was nowhere nearby we could go that was open! We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but we did get Starbucks on more than one occasion, but that's near everything in NYC. Overall- Not a bad place, nice people, but my stay at the Sheraton Manhattan was more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the New York Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: Heske
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the New York Helmsley. After reading previous reviews I was little a concerned as I was travelling with a young child. However, I must have stayed at a different hotel as I found everything to be perfect. Checking in and out was easy. We were given a room with a review of the Chrysler Building on the 35th floor (as requyested by email) and had a fridge delivered to our room an hour after requesting it. The room was large and spacious. We had two double beds and a plasma telly. It was also good that the inroom safe was free. The staff were polite and helpful. The location of the hotel is great, we were within walking distance of all the major attractions (about 10 minutes to Time Square). We didn't eat at the restaurants but can recommend the PAX deli next door which is very reasonable. Overall, I would highly recommend the New York Helsmley and will definitely stay there the next time I go to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: SouthportTravellers
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from our first visit to New York and would like to reassure any potential travellers that in my opinion the negative reviews do not reflect the Hotel in any way. Our stay at the Helmsley was brilliant ,we requested a high room with a view of the Empire state building and this was supplied . We were able to check in ahead of the allocated time and more importantly the hotel allowed us a late check out at no extra cost , which enabled us to spend more time sight seeing.Check in staff were very pleasant and even remembered to wish my husband a Happy Birthday on arrival .Big fluffy towels supplied every day together with bathroom toiletries and the rooom cleaned every day. Spotless room with huge bed and even comfy chair to sit after a very long day of walking .Only complaint for me is the lack of tea /coffee in the rooms however this is easily resolved from the Deli next door . Location of the hotel ideal as just far enough away from Times Square and all the noises but close enough for all the sightseeing. Grand Central very close and all the subway connections from here . Would highly recomend the hotel to anyone travelling to the wonderful place called New York I have emailed the hotel directly to let them know what a wonderful stay we had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: nicearbhaill
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in NYC and would recommend the Helmsley to all. I travelled alone and it was my first time in NYC and the Helmsley is in a great central location. Checking in and checking out were easy and efficient and my room was large and comfortable. The best thing is the location and the security - which is great when you are a lone female traveller. Security at night is very good. The decor is a little dated but the location is fab - walking distance to everything and the subway is very near. The only downside was the housekeeping staff. I was woken up twice before 9am by housekeeping trying to get in and clean my room even though there was a "Do not disturb sign" on my door. 9am is just too early!!!. My breakfast order was wrong aswell but it was noticed very soon. I was ok with the taking of the deposit but for other travellers please be warned about this and this is not normal practice in Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful break at The Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: Hendy50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Helmsley from 15-22nd Feb 08. We had noted a few negative reviews just prior to leaving, but I am very pleased to say we found everything to be great & overall I would rate this hotel as excellant, both in location & value. We had asked for a room facing the Chrysler building & on an upper floor, well room 2905 was perfect for us, a fantastic view straight up 42nd street towards Times Square with the Chrysler looming large. Iconic! A couple of things I would strongly recommend, take the Staten Island Ferry, its FREE & the views of Manhatten, Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island are fabulous. Also go to Roxys Deli on Times Square (North West corner) for a real New York experience, the biggest sandwiches we have ever seen & 1 was enough to feed 2 people easily. All in all a wonderful trip & when we re-visit (soon!) New York would definately consider staying at the Helmsley again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “First class New York Helmsley Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pneuma1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to New York and it was really terrific. We stayed at the New York Helmsley between 13 - 15 February and had a great stay there. The hotel was centrally located in mid town Manhattan close to all amenities.. Beautiful Central Station is very close as is Times Square. We found the reception staff very friendly and helpful and check in took no time at all. We were escorted to our room on 26th Floor by Anthony, one of the bellboys. He has been with the hotel a long time and was full of interesting info about NY. The Concierge was also very helpful providing maps and umbrellas when required. One point to be aware of is that you will be asked to secure a deposit of $100 for each night of your stay, either cash or card. Our travel agent had not mentioned this but we had picked it up from other reviews about this hotel. The hotel room was very well maintained with all mod cons, including LCD TV, recreational dressing gown and huge fluffy towels and was really warm, which was great as outside was so cold. Rooms were cleaned daily and left in mint condition. There are no tea/coffee making facilities but there is a great diner next door called PAX which is open from 6am - 10pm each day. Another good diner, is located in Pershing Square, try their Eggs Benedict, they are great!!!! All in all a very good stay in a highly recommended hotel. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not 4 star...”
Reviews.Author: CABUTLER
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Helmsley for 4 nightsâ€™ recently I would like to add my comments on the hotel. My wife and my self had a very pleasant and comfortable stay at the Helmsley. It's location is perfect for exploring the city, Grand Central Station only down the street, Times Sq a 10min walk one way and The Empire State a 10 min walk the other. The hotels claim of 4 stars is bit high in my opinion, I would gladly put it at 3star, not 4. The lack of a minibar, tea and coffee making facilities in rooms is a loss. There is very good cafe next to the hotel called PAX, head down there first thing and grab a coffee and some breakfast and take back to your room. We also booked a no smoking room which we got. but unfortunately the room next to us must have been smoking as we could always smell smoke, in my opinion if one room is non smoking then the whole floor should be! The bathroom was clean but a little dated, as was the decor of the room, I understand there has been some refurbishment but not on the 10th floor. The view form the room was not good, and there was some work going on to repair a flat roof that we overlooked. I have read other reviews and seen the hotel managers comments that the workers start around 10am, well they donâ€™t! I regularly observed them there between 7 and 8am...I was up so not to much of a problem but for late sleepers I could imagine it being a problem if this work continues much longer. If you do stay here try and request a high floor room so you have a better view, I wish I had asked but didnâ€™t really know until I had got settled. But lets be honest you donâ€™t come to NYC to spend time in your room. On a plus side the room was very BIG and the bed even bigger and very comfortable. Harryâ€™s Bar is a very pleasant place to unwind after a hard days shopping and the bar food is very good, try the mini cheeseburgers. Over all the stay was very good and I am heading back to NYC in September with 2 friends to show then the sights, so I will keep a check and will return on hearing that tea & coffee making facilities had been installed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Westy79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2005. On arriving at the hotel we found the lobby to be very nice and had a cosmopolitan feel about the whole place. We were greeted by very friendly staff who made our stay very enjoyable. There was also free fresh apples!!! All our bags were taken to our room by a very strong bellboy who refused to let us carry any of our luggage. He was very helpful giving us good hints and tips about general New York City living. Our room was a nice size with 2 double beds and it was extremely clean throughout. We had a huge window with a great view of the Empire State building which was lovely to look at throughout our stay. The location was perfect allowing us to soak up in every sight and sound of this great city. We never dined at the hotel but wished we had. Our stay was wonderful and memorable. We would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Plesant stay at NY Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: kitttykat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently returned from a wonderful stay in NYC. I was a bit concerned following some of the mixed reviews on this website but was plesantly surprised. The front desk staff were friendly and upgraded us to a room on the 35th floor with a view of the empire state building without us even requesting. The room was huge with two double beds and large bathroom and was clean. The location of the hotel is great. I got a good rate booking through Expedia.com.au which was great to pay in AUD and avoid additional credit card transaction fees. Only thing I would say is beware that the hotel takes a USD 500 deposit on your credit card so make sure you account for this, not sure if this is common practice in NY but no other hotels we stayed in a 5 week trip took a large deposit from us. I would definately stay here again if ever lucky enough to visit NYC again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing view..minor setbacks”
Reviews.Author: sh3z
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. I took my mum to NY, and I'm glad I chose so well! Yes, it's pricey...most hotels in the city are. Great, friendly service (I read the reviews here and was worried about that), a nice, clean spacious room and an AMAZING VIEW (see pics). We were on the 38th floor, and the only problem we had was that the lock on our door was dodgy..it took at least 6 tries to get the door open, and after getting someone to come and 'fix' it, nothing changed. Tiny problem in the long run though. Oh, and you have to request a fridge, which we did but never received anything. We ended up buying lots of water at the nearest store and stocking it in our room. The location is unbeatable - smack in the middle of everything. Go outside, look up- Chrysler building. A 2 minute walk to Grand Central, a quick walk or taxi/subway straight to the major avenues and Times Sq. Subway station is a minute or 2 away from the hotel, and there are plenty of Starbucks around to keep you going. In the other direction 5 minutes away is the UN building. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant as it was so expensive, but we had a few Apple Martini's and mini-cheeseburgers at the bar (both delicious!). There's a great place next door which serves excellent, cheap food for a quick breakfast or lunch- so do that instead. All in all, we had a wonderful first trip to NY, and it was nice to have this hotel to come back to at the end of those exhausting days. A tip - e-mail the hotel a night or two before you arrive, and request a room on an upper floor with a view of the Empire State. I e-mailed and explained it was our first time, we were really excited and would love it if they could help - which they did. I miss sitting on the window ledge at sunrise and staring at that view :)

Reviews.Title: “Please ignore every other review about this hotel - it is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Adaleme
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Firstly this is my only fully negative review of any hotel in NYC! After taking the advice of previous reviews on TA, on arrival I asked for renovated rooms on a high floor for myself and friends, the reception just snortled and put us in raggedy old rooms on the 11th floor directly above an adjoining roof with very very loud work going on. I assumed (wrongly) this could be sorted out the next day having arrived very late, no such luck! A different yet similarly rude receptionist just told me to get on with it. I started to wonder whether it was becasue I had booked through a well-known online hotel provider rather than with the hotel directly I was woken up by a telephone call at 8am each day by somebody speaking a foreign language but shouting "housekeeping", I think it was their way to get people out of bed and out of the room as quickly as possible so it could be cleaned. The noise from outside was unbearable, from the works on the roof, people next door and people outside the door, it was constant! The view was dreadful and depressing! The tap wouldn't allow for the shower to be used, only the bath, yet again nobody cared and just expected the guests to get on with things, which of course we did! I do not like writing poor reviews but will make an exception in this case as the overall experience was very very dissapointing, and when you're travelling from the UK (with transatlantic flight costs) it is very important to stay somewhere that gives excellent service with added benefits of views etc - you will not get this at the New York Helmsley. There are cheaper, friendlier, cleaner hotels elsewhere in NYC. New York City is the greatest place on earth but please heed my advice and enjoy it from anywhere but the Helmsley, it may just make your stay not as enjoyable as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: Okay, not bad, but letâ€™s be real. The Helmsley can hardly be billed as a 4-star hotel. Itâ€™s decent but not deserving of rave reviews. BEST: - location is close to subway lines at Grand Central Terminal, can walk to 5th Ave. - spacious bathroom, long marble countertop, good water pressure, and outrageously thick, fluffy towels - good sized room filled with king bed, desk, night table, chair and ottoman, and tv cabinet - good illumination - arrived in the city at noon and was allowed to check in with no hesitation. Nice!! WORST: - overall, a bit worn - lack of electric outlets. Nowhere to plug computer on desk and I had to unplug hair dryer before I could plug in my cell charger. - noise from outside hall. A problem with many hotels, not just the Helmsley. Actually, the bedroom is down a corridor away from the door but still not enough of a buffer zone. Didnâ€™t try Harryâ€™s Bar in the lobby but it looked cosy. I say Helmsley is more of a 3-star hotel because too many things lacking: rather small seating area in lobby in case youâ€™re waiting; no coffeemaker nor mini-bar in room; no shower cap or extras offered beyond ordinary toiletries; feels like a former grande dame that hasnâ€™t kept up with time. Bottom line: I would stay here again if the price was right. For my 4-day stay, it was 200$/night.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra050
Reviews.Content: as it was our first time in new york we wanted a safe place to stay..we picked the right place!! The hotel was lovely,clean,friendly staff and great location. The beds were lovely our towels were changed every day and a newspaper outside the door every morning. The location was brilliant as we walked every where day or night!! and if we had to avail of a taxi the doorman had no problem getting us one of course tip needed!! i would highly recommened this hotel and on my next trip will be returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New York! Just not this hotel...sorry.”
Reviews.Author: clancymel
Reviews.Content: I love New York so much! Too bad I was sleepless in New York.... When the opportunity arose to tag along with my husband on his convention, I snagged it. I decided to bring along my two young daughters for their first trip to New York so that we could also celebrate her 8th birthday at the American Girl Place (which was awesome!!!) We didn't personally choose this hotel as it was selected by my husband's staff members. I have to say that the location of this hotel saved it from a "terrible" review. My complaints are mainly about the noise. I realize that New York is loud and busy but single pane windows don't work for a hotel of this calibre. I swear I heard unloading trucks and conversations from the street below at 4 and 5 am nevermind, all the sirens and honking cabs till the wee hours of the night. It was ridiculous because we were on the 25th floor. Then, they gave us a room across the hall from the lovely ice machine that served the whole floor. There was no door on the ice making room if you get my drift. Our room was small for all four of us. I had inquired about the room size prior to our arrival and I was assured that it was plenty big enough...NOT! The beds were just 2 double beds. Neither my husband or I are large people but I ended up grabbing the extra blankets and laying on the floor because the beds were so small. Any movement from my honey and I couldn't get to sleep. Then, there was the no minibar and no little coffee pot for a drink in our room. That's just ridiculous for a hotel in this city, charging as much as they do, and apparently a 4* hotel....NOT. OK. Here's some more. Never once did the bellmen/doormen(not one of the 4 standing around in their lovely long, warm hotel trenchcoats) come to open the door of our cab as we piled in or out in the bitter cold. Also, the morning that I was leaving with my daughters, I called down to the bellmen in hopes they would help me with my luggage (and I would have tipped them generously). However, I let it ring forever and no one picked up. I ended up carting my luggage down to the lobby by myself...thanks! Apparently, the hotel also almost ruined the company breakfast for 60 guests that was planned in November by my husband's company in advance. It seems the staff member that was organizing the function didn't show up for work the day of the event. No one else on staff at this hotel was aware of it apparently--too hard to believe. It was booked way in advance and confirmed the day prior. Nice! Great management. My tip for any and all visitors to New York City is to try staying at a real 4 Star hotel. I bet the Hyatt just a couple of blocks over would be a better stay. You can bet that I will be staying anywhere else next time I visit NYC. I can recommend some great ideas for a NYC trip with kids and we ate at some fabulous restaurants--Carmine's is tremendous for families, Beppe is excellent and very cozy and we all had fun at Ellen's Stardust Diner.

Reviews.Title: “What a Well Run Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesong
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of this Hotel is first rate. Great staff, food, rooms, Concierge and location. 3blocks from Grand Central 5 blocks to Times Square. Every question and need from a late check out to an early check in was handled like I was the king of the big apple. Hats off to this great hotel.... 10 stars...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyroo2
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic birthday trip to New York. I chose the Helmsley on recommedation from a friend who said she had a good view of the Chrysler building which is my most favourite building. My mum emailed the hotel before hand to ask if we could be placed in a room with that view. They emailed back and said that a messeage was sent to the front desk and they will sort it out when we arrive. When we arrived Loida on the desk was happy to upgrade us to a room on the 38th floor and it didnt disappoint. Throughout the stay the staff were very helpful and polite which made the stay excellent. I would recommend this hotel not just for the views, but for its location near all the midtown attractions. I recommend a trip to the Empire State Building at night the veiw is stunning. If you want to visit a new york diner I recommend the Tick Tock diner at 8th Ave and 34th st(great food) and Ellen's Stardust at Broadway and 51st st, the singing waiting staff makes this place fun.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced in N.Y.”
Reviews.Author: mrjubs
Reviews.Content: we have just stayed at this hotel, and from what I've read have paid average money for this type of hotel, but at nearly Â£125 per night, i was expecting a little more. nothing stood out, no attention to detail, no real enthusiasm, the staff are just going through the motions. when we checked in around 8pm the room we had requested was not available(a king room) so we were offered a twin, with a nice big flat screen, which unfortunately was postioned on top of the desk, so you couldn't use the lap top and the other person watch tv, maybe i'm being fussy, but it's details! we changed room the following day to a king, but i had to do the chasing, to make this happen. room was ok, nothing special. on check out got some bad advice regarding taxi or limo, take a taxi to jfk! when we return to NY we'll look for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittyGalway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on the 6th of January. We were on honeymoon. The room was huge. We were on 14th floor. The bed was a superking and oh so comfy. Really clean and housekeeping were really good at their jobs. Again as others have stated no drink making facilities in room which is annoying well for me anyway. We ordered room service once food wasnt great we had the pizza and steak sandwich. We also ate at deli next door which was really handy. Reception on check out were not the greatest very busy and at the slightest inkling we would ask a question they passed us off to concierge. Bit of a let down as rest of stay went so well. Never mind. Overall would stay there again its out of way of any hustle noisy streets etc. Try restaurant naples 45 at back of grand central lovely little place. Head chef bit of attitude but it was funny think he thought he was Gordon Ramsey.....

Reviews.Title: “First time in New York”
Reviews.Author: Ramsden85
Reviews.Content: After returning from a 5 night stay at The New York Helmsley from January 10th 2008, I have to admit I was very happy. If it is your first time to New York, the hotel may seem daunting at first, but believe me it is fabulous! All staff, no matter if they be catering assistants, receptionists, room maids, or security are fun and easy going. The hotels breakfast wasnt really fantastic to what we wanted, so we used the deli located just next door; try option 3, I loved it! Mindys restaurant is superb food, but maybe a little pricey; the cheaper alternative is to use Harrys Bar on the ground floor, in which case I reccomend the Sirloin Burger with Chedder & Bacon! The Helmsley is located directly in the center of most of the attractions you will probably want to visit whilst in New York. No more than 10 minutes in a taxi to either Bloomingdales or Macys (Opposite directions), and the Empire State Building, and a simple stroll left and up through 42nd street to Times Square and Grand Central Station. Do visit Bryan Park, just before Times Square, walking distance from the hotel. It has a lovely outside iceskating area, which I considered much better than the one in central park!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britishbird
Reviews.Content: I Contacted the hotel directly and mentioned it was a special occassion. Got a really good deal and on arrival we were upgraded for free and had an amazing room. The hotel is wonderful and in a great location. Its only few minutes walk from Grand Central and about 15 minute walk from Times Square. We got an airport bus back to the airport, theres a stop just opposite Grand Central station, saved us a fortune! Had an amazing holiday and really enjoyed our stay at the Helmsley. We even bought one of thier bath robes as we enjoyed the use of them on our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinkey1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything it advertises, good location, nice re-furbished rooms, (make sure you ask for these) and friendly helpfull staff. The door men and not sure whether he was a manager in a grey suit but he was really friendly and we always got a warm welcome when we entered or left the hotel lobby. I mislaid my jacket and it had been found and packaged away in the lost property, promptley returned as soon as I asked. We stayed here on our pre-cruise stay and having visited New York previously knew the area, a couple of blocks from Grand Central was a good start as our favourite Irish Bar is situated near here. No coffee or tea making facilities, staff said this complaint had been logged, a lot of city hotels now are offering this facility, however made good use of the deli next door for snaks and breakfast. If you do travel over the Xmas period you must visit Radio Xmas show with the rockets, my husband did not want to go to this but he thoroughly enjoyed it, ' only in America' he remarked as we left the theatre. As a Travel Agent I have stayed in the larger 4/5 star chain hotels and much prefer these smaller hotels, maybee not the health clubs etc, but after a days sightseeing and shopping who would want to work out. I would definatley recomend this hotel to my clients and will return on my next stay in the Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic time in the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: Cheesecakegirl
Reviews.Content: My friend decided to celebrate her birthday in style and visit NY with 5 of her closest friends, for Thanksgiving in November! Our trip lasted 4 whole days and what a time we had! Being a seasoned traveller to New York but not having stayed at the Helmsley before, both me and my friends were very pleased with the hotel and services it provided. The rooms were comfortable, recently renovated and our requests for three rooms 'close together' was completely fulfilled in that our rooms were next door to each other on the same floor, with views of the Chrysler building right outside. Fantastic! We ate a light supper one evening in the hotel's restaurant where the food was great and service even better! We utilised Pax deli on more than one occasion - a great place to stop off for breakfast before hitting the shops! Thanksgiving is a fantastic time to visit NY - we had a brilliant viewpoint for the Macy's Day Parade and enjoyed the bargains in the shops on the Friday. Not to mention the sights. We just ran out of time..! We thoroughly recommend the NY Helmsley when visiting this fanstastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bubbaloo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley for a week from 6th Dec and loved it! The staff were wonderful, especially on the reception desk and the lady in the souvenier shop who helped us to use the Phone Card, even offering to make the call for us if we couldn't get the hang of it. The room was extremely comfortable after a full days shopping and sight-seeing, and everything was replenished every day by housekeeping. There were plenty of towels and these were renewed every day if we left the wet ones in the bath tub. The only down side was the fact that we had to leave a $500 holding deposit at reception..it should have been $700 ($100 for each night we stayed) but the management had agreed to settle for $500 so as not to take ALL our spending money! However this was not mentioned prior to our stay when we booked through Expedia so was a big disappointment. They did allow us to take some of the money back after a few nights, when they saw we weren't running up a bill, but we had to ensure $100 a night was left for the remaining nights of our holiday. Apart from that, we had a fabulous time in New York and would definately stay at the New York Helmsley again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good location but Awful Waiters”
Reviews.Author: cnbc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a good and safe location, even in the night. Rooms are in very good condition, but price is still expensive: from 28/12 it was 395 + taxes. Even if it seems a normal price for NY, I find this expensive, and only with weak dollar many foreing tourist can afford it! We use a lot the room service and quality of food was excellent, even for europeans :) I have a complaint for the level of the staff at the breakfast: they were really amateurs! They have no education for this job! A morning I was looking for a table to sit in, and the waiter started screaming in a something like Indi-English ... After he and the restaurant manager did apologies for the waiter behaviour, but it stiil remain like a not confortable experience as when you wake up you don't really have mooth to fight with a stupid waiter just because he is not able to do his job!

Reviews.Title: “My last review still stands”
Reviews.Author: cmalloy
Reviews.Content: My second review of the New York Helmsley is almost identical to my first, which was written last year. The staff is still helpful and courteous, the location remains great, and the price is right. Ironically, my shower was not the best (like last year's). The water poured equally from the showerhead and the tub's spigot. Additionally, the room's cleanliness was a little lacking; there were a couple of hairs in the tub. And at the risk of being overly critical, there was a need for touch up paint on the doors, but the rest of the room was fine. The rooms are good-sized for NY's primo area and all in all, I remain very satisfied with my experience. The price of $200.00 a night for this area is hard to beat. We still noticed that the rooms were a bit overheated, just open the window and the stuffiness is forgotten. I hesitate to recommend that remedy because of environmental concerns. Again, these problems are minor if you get a good price. Oh, one positive is security: in the evening, the hotel security checks room keys before allowing patrons to go to their rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: charmedalt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! I read many of the reviews AFTER I booked this hotel and I have no regrets. True, there is no coffee in the room but room service will bring you a pot of good coffee for 5.95. The staff is amazing and the location couldn't be any better. My husband and I went here for our one year anniversary and now want to make it a yearly tradition with our whole family. The location is perfect-you have easy access to everything. We only took a cab once and that was to the airport (LGA). I would recommend as a tourist to get the Greyline 3 day hop on hop off pass. It is well worth the $ (112.00/per person). Note that the museums "are donation only" but they will ask for a certain amount-if you aren't planning on making a day of it, I would suggest maybe 10.00 rather than the 20.00 asked for. They will accept that, in fact will ask if 20.00 is okay. The people are incredible. I was apprehensive to go because of the past reputation of the city but it is now one of the safest cities in the world-I believe it! It is winter time and I am a clothes horse but if you want to see the city, do what I did and bring a few pair of jeans, some warm sweaters (winter time) and most importantly, very comfortable shoes. We walked miles and miles-I wish I had brought a pedometer so I could gauge how far we walked. The hotel also has a pretty nice workout room as well. Our room was on the 29th floor-we did have somewhat of a view of the Chrysler building but the room was so nice it wasn't an issue. The only negative thing that I can say about the room is that the lighting is very dim-especially the bathroom lighting. If you want knock off purses, skip Canal Street and go to Ground Zero, there is where you find the nice knock offs but the sellers are pretty discrete. We got 5 for $140.00, 4 Coach and 1 Kate Spade, very nice ones. Enjoy your stay, the hotel is fabulous and the food is really good and the prices are comparable to most of the restaurants. Note that a 15% gratuity at most places is already added in to your total. Have a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “New York Magic”
Reviews.Author: tara1001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 22nd December for 5 nights over Christmas. We were more than pleased with the hotel. The room was fab, lovely and spacious. Bed very comfortable and welcoming after a long day walking. Staff were very helpful, especially Maki at reception. Bell boys were also very helpful. The only downpoint in our stay was Christmas dinner (for which we had pre-booked). The meal was very hasty. My green salad was wilted and the chowder was lukewarm. We hadn't even finished our started and we could see our mains sitting waiting on the counter from where we were sitting going cold. We both ordered warm apple caramel for dessert but it arrived refrigerated cold and was not nice at all. However, even though we were really dissappointed with this, we cannot take away from an otherwise very enjoyable stay. I would definately stay here again and would recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jenjacknick
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel from the 7th of December. Like one of the other posters, we checked in and were told that our room wasn't ready but they my credit card detials etc and told us it would be ready on our return. We were in a party of 7 girls spread across three rooms and wanted to stay togethter. On our return we were told that our room had been given to some one else and we would have to make to with another. The manager who dealt with this was not friendly or overconcerned at the upset. The new room did not have a safe so we move once again and this time back to the same floor as our friends. There was no apology from the manager but the front desk were in embarrassed. Any how the hotel location is fab!! We were about 15 minutes walk from macy's , Grand Central was 5 minutes walk. The deli next door is the best! I had a manicure and pedicure next door for $30. The bell boys are very attentive. The rooms were spotlessly clean and spacious for a new york room. The bar in the hotel was a welcome oasis after a days shopping, though the wait staff could be a little more smiley! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location, and Value”
Reviews.Author: Trev2003
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff was very accommodating, wonderful location and excellent views of the city. The hotel is a little dated even with the recent renovation. Even with that said I had a wonderful time, and would recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “NYH - Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Amanda64
Reviews.Content: I was in a group of 7 visiting NYC for shopping and Christmas atmosphere, we stayed for 4 nights and couldn't really fault the hotel. Reception staff were very friendly and welcoming and the porters were always pleased to help with luggage and shopping. One porter quite happily escorted me to my room as I don't like using lifts on my own!! There is a fabulous deli. right next door for great breakfasts and snacks, and it is very well situated for subway and buses. The twin rooms were great, with comfortable beds and good sized bathrooms. The triple room requested was exactly the same as the twins, i.e. two double beds which meant 2 people sharing a bed, but from previous experience that is standard for NY hotels. A hairdryer is provided but no kettle. We were on the 19th floor overlooking 42nd Street so had a fantastic view of the Chrysler building and the rest of our party were on the 20th floor looking over 41st Street with a great view of the Empire State building so we really felt part of New York as soon as we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: marysj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the NYH and have to say that we were very pleased. I wanted a good location, cleanliness and I didn't want to break the bank. In the end, we went for the NYH and are very glad we did. The location is fantastic - you can walk to Times Square in under 15 minutes and the subway is less than a 5 minute walk. Our room was large, very clean and we had a view of the Chrysler Building if we stood in the right spot. Bathroom was spic and span with loads of hot water. We found the staff very accommodating and were glad to have a bar and restaurant in the building after one particularly long, cold day. Bar has a nice atmosphere and the martinis were pretty darn good. Good deli next door for breakfast - Pax. The only problem we had was that the room was hot, despite not having turned the heating on. Most of the time we had the windows open. That can be a bit noisy - even 34 floors up - but that's what NY is all about. Overall, would stay again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. Nice, large, good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TW1
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were given a lovely room that we were very pleased with. We then went out for a few hours only to find on our return that we could not get in our room. When we told reception that we could not get the key card to work they informed us that someone else had our room and that they had moved all our baggage out of there into another room!. Unfortunatly they had left our passports and all our money in the old room with the new customers ! Not a good start. Although we did get everything back the management were not very appologetic. After this bad start things did get better, and I have to say that the rooms were very clean, as were the bathrooms. The hotel is also about 10-12 mins from times square, 4 mins from central station and about 15mins from The Empire State Building, so well situated. Harry's Bar in the hotel is a nice place for a drink and the Bar Tender (Orlando) is very friendly. Have breakfast in John's Diner up the road, as it is very 'New York Diner' ish, and also a lot cheaper than the hotel. The staff on reception were generally very helpful, and the view from our floor (29th) of the Chrysler building and street below was 'awesome'!. Although we had initial problems We would stay here again. Don't forget to visit Ground Zero as it is very moving.

Reviews.Title: “No fault found”
Reviews.Author: WorthingTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to the Big Apple. Chose this hotel after hours of trawling through Trip Advisor and it didn't let us down. The staff were friendly, welcoming and polite and the room was clean, comfortable and quiet. We had upgraded to the Premier room and felt it was worth it for the extra bit of space it gave. The only downside was the price of the drinks in Harry's bar, which came as a bit of a shock. Experience taught us, though, that spirits always seem to come as a double measure in NY and with a price that more than matches, so it seems a bit unfair to hold it as a minus against the hotel. Also, although it was right on top of the Chrysler Building and not far from Grand Central Station, It was a little bit away from the majority of the main attractions, which meant extra walking. This didn't bother us but is something to take into account if mobility is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CricketerWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in a lovelly room on the 34th floor(3401). View was of the street behind the hotel but we didn't mind as it was mainly dark when we were in the room. Large room with seating and a very comfortable bed which was great as we both suffer with bad backs. Location was not a problem as you were very close to Grand Central Station. If you are OK using the London Underground then you will not have a problem with the Subway. Service was great and you never had to wait long for a lift. I would recomend the Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leadingnote
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for over two weeks. I was in a large corner room on the 33rd floor (3319).
