It was quiet and clean, with a huge comfortable bed and had a good view including the Empire State Building. This is the second time I've stayed there - I think the location is excellent. It's very near the subway and is on a busy enough street for it not to be a problem getting back late at night. There are just a couple of small gripes: the "business centre' consists of two desks and two computers and they're always in use. But even if they weren't - the cost, something like $10 for 10 minutes - is prohibitive. I discovered a McDonald's just round the corner on 2nd Ave. which has two computers and charges $5 for 30 minutes (you don't have to eat there!). Also on 2nd Ave (that is to the right coming from the hotel) there's a food store which has delicious salads and hot food that you can take away. As for travelling by subway - don't worry about it. It's fine and fast, though trains are not as frequent as in London. Also the signs are not as good. But you can always ask for directions.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: maddieIreland
Reviews.Content: this was my second time in new york and after staying at this hotel i will definately be returning. the staff are all very helpful. i stayed with three girlfriends in one room, which was very spacious.the hotel is located close to grand central station. i would 100% recommend this hotel.also there is a fab deli right next door with wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good size rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jehoolie
Reviews.Content: Great location in Mid Town, spacious rooms. Clean, a little kitsch (deco a bit old fashioned) but otherwise a good hotel with a bar, restaurant and parking next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GreenEyedIrishGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Helmsley for 5 nights at the start of Nov. Old fashioned decor in the hotel, but it was spotless and rooms were quite big. We stayed on the 24th floor and had a nice view of 42nd St. Fab location - 10 mins walk from Time Square and the Empire State Building and 5 minutes from Grand Central Station. Reception and Check In staff are so nice and helpful. Door men are very friendly and are alway ready for a chat and a joke. Have security on at night time, but they are not intimidating at all to guests. Only complaint is the concierge (a woman) was very dismissive of us when we asked questions about internet access in the business centre and refused to go in and turn back on one of the PC's that had been turned off (theres only 2 PC's there). She told me to wait! Apart from that, we would highly recommend the Helmsley! Oh, and don't use the ATM in the lobby at the weekend. We waited for out money to come out for almost 15 minutes only to be told by the reception staff that there is never any money in it at the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Some nice touches”
Reviews.Author: LEOFRICK
Reviews.Content: Superb mid-range hotel with a touch of class. Nice room with a good view of the Chrysler Building. Staff were all courteous and helpful. Ate dinner there twice. Not great but definitely not bad. Worth a visit if, like us, you couldn't face any more hustle bustle after a busy day. I would definitely stay there again. Some nice touches such as free bath robes and New York Times on weekdays. Good rate for Manhattan. Great location, being in the centre of everything. Just a block from airport buses if you want to travel that way.

Reviews.Title: “Helmsley new York clean and comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: fl0ssie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the New York Helmsley Hotel and I was pleased with the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. It was well placed, a few minutes walk from Grand Central Station and the Crysler Building and a 10 min walk to times Square. We ate only once in the bar and food was OK but there are lots of places to eat nearby so we wanted to try different places. Pershing Square diner was good quality for breakfast( just opposite Grand Central Station ) Consierge was helpful, staff on reception a liitle sour faced but overall I would definitely stay again as we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place”
Reviews.Author: tw21
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the New York Helmsley recently. The lobby and Harry's Bar are fine. Staff was courteous and accommodating. Our room was clean, bathroom was large. These are the pluses. Now for the problems: The bed was terrible- lumpy, old, almost impossible to sleep on. In addition, the air conditioning did not work. When we first went to the room it must have been 85 degrees in there, with heat blasting out of the radiator. Attempts to adjust the thermostat were unsuccessful but I was eventually able to shut off the heat. The room remained too warm for the duration of our stay. In summary, I would not recommend the New York Helmsley, especially given its high price. There are better options in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton”
Reviews.Author: Peig_Sayers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of October. The best thing about the hotel is the location. We walked everywhere, to Time Square, 5th Ave, Central Park etc. The room was ok, not bad but not fantastic. We were staying in a standard room so perhaps it would be worth paying the extra for a superior room. There wasn't much of a view as we were on a low floor. The curtains didn't close property and like previous reviewers we also had trouble with the shower/bath. On the positive side, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We ate dinner there one night. The food was lovely if a little expensive. The bar area is quite nice and the food seved there is ok. Overall, we were happy enough with the hotel especially as we spent most of our time out and about. I think maybe if we were to return we'd go for a superior room or maybe splash out on a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: traveluvr
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley is a very nice hotel in a great location - very near Grand Central so you can access both trains and the Subway very easily. With just a few blocks walk to Time Square, there is plenty of shopping and restaurants to be visited. We spent 3 days at the hotel and they did 'upgrade' us to a 'room with a view' on the 37th floor, but that meant going from a king size bed to a room with 2 double beds - but the view was worth it. The floor was quiet so no complaints there. The room itself was nicely decorated but quite 'tired' looking. A re-decoration would have allowed us to give it a much higher rating. The room did have a large flat screen TV and in room safe. The bathroom was small but adequate - wallpaper was peeling at the seams, vanity mirror was dropped in the frame. They did have free WIFI internet available in the rooms however, we did have issues getting logged in - actually had to use another guestâ€™s details to do so (per the front desk)! Perhaps we are being a bit fussy, but the price of this hotel is not cheap and we feel that for the cost of the room, they should be top-notch; but then again, this is NYC and nothing is really inexpensive there. I think they should at least have had coffee/tea facilities in the room. All in all, it served our purpose but I don't think we will be staying there on our next visit to NYC - there are just too many other hotels to try there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Loaction”
Reviews.Author: Sandy16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my wife and 2 teenage daughters. Room was quiet and clean, staff were courteous and effiecient. Check in was a breeze after long flight and the same at check out. Breakfasted in the deli next door. Two minutes from the nearest subway and 5 minutes from Grand Central with good choice of eateries. Would stay there again for any future NY trips.

Reviews.Title: “Happy times at The New York Helmsley!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle_anne1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January with my boyfriend. The door staff were very friendly and greeted us when we got out of the taxi. Check in was quick and the staff very helpful. I had emailed the staff a few days before we arrived to request a room with a view of the Chrysler building, they had notes of this on there system and first of all offered us a room on a low floor, I asked if there were any rooms higher up in the building as I thought it would be noisy lower down, so they offered us a room on the top floor with a partial view of the Chrysler building. We accepted this room which I was really glad about as we had only booked a standard room and this was an upgrade to a premier. I cannot remember the room number but it was the last number in the hotel. We walked into the room and it was spotless with a lovely view of the Chrysley building and a fantastic vie of New York itself. There was a flat screen television on the wall and an empty fridge for you to put your own things in. Concierge were also very helpful, our hairdryer wasnt working so they were up within 10 minutes with a replacement. Also the toilet flooded one morning and a plummer was up within half an hour!! I loved the location of the hotel, just out of the hustle and bustle of times square but only 10 minutes away when you wanted to walk in. Chrysler building just over the way and central station about 2 minute walk away. The Pax deli next door was delicious, I took our breakfast to our bedroom one morning and the hotel saw me taking it up and did not seem to mind at all. I would have absolutely no hesitations going back to this hotel, in fact to be honest I dont think I could stay anywhere else as everything was perfect from the actual room to the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Large room for New York”
Reviews.Author: happytime19
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. Location is great - we had a great view of the Chrysler building from our hotel window (18th floor) and Grand Central is a short walk away. I made sure to ask for a refurbished room - the carpet had only just been laid and the paintwork was still new - lovely! Having read mixed reviews about the doorman/porter at this hotel I was a little wary but staff were always pleasant. Large queue to check in but this moved very quickly. Security by elevators at night to check room key - good. The Pax deli next door is great (not the pancakes though!) Also, tried the nail bar next door - had special offer for pedicure and manicure for $35 - excellent value and fun experience for my teenage daughter and myself. 15min walk to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophie_in_london
Reviews.Content: This was a really lovely hotel and my partner and I were both pleasantly surprised. We stayed here for Valentine's day and it was a perfect romantic getaway. We had a fantastic view of the Empire state building from our room. It is in a great location- near many tourist attractions e.g Chrysler building, Grand Central Station, Times Square and Empire State building. The rooms were clean, with a TV and loads of channels to choose from. The staff are really helpful and pleasant as well. I would also recommend having dinner at the hotel as it is really great food. We had our Valentine's day meal here and it was extremely cheap- $20 for a three course gourmet meal and all drinks (beer and wine) included. Hotels in New York can often be a bit hit and miss but this one was a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with view of the Chrysler Building!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu32
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in early October in a double double room. Room was large with comfy beds and plenty of towels etc. Check-in staff were friendly and concierge really helpful (although the female concierge was a bit snooty with my male travelling companions!!). The room had a view of the Chrysler Building looking left and the United Nations looking right - very exciting! Location was great - a short stroll from Central Station for the subway and plenty of restaurants in all directions for breakfast/dinner etc. Really good hotel - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New York Helmsley....Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: NickLangstaff
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place, pleasant, helpful staff, very clean, quiet and calm. Wonderful location...central for everything one could need. Recommend booking direct with the hotel. The manager is the most accommodating and generous person you could hope for. Will definately visit again, no need to look any further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights (Oct. 3 - 6th. ) before starting a cruise. The hotel was in a great location, near Grand Central Station and the Chrysler building. We asked for one of the renovated rooms in the upper levels but none were available, we were given a room on the 22nd floor. The next morning the front desk called us and told us they had one of the upper rooms available and offered to move us. I felt their followup was beyond the call. Very professional and appreciated, however we declined as I felt we were high enough. My only complaint about the room was that there was no coffee maker, refrigerator or bottled water available. We also had the misfortune of being awaken at 3:00 am by the hotel's fire alarms going off and the fire engines arriving 22 floors below our window. We gathered in the hall along with the rest of the guests on our floor to plan our escape down the staircase. After repeated unanswered calls to the desk downstairs we started our escape. Finally a voice in broken English came across a public address system that it was a false alarm. I am disabled and walk with a cane. I would never have survived that 22 floor escape. We loved New York City and we would probably consider staying here again but next time on a lot lower floor!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit - just as good as the 1st”
Reviews.Author: Leothescouser
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Helmsley for the 2nd time within a year with my wife and took our 2 daughters this time. I gave this Hotel 5 *'s last time I reviewed it and it hasn't changed. The location for the price can't be beaten in my opinion with no complaints about the Hotel itself other than the food and drink are pricey. Staff great, location great, rooms great - what more do you want.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruzzz
Reviews.Content: We completed an Eastern Us tour and booked out of our tour hotel early. Arrived at the New York Helmsley 11.00 am which is early by US standards as rooms are only supposed to be vacated by 12.00noon. We were were very pleasantly surprised by the very friendly and helpful desk staff, who booked us into a room immediately without any extra charge. We were even able to choose a smoking room on floor reserved for smoking rooms. A lot of travellers really appreciate this comfort vz standing on the street corner having a quick puff. The room was a large double room on the 27th floor facing East 42nd Street. The room was clean, very well appointed, modern, it felt 5 starish, and the view was fantastic. Look to the left and see Chrysler building in all it's glory, and to the right you can see the United Nations building. The bathroom was also very modern, clean, lots of towels, shampoos, soaps etc. and also had a small refrigerator which was fantastic. The Hotel is really classy for the price we paid, very close to many of the main sight seeing attractions which is perfect when you are on a sight seeing mission as we were. We were out for the most of each day, but when we returned from our sightseeing, the rooms were made up and everything was just perfect. We unfortunately did not sample the hotel's food, as we were on the go, but grabbed breakfast next door at PAX or up 42nd at the Grand Central Food concourse where there must be more than 40 food outlets, with every type of food conceivable and at reasonable prices. Our compliments to the management and staff for being so polite and helpful. I will always go back to The New York Helmsley on East 42nd. I recommend this hotel to everybody who is looking for a really classy 3-4 star hotel. You will not be sorry. Bruno Swanepoel 54 Prince Street Athlone Park Amanzimtoti Kwazulu Natal South African 4126 You can gladly contact me on brunosw@telkomsa.net

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brodders
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before in Sept 2006 and came back in March 2007. The hotel has an excellent location on 42nd St and a short walk down to UN Building. We were given a room on a high floor overlooking 42nd St and had an excellent view of the Chrysler Building. The room was spacious. We had breakfast from the deli next door but they do supply a fridge for the room, so could keep milk and drinks to have in the room. Got an excellent rate at hotelclub.com. Staff are friendly and there was 2 internet stations to use for free. Would stay here with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SubaruDriver
Reviews.Content: A one night business stay on my own. Room was average sized for New York and Bed very comfortable. Room consisted of 2 beds. Plasma screen on the wall. Internet was free via Wi-Fi, but would have been nice if there was a wireless keyboard in the room if you didn't have a computer with you. No coffee or tea facilities. Bathroom was equipped with Gilchrist and Soames toiletries. Bathroom looked, and felt a little old. Had dinner in the restaurant. Food was excellent, service very good and prices not bad either. Trouble is, the restaurant looks VERY dated indeed. Good location - a couple of blocks from everything really, almost next to Grand Central Station. Would stay again, but it felt like I paid a huge amount - but then again, all hotels I looked at for my stay seemed liked their prices were massively increased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bugs1947
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean. Friendly staff. Security 5*'s. Ate next door at Pax deli. Only down side-no coffee/tea making facilities in rooom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: eoleary
Reviews.Content: Just back from a five day family trip to NYC from Ireland. The NY Helmsey was just what I had hoped for. Well located, clean and friendly. We had a room on the twenty first floor with a brill view ( not that you are going to spend time looking out the window with so much to do and see). We did not eat at the hotel but instead had breakfast at 'Pax' next door (good value food and handy). We found a great place to eat in the evening (Libretto's on 3rd. Avenue). Out the hotel door and turn left. Left again on 3rd. Avenue and you will find it a seven minute walk away on the right of the avenue. Great atmosphere loads of good italian food and nice wine at a good price. Family loved it. Wo Hop on Mott Street in China Town was another good experience for a family meal. This chinese 'cafe' in the basement is busey as it is well used by newyorkers (which is why we tried it after seeing the natives going in). If your stuck for time (as we were one evening when going to a show) a nice way of having fast food can be found at a no frills outlet just past and next door to McDonalds on the left past Grand Central (up the 42nd.street from the hotel). Here you can have a pizza or pasta dish made up to your own preference while you watch. You then sit down and eat it piping hot out of a plastic bowl with plastic knife and fork and a bottle of soda or water. Tip for the trip would be as we did. Go up Rockerfeller Centre in the morning and the Empire State in the evening (we went up at 11pm and found the ques to be very short). We found that newyorkers in general were either very rude or very nice and rather than get annoyed, we let there be a competion to find the rudest and the nicest. We felt very safe anywhere we went and can't wait to go back (in which case we will head for the NY Helmsley again).

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a great NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: networkdc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from NYC last night, and I must say, this hotel was pretty good. It's close location to Grand Central/42nd St. subway station was great! You just have to walk a block and a half and you're there. The room itself is good. Yes, a little outdated decor-wise, but the 32" flat screen totally made up for it! Room quite spacious, and the bathroom was nicely done. The only complaint I have about this hotel is, their concierge had no clue what she was talking about when I called down to get info on the airport shuttle to JFK. I talked to TWO different people and they both told me to hike down 42nd to 5th/6th Ave. where we'd find the bus pick-up. It was 84 deg. in NYC yesterday afternoon...my husband & I high-tailed it 4-5 blocks to this location with all of our luggage only to find out that it was the bus pick-up for NEWARK airport (yes, i mentioned that we were flying out of JFK THREE TIMES when i called concierge)!! We then asked the bus driver where the JFK pick-up was and he led us in the right direction - 3 blocks back from where we came from. I was not a happy girl... Kind of left a bad aftertaste of our experience at the NY Helmsley, but I would still stay there again if the chance were to arise.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: holidaytime1
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley was ideally placed for a short stay in New York. We were able to walk to most locations, bedrooms and bathrooms were clean and room service good. Only downside for me was no coffee making facilities in the room, and the restaurant was not open for the summer, although food was available from the bar. So you have to pop next door to Pax for your morning caffine fix! Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel poor reception staff”
Reviews.Author: fulmarHull
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very good in all aspects apart from the somtimes surly attitude of some female members of the reception desk one even sneered when i offered to settle my extras account at the end of our stay by travellers cheque which she made obvious she did not like the extra work it entailed . we asked for a high floor but only got the eleventh but the room was clean a little dated but had comfy beds as two people were staying in the room i could not work out why only was

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned...”
Reviews.Author: IanCBelfast
Reviews.Content: make sure you bring a credit card with you! Even though you Book and prepaid for the Helmsley Hotel New York via Expedia.co.uk. you will be asked to pay $100 pernight for your stay. money refundable when you leave. sort of cover insurance... So if all you are carrying is travellers cheques for safety- it is New York, you will be disappointed as they dont go ot of their way to accomodate. This is my only concern. After 10 hrs of travelling, this isnt a welcome surprise, which is not mentioned anywhere when booking through Expedia. Other than that, its a good hotel, with some really nice employees marred only with the inflexible 'do it by the book' attitude.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but great location!”
Reviews.Author: davelympany
Reviews.Content: Our room was ok, a little dated, but nice and comfy beds, we where on 34th floor but the view wasnt that great. Lobby was very plush and the staff where excellent, very helpfull. Little shop in lobby and floor 3 has payphones and restrooms. Everything was very clean and well organised, but the best thing about this hotel is the location! Grand central only a few blocks, Empire state the same, macy`s etc etc Times square and the list goes on.......its located on 42nd street east which is central and perfect for your vacation. We got taxis` only a few times as the position is so good we could walk almost everywhere with ease. We loved Manhattan and the hotel was a great compliment to the stay in NY! **Recomended**

Reviews.Title: “Just as described on website.”
Reviews.Author: louthIreland
Reviews.Content: After a stay of four days, we found the hotel was just as described on the website, the rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. Bathrooms were immaculate, however, one of the baths had a crack. Soft fluffy towels in plentiful. Room service very thorough. Dining room staff and food were very satisfactory, and good value. Only downside was the bell boy was not very gentle with luggage and some valuable items got broken. However, not discovered until our return home. Overall I found the hotel and most of the staff very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: rrleisurelady
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed first trip to New York City in 4-07 and felt like we received good value/rate at this hotel. Location was good, 3 blocks east of Grand Central Station and within a block of Chrysler Building on E 42nd Street. Some problems with room thermostat as it is an older building with either all heat, or all A/C. Mid April is a seasonal "shoulder", and turned unexpectedly warm. Furnace was finally switched to A/C on our third or fourth day there. Until then, we were certainly glad we were able to open the windows; and then that we were on a high enough floor that didn't cause street noise to be another issue. Due to that inconvenience, we received some compensation from management by an adjustment to check-out billing. Room and amenities were above average, except for no in-room coffee maker. Small refrigerator was requested and provided w/no added cost. Bedding was very good; closet, storage, and bathroom were more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Belligerent security staff, bad atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: pakia9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently. Hotel is well located in midtown Manhattan near to the Chrysler building and Grand Central. Rooms were clean and ours had a nice view of the Empire State Building. There is a heavy (and heavy handed) security presence in the hotel - most notably in the lobby. Our 6 year old accidentally locked the bathroom door (thankfully from the outside) and we couldn't open it. I rang the front desk and who did they send up to fix it? a security guard in shades! Mind you he did manage to get it open and was on the walkie talkie to the maintenance guys to 'DISREGARD - I REPEAT DISREGARD!!" We laughed ourselves silly when he left. Another night I was in the bar having a drink and just about to return to my room. I was immediately stopped by a BIG security guy who loudly questioned me in front of everyone. He wanted to see my room card and when I pointed out I did not have it with me he began eyeballing me and posturing aggressively. I honestly thought he was going to throw me out there and then. I told him my room number and he let me go, sneering at me as I hurriedly left the scene. What annoyed me about this was that all he had to do was ask me my name and room number and check it with the front desk - instead he seemed more intent on intimidating and humiliating me (he succeeded on both counts). And I could have given him any old baloney by just giving my room number! I did ring the manager to complain. She said she "would meet with department heads to discuss the matter". I wasn't at all surprised to hear nothing more. The only time we felt threatened at all during our stay in New York was when we were in this hotel. We'll definitely visit NY again but we'll be giving this place a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to”
Reviews.Author: ABD119
Reviews.Content: The stench in the corridors was unbearable! The room was quite spacious in NY terms, but was begging for renovation. Location is quite good, if you like staying in mid-town. If it's a business trip to NY - I'd recommend it. Anything more - I would aim at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!”
Reviews.Author: world-traveler96
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and in a very good location. Stayed in many US hotels and this one so far is one of the best. All attractions are close by and are easily accessible(by foot). Hotel room appears to have been recently renovated and is very clean. View from the room is the Empire State Buliding! World-traveler96 signing off!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulandsuerus
Reviews.Content: wow the hotel was fantastic ,we stayed for four nights and the service ,the staff and the room were great .The staff left us alone but they would go out of their way if need be.the room was very clean and spacious.I would strongly recomend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fergi-Boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The New York Helmsley for the first part of our USA holiday. Having never been to New York, we really didn't know where to start. I'd looked at a few and it was the reviews on this site that made my mind up to stay here. Being only a 5 minute walk from Grand Central Station made it really easy to find our way around. We were on the 39th floor with a good view. The views of they Crysler tower really are wonderful if you're lucky enough to get them. The room was really spacious, although we didn't spend much time in the room. So much to do in New York, we only used the hotel as a pit stop. Stopping only for sleep and to have a couple in the bar. The Bar staff were very friendly and gave us a few tips on where to go and when. We will be going back to New York at some point and I will look to book at the New York Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “Less than impressive”
Reviews.Author: Thebic
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley staff made a terrible first impression on me. Because of a family emergency, the person who had made the original reservation was unable to be present, but we had called several days in advance to notify the hotel manager and were told by two different people that everything would be taken care of when we checked in. Not only was nobody at the desk aware of our situation when we arrived, they accused me of lying about having spoken to the manager about getting the name on the reservation changed. The woman who was sent to recify the problem was unbelievably rude and when she overheard me refer to her as "the desk clerk" when calling my mom about the problem, the woman shouted " I have a name!" which I might have known had she introduced herself when she met me to address the problem, rather than sauntering up to the counter, looking at me with a sour face and mumbling "yes?" The room itself was ok, we were on a low floor with a sweeping view of the Staples Express across the street, and the noise from 42nd (blaring car horns, police sirens, trucks hitting a giant pothole every 5 seconds) was very loud and annoying. I'm not usually too hard to please, but a combination of rude staff and subpar accomodations at a high price was just really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: ei6hb
Reviews.Content: Had a family holiday in New York from July 3rd to July 11th. Booked New York Hemsley Hotel online via their website. Booked two rooms - irish family !! Had read the reviews here and was wondering whether it was a good choice. Location of hotel made the booking easier. Location is excellent, 10 minute walk to 5th Ave. another couple of minutes to Time Square, passing Bryant Park on the way. Having experienced the hotel first hand, I can't say enough good things about it from the moment we set foot inside the door. Forgot to bring an adapter for the plugs. Quick ring down to reception, one was delivered to our room within 10 minutes. Housekeeping was done daily, excellent service. Conceirge was most helpful with enquiries, bell boys (especially Pat from Mayo) was great to chat to in between helping with people either arrieving or departing in taxi's. Bar staff very pleasant, had drinks in the bar every night. Final recommendation - Would book there again when returning to New York Denis Cork

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend at the New York Helmsley at the end of March. We had booked the hotel as part of a package deal with a travel agent, so we didn't quite know what to expect. However, we were pleasantly surprised. I've been thinking really hard and I can't quite find anything to complain about. The staff was very friendly, the room was nice and clean. The location of the hotel was very good. It's just a 10 minute walk and you're on Times Square (not that there's anything to do there other than take your pictures and go and see the real New York....) The hotel is highly recommendable and the view from our room was absolutely stunning. From my bed I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building...what more could you want in New York?!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Would Stay Here Again, Dublin, Ireland”
Reviews.Author: GARJOHN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NEW YORK HELMSLEY for 5 days with mam and sister and loved the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful.The room was comfortable and location was brilliant. The bar is lovely for a few drinks before bed. Cant believe there are bad reviews on this hotel. Would recommend it to anybody and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: BBBB5
Reviews.Content: It looks like this hotel hasn't been touched since Leona worked her magic (please note sarcasm) in the late 80s. This property needs an overhaul badly. On the upside, the staff is nice and helpful, the beds are comfortable, the location is outstanding and there is complimentary WiFi. So, don't expect perfection, but this is a good value for the location (next to Grand Central).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmccann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The New York Helmsley for three nights from the 6th jun 07.found the rooms were very clean and well layed out the staff were friendly and helpful the location was very central and i would reccomend this hotel to anyone. If I ever get back to New York I will try to book this again. I had read some negetive reviews but I had nothing to complain about

Reviews.Title: “from the days of Leona”
Reviews.Author: SaminDC
Reviews.Content: Tthe hotel was fine, and it is near Grand Central. The plush towels were the best feature. The staff was ok but not too helpful. While I was there, the gym was supposedly being renovated, and they charged $15/day to use a nearby gym. They also charged for internet. They provided the Times, which most NYC hotels don't. After staying once, I cancelled future reservations and stayed at a less convenient hotel because I didn't want to give them my business again. It does not appear they have done any work on the interior since the days of Leona and Harry. The breakfast buffet was horribly overpriced, and after adding a 15% tip automatically, there was a line for "additional tip" which was outrageous given how little service they provide for a buffet.

Reviews.Title: “helmsley stinks”
Reviews.Author: eyefordetails
Reviews.Content: My room reeked of cigarette smoke. The pillows, linens, everything smelled like an ash tray. Asked for a new room. They told me none were available...hello this is a 42 floor hotel. Theys said they would remedy the problem but did nothing. The room was very, very noisy even though I was on the 22nd floor. The fitness center was hot, humid and poorly equipped. The staff was not helpful. I moved to another hotel the next night with courteous staff, quiet, clean rooms. Pristine linens and bathroom. What a relief to get out of that dump! I would not stay here for free!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE VIEW”
Reviews.Author: RafflesInverness
Reviews.Content: Wonderful family week spent in NYC. This hotel certainly made our stay very comfortable. Reception staff extremely helpful. Our recently refurbished room on the 26th floor had an amazing view of the Chrysler Building. Brilliant location. Within walking distance of all the must-see sights!. The beds were the highlight of my 13 year old daughter's holiday. Already planning our return visit and will be taking more members of my family to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SavvyUrbanite
Reviews.Content: New York is extremely expensive during the week. It is hard to find a decent hotel for less than $300 a night. This is one of the few, if only, first-class hotel that offers such a rate in the dense midtown area. If you are willing to spend $500+ a night elsewhere, be my guest and best of luck to you. After reading some of the nightmarish reviews I was a bit apprehensive. I booked directly with the hotel and was given a fine room on the 23rd floor. This may be the way to go to guarantee one of the refurbished rooms on the higher floors. If you hate street noise, ask for a room on the back street side. 42nd Street traffic at 6 am is pretty loud. Bathroom a good size and clean. Beds fine. Our corner room was superb, with view of Chrysler building. Breakfast a good value in nice dining room. As I said, if you are looking for value, book here. I have heard that if you get a room through the cut-rate Internet sites you might not get the best room. But then you might if you play your cards right when you arrive. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NY Helmsley May 18th-25th 2007 with our two year old son. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The room at the 30th floor was nice, reasonably large, and very family-friendly (nothing that breaks easily, large bathtub, etc.). The hotel also has a great location - close to Grand Central Station, and, very importantly to us, within walking distance from Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - better than I could have hoped for”
Reviews.Author: UKNemo
Reviews.Content: Booked directly via the hotels website as this was the cheapest option. Allowed us to check in early, gave us a room on the top floor of the Empire State Building and couldn't have been more friendly. Room was bigger than I expected and very clean. Room service was great with a good choice of food. Had a bar and restaurant downstairs which we didn't use but looked very nice. Even has a small touristy shop in the reception. All staff we encountered were incredibly helpful. The hotel is over the road from the Chrysler building. A couple of blocks one way is the United Nations and about 1 block the other way is Grand Central Station. A block further on is Fifth Avenue. All in all this was a fantastic hotel in a superb location and next time we are in New York we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience made better by a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: AndieF
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one-night stay at the NY Helmsley. We initially got off to a bad start at the hotel. I'd asked for a room on one of the upper floors, only to be booked on the 9th floor. The front desk was very accommodating, moving us to a different location -- on the 33rd floor. I want to personally commend Lily and the others at the front desk for being professional, courteous, and for going above and beyond to ensure our stay was a good one. The room itself was a decent size, and the view was magnificent-- the skyline and even a glimpse of the river. The room was very clean, and while we appreciated the small, flat-screen TV, it was odd to have an empty armoire still in the room where I imagine the previous tv had been housed. Our only complaint about the room was very dim lighting in the bathroom. It cast everything in a sort of grey tinge. The location is fairly convenient, though the neighborhood is quiet at night. We actually walked across town to the theatre district -- which took about 20 to 25 minutes. We didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on their restaurant. In all, I felt this was a fairly good experience...made so much more enjoyable by the professional and accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycdreamer
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel,very friendly staff. Nice clean rooms maid service daily,The new york times gets delivered free on weekdays to your hotel room. Highly recommended!Lovely little shop inside aswell. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “S'ok... Not great.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Coyle_Test
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a little tight, and the thermostats didn't work. We called down to the front desk and the maintenance guy told us to "open our windows if it's too hot, and close them if you're too cold". For the price, they can do better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bed Linen”
Reviews.Author: Nikki79
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I was treating my mother and two sisters to a trip of a lifetime to New York city for 3 nights from the 3rd May. I checked out the reviews here on tripadvisor and thought it looked a safe enough bet. We were planning on being out shopping and sightseeing all day long so all we really wanted was a clean bed and bathroom - nothing fancy. However, we didnt receive this..... On the first night my mother got into her bed and found a long black hair beside her which obviously didnt belong to her and when she pulled back the covers the sheets were stained with blood and had hairs all over them from a previous occupant. The sheets hadnt been changed from the previous guests, instead the housekeeper had simply remade the beds with soiled linen. My aunts bed appeared to be stained with urine or something else equally unsavoury. This is just not acceptable in a supposed 4 star hotel. The most basic function of a hotel is to provide a clean bed to sleep in and for over EURO 230 a night it isnt too much to expect. I simply cannot express how disgusted I am at the lack of hygiene displayed and the complete lack of pride the staff/hotel owers have in their establishment. I wouldnt invite someone into my home and ask them to sleep in soiled sheets let alone expect someone to pay for the privilege! I have been in hostels that were cleaner than this room. In the second room which my sisters and I shared there was blood stains on the carpet and the mattress bases were heavily stained but at least our sheets were clean. The rooms are badly worn and in serious need of redecorating. We were staying on the 19th floor and these are the old unrenovated rooms. After reading the reviews here it would appear that the renovated rooms are far superior to the tatty lower floors which really are not suitable to be let out. When we complained to the on-duty manager about the condition of the rooms all he could do was apologise but said that as I had paid upfront he couldnt compensate us for the stomach churning incident. I filled in a customer comment card and both my aunt and mother wrote letters to the general managers outlining how awful the rooms were but we have not heard anything back as yet. It is only 48 hours later but with something as serious as this I would have expected an immediate response. The location of this hotel is really excellent and some of the staff were very friendly and the food in the restaurant was great ( we ate there the first night before the soiled sheets incident) however this is all overshadowed by the dirt of the rooms. If a hotel cannot provide its patrons with a clean bed what else is it lacking? My advise is DO NOT STAY HERE unless you're guaranteed one of the renovated rooms! It really is a shame because this could be a great hotel but it fell well short of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daff201
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York Helmsley. Great position. Great views. The staff were brilliant and room was great. Would agree that the breakfast wasnt fantastic but plenty of Delis around the corner. Grand Central within a 3o second walk. What else could you want!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aidan07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York Helmsley with my mum for 5 nights and found it really comfortable. The location was brilliant and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only minor disappointment about our room was that there wasn't a keyboard for use of the free wireless broadband...but we were allowed free use of the internet in the loby. We stayed in a premier room on the 39th floor, which had a 38 inch LCD flat screen TV and 2 queen size beds. We found our room and all parts of the hotel spotless and well looked after. If I ever stay in New York again I would defianatly go back to this hotel. The hotel's restaurant is a little expensive so go to the little Deli next door called Pax World for very cheap but good quality breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Leona Would Not Approve”
Reviews.Author: JKantor
Reviews.Content: For the significant cost (approx. $300/night) and the location, I expected a hotel that was well-lit, clean, with up-to-date furnishings and details, and with a staff (e.g., front door, restaurant, etc) that was readily available and service oriented. (In the 4 days I stayed there, no one was around or offered to help me with my bags or get a taxi.) The first room I received was filthy. There were huge stains on the carpet, there was either food or some sort of animal dropping under the bed--I didn't choose to investigate it too closely to determine exactly what it was!-- and was dingy overall. In addition, the furnishings were dated and the tv remote didn't work. I requested to be moved. While the front desk staff was pleasant about the change, they hardly went above and beyond to help me make the move--I expected at least an offer to have a bellman help me move my bags! The advertised package--"Eat, Sleep, Be Merry"--that included breakfast was not worth the money for the breakfast. The prepared food--hot and cold--was absolutely miserable (old mushy fruit salad, greasy, overcooked hot food), and the service almost non-existant. After my first day, I made other breakfast arrangements outside the hotel. Finally, on my last day, I returned to my room to find that someone (the maid?) had left a used newspaper and a pen scattered on the sink counter...were they using my bathroom as a rest stop to do their crossword puzzle? Originally from the NY area, I was familiar with the Helmsley hotel name, and expected at least average service and surroundings. I was left sorely disappointed by my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more”
Reviews.Author: CorkPaul23
Reviews.Content: This is a very impressive hotel and my wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Having read the reviews here, we were happy enough that the comments were mostly positive. The location on 42nd St is ideal as a base for shopping/sightseeing/activities. We spent 4 nights here starting on St. Patricks day and during this time we shopped in Macy's, the Manhattan Mall and Jersey Gardens, We went to a game in the Garden and did a helicopter tour of Manhattan. With the exception of the helicopter trip, everything was within walking distance. The rooms were big for a New York Hotel. a HD flat screen LCD TV in our room and a comfortable bed. The room was on the 32nd floor and looked across the city skyline to the Chrysler building. Importantly the room was clean. The bar in the hotel was comfortable enough but to be fair, we were not in NY to see a hotel bar and only stopped off for a drink. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and courteous. I have seen some comments about the staff and I guess that it is just the luck of the draw. On Paddy's Day, the staff were all wering green flowers and I was chatting to the porter (Joe) about this and when we came back down to the lobby to go out, he was waiting with lapel flowers for my wife and I. A nice touch. The Pax deli is pretty nice but also walk down the street and opposite grand central, there is a lovely restaurant that serves great breakfast. They advertise it as the best in the world... I must say, it is pretty good! For a non-expensive activity, try Central Park. There is an Ice rink in the centre and some great views of the city. We walked back to the Helmsley from Central Park via 5th Avenue and visited St Patricks Cathedral. One regret was not going to the 'Top of the rock' but that is a must for next time. Locals tell us that the views are better than the Empire State Building. For nightime activities, there is no shortage but behind Grand Central station on 43rd btwn Madison & Vanderbilt you will find Annie Moores Irish pub. We didn't try the food but the beer and service was pretty good. If you do go shopping, there is a shop in the Manhattan mall that I particularly enjoyed. It's called Brookstone and is full of gadgets and gizmos as well as having massage chairs. Great place to spend an hour while the wife goes shopping! Also, bring your passport to Macy's. There is an office upstairs where they will give you an 11% discount card for all purchases. The outlet stores are full of good deals and we opted for the Jersey Mall as it was 30mins on a bus from Port Authority and $10 return on the bus versus $38 and 90mins to woodbury Common. Again, bring the passport for a discount card. Great hotel, great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: hoghill1
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for NYC. Close to subway, Times Square, Empire State Building, Grand Central Station. All of the staff concierge, front-desk, bar staff were well above average. Rooms were clean with very adequate amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, overall”
Reviews.Author: Nawlins_LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the NY Helmsley and, overall, I'd say it was a good experience. The room was a nice size and was clean. The staff was pleasant. We had lunch in the restaurant and the food and service was fine. One disappointing thing, though, was lack of air conditioning (they hadn't turned it on yet). Days in April can be warm or cold but our room was sometimes too warm so we had to open the window to get some cool air. The problem with that in NYC, of course, is noise. And when you're spending $225 (+ taxes) per night you expect at least _some_ air temperature control. I don't think I'd stay again if I had to pay that much and couldn't be sure I could make the room a comfortable temp without opening the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: nyrob
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from spending 11 nights in the Helmsley on East 42nd Street. Our stay in this hotel just added to the experience that is having a stay in New York. We found the staff to be helpful, friendly and very approachable. The room we were allocated on our arrival was one of the refurbished ones. Although slightly small, partly due to the two queen size beds in it, the room was beautifully decorated and very well appointed. The room was clean and tidy and the maids kept a good standard of cleanliness throughout our stay. We did not have much opportunity to eat in the hotel with som much choice but the one breakfast and one evening meal we did have in the hotel were both large and delicious, especially the evening one where we were given cheesecake that was even better than the world famous Juniors which we had sampled earlier. Overall, we found everything at the Helmsley to be of a good standard and we would be happy to stay there again when returning to the Big Apple and would readily recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: LorraineLondon
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were some of the rudest and unhelpful I have come across. The heating had been switched off for the summer - rooms were freezing - told too bad by the staff on reception. Fire alarms at 8.30am - just testing - not a real fire alarm test - could this not have been done later. Bell staff rude and unhelpful. Bar staff great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grainnemeehan
Reviews.Content: Waterford, Ireland. We stayed here for St patricks Weekend, location was excellent, Accomodation was great, well above average. Great value for money. Breakfast over priced for what was available. Staff friendly and helpful. Great expereience overall and have no problem reccomending it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: mickdruid
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my wife and two friends to New York to see the St Patricks day parade. We found the staff very helpful and pleasant. Our room was on the 26th floor with a view of the empire state building from the bed!! We stayed room only as eating out in New York is great.For the best breakfast tun left as you leave the hotel and walk up to where the small bridge crosses the road at Grand Central Station under this bridge straight across from the station you get the most fantastic breakfast, be early it gets very busy. The hotels location is second to none you have the Empire state, 5th Avenue, Grand Central, Chrysler Building, Times Square etc all within a few minute walk. Ps Do the circle line boat tour to see the statue of liberty and the new york skyline it is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LennonDMP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the here in early March and have nothing but praise. We were given a really nice room on the 30th floor which fantastic views of mid town and 42nd street along with a queen sized bed and plasma TV to boot. As the forum suggests, the hotel is in a great location, minutes away from grand central station and Times Square is only a 10 â€“ 15 minute walk. A special mention has to go to Orlando (the bar man), mention any type of ffod or bar and he will recommend the best. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kerrymonkey
Reviews.Content: My FiancÃ©e and I stayed here just over a year ago. It was about $200 a night for 7 nights. The room was on 41st floor. I highly recommend you ask for a room on one of the upper floors as they have been refurbished lately. The room itself was excellent. Huge bed. Large flatscreen TV with free internet. Nice enough bathroom. View was from front of hotel so we had a great view up 42nd St and of the Chrysler Building. Staff were fine. No complaints though we didn't interact much. They were helpful on our last day when we asked them to keep our bags while we had most of the day to kill. The bar was pricey and to be honest I wouldn't bother with it. Much better bars near by. Can't comment on the restaurant either but again when in New York why bother eating where you stay? Get out there! We normally caught breakfast in the cafe beside the hotel which was fine. Best thing about this hotel were the fantastic location and the room was superb. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RedJak
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous 5 night stay at the Helmsley to celebrate my 40th birthday. We found the staff to be very helpful and check in was efficient and quick. The rooms were spacious and adequate for our needs. The bar was nice and cosy and great for a drink at the end of a long day. The hotel is in an ideal position to all the major sights and the easiest way to see everything is to walk as the buildings are amazing! For breakfast we used PAX next door which offered a huge variety of food all day long. There is also a lovely Italian restaurant opposite the hotel. The hotel was situated close to Grand Central Station and within easy walking distance to the Empire State Building. We also visited the Rockerfeller Centre and went to the top, the views were just amazing and in our opinion far better than the view from the Empire State Building (we bought out tickets online before we travelled for both of these attractions which saved having to queue!) The hotel is within a 15-20 minute walk from Times Square, Central Park and fifth avenue! We would also highly recommend a helicopter trip - the only way to see New York - We cant wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: No.1shopaholic
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the New York Helmsley. I took my Mum for her 60th Birthday. Location is fantastic, a few minutes walk to Grand Central, 5th Avenue. About 20 minutes walk to Times Square. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 22nd floor with a fantastic view of the Chrysler. There is some renovation work going on, but we weren't disturbed by any noise. Rooms are very clean and comforatble- beautiful bathroom. We also used Pax next door for drinks etc. like many other reviewers. There's a fabulous restaurant around the corner called Cibo- extremely friendly staff and fabulous, reasonably priced food. We were also given a free round of drinks at the bar! I would highly recommend this hotel, and will certainly be using it again. We also noticed airline crew staying at the hotel which is always a good sign- in my experience if the airline crew use a hotel, it's generally a sign of a good hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day New York Visit. I cannot rate the hotel highly enough, the staff were excellent and couldn't do enough for us especially Leon at the front door. The service was fantastic, rooms clean and comfortable we had a room on 31st floor with an excellent view of the Crysler Building. We didn't eat in the hotel but did use the bar which was cozy and the staff where friendly - we used the Pax deli next door for breakfast good food and reasonably priced. Check in and out went without any problems again due to great staff. We were so impressed with this hotel that we will be booking to return later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so rude! Don't stay here if your young!!!”
Reviews.Author: nestrel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend of mine. We booked in for a week, specifically requesting a non-smoking room - they gave us a smoking room. My friend decided that there was no way we wanted to put up with the smell for a whole week, so requested they move us to a non-smoking room as we had initially requested - which to be fair, they did - though why they didn't put us in that room in the first place is a mystery. Later on in the week my friend and I arrived back at the hotel, and she started to feel very unwell. It turned out that an allergy had flared up. We called the switchboard who were very helpful, who put us through to the on-call doctor. The doctor suggested getting something from the local chemist. This was at 11 o'clock at night. It was only the two of us girls, both in our twenties, so I went down to reception to see if I could get some help. I explained the situation to the reception staff, who were very little help and very off-hand. The door staff were also very rude and did not offer any help, even though it meant a woman going out late at night alone in a city she wasn't familiar with. I felt very upset and completely abandoned by the staff, considering I had no choice but to go out alone to find the medication my friend needed. Time and again during our stay the staff were rude and off-hand with us, clearly favouring the older patrons. They obviously saw us as being young and potentially poor tippers! The switchboard staff were always very helpful but the front of house staff treated us rudely and as if they couldn't wait to get rid of us.They were very off-hand and continually treated us as if we weren't good enough to stay there. Bascially if you are younger - and I was 25 at the time, so not that young - you are probably better off staying somewhere else where they will help you in the middle of the night and not send you off alone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: yerominas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Feb 07. Superb location on 42nd street between 2nd & 3rd Avenues. Less than five minutes walk to Grand Central Station & not much further to Times Square etc. Good comfortable room with two double beds, table & armchairs, TV, lovely bathroom with good shower, ice machine on corridor. Very friendly staff. Ask for high floor room if possible for best views. We were floor 12 & could see nearby beautiful Chrysler Building & UN HQ on a sideways view, but the higher the better. Didn't use bar or restaurant so can't comment. Useful business centre (small charge) in lobby with two PC's & printers - good for reconfirming flight. Fantastic cafe next door - Pax - with lovely fresh food for breakfast & through the day, & loads of other food places nearby. Don't miss Grand Central Station - beautiful building, fantastic fresh food market, nice shops, & great dining area downstairs - especially with kids as there's lots of different food stalls to choose from & plenty of places to sit. Loved New York & for those worried about safety (like I was) - don't, I never felt threatened or insecure even at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend in 'The Big Apple!'”
Reviews.Author: UKMichelle
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay in The New York Helmsley Hotel.....overall very impressed, hotel is very clean, good service, most of the receptionists very helpful and friendly. Room service....reasonably priced, we ordered 3 hot chocolates and ended up with 3 massive teapots full....too much to drink, but very nice... but thats America for you! As most people have said use Pax World next door for breakfast....fab, fast service, friendly staff, we used it for drinks in the evenings in our hotel room too. Well worth booking this hotel....good location, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad... Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: iowaruggerbugger
Reviews.Content: Had a corporate rate through my company which made the hotel affordable. Wasn't overly impressed but was not disappointed. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Location is great. All in all, not a bad place to stay if you don't have 400 + bucks to spend on the Marriort or 4 Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonRich
Reviews.Content: We only spent a couple of nights here, but found the hotel to be excellent. Staff were great especially Dennis who was very pleasant and helpfull! We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Scannie
Reviews.Content: Very mediocre accommodation - I was disappointed having read the reviews on this site. The hotel's in good location (right next to Grand Central) and everything was clean but - the hotel looked tired - the food was awful - do not order room service! - they're still renovating so start banging at about 8.30 in the morning which you can hear several floors above and below - the shower runs out of hot water pretty quickly - the plumbing leaves something to be desired (we had a very noisy toilet (!) which they took ages to fix) It isn't really a 4 star hotel. Don't think I'd stay here again - it's worth paying the extra for a solid 4* with a few perks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe83
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend & I arrived with Delta Airlines from London Gatwick on a Thursday for a 4 night stay - we were immediately impressed by the attentive & friendly staff at Check In - I would particularly like to thank Deirdre for her honest advice about where not to venture across town! I also mentioned that it was my birthday (hence the reason for the trip) & she kindly sent up a complimentary bottle of red wine! Our room was on the 33rd floor - very roomy,huge bed & flat screen TV! The bathroom was nicely finished in marble & was clean. We had a great view of the Empire State Building & felt very faint looking down from our room onto the traffic below!! There was a great little cafe next door called Pax - I would recommend going there for brekkie as the hotel charges about $18 each!! The hotel's location was ideal - Times Square, 5th Ave etc were only about 15mins walk away, Grand Central was the next block along. We had a great meal out at The Peking Duck on E. 53rd Street, and also an expensive but yummy meal at the Sparks Steak House on E. 46th St - steaks & wine list very impressive! If you want to go ice skating in Central Park, keep in mind that the rink closes at 2.30pm on Mondays and Tuesdays! All in all, a wonderful birthday weekend. Just a couple of down points: 1. Tipping - everyone expects a tip & it drove us mad!!! You're even expected to tip a barman for only pulling the top off a beer bottle. 2. Caroline's Comedy Club - we felt like we got scammed here! It was rated 2nd in our guidebook, so thought we'd check it out on our last night. Tickets were $24.50 & you had to purchase 2 drinks each. We bought 2 drinks at the bar before we entered the stage area, but were told afterwards that these drinks didn't count towards our quota! At about $13 each (for a beer!) these were ridiculously expensive! The comedy was awful, not really comedy at all, as the main act 'comedian' decided to get up and give everyone a sermon about 'loving thy neighbour' and how 'black brothers' should respect one another!! Not exactly our cup of tea!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123Boston
Reviews.Content: I was compelled to write a review b/c I relied heavily on this site when trying to find a hotel in NY. From the moment we walked in, we were impressed. The Front Desk staff were very friendly, our room was quite spacious on the 36th floor (corner room) with king bed. Everything was very clean. I have two complaints: Bed was sagging in the middle I put a DND sign on door.. didn't want maid to come and they came in anyway. That is a BIG no no in the hotel industry! I didn't complain, but really should have. We did not use any of the services there, just to sleep, but overall, very happy. Do not hesitate to book here!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: mgmarmolijo
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. I stayed here for one week and a half for work and hated every minute of it. *Gave me free internet, only to find out their server didn't work. *Room service was wrong all five times I ordered. *The light bulb in the room was blown with broken glass. *The phone by the bed didn't work. * The closet door knob was broken. *The Mindy's restaurant rushed me out of my lunch. *I had them add a name to my room for a guest traveling with me, and they took my name off instead. *Worst of all, the front desk charged my own personal credit card by accident when the room was already paid for by my employer! It took them a week to reverse the charge. *The concierge was extremely rude giving dirty looks when I needed help with my luggage, or when I needed help with packages I was expecting. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. It deserves a 1 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bellygem
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have just got back from a five night stay at this hotel and we thought it was fantastic. We was a little worried as we had seen mixed reviews for thid hotel but I don't know how anyone could not have been impressed by this. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the very friendly and helpful bell boy. The ladies behind the front desk were also very accomodating. We were shown up to our room that was amazing. The only thing I found a little dissapointing was the view of the office block at the back. We weren't in the room much anyway and being at the back meant it was nice and quiet. I am sure that if we had asked to move, then they would have moved us but we weren't bothered. The room was a little cold when we got there, so we explained to the front desk who got our heating fixed straight away. The beds were extemely comfortable and the room was always clean. Rooms were of very good size with three phones, iron and board, safe in the wardrobe tv and alarm clock. To say this was posh for us was an understatement. We paid a little exrta for what we had hoped as a lot of cheaper hotels seemed to have bad reviews. We are so glad we picked this hotel, it was gorgeous. We even had th taxi door opened and the door spun for us, we didn't have to lift a finger if we did't want. The location is great too. Just across form the Christler and down the road from grand central. Right at the heart of everything really. So if you're in doubt whether to book this or not, I strongly advise you do.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Trip”
Reviews.Author: TonbridgeSunshine
Reviews.Content: For my 50th Birthday we went to New York & stayed at the Helmsley, this turned out to be an excellent choice. The majority of the tourist hot spots were within walking distance & we had a view of the magnificent Chrysler building from our bedroom window. We only had one meal in the hotel (buffet breakfast) which was excellent at circa Â£10 per head although you can find local restaurants/cafes offering similar fare at half this price. We shared the "family" room with my teenage daughter and there was plenty of room for us, the room was very clean with plentiful towels & lotions. The only minor gripe was that the fridge "froze" everything although we did not report this, so cannot complain. All the staff were friendley & efficient & the front desk arranged for a complimentry bottle of wine on my birthday. We found it very easy to find our way around New York & we had a lovely trip & we will definately come back. A tip; Do not que for hours to view the statue of liberty, go round the corner to the staten Island ferry, which is free & you can get some god photos of the statue.

Reviews.Title: “New York New York so good they named it twice”
Reviews.Author: ggWakefield
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked our trip to New York and really did not have a clue what to expect. The hotel was terrific, comfortable, clean and friendly. A 5 minute walk away from Times Square, 2 minutes from Grand Central Station and an excellent view of the Chrysler Building from our hotel window. This was an excellent experience, made even nicer by the comfort of the New York Helmsley. My only gripe............ On the Saturday night nobody wanted to help us get a taxi. Although we managed to get one ourself in the end. I would reccommend this hotel and when I go back (and I do plan to) I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “The Helmsely Hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: BarnettFamily
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley Hotel was great! 212 East 42nd Street, New York City. Excellent location, close to Grand Central Station, the United Nations and the Chrysler Building. Walking distance to the Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue and Times Square. We were upgraded on check-in because we were staying for 10 nights over the Christmas / New Year period. Lovely, large room on the 39th floor! The staff at Helmsley were generally very helpful throughout our stay. The first night we got in very late after our 19.50 hour flight from Auckland, the Concierge arranged for a delivery of burgers from the local take-out because room service had finished! We obviously looked hungry! We would stay at the Helmsley again when we next visit New York. We thouroughly recemmend this Hotel to anyone planning a trip to New York. Barnett family, Auckland New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AÃ­ne
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Helmsley and couldn't be happier about the experience! From our super-fast check in process to our super-fast check out it was marvellous. I requested a room on a high floor - no problem. We were given a room on 34 with a great view of the Empire State Building. All of the staff, without exception, were courteous and helpful and did not 'hover' for tips. All requests were dealt with immediately and withut fuss (our toilet backed up and the maintainance guy was at the door in 3 minutes after I called reception). We didn't use the bar or restaurant (we prefer something more casual) but they looked great. The area where the hotel is situated is perfect - within walking distance of Times Square, Grand Central Station and the great shopping on 34th Street (including Macy's) and just far enough away from the hustle & bustle to ensure a relaxed stay. If I were to recommend a few things to do/see I'd say take the Circle Line 3 hour boat tour (from pier 83 at 42nd & 12th), eat at Josie's Restaurant (at 38th & 3rd), have a beer at O'Lunney's Bar (just off Times Square on 47th Street), go to Jersey Gardens for the shopping (111 bus from Port Authority Bus Terminal on 8th Avenue at 42nd Street), see the inside of Grand Central Station (a hop and a skip from the hotel), have breakfast at PAX Deli (next door to the hotel) and just have a great time in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayster
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the NYC Helmsley. The only complaint is that it needs a facelift. You really do feel like you are walking into the 80's when you head into the front lobby. That said, the front desk staff was very friendly. The bathrooms have marble. The toiletries are very nice. Robes are provided. So are extra blankets in the closet and a mini-fridge in the bathroom. The location is a slight hike from Times Square and Penn station, but still within walking distance. It is right by the Chrysler building. I found the price to be unbeatable. It was by far the lowest priced hotel in the 4-star category when I booked and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: Lk68
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous reviews before leaving, we were apprehensive about this hotel - particularly since we would be staying for 5 nights over Christmas. I cannot fault the hotel in the slightest! the staff in all departments were fabulous, extremely helpful and courteous. The only blip (and this maybe the norm in any hotel in NY) is I'd have liked a coffee making facility in the room - we had a fridge, so it would have been nice, but this is not crucial and besides the PAX deli right next door had the most DEVINE coffees, the other one a bit further up the block serves a mean french vanilla! For anyone going to NY, I also recommend "Brooklyn Bagel" on 5th Avenue across from the Empire State - the staff fixed us some delicious bagels on Christmas Day and were very helpful. I will DEFINITELY be using the Helmsley again and will actively recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: Wonderwoman0126
Reviews.Content: Having researched many potential accommodations, we enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Helmsley for a 4-night holiday trip! Bernardo upgraded us to a king room on the 40th floor, the view from which my NYC newbie boyfriend loved. The room and bathroom were spotless and the king bed was incredibly comfortable. Closet and drawer space were ample. This hotel is very well sound insulated. We never heard a peep from another room or another floor, and there seemed to have been high occupancy. We had a problem with our in-room safe (not the hotel's fault), and the abundant, expert and professional security and maintenance staff took care of it very quickly - on Christmas day, no less. Front desk, concierge. security and bell staffs were all very friendly and helpful yet refused to accept well-deserved tip money. And, of course, the location is prime for subway, walking and sightseeing enthusiasts. We will undoubtedly stay here again. Only one thing to watch out for - it is very hot in the winter on the upper floors. Take lightweight clothing to wear while in your room and keep some air conditioning circulating. This was a very minor annoyance that we were able to deal with by keeping the room door ajar and windows open while awake. Overall we had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay. Kudos to the hardworking Helmsley staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blocky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new york helmsley for three nights in december, it is a lovely hotel, location is great a short walk from Times Square& Grand Central Station which was great for travelling on the subway, hotel rooms are a decent size and are well looked after. Gray line tour buses do a good two day deal which is handy for getting around to see a lot and being able to get off at whatever stops you want. The view revolving restaurant in the Marriott in Times Square is a great experience in dining, wine and the views, well worth a visit. If you like shows or have never been to one on broadway The Lion King is well worth going to is is very entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Tell all your friends”
Reviews.Author: coventrygal
Reviews.Content: Booked this through a package with Harry Shaw Travel of Coventry and when we turned up it was like 'wow' ... friendly staff, nice large room and clean large well lit bathroom and complimentary newspaper and oh so comfortable beds and fluffy towels and bathrobes!! ... and excellent location just a few blocks from Times Square and right by the Chrysaler Building. The hotel allows you to take food into the room so the deli next door was frequently used for a mid afternoon pit stop and foot rest!! Would definately stop there again and would encourage anyone to think about this hotel for service and location .... only one gripe ... the window wasnt well glazed and was a bit drafty so you could hear some street noise but with the heating cranked up and the blinds, nets and curtains closed then this did the trick. As part of our package our cases were securely locked in a room til the mid afternoon of our departure and the Bell Captains were very helpful indeed ... there is also a full sense of security too, especially at night ... everyone was asked to show their room passes to get into the lift. All in all its our 2nd trip to NY at this was by far the best hotel .. and looking at the other hotels we were going to book that were just situated off Times Square/Broadway .. this was definately the pick of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standard of service”
Reviews.Author: markyboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Helmsey from Nov 14 2006 for 13 nights. The stay was excellent. The only slight hitch was that there was a problem when we checked in (at know fault of the Helmsey), so if you are booking through a travel agent as we did with escape travel, then always confirm your booking if it was booked via a 3rd party in the united states!!! This problem was quickly rectified within 24 hours, with much thanks to Desseree (wrong spelling!! She was the manager at the time of our check in). Her attitude was positive, never arguing with us, and placed us in an excellent room on the 38th floor facing 42nd street with views toward the east river and the chrysler building. Highly recommend its location. For excellent coffee (new york standards...) go to cipriani le specialli on 42nd st east just a couple of blocks west of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the N.Y.Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: gihon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the N.Y. Helmsley from 23rd Nov. for three nights prior to a cruise. Booked as part of a package deal with NCL We had been a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews, however, from arrival to departure we were delighted. The receptionist was very friendly and had taken note of our e.mail asking for a room on a high floor. We were on the 31st floor with views of the Chrysler Building. Anthony, the bell hop, was very helpful, and gave us lots of advice. We did as everyone else and had breakfast in Pax Deli which was excellent value, we bought take out in the afternoons and took back to our room lovely cakes. We did take our own kettle and tea making things as suggested.The room was attractive with two queen size beds and a plasma t.v. which we hardly had time to watch.
