Access to the subway and Grand Cebtral Station was a short walk away. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: kirkjshurey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New York Helmsley with 3 friends for a two night break. Check-in staff were friendly but bell captain was not particularly helpful as we were unable to store our bags prior to the room being available, due to 'security measures' which meant we wasted valuable time sitting with our suitcases at the bar rather than sightseeing. The room was on the 18th floor, large, but slightly shabby, although not dirty, with views of the Chrysler Building and Second Ave. Street noise was not too loud and no noise heard at all from other rooms. Room lacked tea/coffee making facilities or a safe and although a fridge was located in the bathroom, it didn't work. Plenty of comfortable new towels and decent toiletries were provided and service was quick when we asked for additional items. The bed was comfortable and iron/board handy to have. The best thing about the hotel for us was its location, just diagonally across from the Chrysler Building and a couple of blocks from Grand Central Terminal, 5th Ave. and Times Square. We managed to get an exceptionally good airline rate due to friends working for VAA, but I would not have paid full rack-rate as the hotel was simply too shabby for anything more than a weekend break and would benefit from a complete refurbishment. I would recommend this hotel for a long weekend if you can obtain a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “The NY Helmsley - a top spot”
Reviews.Author: ndwhyte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to New York along with our niece and had originally booked another hotel but having read the horrific reviews on this website we decided to change. We booked the NY Helmsley based purely on location. And I'm glad we did. Although just a little further from the shopping districts than our original hotel I actually thought it was in a much nicer area....still only a 10 minute walk from Times Square, close to 5th Ave shopping and 1 block from Grand Central Station which is well worth a visit. The room was relatively large, clean and had it's own safe. No fridge but there are ice machines on each floor with ice buckets in the room. Room service called each day and rooms were always left tidy and towels changed each day. Over all I was very impressed with the hotel and would not hesitate to stay again. Only a few very minor gripes We had booked a Double Double Premium room (apparantly have Plasma screen tvs) and paid a little extra for this but on arrival we were just assigned a standard double room. I queried this at the desk and they had none of the premium rooms available for the night we arrived (strange considering I booked directly through the hotel website!). The room we'd been given was fine so once I ensured that the extra premium on the bill had been removed we decided not to complain any further. Our room was at the back of the hotel and had a view of nothing, if you want views of the Chrysler Building ask for a room at the front of the hotel (although it may be a bit noisier! Mindys Restaurant and Harrys Bar are *very* expensive, (as is the Pershing Square Deli at GCS - beware! Pax Deli next dooor is great for breakfast/snacks and the Phoenix Garden on 40th Street (2 blocks behind the hotel) is a *superb* chinese restaurant, low on decor, low on price but very high on taste!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: jb06
Reviews.Content: I read many mixed reviews prior to my trip so was unsure what to expect but I should not have feared as this is a lovely hotel and overall my experience was excellent. My room was on the 25th floor: it was large, the bed was huge and very comfortable, there was extra beding, bathrobes and ample towels available. I did not have a new room with plasma tv and internet but mine appeared to be recently decorated, the furniture served its purpose, was comfortable and everywhere was spotlessly clean. Decor was quite old/traditional so it may not be to everyones taste but I could find no fault. Checking in and out took less than 5minutes and I did not encounter any rude staff pushing for tips. Had room service a few times and food was lovely. I would stay here again as it was in an ideal location to experience Manhattan, 5minutes walk to the Chrysler Building, Grand Central and the United Nations, 10minutes walk to Times Sqaure and Broadway. The one thing this hotel is missing is tea/coffee making faclities in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: NJSid
Reviews.Content: Strengths: -Location -Cleanliness -Free internet and mini-fridgies in premier rooms -Price Weaknesses -Hotel is very dated. Even the new rooms that have been renovated still feel dated. Most of the rest of the hotel feels very 1980's. -Harry's bar : go to one of the many local pubs. -Serivce is adequate but not great -Noisy: the staff noise in the halls traveled straight into the room. Probably would not stay there again except in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “really nice place”
Reviews.Author: lexman
Reviews.Content: very impressed with the room, it was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Would recommend this hotel any day!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cateviwa
Reviews.Content: Have just retruned from a 4 night trip to New York with 3 girlfriends. Having had previous bad experiences with hotels in New York we were slightly anxious about what was in store for us at the Helmsley. We needn't have worried. What a great hotel ; spacious rooms and bathroom, spotlessly clean, flat screen TVs in the bedrooms, a magnicifent view from our 35th story room. The staff were excellent, courteous and helpful . We asked for restaurant recommendations 2 nights and on both occassions the places were spot on. We were sent to places where locals dine and enjoyed great food and wine at reasonable prices. The location was perfect for walking to Time Square . There were plenty nearby delis for breakfast and lively bars to relax in after a busy day's shopping/sightseeing. The concierge was very obliging when it came to holding our large amounts of luggage and calling a cab for the airport on the day we checked out. We definately will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “If you need internet access...”
Reviews.Author: Mollydoll
Reviews.Content: ....you should know that when I first checked into this "modern, business oriented hotel" I was given a rather drab little room with no internet service. Given that I intended to be working out of my room for the nexxt several days I was utterly horrified --I could have stayed at the Best Western for much less money and in-room internet. When i called the front desk, I was told "only premium rooms" had the luxury of internet cables. The buisness center was the only options for peons like me. So I went downstairs and as I very nicely began to explain in person that, as I had to meet a deadline, I'd need internet access, in my room--boom, I was handed a key to a premium room. Very nice! I went from hating on the Helmsley to liking it a lot.. It's a little dowdy compared to the flashy newer hotel, but it's an appealing kind of stuffiness. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: twiggy-and-gin
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the New York Helmsley Hotel and had a fantastic time in the hotel and in New York. On arrival to the hotel the staff were very helpful and friendly. There's always someone around to give you some help and advice at all times of the day/night. Every member of staff we met were very friendly towards us. We stayed in a twin room on the 31st floor with a fantastic view over 42nd street and buildings beyond (see my photos). The room was well equipped with flat-screen TV, comfortable beds, clean linen and a fantastic en-suite bathroom with plenty of towels, etc every day. Security at the hotel is fantastic with extra-safe security at night. Mindy's restaurant has excellent staff but the food is slight pricey for what you get. Harry's bar has a nice friendly feel and is not too expensive compared to other bars/pubs in New York. But obviously there's plenty of alternatives near the hotel instead if you wish! Location-wise the hotel wins me over again. Fantastic shops such as Gap are literally a minute away. Times Square is about a 10 minute walk and everything else is nearby. The Crysler building is literally opposite the hotel and The Empire State building is quite close too. We also walked from the hotel to 5th avenue to do a bit of shopping. It was about a 20 minute walk but there's plenty to keep you occupied on the way. The subway is very close to the hotel too so basically every area in New York is close to you! Overall I would rate this hotel 9.5/10 - it really was a great stay. The only downside would be Mindy's restaurant, although we only had breakfast in there. If you're planning a stay at the New York Helmsley Hotel, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “NY Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: EastSide22ZD
Reviews.Content: Good solid business class hotel on 42nd Street. Only draw back is it's a little far east. Good size rooms for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: DubLass
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of mixed reviews on this hotel, I was very apprehensive and dreading the worst. I will admit that I am very fussy when deciding on a hotel and after doing alot of research I decided on the New York Helmsley, I wasn't disappointed. We arrived on 26 Oct 06 for 4 nights and checked in around 2pm. We had booked a double double room and requested the 37th floor when checking in, as I had read on this website that this particular floor had been recently renovated and the rooms were 'Premier'. The front desk staff were very nice and promptly upgraded us with no problems. The decor in the room was traditional but was extremely clean and was in no way shabby. The beds were extremely comfortable, there was a plasma tv, fridge, steam iron and board, safe and dressing gowns in the room also. The bathroom was pretty spacious, again, always clean, with new towels every day. We did leave a tip for the housekeeping staff every day, just 2 or 3 dollars and we definitely got excellent service from them. I had read that some people had problems with the lifts but we never had to wait more than a minute for them. We contacted the Concierge the 2nd morning and asked her to book some restaurants for us during our stay, we gave her a price range that we were willing to pay and the type of food weâ€™d like. We arrived back in our room that evening to find a voicemail from her detailing the reservations, we werenâ€™t disappointed at all with her choice. All in all, we honestly had no problems with the hotel and would definitely return. It is only a 5-10 minute walk from Times Square, Central Park etc. and right beside Grand Central and the Chrysler building.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SthAussies
Reviews.Content: we recently spent 3 nights in New York. The hotel is in a great location, a short walk to Times Square and the hop on hop off bus. The staff were extremely helpful from arrival onwards until we left. The room was clean, and the breakfast in the resturant was great (a little expensive with the exchange rate). If you don't want to eat in the resturant there are a number of small shops which serve breakfast close by or 10 minutes to time square. The security on arriving back at night was excellent and we found the room quiet and the outside noise not too much of a problem even though we faced 42nd street. If you want to be close to Time Square this is a great location. We felt safe walking back a night along 42nd street. A tip to those proposing transfers from the airport. Ensure you book before you leave home and expect at least a 30min wait at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “New York Gem”
Reviews.Author: Arthaus
Reviews.Content: My wife and another couple of friends stayed at the hotel between Saturday 21st - 26th October 2006. Upon our arrival, there was a problem with our booking, however the staff dealt with the issue in a competent and timely manner, even allowing us into our rooms before the scheduled time......And what a room. We were in Room 3605 which presented us with the most glorious view of The Chrysler Building and the surrounding skyline. The size of the room was more than adequate with an extremely comfortable bed, flatscreen TV and lovely soft towels in the bathroom. There is also a safe, iron (and board) and a hair dryer. The room would benefit from tea-making facilities. Overall, the staff couldn't have been any more helpful, and this included a bottle of champagne left in our room with the hotel's compliments to help celebrate my wife and I's joint 50th birthdays. The Concierge was also very helpful with information about local tours, arranging transport to the airport and confirming flight times etc. The hotel is also in a great location, a short walking distance from Grand Central and the Chrysler Building. We didn't eat in the hotel, but found very good breakfasts next door at Pax, around the corner at The Frontier and for more of a dining experience, The Pershing Square Central Cafe opposite Grand Central. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel overall!”
Reviews.Author: Laura808
Reviews.Content: The Hemsley was above our expectations! From the moment we stepped out of our cab upon arrival until we checked out. The bell/ valet staff was like no other and went out of their way to tend to our needs. My daughter left an oversized stuffed animal in the room when we checked out. They mailed it Fed Ex to us all the way to Hawaii! I will 100% stay there again! Laura Kapolei,HI

Reviews.Title: “Fitness Center is almost ready!!”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: The Helmsley has recently renovated its rooms. Everything has been updated but the old air conditioning system is still there. For my stay, they had already switched to "winter" mode, so if you encounter "Indian Summer" as I did, with outside temperatures above normal, you're going to sweat inside your room! Also, the renovations either did not involve changing the beds or the hotel chose to install very poor quality beds. They are hardly comfortable, and I woke up each morning with lower back pain. The bathroom towels, on the other hand, are probably the finest I've encountered at any hotel. Large, fluffy, very nice. Free internet service has been added, and they have plasma screen TV's. The good news is that more than one hotel staff person told me that a much needed fitness center will open within a month. I sincerely hope that they haven't scrimped on size of the fitness center, or the quality of the machines purchased. I also hope that it will be a complimentary service for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get over-excited”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_Laz
Reviews.Content: In the last 4 years my wife and I have travelled some 48,000 miles around the world. We've stayed in some very impressive places and feel that we have enough experience to justifiably offer a critique of any hotel we encounter. The NY Helmsley is an OK hotel. It's good good staff, it's efficient, clean enough and has a decent bar and restaurant. If you don't expect any more than that you won't be disappointed. It's very convenient for all the sights and sounds of this incredible city and it's a true reflection of the people and the ambience itself. New York is a loud, bustling metropolis, where people live in the fast lane while trying to survive and make a living. Tourists are obviously welcome and well catered for but this is a living, breathing monster so if it's your first time be prepared to accept that New Yorkers have a unique 'style' in keeping with their surroundings. We had no complaints as such. Sure the rooms are smaller than any other in the US but this is New York - space on the island is at a premium so you'll just have to accept that. The people are great - laugh off the abrupt ones and join in with the colourful ones - this is what makes your trip anyway so enjoy it no matter what happens! You can't really go wrong at the Helmsley for a mid-priced base. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jospehine
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying at this hotel after reading some reviews on this web site but, as it turned out there was no need. My stay was completely without incident. In fact, I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service and accommodations. The hotel restaurant had a high level of service and I was served a quality breakfast each morning, with a great cup of coffee. The room service meals were always hot and tasty as well. We had a beautiful room on the 11th floor with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. The hotel is located on E.42nd Street in midtown Manhattan, one block away from Grand Central Station and the Chrysler Building. I also found the bus service to be a fast and cheap option when I needed to run across town to the heliport. The area near the hotel is littered with restaurants and markets where you can grab a bite and take it back to your room. The room also has a small refrigerator under the bathroom counter, and Grand Central Station has a great market where you can pick up nutritious snacks, and fresh fruits and juices. I definitely plan on staying at this hotel later this year

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again, great location”
Reviews.Author: EupearsiaTaylor
Reviews.Content: Great location, when I arrived bell boys to carry my suit cases. The receptionist was very friendly. Room was clean but was not aired. Opening the window sorted this out. Room service was quick and fast. In house restaurant was a bit expensive but food was great for the first night if you've tired and don't want to go out. The down side House Keeping very basic and poor. Made and beds and cleaned the bathroom room but left tea cups from the previous night in the room. We used ironing board left it in the middle of the room they did not pack away. Besides house keeping this was a great stay, on 42nd street but away from times square btw 2nd & 3rd.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: OrlaM
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in September, 22nd and 30th so experienced two different rooms. Both were clean and well furnished . Beds were extremely comfortable. However although location was good, for the price we paid we felt we should have had a coffee maker or minibar in room as the food and drink in restaurant were expensive. The lobby area was small and became congested . The reception was efficient and friendly but quite often long queues developed as there was only one person on the desk. Not a good hotel for business users as information on internet access was difficult to come by - there was no information in handbook in room. Hotel seemed to be used by flight crews and if you didn't have to worry about meal costs it would be great. In conclusion, this was a nice hotel in a good location on 42nd St , close to Grand Central Sation and bus to Newark Airport, however I think there are probably other hotels giving better value for money. Would only go back if we got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlecoyote
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that everyone on staff was very nice. Everything else about this hotel wasn't so great. It's two stars, maybe 2.5. Although the copy on the Expedia site has been changed -- no doubt due to me -- one of the reasons I booked this hotel was for "complimentary wireless service." If you are on the lower floors it's all dial up. If you're on an upper floor, it's a dsl cable that isn't operational. At least it wasn't working in the room I was in, which featured a spaghetti of wires beneath the desk, not all of which were hooked up. An "IT" person was supposed to come up to the room to fix things while I was out but apparently never showed. I was, however, told there was "free wifi" in Bryant Park just three blocks away... (Bryant Park is by the Library between 5th & 6th - it's lovely place -- also where they hold Fashion Week). You can access wifi in the hotel's Business Center, but they charge a chunk. Beyond all that, the place was falling apart and on the wrong side of shabby. In the "renovated" room I was moved to: 1) There was garbage in the trash can by the desk 2) Three lightbulbs in the cut glass fixture around the mirror in the bathroom were burned out 3) The hot water knob on the sink was missing a finishing piece 4) The sink drain was an extremely slow drainer... 5) And scrawled onto the interior shower curtain were the words "Too Short. Too Short." True, but even worse with the scribbles. When I decided to do some evening ironing so I wouldn't be so hurried in the morning before a meeting, I first thought the iron wasn't working. It turned out that the bottom outlet in the two-plug outlet I plugged into was dodgy. The top plug apparently worked because a lit lamp was plugged into it. My room had two beds so, given everything, I analyzed them closely before deciding which one to get into. One bed was rather poorly made, with a dust ruffle askew. I opted for bed #2, I don't know how anyone thinks this is a clean hotel. There's chipped paint, bad seals, spots on unholstery and carpets. It made me wonder whether some of the reviews I've read were plants. Having visited New York mostly for business many times, and stayed all over the island, I can tell you with absolute assurance that you can do better. Next time, I certainly will... I tried the Helmsley because the reviews sounded good, I'm always looking for new places (depending on the season, NY can book up so it's nice to have options), and 3.5 stars for a mid-price hotel was impressive. Beyond the location, which is convenient, especially if you want to catch the bus shuttle to LaGuardia across the street from Grand Centrel, this hotel is a bust. Keep looking...

Reviews.Title: “Handy and Convienient”
Reviews.Author: Cork-wanderer
Reviews.Content: Myself and My wife stayed there for a few days in august on our way back home to ireland. The room was very nice witha great view of the Chrysler building on the 26 floor. We found the location excellent for broadway, shopping and sightseeing. The staff were professional, polite and very good at their job. We didnt eat that much at the hotel but what we did eat there was very nice. Pax deli next door is great for breakfast and treats. We intend on returning to new york in a few months time and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: leadingnote
Reviews.Content: I've just got back after a five night stay. I was on the 10th floor in what I assume is not a newly decorated room. Nevertheless, it was spacious and clean, with a large bed, nice bathroom and plenty of towells. The only criticism I have is that I was woken several times by what I think were garbage collectors, emptying and then dropping large metal skips. This is pretty noisy at 1.30 in the morning. There's also some noise from traffic, as the windows are single glazed. The hotel is in a good location, and I'd like to recommend the food court at Grand Central Station, which is a few minutes' walk away. There's a huge variety of food which you can eat there, or take out. I would stay at the Helmsley again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, would go back tomorrow !”
Reviews.Author: Bryno
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights in September 2006. Three of us sharing a room on the 39th Floor. It's in a fantastic location, just a few mins walk from Grand Central Station and Chrysler Building. Bus Stop across the road will take you all the way across 42nd Street to the West side for access to any of the Piers. Uptown/Downtown trains are available at Grand Central Station subway. The room was very well presented. We had a lot of trouble with the new flat screen TV and had to phone 'Tech Support' a lot of times, but I cannot really fault this as I believe that the flatscreens had only recently been installed and there were some teething problems which will get sorted out. The room had a double and a single bed, nice size en-suite with loads of towels, hair drier and other necessities. Only one dressing gown, but I'm certain we could have asked for more if we had really wanted them. There was fridge and a safe, ironing board and iron (didn't get much use!!) The elevator took less than one minute to get from ground floor to 39th, so no holdups there and as there are 6 elevators, there was rarely a wait. The reception staff were very efficient, it only took about 3 minutes to check in and the same to check out. The front of house guys were very friendly. Right next door to the hotel a very good coffee shop called PAX, while a three minute walk took you to Duane Reade Pharmacy/convenience shop for anything you may have forgotten to bring along. There is a very nice bar called Harrys just off the foyer and also a very good restaurant called Mindys where breakfast prices were quite reasonable. We did not use Mindys as we wanted to check out the local diners. (Johns, 45th street - very good, Comfort Diner, 46th Street - great, Brooklyn Diner, 57th Street - spectacular, though twice the price of the others) Our room was a 'Premier' room and it was slightly more expensive than standard but the few dollars more was well worth it. For anyone a little nervous of heights, you should make this known on booking so that they will allocate you a room on the lower floors. We had a most enjoyuable stay in NYC and the NY Helmsley played a major part in this. I didn't want to leave, but unfortunately c'est la vie. I'll be back, hopefully sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “An EXCELLENT location!!”
Reviews.Author: USAfreak!
Reviews.Content: My Mum and Dad and My husband and I stayed here for two nights at the beginning of August. I had researched the hotel on Trip Advisor and was pleasantly surprised to see that MOST of the comments left were positive. I can only endorse this sentiment1 The hotel was very clean and welcoming. We were staying on the 29th floor and our room had a superb view of the Chrysler building. I could hear traffic but that only added to the feeling of being in the 'city that never sleeps!' This was our first time in New York and the atmosphere was electric. We were totally over whelmed with the whole experience. The hotel was perfect for Grand Central Station and we were more than thrilled with the service. We didn't think that the $18 (before tax) breakfast at the hotel was worth it so we toured every morning to the Pax Deli next door. The staff there are courteous and the food is wonderfully fresh - good value too. This was a perfect start to our three and a half weeks in the USA. We went to Florida for the rest of the vacation. The New York Helmsley is worth a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay; would return”
Reviews.Author: Luvtotravel7
Reviews.Content: What you see/read on their website is what you get here at the NY Helmsley - no surprises - altho we had to ask for the bath robes to be brought to our rooms. We had 2 rooms on the 28th floor: 2801 with a King bed & 2818 with 2 doubles. Neither had a view of the Chryler Bldg unfortunately. 2806 does but it didn't have a king bed so my husband & I moved to 2801. Altho we were so high up, we could still hear traffic noise & sirens but the hotel itself was very quiet. I was initally worried when I saw on their website that they are renovating but if they are, we were not all affected by construction noise. And we never heard other guests on our floor. Rooms are a good size for NY; beds were very comfortable altho the mattresses were not pillowtop. The towels were wonderfully thick. It was great having a small fridge in the rooms (their website says these are available on request but we didn't have to ask for them.) For a hotel with this reputation, you wouldn't think they were use plastic glasses in the rooms but they do. (They do have the Helmsley logo on them.) Although the decor ("traditional") isn't my favourite, I would certainly consider staying at this hotel again for all the other features plus the close proximity to Grand Central Station. One warning however - the drinks at Harry's bar are very expensive. 2 drinks - a vodka martini & vermouth - cost my step daughter about $26! Maybe that's par for NY but I thought it was outrageous. For a healthy & very reasonably priced breakfast or lunch, eat at Pax right next door. We had breakfast there each day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Price, Comfort, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: marybondalilo
Reviews.Content: All good, stayed 3 nights, no complaints. Good Restaurant's Nearby Cibo on 2nd Avenue to the right and the capital grill o Lexington. Great view of Empire State Building from our bedroom. Comfy Beds. Great 4 star by New York standards.

Reviews.Title: “Helmsley Survivor”
Reviews.Author: thumber77
Reviews.Content: After 3 trips back to the front desk at 1 am and the hotel keys still don't work; after dealing with the surly staff including a doorman who asked for a tip after telling me it was NOT his problem where I parked my car; and after being told the hotel valet charges $45 each time you give them your car, I knew I had made a BIG mistake coming to the Helmsley. At $275/night including tax, I had never had such a negative experience in NYC including at the 15 or so hotels I had used that were significantly cheaper. Do yourself a favor - don't stay here and experience your own horror story. On a scale of 1-10, I give the Helmsley negative 4.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: nyoung318
Reviews.Content: I researched the New York Helmsley for a while before deciding to book the hotel. There were some mixed reviews about the Hotel. A group of us just returned from a trip to NYC on Mon. Aug. 14th. Our visit and stay shattered all stereotypes about NYC and the hotel. The Bellman was very helpful and provided tips on where to eat and get good deals. The renovated rooms were very clean and smelled clean. The room included a flatscreen tv along with free internet; including using your own laptop to connect to the Hotels Internet. From the moment we arrived until we departed, everyone was very nice and polite. The hotel employees were not overzelous about making it known that they are supposed to be tipped. I will definitely stay at the New York Helmsley for my next trip to NYC! Be sure to request a renovated room from the hotel directly after you initially book.

Reviews.Title: “beware the rude bell captain”
Reviews.Author: Goessag
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with good sized rooms in a great location. However my stay was ruined by the incredibly rude bell captain on duty there. He cannot be serious ! He was waiting for a tip after being so rude and downright nasty to guests. It really gets to me when staff think they can treat people like dirt and then expect their couple of dollars as 'appreciation'. This guy deserves to be sacked. Also 7 dollars for 15 minutes of internet access is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Identity Theft at this location”
Reviews.Author: mirage777
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel in July 2006. I used the in-room internet on the 30th floor and my passwords were stolen. I traced the theft back to the Helmsley so I know this for sure. The in-room internet browser should be avoided unless you just want to browse the news, etc. but DO NOT ENTER any info you do not want stolen. As for the rest of the hotel, I liked my stay there. Room was very nice, esp. the bathroom. I didn't have much contact w/staff but what little I did, they seemed courteous. I didn't try the (expensive) restaurant or bar but there is plenty of food within walking distance. The hotel's in a really convenient location and I'd even stay there again. BUT i would not use the in-room internet for my e-mail!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: casavaldez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Helmsely during our trip to NYC at the end of July. This was the best experience with a hotel we have ever had. We got a room on the top floor with an unobstructed view of the Empire State Building! The staff was all very nice and helpful. The location is just a couple of blocks from Grand Central right on 42 Street! You can walk to anywhere from here! Harry's Bar was wonderful during their evening cocktail hour! If we ever come back to the beautiful city of New York we will always stay at the Helmsely!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: SissyGreen
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the Helmsley in Dec 2004 for 4 days as part of a package we booked with lastminute.com - we were meant to stay at the Crowne Plaza but due to a mistake with our booking our accommodation was changed - and I'm glad because I loved this hotel! This was our first time in New York and it was a great location, easy to get everywhere from Grand Central and I felt like I was 'really in Manhattan' with the Chrysler Building and other skyscrapers all around. Not the funkiest of areas though, I wouldn't go out on a session around midtown. Got a fab deal with return flights & 4 nights here a week and a half before Xmas for Â£350 each and def thought it was worth it. Our room was comfortable and spotless and our bed was huge. Bathroom was nice and I loved the mirror (had light bulbs all around it like a makeup one in a theatre). Staff were really friendly and helpful and we had a drink in the bar which was expensive but enjoyed the piano and watching the world go by. Lobby and restaurant etc looked immaculate. We ate breakfast every day at Pershing Square which is a cute little diner under the raliway viaduct about 5 mins from the Helmsley and my boyf swore by their pancakes! Only complaint I had was that the room service wasn't 24 hour when I was there, that may have changed. That says it all when that is your only complaint!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteepleHill
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms for 4 nights at the New York Helmsley. From the min we stepped out of the cab we were greated with smiling faces. As we went to check in, the staff were super friendly. Up to this point I was very impressed. Anthony and Nick the door man were great to give advice where to go to eat in NY city. Jemal at the front desk was amazing trying to accomodate all of us and because we couldnt get our rooms on the same floor we were sent free champagne which was a nice gesture. The rooms were very clean and modern. All rooms had flat screen TV with internet. The maids were very good at doing what they are asked to do as I was staying with a toddler and requested that the bathroom be scrubed extra clean and I given extra towels which they were very plush and nice. I've been in New York city many times and I've never left the city satisfied as I was this time around. I really saw New York as a first class city, maybe it was just my luck with the right staff working the days of my stay or New York has really changed. Much cleaner than I remembered. I do visit New York yearly and will again stay at the Helmsley Hotel next year. I recommend anyone who wants a nice clean moderately large room for NY standards with great location to check in at this hotel. Only problem is the TV and internet, I was told that the system is new so the program has problems..Just call the front desk and they will fix it right away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jake36
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the NY Helmsley hotel for 5 nights, earlier this month and I would highly recommend it. The rooms were spotless, and the hotel has a nice ambience about it. The location is ideal for exploring Manhattan on foot. pAX DINER next door do great breakfasts. Had lunch in the hotel restaurant once and it was very nice , but a little expensive if you have kids etc. The staff are efficent and professional but some at the front desk are not over friendly. There is free tea and coffee in the lobby every day but they seem to take it away at about 8am so u need to be up early for that. Overall a very pleasent experience and I would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rock1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay during a major New York heat wave-temperatures in the 100's. I am happy to say that the air conditioning worked beautifully! There was a minor glitch at check-in when they inquired if I had cancelled my reservations, but all was well, and we ended up with 2 adjoining rooms with a rollaway bed as requested. (We are a family of 5). The room with 2 double beds could accomodate a rollaway, which tells you that the room sizes were generous. We stayed on the 10th floor which was NOISEY. I am surprised this has not been mentioned more often--sirens were quite constant. I do not know if a higher floor would have helped, but when making reservations ask about the quiet side of the hotel. We also did not have the flat screen TV's I have seen mentioned, so if that is important to you, request one. Pax, the deli next door was perfect for breakfast to go. We did take our own coffee pot-although I was told complimentary coffee was available in the lobby from 6-8am. Bottom line-a nice basic hotel-nothing to write home about, but very satisfactory-and an excellent price by New York standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the New York Helmsley in June. We got a good deal booking through Octopus Travel for a central New York hotel. The Helmsley was very good value for money for a centrally located 4 star hotel as we paid nearly as much 5 years ago for a 2 star. We got a room on the top floor which was spacious and although at the back of the hotel had nice views over towards the Empire State Building. The bathroom was quite good compared to most hotels in the UK and US - quite clean. I would agree that earplugs are a must as the air conditioning is quite noisy and there are always yellow cabs blowing their horns during the night! Our room had a flat screen tv and a fridge which came in useful. The hotel is ideally located close enough to walk to most attractions and only a few steps away from Central Station for those wanting alternative modes of transport. We found taxis fairly cheap and plentiful. We found the staff pleasant enough although we didn't have much contact other than checking in and out. The bellman was helpful enough when asked to keep our bags after check out until we were picked up for going back to the airport. The bar can be a bit of a pain as the staff are usually a bit evasive and they won't take orders at the bar or let you pay at the bar so it can somethimes be a bit of a wait. We went for breakfast at the Pax next door but I would avoid the pancakes as these are simply microwaved and not very fresh tasting. We found a great deli round the corner - Old Bridge (I think!) where you choose and buy your food downstairs and then there's a huge seating area upstairs. It was really fresh food and smoothies and only cost pennie - it seemed a bit daunting at first but its worth it. It was a pity we found it on our last morning. For dinner when we didn't want to venture far we went across the road from the hotel to an Italian, Osteria Laguna (I think). It was quite nice food with Italian rather than US portions so a bit of a lighter bite.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic base for New York City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The New York Helmsley is a fantastic hotel in an ideal location in midtown Manhattan. We were made very welcome by Bernardo at reception who gave myself and five nursing colleagues rooms on the 37th floor. The rooms were very plush indeed with fabulous tempura mattresses and plasma TV screens and free email. The view from our room was awesome with the crysler building being on the left and the united nations being to the right. The staff were very attentive to your needs and despite comments from previous visitors of hands out for tips, we never saw this at all. The Door Staff were amazing and the two that shone for us were Nic and Michael, who were always smilling and ready to help with any query we had. They made getting about in Manhattan so much easier, and were so courteous and polite. The location is central for all subways and locations in middle Manhattan and as far as we were concerned was terrific value for money. If we are ever fortunate enough to be in New York again then we would have no hesitation in making The New York Helmsley our accomodation. It is a superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 friends stayed at this hotel for our first trip to NYC, We all thought that the hotel and staff were brilliant and couldnt do enough to make our stay great, for example when we arrived in NYC at the hotel we were advised by the hotel manager that our rom wasnt ready due to a problem with the previous guest flight therefore we couldnt have it so they put us up in there suster hotel the park lane helmesley over looking central park for no extra cost and even gave us $20 for the cab ride. After staying at there sister hotel we arrived back at the helmsley at 10am the following morning and were advised that the rooms wasnt and would be about an hour so instead of telling us to come back she bought us breakfast which took and hour so when we finished the room was ready Great hotel and would go back to again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sutiegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Helmsley for 4 nights over the Memorial Holiday. At check in we were greeted by the friendly staff and we able to check in early (around 1). We were upgraded without asking and had a lovely veiw of the Empire State Building. We were on the 37th floor and only experience problems with the lifts 1 morning. The room was spacious & the beds were very comfortable. We had 2 small problems while staying there. The A/C unit did not work very well, we keep it running the whole time & it never got really cold. It was cool but the weather was not really hot while we were there. I would have second thoughts of staying during the heat of summer. Secondly the hot water in the shower was minumial. Had to take showers with almost no cold water on the get it hot enough. Overall it was a nice hotel, with friendly staff & very clean. We did dine in the hotel bar one night, it was good food, but pricey. We also took the advice of the forum and had breakfast at the PAX. Drinks were overpriced there but food was good. We really like the location, being close to Grand Central. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overatted like the rest of New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family fromthe 23rd May. Like everything else in New York I left this htel with the feeling that I had not recieved good service or value for money. The room itself was OK with a good view of the Chrysler building. There were several annoyances with it though. Firstly it was nearly impossible to sleep with the noise from the traffic, horns and sirens going all night long. We were on the 29th floor yet it was just as noisy as being at street level, why the room doesn't have double glazing to reduce the noise, beggars believe. Another annoying thing was the TV. It was stored in a cabinet. The cabinet doors would only open a small amount, so basically if you weren't directly in front of the screen you couldn't see it from any other angle in the room. We had a double bed and only one person laying on the bed could see the screen. We had an early morning call at 6 am even though we didn't arrange this. I'm certain this was arranged on the automated system by the cleaners in our room as we hadn't left a tip in our room every day. We had every intention of leaving them a tip on the last day, but due to this incident they got nothing. The hotel tried to charge us for room service even though we had nothing, again I think this was the cleaners ordering something from our room. When I told the staff at the front desk about these incidents, they were very indifferent and gave me the impression that this sort of thing goes on all the time. There was no tea or coffee facilities in the room, and no breakfast included in the price. For Â£200 a night I feel this hotel was a complete rip off, although that goes for everything in Manhatten over priced and over rated, glad to get out the place in the end. Top tips, ask for a room thats away from the street, if you want a good view then you gotta suffer the noise that goes with it. Take breakfast at Pax's deli next door, it's not the greatest, but the prices are resonable for Manhatten. Buy all your snacks, crisps, biscuits and drinks from Duane Reade ( 100 yrds away ), turn left out of hotel and then right, it's on the far corner. A 2 litre bottle of water from the Deli costs $4.00. Where as at Duane reade 4 litres will cost $1.00. Be prepared to get ripped off all over the city. I'm surprised they don't tax the air. Also you got to tip everyone for everything, they've all got their hands out for something and if you don't give them it, they'll ask for it. Nice to go once, but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for First Visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: JoanButler
Reviews.Content: My son and I travelled to New York for a weekend May 11 and I did extensive research on hotels before deciding on the New York Helmsley because of its location, features and price. Thanks to Trip Advisor I had a comfort level with the hotel and location but having read so much about small rooms and other issues with New York hotels I admit I was still a little apprehensive. We were able to check in very quickly and staff friending, although we were not given any information on any features of the hotel. We were very pleased with our double room and its amenities. We were on the 37th floor and except for the faint noise of the constant horn blowing in New York, the hotel was exceptionally quiet. The location was fabulous - away from the hustle of Times Square yet within walking distance of everything and close to subway which we used to get to and from Yankees games. The only thing missing was a coffee maker in the room, but we did have a fridge. I will certainly go back there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in New York a number of times I have known only too well how terrible hotels can be, and so I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the Helmsley was a great place to stay. We stayed for 7 seven nights but by the second we already knew a number of the staff by name and I was greeted personally each time I entered the lobby. The room was a good size, especially by NY standards. There were three of us staying in a room with two queen size beds and while none of us packed lightly there was still enough room for us and our considerable luggage. I know that a number of people have written about the very slow lifts, and while I agree, I think that if you're in New York and lifts are enough to mar your trip, you're really not making the most of your stay. All in all I would reccomend this hotel and will stay again on my next trip.. especially if I can get the same great deal I got through Escape Travel here in Aus!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New York Helmsley at end of April for 4 nights. Thought the Hotel was great, we arrived about 11.50am, our room would not be ready until 16.00hrs. Dumped our bags and went off exploring.. When we returned was over the moon to find out we had been upgraded to one of the renovated rooms. Room was lovely, plasma t.v (not that we watched it much) Lots of little extra's in the bathroom (robe, toiletries etc). Beds were so comfortable. Did not have much of a view but we were hardly in there.. Found no problem with lifts (we were on 30th floor) took advice of this forum to eat at PAX Deli which was great.. Had a treat on last day when we had breakfast in Hotel which was very nice. Good bar, expensive, but you would expect that in a City Hotel. Excellant location, right near Subway and Times Sq, weather was fantastic so we walked everywhere (and I have the blisters to show for it !!). Ist day there was a lovely Bell Boy there called Anthony - so helpful and friendly. Day we left we put our bags in storage room - guy who took them was so rude just standing there with his hand out. That was only downside.. Great Hotel, I would definately go back and would recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning next trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms for NY, very pleasant staff, especially those on the breakfast buffet. Overall very happy with NY Helmsley, and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: tanyah
Reviews.Content: We payed over $300US a night for a room at the Helmsley, and although I expect NY to be pricey I possibly would have expected a little more from the hotel at that rate. The rooms were big enough and clean (if you ignore the hair that was in the bath when we arrived), but it was just the little things. Like a cold tap in the shower that barely worked, a sink tap that was broken (tap still useable), a complete lack of a view (i think we were given one of the few dud rooms on the floor without a view), no fridge etc. And I'm not sure what happened to the plasma screen with internet access .. for us we would have had to pay $7US for 15 minutes down in the lobby! And we also had issues with the bag boy. We did give a tip, but the guy had some attitude issues. On the plus side though, we were happy with the location (10-15 min walk to Times Sq) and the beds were ultra comfy. If you can get a good price for a room here, its not a bad place to stay. But I would probably try some place else on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie7
Reviews.Content: April 2006 My husband and I were guests at the Helmsley New York Hotel on E. 42nd Street and the word 'guest' applies. We were treated as guests by ladies and gentlemen and were made to feel very special. We made our reservations through the internet, our room was one with a fine view of the area and in excellent repair. Every employee made us feel welcome for the four nights we stayed at the hotel by being considerate, helpful,responsive, organized and wishing to fulfill our needs and wishes. We felt comfortable, safe and welcome. We would recommend this hotel highly to people of all ages. R.H., Sarasota, Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: carole hughes
Reviews.Content: Helsmsley was okay. Good location and comfortable beds but shower wouldnt empty and it was so hot at night even when we tried to turn on the outdated air conditioning. New York is known as the city that never sleeps and even though we were on the 36th floor the constant noise of sirens and car horns kept me awake. Reception staff friendly apart from the man who looked after our cases and snarled when a tip was not offered. Harrys bar is old fashioned and far better to go to Muldoons or Mcfaddens were the staff are more friendly and there is a bit of life there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Luv
Reviews.Content: We arrived on April 9, 2006. I was afraid of New York hotels because of all the mixed ratings. This was EXCELLENT. I have posted pictures. I booked on Hotels for what I thought was a low price, and we were NOT treated poorly because of our booking place. We were traveling with only backpacks, and were never treated badly by the bellmen or the housekeepers. Fridge, plasma TV, Internet on the TV, all INCLUDED. Full amenities of shampoo, lotion, soap (the oatmeal soap was soothing each day after the city!), and mineral bath. HUGE ROOM, HUGE FLUFFY TOWELS. Safe in the closet. We were in room 3008. The place was spotless and comfortable. We kept the windows open. 6:15am sunrise out the 42nd Street view window. Just a true jewel. 2 blocks to Grand Central Station. We took the subway after a broadway show (there is a shuttle from times square to Grand Central). Felt VERY safe. it was just like the daytime! I have posted pictures. Close to lots of shopping. Easy walk to Times Square/Broadway, Fifth Avenue Shopping, Subway. Taxi to Lincoln Center was $12 in rush hour (including the tip). The bellmen and housekeeping were especially special in this place! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: buzzard1234
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Helmsley the first week in December.It was fantastic we had a room on the 35th floor overlooking the empire state building to our right and straight through other buildings to the Brooklyn Bridge.The room was cleaned and new sheets put on the very comfortable beds daily.When we woke on the first morning to find it had snowed our trip was complete.Will be returning to New York next year and will definetly be staying at the Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the helmsley for 5 nights with 4 friends, rooms are suprisingly spacious for a city hotel. We had 2 double beds, a plasma screen and a fridge. A very good price for a 4* hotel in a very central location. We also hired a roll away bed for $30 per night which was like a proper bed with wheels... The hotel location is brilliant....a short walk from 5th avenue shopping, the empire state building and timesquare. The closest underground station is Grand Central Station. We got a cab frm JFK...with there being 5 of us we ordered from a private hire firm - 'carmel' and payed $70 inc tips and toll. Some of the hotel staff do come across a little roud and somewhat impersonal. The shower was a little annoying as the water was either a little too warm or a little too cold and it did take a while sometimes to adjust to the right temperature. Aside from that cant fault the hotel. Rooms were made everyday and copy of new york times was delivered daily. The concierge are very helpful and provided all sightseeing info. If you're vegetarian I would warn you that there is a general limited variety in new york city. We lived off subway and dominos pizza for the week.... Would definitely stay at the helmsley again....great time in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for four nights over the St Patricks day period. Our rooms were on the 36th floor, really nice rooms, very clean and modern, maid service every day. The only thing I would fault would be, some of the reception staff are quite rude, and keep an eye on your bill with the bar staff, if they are serving at your table, keep tabs of what you had as they do seem to try to add drinks on that you haven't had, or imply you haven't paid! This also happened to another couple who were staying there the same time as us! Apart from that, good location and a lovely hotel, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with no hassle”
Reviews.Author: grapegirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotel club and after reading some of the reviews I was a bit apprehensive. We checked without any hassle at 2.30pm. Our room was on the 14th floor facing out on to 42nd street with fantastic views of the Chrysler Building across the road. There was some traffic noise during the night but after one night we were used to it. I'm not sure if the room was one of the refurbished rooms or not - I think maybe it was cos everything looked pretty fresh. We had 2 big double beds, tv, huge dressing table and 2 arm chairs. There was even a fridge in the bathroom! All in all the hotel was good, a great location with Grand Central just 2 blocks away and easy access to the Newark Airport Shuttle bus which stops at 41st & Lexington. We had breakfast most mornings at the Pax Deli right next to the hotel. It was good, although it took a while to figure out the queueing system. It can be busy around 9am but there is a quick turn around. I'd definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New York so we were a bit nervous of what to expect especially with regard to our hotel. We were so impressed with the hotel, we would definately recommend it. It was clean, by no means basic and centrally located. For the price we paid we were over joyed with our accomodation and would not fault it. It cost us about $60 in a taxi from JFK, that was including toll and tip which isn't bad. There is a bus which goes to and from the airport and stops at Grand Central Station which is literally a 10 minute walk up the street which is about $13 each. If you are lazy (like us)there are always taxis right outside of the hotel. Next door to the hotel is a place called Pax which offers a selection of food and drink which is really handy for breakfast or a coffee. I could not comment on the hotel food as we did not eat there once! We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York and having a good hotel really helped. If you are planning a trip on a budget definately stay at this hotel because I can guarantee you will not be dissapointed. The only fault I could possibly find is the time you have to wait for lifts, but I reckon that is standard in NY as everything is so high!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel & was very pleased with it! The rooms were spacious, clean & nice there was nothing you could fault in them. Lifts were a bit slow at times but as we were on the 6th floor it wasnt a problem for us at all. The location was excellent only a stones throw from Grand Central station with access to everywhere & only a short walk from Times Square. A great Deli next door for breakfast, snacks & great coffee. Def will stay there again when go back to New York

Reviews.Title: “hotel spot on”
Reviews.Author: tilleydog
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel could not fault it. Reception service no que, rooms good size, two beds 22nd floor lifts not a problem, bar prices are what you would expect to pay in a new york hotel, breakfast next door in the pax food cafe, good italian across the road, excellent location would stay in here again

Reviews.Title: “Super Location and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: preston49
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 31st floor and has superb views of the Empire State Building. Rooms are big and we could not fault it. This htel is value for money. Two sets of our friends were on the 12th floor and I saw their rooms which were also good. Maybe we were just lucky, but I have to say that this hotel is great. I didn't have to wait long for the lifts. Location location location - can't fault it. If you stay here, have breakfast in the cafe next door to the hotel (cant remember name)or I definately recommend Grand Central Station food court with a great choice. Would go back again........ Happy guests from the UK

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from New York 2 days ago and spent 5 nights at the Helmsley along with my parents. This was my second time in New York as I loved it so much the first time round. The hotel is conveniently located by most of the amenities New York City has to offer. Most of the famous landmarks like Grand Central Station, Times Square, Empire State Building, Macys etc, are all in walking distance. We also emailed the hotel and asked for a higher floor, but did not get that as you have to pay extra. In any case, you really dont need to pay for a better room as the rooms are fine anyway. We were on the 10th floor, the room was very comfortable and spacious. I've never slept on a more comfy mattress as the ones they have on the beds, so nice to not wake up with a bad back like I do every morning at home! The only grumble we had was that the rooms do not have any tea or coffee making facilities, no kettles, nothing. The hotel has complimentary tea and coffee every morning in the reception, but when we wanted a hot drink at night we had to go next door to the Pax deli. The staff were all very nice, particularly the english doorman, don't know his name but he was from Hertfordshire and was really friendly and always had a smile on his face. The Pax deli next door to the hotel is great for a breakfast, I can't say that the staff were not nice like somebody else mentioned on here, because they were all ok with us. A tip NOT to go to is the Comfort Diner which is 3 blocks down on 45th Street, we went there for a breakfast on our 2nd morning, and the food was cold and overcooked, obviously heated up, and not nice at all. On the whole, the Helmsley is a wonderful Hotel in a wonderful place. I'd definitely stay there again in the future, hope to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back after spending 5 nights at this hotel. Asked 10 months ago for a renovated room on a higher floor - got a room on the 10th. I think it was refurbished but couldn't be sure. At the back of the hotel but I had a decent view of the Empire State Building. Room was ok size wise with two Queen sized beds. Got static electric shocks off everything - must be a load of nylon in the carpet (which looked clean and newish) or something. Room service prices are extortionate but I guess thats to be expected. Good location - only 5 minutes from Grand central Station. Reception staff were polite and helpful with no delay in checking in or out. No delays in getting a lift either as reported elsewhere. Bellhops were ok so long as you tipped them but the doorman (who was english like me) was downright rude - may as well get himself a begging bowl. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel but only if you get a good deal on the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: banerigg
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just stayed at the New York Helmsley for five nights. The room was beautiful - on the 31st floor with amazing views overlooking the Chrysler Building. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times - particularly when they knew this trip was to celebrate my daughter's 18th birthday! The location is perfect - so close to Grand Central Station - and the subway - by far the easiest way of getting around - (check the price of a weekly metrocard - we found this to be cheaper than buying daily tickets for 5 days!!) The hotel recommended a helicopter flight over the city - this was the highlight of our holiday - we flew with Liberty Helicopters - please don't miss this magical experience - it might seem expensive but well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: February 22, 2006 My teenage daughter and i were pleasantly surprised as we spent our first overnight in the city. After searchng online and reading tripadvisor reviews we chose the new york hemsley on 42nd street. The hotel was conveniently located to Grand Central(approx.a 2 block walk). Since we arrived at noon we were prepared to have to store our luggage until the 4 p.m. check-in time. To our surprise we were given the room key and were able to go to our room at noon! The bellhop was extremely pleasant and helpful. The room was spacious with two full beds, two chairs, a small table and a large desk/dresser. Although the hotel is older it was very well kept and extremely clean. All of the employees that we encountered were especially courteous and helpful.I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return there for our next trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just got back from 4 night stay. Did request high floor room and was told the same as everyone else 50 dollar charge didnt pay it. Room on the 7th floor recently been renovated and done to a very high standard, best bed we have ever slept on, spacious room and very very clean. Staff all well mannered and pleasant. Didnt eat in Mindys but had a couple of drinks in Harry's bit pricey but lovely atomsphere and very relaxing. Everyone recommends Pax deli next door, we found the food to be as cold as the staff (very ignorant) our advise walk past pax and a little further down the road is cafe metro better choice of breakfast and pleasant staff. Best steak dinner we tasted was a PJ MORAN's a 5 dollar taxi ride from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the Helmsley.”
Reviews.Author: shedon
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back having stayed in the New York Helmsley for four nights. On arrival we had no problem with an early check in, but we were told our room was on the 10th floor. We told the receptionist that we had rang 3 days earlier and requested a room on the 39th floor, which we wereto by in house reservations was done. The receptionist then told us she had a room available on the 39th floor but we had to pay an extra 50 US dollars per night.(We paid the extra, its not worth it) The receptionist could do with going to finishing school, she had no idea how to treat a customer and was quite rude. As for the Harrys bar, it looks great on the web, its very small and the staff there have two speeds, slow and slower. The hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere, Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, time square and broadway. Great Italian restaurant across the street and a lovely Deli next door for breakfast (which had quick and FRIENDLY staff). If you are not spending time in the hotel (just sleeping) go there. Location, Location, Location.

Reviews.Title: “Valentines @ the Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: Meathman
Reviews.Content: I brought my now fiance to NYC last year (actually this day last year!!!) and we stayed at the Helmsley. I was cautious as a 4 star hotel bang smack in the middle of the city for $120 a night seemed too good to be true but man was I suprised!!! The receptionist who greeted us was just lovely - lamenting the fact that we were staying only 4 nights therefore leaving on Valentine's Day but the biggest supprise was the room. We were about 30 or 40 stories up facing onto 42nd st. The Chrysler building opposite made it seem like a film scene - it was perfect. The room was huge and the bathroom well stocked with towels and gowms. Definately the best hotel room I ever stayed in (and I've been in 5 star hotels on business). It got a bit noisy - but for me this was part of being in New York - quiet would have been false. The only gripe I had was the concierge whom I found not very friendly (in fact quiet rude) but that didn't bother me as all other staff were so good. The bar was fine as hotel bars go. Didn't eat in the restaraunt. When I finally popped the question on the Saturday night the bar and room service had closed however the night staff went out of their way to find me a bottle of champagne amd for this I will be eternally grateful. Most definately going back there again the next time I'm in the big apple. Hope they don't hold it against me that I took home the 2 champagne glasses from that night as a keepsake :-)

Reviews.Title: “The New York Helmsley is Definitely the hizzle for shizzle!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Helmsley for a long weekend and it was a fantastic experience. I made my booking via Expedia UK and got a good deal on the room. I made a request for a King-size bed in my application and I was given a mini suite on the 40th floor, (the hotel has 41 floors!) where I could see the Chrysler Building to perfection. I swear I could have reached out and touched it! The staff were magnificent: friendly, helpful and courteous. I went back to my room early one day and the cleaner was still there. I asked if it was OK to go into the room and she said yes, but asked for my card-key which she checked in the door. I was so impressed with the level of care and security which operated in the hotel, which has filtered down to all the staff in the employment. The room was beautiful. Ensuite bathroom, flat-screen TV with free internet access and the most incredible bed I've slept on for the longest while. Firm and supportive, yet soft. I had room service and had a couple of beautiful meals. The meals were a little pricey, but no more so than if you went to a resturant, so I was happy to pay the asking price. The hotel is conveniently located 2 blocks from Grand Central Station and within easy walking distance of Times Square. All in all I had a fantastic trip that was in no small part due to the Helmsley. I'll definitely be going back... For shizzle!

Reviews.Title: “Leona would roll”
Reviews.Author: gingerca
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 2 nasty nights at the Helmsley. Waited 15 minutes to get an elevator to the room. It was a non-smoking room and it smelled from smoke. The sheets had big holes in them. The shower was almost a bath- water would not drain and it was up to my knees. The room is tired and dirty. Going down another 15 minute wait for the elevator!!! The best feature--the apples at the front desk-crisp and fresh, but you can't relax in an apple in the big apple!!! The rates were good but pay a little more to stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Galwaytripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 25-29 January 2006 and it was fantastic. I had emailed ahead asking for a room on a higher floor for which I was delighted to be told had been allocated when we arrived. The receptionist was very friendly and wished both my son and I a Happy birthday. We had a room on the 34th floor which had fabulous views. Like other reviewers, we did not eat in the hotel which had extremly pricy food, however it was not really that much more expensive than other restaurants. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard and all the bathroom towels and soaps etc were replaced on a daily basis. I would definatly recommend this hotel and if ever in New York again will definatly stay here. One tip - if eating at McFaddens Irish Pub/Restaurant (2nd Ave) watch the service charge - their menu states 20% for parties of 5 or more, but this was added on to my bill of 2 adults and 1 child!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: boznich80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley between the 19-22nd January and really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel! On arrival at JFK we got a Taxi to the hotel which was at a fixed price of $45 and took about 30 to 40 mins, Check-in was nice a smooth and the hotel staff were extremely polite, friendly and helpful. We read the reviews and sent a mail to the hotel requesting a renovated room on a high floor but when we checked they told us that the hotel was full and so an upgraded room was not available. We were on the 17th Floor facing south and could see the Empire State building. The room was large but a bit outdated - for the money it was really good (Â£75 a night through Hotel UK!). This was also on a non-smoking floor so I went down to reception and requested a new room and they said that the hotel was full but to come back down tomorrow morning which we did. I decided to pay the US 50 (excl) per night to get an upgraded room and this was really worth the money. Our new room was south facing on the 38th Floor. The views down 42nd street were amazing, with the Chrysler building virtually right in front of us and you could just about make out the neon lights of Times Square in the distance. The room was the same size but has been updated with nicer dÃ©cor and a better bed. The HDTV Plasma screen was also a bonus with many more cable channels than our old room and complimentary internet through the TV. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel restaurants as the prices were a bit steep and so we made use of the Pax Deli next door which was really nice. Grand central is only a 5-10 minute walk down 42nd with some nice and reasonable priced restaurants down stairs â€“ but you are spoiled for choice in NYC. The other hotel guests were a mixture of tourists, business men and flight crew and even though the hotel was full it never felt over crowded. On return to JFK I used the Airlink shared taxi (through their website) which cost about $15. This was really quick but I was the last pickup on the way. Overall, if you want a good value friendly hotel in a central hotel I would definitely recommend the New York Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “Room was a Broiler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not all that bad, but old. Room was so hot it was alwmost unbearable and could not get anyone to fix. Heating/cooling system obviously old. Could probably use a good renovation. Hotel has a lot of character however.

Reviews.Title: “Beat My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am used to tiny hotel rooms in NYC that cost $400/night and involve sleeping with your feet dangling off of the bed, jammed against the dresser, and waking up and rolling into the wall due to lack of room. The New York Helmsley definitely exceeded my expectations. Our 37th floor room had a spectacular view of the city, a plasma TV, two FULL sized beds, a large bathroom, and all of the trimmings that you expect at a midrange hotel OUTSIDE of NYC, but learn to live without at a sub $200 night spot in Manhattan. The one complaint was the check in time. The line was out the door, and they had one, slow as molasses, clerk checking people in. We had to reschedule our dinner due to the AWFUL wait. They had other clerks that seemed to be standing around and not helping to aleviate the long line, which made things even worse. Overall, a great value and I will stay there again. When you find a hotel with large clean rooms, that is centrally located in midtown, for under $150/night, you stick with it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: smf
Reviews.Content: Ok so ive read other reviews of this hotel, maybe i got a great room or maybe i dont expect the plaza when i arrive....we arrived on a saturday afternoon and were told by reception we had been upgraded to a deluxe room. We were on the 39th Floor (which seems to have been renovated) two decent sized double beds, plasma tv on wall and the most fabulous view of the Chrysler building. Room was decent size (considering there were 3 of us) with good storage space and a nice bathroom. There was an ice machine right outside the door. Only complaint would be the heat, it seems we fiddled with the temp control thing on the wall on our first night and jesus did we pay for it all week. Only realised on the last night, but other than that no probs at all. Greeat location one block from Grand Central Station, nice enough deli (Pax) next door, concierge were more than helpful (especially the man). Harrys bar was fairly small, ate there twice again nice enough. Would have no problem staying there again, but after reading previous posts ill request a room on the 38/39th floor again. Really christmasy too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Helmsley”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would recommend the New York Helmsley. We stayed in a quad room on one of the lower floors and, despite what I have read elsewhere, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff were courteous and helpful. Location on 42nd Street is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: confetti2
Reviews.Content: We were a group of seven( including a toddler) who stayed in the helmsley for 5 nights. Location was brilliant, close to all the major tourist attractions, although set in a quieter area. We had three rooms, on the 32nd and 35th floor, even had a view of the empire state building from one. All the rooms were very comfortable and clean, and a good size. A fridge was very handy when you have children with you. The maid service was excellent, clean towels daily, and plenty of, it was just a shame that there were no tea making facilities in the room, however there were free coffee and tea in the lobby every morning. All the staff were friendly especially sam (bar man). Overall a great place to stay,and would definately stay there again! P.S Pax next door was good for breakfast.as was Bullys round the corner 43rd st 3rd ave (i think) opposite fitzpatrick hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 6 days and were extremely pleased. The room was clean with a king bed. Bathroom was also very clean with a large vanity - great for girls! Cleaning staff was good also. Replenished towels and sheets daily, even asked what the best time for us was. Night time security also great - must show keys before entering. Location is great!!! 2 min walk to Grand Central. 10-15 min walk to Times Sqaure, Broadway, 5th, everything! Better than staying in dirty Times Square but still close enough to walk everywhere. Location is the best thing! But the hotel is also great by itself!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if you pay $200 or so a night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a great stay. The beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. Our room was extremely clean everyday and the rooms were very large for a NYC hotel. We would stay there again. I recommend that you stay on the 38th floor. Our bedspreads and everything else was in great condition. Nothing was worn down like other people mentioned. We had a great view of the Chrysler building. I recommend that you book the hotel from www.crshotels.com. CRS hotels had the room for the same price as expedia but there were no additional fees and you don't pay until you leave. We paid $300 for a Saturday and $200 per night for a Sunday and Monday. I would not stay there for $300 a night for all three nights but our deal was a great one and we'd go there again. Location is excellent! I'd bring a fan or buy one though. We were kind of hot and had to keep the windows open at night. Even though the windows were open it was still very quiet since we were so high up. Overall, a great experience and a trip of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl502
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed to read the review from the person who was at the hotel the same day I was. We had the NY times delivered every morning. The ice machine was next door to our room and of course was free. We were there on a business trip and the company picked our hotel. I usually pick a hotel that has an inroom coffee maker - this one did not - and the only inconvenience was going street level to pick up coffee in the morning for us. Room service prices were outrageous. But it was clean, well appointed, very comfortable and had a great location. Walked to the Radio City Music hall and caught the Christmas Spectactular (someone in front of me had an extra ticket and I got in free!) and loved taking in the Grand Central Station right down the street.
