I can't tell you the cost per satisfaction ratio since the company picked up the tab, but it was a very pleasant experience. When I read reviews like the one before me, I wonder what the expectation of the traveler was and if they are truly ever happy. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 11/28/05-11/30/05. I had a room on the 29th floor. The room was extremely outdated. Both the bedspread and the sheets were raggedy and looked dirty. The wallpaper was peeling and the heating system was noisy and never heated the room to the desired temperature. I was attending a training seminar within the hotel. This room was among the block of rooms reserved at a discount rate for conference attendees. Maybe that had something to do with it. I donâ€™t know. Needless to say, this hotel did not meet my expectations and I would NEVER stay here again. On a positive note, good location, the bellmen provided excellent service, and the comman areas met expectations (e.g. lobby, conference rooms, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never stay at this hotel- Unclean- small. The staff is very rude and not helpful at all and always have their hand out.I travel alot and know what to expect and this is just a BAD way to treat your clients All the staff was more concerened about talking with their fellow workers than helping the patrons. This was everyone from the desk clerk Bell Hops Doorman No Coffee for you in the morning, No Paper and if you want Ice in your room you will need to pay for this!! Needed to flag our own taxi out front- And for this you pay 500.00 a night- very bad stay- Stay somewhere in time square whre they are nice and everything is right there. the best place we have found is the CourtYard Marriot- Great place. Should have stayed the whole 5 days in New York there but I thought we can go to central park for 2 days- what a big MISTAKE The Helmsley is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at

Reviews.Title: “okay but problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel Nov 18th. I checked in early the person working at the front was nice so she actually like me do that. But the room was a different story. It was freezing in the room aroung 20 deg in the rooom. I called the front desk and told them about the problem but no one came to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: tensing
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel with three other girls and we were really impressed with everything about it. Its location was excellent being within walking distance of many attractions and the staff were all very friendly, polite and helpful. Our room on the 12th floor was clean, and comfortable with plenty of storage space and we were not disturbed by traffic noise (although we were not at the front of the building}. In reception we were able to change our dollar travellers cheques at no charge and we also had a safe deposit box again at no charge - both of these facilities were available to us 24hrs per day. On our last day we were able to leave our cases with a bell boy and collect them just before we left for the airport. We ate breakfast in the PAX diner right next door to the hotel which was very convenient, reasonably priced and of good quality. After a long tiring day we had a bar meal at the hotel and although not cheap the food was good. Spirit & mixers were about $8.50 but much larger than the measures in uk. Only critism would be that it would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities in room - free coffee/tea available in reception lobby but not available all day so we brought in from PAX next door if it was still open.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: T_Carter067
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon and we took along our two 11 year old kids. I was hoping for a honeymoon upgrade when we checked in but we seemed to have got the only miserable person who worked in the hotel and was placed on the 28th floor. Room small but clean, not much of a view. The bellboy Anthony however was fantastic. He arranged for complimentary wine for us and apple juice for the kids to be sent to our room minutes after checking in. The next day he gave us a no. of tips for our sightseeing. Dee on reception arranged for complimentary milk and cookies for the children to be sent to the room when we returned from our first day out. After two nights my husband requested a room change to the 35th floor, which we later found out was complimentary too thanks to Anthony. **Wow.....what a view....The Chrysler Building!!! Makes a big difference. All staff very friendly and good with the kids. Be prepared too wait for the lifts too!! Breakfast at hotel is a little dearer than the diner but well worth it for the selection and service. Location is great, short walk from Grand Central, Times Square etc. Recommend a visit to the ESPN Zone for a meal, good for US Sports fans and foodies alike. Comfort Diner also good for breakfast, be warned portions are BIG!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: clarkemanu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok but would say its more 3*plus than 4* when we checked in we were not asked if we wanted smoking or non smoking king or queen beds so when we got to the room it had a really bad smoke smell and was two queen beds my husband rang reception to see if we could change and she said wait 5 mins and she will call back, she never did so he had to go down and we got moved to a non smoking room but still queen beds, room was good size compared to some new york hotels and was cleaned well every day. The bar area was nice and staff were plesent. It has a great location couldn't ask for more central to everything. One thing that amused us was were were sat in the bar one night and we think a guest brought a prostitute back as she appeared the following night with different man and the security were quite happy to let her go up!

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel in a great mid-town location”
Reviews.Author: CharlieFrance
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New York Helmsley Hotel for one week in September 2005. The hotel had been recommended to us by a native New Yorker, so we reserved it from home on Expedia. Overall we were happy with our stay. The room was clean, spacious and had a big bathroom. The double bed was hard. There was a flat screen TV with Internet access. The real advantage of this hotel is it's location. It's a short walk to Grand Central Station. The neighbourhood is safe because the United Nations is only a couple of blocks away. Some of the lower floors of the hotel need to be refurbished ASAP. And the hotel parking lot is ridiculously expensive!!! This is a hotel with a lot of rooms and a high turnover of guests (airline crews stay here). If you want a more personal service you should stay in a smaller, boutique hotel. We found a traditional American Diner only 2 blocks way which serves a full American breakfast. It is called The Comfort Diner and it is located on 214 E 45TH St. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wabbit1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after our flight from Scotland before heading up to Massachusetts. We arrived on a Friday afternoon so the airport was very busy and it took about 2 hours to get into Manhattan and to the hotel. The staff were very welcoming, opened our doors and took all our luggage out of the cab and to the front desk for us. Thumbs up! The girl at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. I asked for a fridge for our room to store insulin (And soda) and she just said "No problem". The bellhop took us to our room which was on the 08th floor at the front of the hotel. When I walked over to the huge wall to wall window I was amazed by the view - The Chrysler building!!!! The hotel room had two huge double or maybe even king size beds, a dresser, TV with loads of channels and good closet space. The bathroom was very clean and had lots of towels and supplies. There is an ice machine on every floor which was great. The only tiny issue I had with the hotel was the problems with the elevators. There were six of them but the wait for them was quite long and disappointing :-( All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & location excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last November with my sisters for a girlie shopping trip and I am returning again this November. Brillant hotel the location was excellent. the rooms were lovely and the tv on the wall was the best bit.The staff were really friendly. Couldn't fault this hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault the place. Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanandLyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Helmsley on 2nd Sept for 6 nights and having been to New York on 3 previous occasions, I can honestly say this is the best hotel I have stayed in there. All staff at the hotel were friendly and very helpful, room on 38th floor was cosy but very comfortable and most importantly, very clean. Location is excellent, about a 3 minute walk to Grand Central Station and within comfortable walking distance of all major midtown attractions. If your looking for a midtown location, great value for money and a nice place to stay try the New York Helmsley.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: frappucina
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the NY Helmsley. First of all, I did not find it easy to find a room in NY with two double beds for a reasonable price. Not only was it reasonable, but the room was large! Previous hotels I have stayed at in NY were very tiny - granted, this room had to accomodate two beds, but still. There was plenty of room to move about. The decor is a bit outdated if you're concerned about that sort of thing. Everything looks a bit faded and the wallpaper is peeling in areas if you look for it. This stuff doesn't bother us, and had zero impact on our stay. The location was another bonus. It wasn't in the heart of everything, but it was easily accessible and within walking distance of everything we went to see (with the exception of the Statue of Liberty which required a cab ride to Battery Park.) We were on the 29th floor and had a great view! Yes, we could hear some street noise, but I didn't find it bothersome. There was an ice maker across from our room (opposite the door). I could only hear it when someone was dispensing ice. I can't say that it bothered me at all. Also, in regards to noise, there was some hammer-type noise coming from the floor above us. This happened on two of our four mornings there. I'm not sure if there was renovation or if our neighbors upstairs were up to something. I'm a heavy sleeper, so this didn't bother me either, and I only noticed it when I woke up. The staff was very helpful and pleasant at all times. I did not feel as though anyone on the staff constantly had a hand out for a tip. We were, of course, happy to tip them as they were pleasant - and it's just what you do in NY. When in Rome, right? The Pax deli and Teresa's deli - one on either side of the hotel - were both great places to grab brunch as we never woke up in time for the complimentary continental fare. SO, all in all well worth it. It was a great find in NYC, and we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with class!”
Reviews.Author: iciejan
Reviews.Content: I'd read so many things about small, dirty rooms in NYC that I couldn't believe my luck when I walked into my room and found it to be huge with large windows overlooking the Chrysler building. I often book hotels using Priceline but had decided not to on this occasion because I needed 2 double beds. Rang the hotel beforehand and when we arrived at the hotel there was no problem - even got moved to a higher floor without any trouble! Coffee available in the foyer in the morning and loads of places to get a quick, cheap breakfast a 5 minute walk away. Although the hotel is not in the main tourist drag near Times Square this didn't bother us as I think we saw more by just walking to and from there. Grand Central Station is very close by as well as the UN buildings. Couldn't quite believe the number of Duane Reade's in the area - dozens of them! Loved the hotel and would go back there as the staff were pleasant, room was large and clean and the view out the window was superb- New York at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay and more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First......to address earlier reviews, IF the ice machine is not on your floor, there is a clear sign in the hall directing you to the appropriate location....The staff did not at all appear "ignorant" to us - we found the front desk staff very pleasant and helpful, and the bell staff were more than adequate. As far as the tipping issue...YOU'RE IN NEW YORK!!! EVERY service person in NYC is working for the tip...get over it and move on! Now, my wife and i just returned from our 4th trip to NYC. Stayed 4 nights at the helmsley. Location is very good - can get to anywhere close on foot, and Grand Central Terminal is just 3 blocks away. I was very surprised by the room - much bigger than i expected for a Manhattan hottel room. Nicely appointed - though not "space age" chic. Found the bed to be very comfortable -- and quite frankly i have nothing against a "t.v. on a stand" as opposed to an armoire (BIG freakin deal!). We were on the 9th floor, on the back, facing 41st street. Noise level was very low and had no problem sleeping- the a.c. more than covered any outside sound, and it worked very well (much to my wife's chagrin). Overall this hotel is a VERY good deal for the money in NYC. We would definitely stay there again. It always amazes me how "persnickity" many travelers have to be about accomodations - typical pampered, arrogant, American attitude when it comes to traveling. I'm in NYC to relish in the city and the culture, not my hotel room:)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the begining of May of this year. I was by myself and it was in a great location to catch quick dinners, quick cabs, and just a hop, skip and a jump from grandcenteral. It was not quite in the hubbub of Time Sqaure so it was a bit more laid back, but everything was easily accessible. The room was nice. I had a great view of the Chrysler Building. Definitely ask for a room on a high floor. The street noise was still a bit loud and I was on the 41st floor, I guess that is to be expected being in New York. The staff was friendly. Aside from the street noise the only other issue was the TV, it was a a strange system that didn't always work. Normally I wouldn't have cared, but being by myself I counted on it for company now and again. All in all I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed at the New York Helmsley for 5 nights in November 2004. After searching the internet for a reasonably cheap holiday to New York, we came across this hotel. As this was to be our first time in New York we requested a king size bedroom with a good view. When we arrived, we were really happy with the appearance of the front of the hotel, with the bell boys outside opening the doors for us, made us feel important. Check in was very fast and efficient, considering there was about 20 virgin reps checking in at the same time. The receptionist was very pleasant and informed us she had upgraded us to an executive room at no extra charge. We were on the 41st floor (very top floor). On walking into the room, it was huge (for a hotel room). The bathroom was lovely decorated, as was the whole room. Our bed was huge, we had a flatscreen huge tv mounted onto the wall. The best bit was to come, we opened the curtains and the view of the Empire State Building was just amazing. The cleaners changed our towels everyday, and tidied our room when we had made a little mess. The bell boys were very informative. There was however two things we wasnâ€™t so happy about. Although we took part in the New York â€œtipping systemâ€� I did come across one rude bell boy. He carried our luggage on the last day to a store cupboard 2 feet away and would not give our tickets to us unless we tipped him and just stood there holding his hand out. Another thing to be aware off is the phone in the room. We did not intend on using the hotel phone. but our mobile phones would not work in New York, and the pay card we had purchased would not work either, we resorted to using the hotel phone to inform people back home we were there safe and well. You know what its like when your away you can never remember the international codes, then the code for dialling out of the USA. So after about 4 blank attempts at trying to phone home we eventually got through. What we wasnâ€™t aware of for all the times we had dialled the wrong numbers we got charged for even though we never even spoke to anyone on the other end of the line. We spoke to the receptionist and informed her we would not be paying the $225 dollars they billed us for as we had not spoke to anyone. We only ended up paying for the 3 minute call we made, which we was much more satisfied with. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone of all ages. We are in our early 20â€™s but anyone with standard and a bit of class like us would love and appreciate this hotel. Will hopefully be returning in the future. I shall add photos of Empire State building view from the window and pics of the hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask for a fan.”
Reviews.Author: cyraxote
Reviews.Content: It was probably nice the last time it was redecorated, which appeared to have been about 30 years ago. The room was unremarkable, very "motel-like," perhaps because the TV was small and on a stand rather than in an armoire. Of the few outlets in the room, only the one into which the TV was plugged was actually accessible. The others required crawling on the floor or moving furniture, only to discover that the outlet might not actually work. The climate controls were rudimentary at best, and the AC seemed to run constantly no matter what the temperature setting. I asked for a fan, and housekeeping delivered a fan that had no knob. When I finally found a working outlet, and a pair of tweezers, I discovered that the knob was apparently missing because the fan did not work. I requested a second fan, and this one had a broken blade than sat at the bottom of the case and impeded the rotation of the other blades, which made the fan jump around like one of those cartoon alarm clocks. When I called Housekeeping a third time, they did not answer, so I took my fan to the lobby, where I was forced to circumnavigate the ridiculous late-night security features. These consisted of blocking the entrance to the elevators from the side of the lobby nearest the front desk, forcing people to walk all the way around the lobby for no apparent reason. However, the manager was able to convince Housekeeping to provide me with a non-damaged, functional fan. The beds were quite brick-like, and the pillows were uncomfortable for reasons that I cannot quite put my finger on. The tub had a tendency to back up during showering. Last but not least, there was an ice bucket, but there was no information regarding the location of the ice machine. I considered calling the front desk to ask, but I was tired after my adventure with the fan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tiddles1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Helmsley for 4 nights in April 2005. The hotel check in staff were very efficient and polite- we were in our room within 2 minutes of walking through the door!!. The room was clean and a good size for 3 people. The towels were indeed fluffy !!! Tiny complaint was the rattling pipes although also very funny - however if you turn the tap on fast no noise just splashes !! We were on the 7th floor and despite some reviews we heard no noise from the restaurant downstairs or from the traffic on 42nd street. The hotel is in an excellent location really close to the subway and Times Square etc. The deli next door was excellent value for money and the staff were very friendly. Upon check out we left our bags with the bell hop who was only too happy to help and when we returned to collect the luggage, it was brought to us speedily and cheerfully. We would definately use this hotel again, and if you are looking for good value, clean accomodation, and great location this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: airportsnoozer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, great location. There is a chinese woman who works behind the reception who is as miserable as sin, she is very rude but that never fazed me a bit. The rooms are VERY tired, if fact they are upgrading rooms at the moment, I should know because for 5 days we heard work being carried out directly above us on the 33rd floor. We complained to management and were told it was a leek, some leek, we took a look and the whole floor is being refurbed. I complained in writing to the manager and we were given a comp breakfast and they reduced our bill for one night!!, after all their lying that was the best they could do. Watch the bar prices, they are steep, and watch the concierge, they are like hawks, I had to speak to one of them after he was rude to my wife, she got in to a taxi and didnt tip him enough so he slammed the door and nearly caught her foot. Use it if you have to or you can get a good deal but otherwise make sure you get a new room

Reviews.Title: “Good time in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week in the Helmsley Hotel in New York. We had a great time in the city and our experiences at the Helmsley contributed in no small way to our enjoyment of the Big Apple. The Hotel is centrally situated and is very close to Grand Central ; this was of special advantage to us as it is pretty easy to get to Grand Central from anywhere in the city. The staff in the Helmsley were helpful and courteous at all times ;when the elevators developed a problem on a busy Sunday morning,the staff facilitated guests through the use of the service lift,for instance. We were particularly impressed with the concierge service. We stayed in a Deluxe King bedroom and we both agree that the ambience of the room was excellent( We were at the top of the Hotel on floor 41 so traffic noises were within reason).If you haven't been in a big bed before, then this is the place to go! Room was cleaned every day,we got plenty of big and small towels and the New York Times arrived at our door every morning. The TV set was of high quality but we didn't get much time to sit and watch. The radio was good ( FM seems to focus on music and AM on talk shows in NY ) One problem we had with the room was the lighting. It was difficult to read ; the table lamps proved good lighting for getting about generally but were not conducive to reading. It was difficult to read in bed....it is unfortunate that lights aren't provided over the bed to allow guests to read in comfort while resting in bed. We didn't take breakfast in the Hotel and we only had late night drinks on one occasion; the drinks were very expensive but the bar is very attractive. Although we didn't do it ,we were surprised to notice that guests are allowed to take food to their rooms.....for instance,I met a guest in the lift with a large pizza !! Coffee....very nice coffee..... was available in the foyer free of charge in the morning ; we are not sure if this is common practice in New York but it was a plus for us in this hotel. This hotel is a little expensive but ,on balance, it is worth it. We would stay here again .It is clean,has courteous staff and the bedrooms are attractive. We can certainly recommend it and give it an above average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Best View you could ever wish for!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I would recommend this hotel to everyone! The location is superb!! You walk outside the hotel, turn left, walk 500 yards and you are standing next to the Chrysler building! Walk a bit further and you are outside Grand Central Station. Your 10 minutes away from the Library (seen in the The Day After Tomorrow film), 10 minute walk to Empire State Building and 15 minute walk to Central Park and Broadway. The hotel is clean and fresh, beds and rooms cleaned everyday. We stayed for four great nights and came back engaged. We can't wait to go back and definitely stay at the Helmsley!!! Book your trip now!! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenBrussels
Reviews.Content: It was my first staying in NY. I hope other hotels are better than the NY Helmsley. I choose the hotel because of the reputaion of the Helmsley at central Park which is a leading hotel of the world..... This hotel was expensive and outdated. The Breakfast is a ripp off. The room was old. The heating made noise and didn't work properly. the batroom had it's best time. Matresses were slept through. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snickerbar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in mid April 2005. We had 2 rooms as there are 5 in our family - the children are 21 (twins) and 18 - they were on the 11th, we were on the 27th. That wasn't a problem at all! We were very pleased with the hotel indeed. The rooms were very nice, good bathrooms, plenty of towels, comfortable beds, good decor. Prices in the bar and restaurant were high, but there is a very good choice of breakfast places in 42nd St - the one next door (Pax) was where we ate every morning in fact. Good restaurants nearby - several in 3rd Avenue, which is just around the corner - Rio Grande (tex-mex), Earl's (bar with good food, great service). Also we enjoyed eating at the Townhouse, a traditional diner in 2nd Avenue. In all, we had a marvellous week in the Big Apple. So exciting!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: lovedeveryminute
Reviews.Content: Helmsley Hotel NY was a great place to stay! the rooms were cleaned everyday, they were big and the view from the rooms was amazing! staff are really friendly and efficient (we asked for the janitor to change the light bulb and i swear he was at our door before we put the phone down!) although we never had a room that had been recently renovated, our room had been renovated only two years ago and so you can imagine that it was in great condition. Went with my parents, my brother and sisters. even the 5year old loved it, it really was our home from home. it felt so great knowing that after a hard days shopping :) we were going to go back to a lovely warm room (we went in NY winter) oooooh cant wait to go back, definantly staying here again! the location and the view should pursuade anyone to stay here! around 7 minutes walk to times square and located a stones throw away from grand central station this hotel was great... its fab. go check out the website!

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: rmgatlanta
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that my perspective is that of a business traveler and the hotel does have some good points--it is good value for a NYC hotel in this hotel class (paid about $185 before taxes) and is well located (42nd and 3rd ave). This hotel must have been rather grand some years ago but, in my opinion, has fallen into some disrepair now. The staff does try to keep the rooms clean and that is a plus. However, I found the room rather shabby because it hasn't been kept up, the bedsheet was torn, the temperature control in tbe room was broken, had no hi-speed internet access, and the lighting in the hallway was dim and unappealing. I have stayed before at the Sheraton on Sixth Ave and for about $15 more, had a great room in a spotless hotel--unfortunately the hotel was sold out this time. Will never return to this hotel if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GVTV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 3-5 April 2005. Very happy with the location - only 5 mins walk to Grand Central Station which has a shuttle service to Times Square about every 5 mins and just a few minutes ride. Clean hotel with friendly staff. Harry's bar is defintely a good place to eat. Quite a good bar menu and not anyway as expensive as Mindy's restaurant. Room was fine - beds comfortable, iron and ironing board provided. Bathroom larger than thought it would be with good toiletries and big fluffy towels! Quite a lot of noise in the rooms from the traffic below and we were on the 28th floor! Didn't eat in the restaurant - $18 for breakfast. There is a deli next door called PAX. Very clean cafe and very friendly staff. They do a standard breakfast of omelette, breakfast potatoes and toast or sausages or bacon, breakfast potatoes, eggs and toast for Â£3.75 - also a choice of breakfast sandwiches. They also have fruit bowls, choice of dried cereals, english muffins and yoghurt to choose from - all reasonably priced. They also do lunch menus sandwiches, wraps and soups and salads - again all good value for money. The only problem we had was checking out. We had to check out at 12:00 but were not getting picked up until 18:00 as our flight was 21:30 that night. We left our luggage with the doorman for storage. However, when we asked for our luggage to be retreived as our taxi had arrived it took them 15 mins to get back to us - not good when you have a taxi waiting outside. Anyway, all in all I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the New York Helmsley Hotel for 2 nights in March 2005 after reading good reviews on Tripadvisor. Booked through Expedia. It is certainly a decent hotel for New York and good value for money. Room was large and clean with a good size bathroom and plenty of fluffy towels and toiletries. A bit tired around the edges in places but nothing worth worrying about, there are far worse hotels in New York! It's in a good location for getting around, just a short walk from Grand Central and subway links. Plenty of places nearby to catch a bite to eat. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in March, including St Patricks Day. It is in a great location, just a 5min walk from Grand Central Station and not too far from the 5th Avenue. After a long day sight seeing and shopping! the bar area is a great place to chill with a few beers. Its comfy and the waitresses are freindly. We were on the 26th floor and rooms were clean and presentable. Although you could here constant traffic through the night - but I expect you would have this with most New York hotels. I'd definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Nick_C_London
Reviews.Content: March 15 to 22 2005. Party of 4, two rooms on 8th floor, booked through expedia @ UKÂ£90 per night (US$166.50) including all taxes. Summary: Very good quality, great value for money, would def stay there again and recommend it. Expedia rate it 3.5*, I'd give it 4.5*. Great deal through Expedia - could have paid slightly more for a high floor executive room on the hotel's own web site. Pros: Friendly and helpful staff, large clean rooms, lots of towels and good toiletries. Iron and ironing board. 3 phones, cheap local calls from room. Reasonable range of TV channels plus pay to view movies. Great location. Cons: Low floor (8th) on 42nd St - a little traffic noise during the rush hours but no great problem for us and quiet at night. Blinds don't open/close easily - need replacing, but curtains open/close easily giving complete black out at night. Carpet a little worn and could do with replacing, but these unrefurbished rooms are much better than I had expected from other reviews on this page. No in room safe in standard rooms. No international or foreign language TV channels - no world news channels - even CNN was domestic, typically American! Commentary: 4 guests with lots of luggage. Not offered help with luggage on arrival. Very friendly check in. Rooms a pleasant surprise, large clean and comfortable - old fashioned but cheerful decor in generally good condition. Plenty of storage and hanging space. Oblique view of Chrysler from room at front (42nd st) and a better view of the Empire State from friends' room at back (43rd st). Cocktail bar good value for money for us Brits as the Â£ is strong right now. Waitress had a dry sense of humour - loved her. 15% service added to bar bill automatically and highlighted - very honest and reasonable. Strawberry Daiquiri's very artificial and not very strong. Good bar snacks; free hors d'oeuvres during happy hour (5pm to 7pm). Tipped the bell captain a dollar a bag for looking after our 8 cases on checkout, and tipped another dollar a bag to a different guy when we retrieved them. Tipped the doorman $5 for loading them into the taxi. All seemed quite happy, and you expect to have to tip in these situations. Deli next door has excellent food, but self service and quite busy. Andrew's coffee shop on 43rd near the side of Grand Central very cheap, good American breakfast, friendly service. Pershing Square (under the road bridge over 42nd outside Grand Central) very good quality food (real maple syrup!) but poor luke warm coffee, slow service, and 3 times the price of Andrew's! Strongly recommend El Rio Grande just 4 blocks south on 3rd and 38th - Tex/mex with the best (and strongest!) margaritas in town.

Reviews.Title: “March 10-13, 2005 - Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: coladin
Reviews.Content: Can't ask for much more. Rooms were very celan, lots of towels, amenities. The staff was very polite and the only beefs I had were out of their control, my wife wanted smoking which wasn't too bad, and because we booked through Expedia, we ended up with two double beds. For what we paid, $200 CAD, it was a steal and felt much more expensive. Beds were comfortable, excellent pillows. The location was perfect for us...close to Times Square, major shopping at 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building, UN, Grand Central, ...in fact it seemed we were close to everything important. Avoid the pricey items on the menu and have a really good breakfast, lunch next door. I completely recommend this hotel, it is a great value and was an excellent home base to see New York.

Reviews.Title: “Would definatly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: claura
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, sepecially for the price I got it. Location couldn't be better. Time square anf fith avenue in easy walking distance. Grand cental is the local station. Loads of rail links. Chrysler building across the road. So to find hotel just look up. Height makes views from rooms which have large windows excellent. Area seems safe. Did witness the bell captain be rude to a guset. But tats cos she didn't tip him. Unnaceptable from him but the other BC was polite as you'd expect to us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, one big problem!”
Reviews.Author: TFSQ
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good place to stay. Only one fly in the ointment, the staff who dealt with baggage. In line with an earlier reviewer we experienced the "I won't be here when you come back", hand out for a tip approach. I challenged this a bit but the conversation was amicable enough and I tipped the porter $20 for placing 5 small pieces of luggage in a closet. Sure enough when we came back to collect them it was a different porter who was very rude when we refused to tip again for lifting the bags out of the closet. It's such a pity that this spoiled what was otherwise a great stay. My advice would be to tip the first guy, and refuse to tip the second. The alternative would be for the hotel to charge for storage per item, all in all a hotel of this standard needs to clean up its act on this, and get their staff to drop the "attitude". Lastly, there was a very spooky coincidence. On checking our bags my wife and I found that our external combination locks on our baggage (that had worked fine that morning) were no longer working later that same day. Isn't that weird?

Reviews.Title: “fantastic,great location,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a stay at the new york helmsley.cannot fault the location of this hotel.10mins walk from times square and several mins to grand central.cannot understand some comments regarding lack of shopping.are they for real.within 15-20mins walk or a short taxi ride and cheap at that,fifth avenue shopping at its most pricey! macys and bloomingdales slightly further but worth the walk there but hail a taxi when you done,its easier on your arms! we walked everywhere and as new york is flat had no problems though taxis are very easy to hail from the hotel else grand central and the subway. we never tried the food as hotel prices tend to be expensive.diner next door was great value though several more around the hotel if you look behind!again great value ranging from $3.75-7.95 dollars.some clients suggest no internet access.yes there is the business center but upgrade your room for flat screen tv and internet and great views from 37th floor! hotel staff very pleasant and security great.nothing was too much trouble. overall a hotel with excellent facilities and fantastic location . would have no problems recommending this hotel to anyone. rooms large by NY standards and yes the towels are so fluffy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: sendmehome
Reviews.Content: Rooms were well decorated, spacious for NY standards, clean and had fluffly towels. The bathrooms were nicely done. The deli next door is wonderful with bacon,eggs,homefries and toast for $3.75. However the hotel has no interent access. You can use the business center at $7 for 15 minutes or local phone calls are $1.00 for 3 minutes at .15 for each additional minute. There are no desks in the rooms. If you need to talk in the lobby, seating is very limited. While hotel is two blocks from Grand Central, there are limited restaurants within walking distance (in cold weather anyway) and very little shopping. Be prepared to take cabs. The hotel has free coffee in the lobby in the morning, but again seating is very limited. Don't eat at Harry's Bar as the sandwiches are terrible and way over priced. However if you get a good rate, this is an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT, PLEASE STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic Hotel. I have stayed there 4 times now and they NEVER disappoint. Excellent rooms, with fluffy carpets, great showers, comfy beds and very polite staff. The food is great and the service from the Bell captain is spot on. If you visit New York, please stay here, just PERFECT

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during 2nd week of June 2004. Not a very "ritzy" hotel if you're looking for that but the rooms are clean and the staff was very accomodating. Above a Holiday Inn or Sheraton but not the Four Seasons or the Ritz. I was pleased with our room however the beds were hard. I would stay there again however if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover
Reviews.Content: Me and my parter have just returned from our week trip in new york and we stayed in the new york helmsley. I do not agree with some of the bad reviews it has got as i thought everything was fantastic. The room was big and clean and we had a wonderful view of the Empire State Building which looks great at night. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and the restaurant and bar provided and excellent service. I would highly rate this hotel for the people that want to be in the middle of everything as it is just around the corner from 5th ave and times square which is just amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended - Very worn and Dirty - should be 2*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York and stayed in The Helmsley Hotel for 4 nights - 12 - 16 December. Our room was big but the carpet was filthy, all the furniture was very worn and the window would not close properly so there was a very cold breeze in the room all the time - this was December so it was very cold. I turned on the heater to warm the room but this was very poor and only blew out warm air which didn't heat the room. After spending the day walking in the freezing cold, it wasn't very comforting to know that you were coming back to a cold room. Also, this hotel is not very central as it is on 3rd Avenue which is a good 10 minute walk to 5th Avenue. Before we stayed in The Helmsley, we stayed Hotel 5A which was very central on 40th Street right on 5th Avenue. The room was small but very clean and I would strongly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my friends stayed at Helmsley during the Thanksgiving break and it was great!! We paid 220/night. Our room looks exactly the same as the video shown at expedia. Our bathroom is also great--not only it is spacious and clean, the hotel also provides body wash, shampoo, body lotion, soap, and dental rinse. the only thing is the housekeeping person didnt do a good job making the bed because we only put 3 bucks for the tip for the first day. make sure you put more money for tip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: emjayen
Reviews.Content: Part of a pre stay package with Norwegian Cruises. Disappointed initially in the decor of the rooms, although they were clean the furnishings were very worn and carpet was stained very badly, not a good first impression. Having said that the hotel turned out to be OK, the bar food and wait staff were fine. Door staff very helpful and friendly. All in all turned out well, after bad first impression. Have been advised that Helmsley is one of New York's better hotels !!!
